title: Requires certain civil court documents to be provided to parties in their native language
abstract: Relates to requiring certain civil court documents to be provided to parties in their native language and requiring parties to demonstrate their understanding of the nature and effect of such documents.

title: Authorizes the city of Yonkers to establish one or more transportation improvement districts
abstract: Authorizes the city of Yonkers to establish one or more transportation improvement districts to improve transportation in certain critical areas of the city.

title: Relates to establishing a training program for first responders for responding to victims of suspected drug overdose and the administration of opioid antagonists
abstract: Establishes a training program for first responders for responding to victims of suspected drug overdose and the administration of opioid antagonists.

title: Repeals provisions of law granting real property tax exemption to certain entities; repealer
abstract: Repeals provisions granting real property tax exemption to certain entities.

title: Provides for the humane removal of downed animals
abstract: Provides for the humane treatment and removal of downed animals.

title: Provides for a partial real property tax exemption for the water filtration plant for the City of Newburgh, Orange County, New York
abstract: Provides for a partial real property tax exemption for the water filtration plant for the City of Newburgh, Orange County, New York.

title: Relates to extending the two hundred foot rule to certain treatment facilities
abstract: Relates to extending the two hundred foot rule to certain treatment facilities for mental illness and chemical dependence operating under the mental hygiene law.

title: Relates to permitting party enrollment within 10 days of an election; repealer
abstract: Permits party enrollment and change of party enrollment within 10 days of a primary, general, or special election.

title: Requires an automatic recanvass of ballots in certain elections
abstract: Relates to requiring an automatic recanvass of votes where the difference between votes cast for two candidates that determines a candidate's nomination or election to office is less than one-half of one percent of total ballots cast in such contest.

title: Limits fees that may be exacted for the production of records relating to the condition or treatment of a patient
abstract: Provides that notwithstanding the provisions of the public health law, no fee other than those authorized by section 2303 (a) of the civil practice law and rules may be exacted or levied for the production of records relating to the condition or treatment of a patient; relates to access by an adverse party to medical records.

title: Authorizes the issuance of "Blue Star Mother" and "Blue Star Family" distinctive license plates and establishes the "blue star mothers and families fund"
abstract: Authorizes the issuance of "Blue Star Mother" and "Blue Star Family" distinctive license plates for parents and family members of active duty service members; establishes the "blue star mothers and families support fund".

title: Requires the commissioner of motor vehicles to install notification of the thirty foot requirement on every stop sign
abstract: Requires the commissioner of motor vehicles to install notification of the thirty-foot requirement on every stop sign; ensures that the required distance established by the law will be posted on any stop sign to forewarn motorists upon approaching a stop sign.

title: Relates to RFPs for gun violence reduction
abstract: Relates to RFPs for gun violence reduction; provides that any state agency that issues an RFP relating to gun violence reduction shall establish a coordination plan including all awardees; requires that such coordination plans shall be in a form as prescribed by the department of state; requires that at a minimum, such coordination plan shall help ensure complete coverage of the area for which such RFP is issued and minimize competition between awardees.

title: Prohibits broad indemnification by a design professional of a state or local agency or political subdivision involving public work for contracts
abstract: Prohibits broad indemnification by a design professional of a state or local agency or political subdivision involving public work for contracts except to the extent that damages were caused by or the result of the negligence, recklessness, or willful misconduct of the design professional.

title: Relates to residency restrictions for sex offenders
abstract: Authorizes municipalities to establish residency restrictions for sex offenders.

title: Establishes the relocated worker grant program
abstract: Establishes the relocated worker grant program which requires the empire state development corporation to design and implement the relocated worker grant program which shall include a certification process to certify relocated workers and certify qualifying expenses for a reimbursement grant; defines terms; makes related provisions.

title: Expands the scope of nurse staffing committees
abstract: Expands the scope of nurse staffing committees to include additional types of health care facilities.

title: Relates to requiring employers submit an affirmative acknowledgement of implementing a sexual harassment prevention policy which meets or exceeds the minimum standards
abstract: Requires employers to submit an affirmative acknowledgement of implementing a sexual harassment prevention policy which meets or exceeds the minimum standards upon the completion of the employer's annual training or the training of a newly hired employee.

title: Relates to the encroachment or adverse effect upon military operations by tall energy structures, major renewable energy facilities or wind energy facilities
abstract: Relates to the encroachment or adverse effect upon military operations by tall energy structures, major renewable energy facilities or wind energy facilities.

title: Relates to the appointment of a military liaison to each school district
abstract: Relates to the appointment of a military liaison to each school district, charter school, and private elementary and secondary school for purposes of providing military families with information regarding benefits they may be eligible for under the laws of this state.

title: Relates to the eligibility of New York city transit authority employees for performance of duty disability retirement
abstract: Relates to the eligibility of New York city transit authority employees for performance of duty disability retirement.

title: Relates to crimes committed during periods of post-release supervision
abstract: Provides that a person who commits a crime during a period of post-release supervision and when such charge culminates in a new sentence, the period of post-release supervision shall be deemed interrupted for any period in which such person was held in pre-trial detention.

title: Provides that certain communications made without malice regarding an incident of sexual assault, harassment or discrimination shall be deemed privileged
abstract: Provides that certain communications made without malice regarding an incident of sexual assault, harassment or discrimination shall be deemed privileged; provides that a prevailing defendant in an action brought against such defendant for making a communication that is privileged shall be entitled to attorney's fees and costs for such defense.

title: Relates to the applicability of certain provisions with respect to persons injured in the use of scaffolding and other devices for use by employees
abstract: Provides that where safety equipment or devices have been made available, and an employee has failed to follow safety instruction or safe work practices in accordance with training provided, or failed to utilize provided safety equipment or devices, or engaged in a criminal act or was impaired by the use of drugs or alcohol, and such failure, act or impairment is a proximate cause of an injury to such person, the conduct attributable to such person shall not bar recovery, but the amount of damages otherwise recoverable shall be determined in accordance with contributory negligence provisions.

title: Relates to the application for the medicare savings program
abstract: Provides that low-income subsidy data transmitted from the social security administration to local departments of social services in accordance with section 1144(c)(3) of the federal social security act shall be treated as an application for the medicare savings program, without requiring submission of another application.

title: Requires the department of transportation to determine which entrances to parkways in the state are most frequently accessed by oversized commercial vehicles and to prevent such access
abstract: Requires the department of transportation to determine which entrances to parkways in the state are most frequently accessed by oversized commercial vehicles and to install certain barriers to prevent such vehicles from accessing such entrances.

title: Provides certain exemptions for individuals having entered into a contract to play baseball at the minor league level and who are compensated pursuant to the terms of a collective bargaining agreement
abstract: Provides certain exemptions for individuals having entered into a contract to play baseball at the minor league level and who is compensated pursuant to the terms of a collective bargaining agreement; includes exemptions under the labor law from minimum wage, overtime, and recordkeeping requirements and under article 6 of the labor law including but not limited to, recordkeeping requirements, wage statement requirements, and weekly pay requirements for "manual workers".

title: Establishes the reimaging excess New York state property act
abstract: Establishes the reimaging excess New York state property act; provides the reimaging excess New York state property authority shall purchase any abandoned, surplus or otherwise unused state-owned real property and reconstruct, renovate, replace, maintain, repair, enlarge, extend, operate, lease, as lessee or lessor, and/or regulate the repurposing of such properties.

title: Relates to federal qualified health center rate adequacy
abstract: Provides for the calculation and analysis of certain health center costs.

title: Relates to Medicaid reimbursement rates for private duty nursing
abstract: Relates to Medicaid reimbursement rates for private duty nursing.

title: Relates to wage claims for manual workers
abstract: Relates to wage claims for manual workers; establishes an exception is provided from certain legal relief for instances of when payment is made within fourteen calendar days after the end of the week in which the wages were earned.

title: Establishes a drug checking services program
abstract: Establishes through the department of health, in conjunction with the office of addiction services and supports, a drug checking services program to allow individuals to bring drugs or controlled substances and have them tested for contaminants, toxic substances, or hazardous compounds.

title: Commissioner of the Office of Parks, Recreation and Historic Preservation shall provide Empire Passports to individuals whose qualified service commenced on or after
abstract: Directs the Commissioner of the Office of Parks, Recreation and Historic Preservation to provide Empire Passports to the families of reservists and members of the National Guard, whose qualified service commenced on or after September eleventh, two thousand one.

title: Relates to protective orders for juries
abstract: Permits the court to withhold the names and addresses of jurors in certain proceedings; sets factors for determining good cause to issue protective orders for juries.

title: Requires electric vehicles to have an automatic cutoff switch
abstract: Requires electric vehicles, including motor vehicles, bicycles with electric assist and electric scooters, to have an automatic cutoff switch; defines automatic cutoff switch.

title: Creates a transparency database for contracted not-for-profit organizations
abstract: Creates a transparency database for contracted not-for-profit organizations; provides such database will include those that are in the process of being approved for contracts, that have received certificates of approval, are approved for contracts, have received renewal contracts, or have been the recipient of fully-executed contracts with the state of New York.

title: Relates to unlawful possession or sale of imitation drug paraphernalia
abstract: Establishes the crime of unlawful possession or sale of imitation drug paraphernalia when such person knowingly possesses, purchases, delivers, sells, or possesses with intent to sell or deliver any punch, die, plate, stone, pill press, tableting machine, encapsulating machine or any other equipment in order to print, imprint, or reproduce the trademark, trade name or other identifying mark, imprint or device of another or any likeness of any of the foregoing upon any substance or container or labeling thereof knowing, intending, or having reasonable cause to believe that it will be used to manufacture an imitation drug.

title: Permits assistant district attorneys to live anywhere within the state
abstract: Permits assistant district attorneys to live anywhere within the state.

title: Relates to the brownfield redevelopment tax credit
abstract: Relates to the brownfield redevelopment tax credit; provides that in the event that the qualified site is owned by, or was acquired by a taxpayer from, a municipality and such municipality is a volunteer under the brownfield site clean-up agreement with respect to such qualified site, then the amount of the credit shall be reduced; defines "infrastructure work"; makes related amendments.

title: Requires the distribution of an information card or sheet with Schedule II opioids
abstract: Requires the distribution of an information card or sheet with Schedule II opioids.

title: Relates to creating a state office of algorithmic innovation
abstract: Creates a state office of algorithmic innovation to set policies and standards to ensure algorithms are safe, effective, fair, and ethical, and that the state is conducive to promoting algorithmic innovation.

title: Requires the commissioner of health to develop a sustainability plan for the state university of New York downstate medical center
abstract: Requires the commissioner of health to develop a sustainability plan for the state university of New York downstate medical center; provides that such sustainability plan shall not limit or alter the rights of employees pursuant to a collective bargaining agreement.

title: Prohibits the use of biometric surveillance system or biometric surveillance information in places of public accommodation
abstract: Prohibits the use of biometric surveillance system or biometric surveillance information in places of public accommodation; prohibits entering into any agreement that authorizes any third party to use any biometric surveillance system or biometric surveillance information; provides penalties for violations.

title: Prohibits the use of primates in entertainment acts
abstract: Prohibits the use of primates in entertainment acts; prohibits the department of environmental conservation for issuing any license or permit that would authorize the use of a primate in an entertainment act.

title: Requires an updated photo to be taken in order to renew a driver's license
abstract: Requires an updated photo be taken in order to renew a driver's license.

title: Authorizes private membership establishments to have certain licenses for sale of alcohol
abstract: Authorizes private membership establishments to have certain licenses for sale of alcohol for consumption on premises.

title: Authorizes the delivery of telehealth services in schools by licensed providers
abstract: Authorizes the delivery of telehealth services in schools by licensed providers.

title: Requires school crossing guards at high schools
abstract: Requires school crossing guards to be on each and every corner of every city block that contains a public or private high school during arrival and dismissal.

title: Exempts certain entities from the in-person quorum requirements for videoconferencing by public bodies
abstract: Exempts citywide/community education councils (CCECs), school leadership teams (SLTs) and district leadership teams (DLTs) from the in-person quorum requirements for videoconferencing by public bodies.

title: Relates to making a certain technical correction
abstract: Amends the penal law to change an incorrect reference.

title: Requires the state to pay real property taxes on the assessed value of the Moriah shock incarceration correctional facility
abstract: Requires the state to pay all real property taxes on the assessed value of the Moriah shock incarceration correctional facility.

title: Repeals provision of vehicle and traffic law relating to periodic inspections of police vehicles
abstract: Relates to periodic inspections of police vehicles; removes exemption for police vehicles for periodic inspections.

title: Relates to expanding the geographical area of employment of university police officers; repealer
abstract: Relates to expanding the geographical area of employment of university police officers; extends the jurisdiction of New York state university police officers from state university of New York property and abutting roadways to all areas of the state.

title: Adopts the interstate teacher mobility compact
abstract: Adopts the interstate teacher mobility compact to facilitate the mobility of teachers across member states, with the goal of supporting teachers through new pathways to licensure; establishes a regulatory framework to expedite and enhance the ability of teachers to move across state lines.

title: Requires the department of health to approve medical exemptions from immunization requirements
abstract: Requires the department of health to approve medical exemptions from immunization requirements.

title: Relates to creating a contraband and drug information hotline
abstract: Creates a contraband and drug information hotline for state correctional facilities; defines terms.

title: Repeals title 2 of article 14 of the election law, relating to public financing
abstract: Repeals provisions relating to public financing.

title: Requires utility companies to reimburse consumers in the event of a prolonged power outage
abstract: Requires utility companies to reimburse consumers for spoilage of food and medication due to the lack of refrigeration in the event of a power outage lasting seventy-two hours or more.

title: Relates to apprenticeship training
abstract: Requires such apprenticeship program is specific to the type and scope of work which is being performed and have a graduation rate of at least thirty percent as determined by the department of labor; makes technical corrections.

title: Relates to the use of telematics systems by insurers
abstract: Provides for the use of telematics or usage-based insurance for private passenger or commercial automobile insurance or policies in certain circumstances.

title: Relates to providing county correction officers with a special optional twenty year retirement plan
abstract: Relates to providing county correction officers with a special optional twenty year retirement plan.

title: Suspends the registration of a vehicle which has been documented five times within a twelve month period by a photo violation monitoring device for failure to comply with traffic-control indications
abstract: Suspends the registration of a vehicle which has been documented five times within a twelve month period by a photo violation monitoring device for failure of an operator thereof to comply with traffic-control indications for a period of six months.

title: Relates to establishing a sex trafficking awareness and prevention program
abstract: Directs the commissioner of DMV to establish a sex trafficking awareness and prevention program to provide education and awareness literature and educational materials to all drivers with a commercial motor vehicle license.

title: Relates to primary social security retirement benefits for members of the New York city fire department pension fund
abstract: Relates to primary social security retirement benefits for certain members; provides that in the computation of the normal service retirement benefit of members of the New York city fire department pension fund, there shall be no reduction for the primary social security retirement benefit.

title: Relates to the enactment of the Safer Consumption Services Act
abstract: Enacts the safer consumption services act which provides for the establishment of a program to provide safe injection sites.

title: Enables safe access to public roads for all users by utilizing complete street design principles
abstract: Enables safe access to public roads for all users by utilizing complete street design principles.

title: Includes clinically necessary treatment for certain inpatient coverage
abstract: Includes clinically necessary treatment for certain inpatient coverage, which shall mean an individual's medical needs and any social determinants of health that will promote such individual's stability following discharge from treatment.

title: Authorizes the state gaming commission to impose fines upon entities participating in thoroughbred race meetings or off-track wagering; non-patrons
abstract: Authorizes the state gaming commission to impose monetary fines upon any corporation, association or person participating in a thoroughbred race meeting or off-track betting, whether licensed by such commission or not, for violation of a commission rule or regulation; does not apply to track or parlor patrons.

title: Relates to coverage for punitive damages and civil penalties
abstract: Permits a liability policy to provide coverage for punitive damages, civil penalties and other non-compensatory damages.

title: Relates to recovery of certain housing accommodations by a landlord
abstract: Relates to recovery of certain housing accommodations by a landlord.

title: Relates to establishing a property tax credit for class 2 cooperative and condominium buildings that are designated safe after a facade safety program inspection
abstract: Relates to establishing a property tax credit for class 2 cooperative and condominium buildings that are designated safe after a facade safety program inspection.

title: Relates to regulation of toxic chemicals in pet products
abstract: Relates to regulation of toxic chemicals in pet products; requires disclosure on information on priority chemicals; establishes the interstate chemical clearinghouse; makes related provisions.

title: Relates to requiring qualification-based criteria for awarding certain contracts for services
abstract: Requires qualification-based criteria for awarding certain contracts for services to an entity that submits a statement of qualifications in response to a request for qualifications when an authorized entity utilizes a one-step method.

title: Bans open pickup trucks on the historic ten and one-half mile section of the Bronx River Parkway
abstract: Bans open pickup trucks on the historic ten and one-half mile section of the Bronx River Parkway, beginning in the city of Yonkers and the village of Bronxville where such Parkway diverges from the Sprain Brook Parkway and extends north along the Bronx River Parkway Reservation to the Kenisco Dam Plaza in the hamlet of Valhalla, town of Mt. Pleasant.

title: Establishes a child care tax credit
abstract: Relates to establishing a child care tax credit; credit shall be twenty-five percent of the expenses of child care.

title: Relates to a pedestrian's right of way
abstract: Expands and clarifies when pedestrians shall be entitled to the right of way with respect to all other traffic.

title: Enables public authorities to transmit electronic notifications to E-ZPass customers
abstract: Enables public authorities that offer E-ZPass payment for tolls, fares, fees, rentals or other charges to transmit electronic notifications stating that the electronic toll collection system has registered the customer's account to E-ZPass customers who opt in for such service.

title: Authorizes distinctive license plates for supporters of the conservation of the Seneca white deer
abstract: Authorizes distinctive license plates for supporters of the conservation of the Seneca white deer; establishes the New York state "preserve the Seneca white deer fund".

title: Expands eligibility for the New York state excelsior scholarship award to certain applicants enrolled on a part-time basis or in a BOCES or other approved vocational program
abstract: Expands eligibility for the New York state excelsior scholarship award to certain applicants enrolled on a part-time basis or in a BOCES or other approved vocational program; provides criteria for eligibility, and limits on amounts and durations for any such awards.

title: Provides that the commissioner of environmental conservation shall place and operate certain air quality monitoring systems in proximity to N.Y. city airports
abstract: Provides that the commissioner of environmental conservation shall place and operate certain air quality monitoring systems in proximity to NY city airports.

title: Creates an extra transfer for pay-per-ride Metrocard users
abstract: Relates to allowing two automatic free transfers for riders using pay-per-ride Metrocards.

title: Relates to petitions for election to the party position of member of the county committee
abstract: Relates to petitions for election to the party position of member of the county committee; provides that candidates shall not be required to provide their zip code if they have clearly stated their town or city on their petition.

title: Provides for a sex offender registry check for youth organization volunteers who have direct contact with youths under the age of 18
abstract: Provides for a sex offender registry check for youth organization volunteers who have direct contact with youths under the age of 18.

title: Establishes the clean fuel standard of 2023
abstract: Establishes the clean fuel standard of 2023; provides such standard is intended to reduce carbon intensity from the on-road transportation sector by 20% by 2031, with further reductions to be implemented based upon advances in technology.

title: Relates to mandating greater levels of disclosure by non-fiduciaries that provide investment advice
abstract: Relates to mandating greater levels of disclosure by non-fiduciaries that provide investment advice; requires signed acknowledgement of disclosure informing clients that the advisor owes no fiduciary duty.

title: Prohibits the disclosure of immigration status for victims of domestic violence
abstract: Prohibits disclosure of immigration status for victims of domestic violence.

title: Relates to aggravated cruelty to animals
abstract: Relates to aggravated cruelty to animals.

title: Relates to the imposition of penalties and remedies in suits brought for the vindication of civil rights or human rights
abstract: Relates to the imposition of penalties and remedies in suits brought for the vindication of civil rights or human rights.

title: Establishes certain offenses relating to crypto fraud
abstract: Establishes the offenses of virtual token fraud, illegal rug pulls, private key fraud and fraudulent failure to disclose interest in virtual tokens.

title: Prevents interactive computer service providers from knowingly or negligently promoting developed content that is dangerous or otherwise injurious to minors
abstract: Prevents interactive computer service providers from knowingly or negligently promoting developed content that is dangerous or otherwise injurious to minors; assesses a civil penalty to social media networks that knowingly or negligently promote such content.

title: Requires hospitals to provide language assistance services
abstract: Requires hospitals to provide language assistance services to a patient or a patient's assistant for communication of clinical and other information, including but not limited to health care, billing and making appointments, to ensure effective communication; provides that such interpreter may be a qualified interpreter, volunteer or medical personnel at such hospital; provides for such services to be available at all locations during all times that patient care is available; provides that translations of frequently used forms essential to a patient's care and treatment be available in all of the hospital's primary languages; provides for training of those providing interpretation services; requires the hospital to submit to the commissioner an annual report assessing compliance; defines primary language and patient visits.

title: Relates to bias related criminal activity
abstract: Proscribes conduct constituting a bias related crime, meaning for such purposes, the commission of a designated act that demonstrates a prejudice based on the race, color, religion, national origin, age, ethnicity, disability, gender or sexual orientation of the victim; denies the granting of youthful offender status for any offender committing such a crime.

title: Requires foster care records of incarcerated individual to be sent to a correctional facility
abstract: Requires foster care records of incarcerated individuals to be sent to the correctional facility.

title: Implements escalating penalties for vehicles which have been documented multiple times by a photo violation monitoring device for failure to comply with traffic-control indications
abstract: Implements escalating penalties for vehicles which have been documented multiple times by a photo violation monitoring device for failure to comply with traffic-control indications up to a suspension of a vehicle's registration.

title: Waives a registration fee for basic life support first response agencies
abstract: Relates to waiving the $200 microscopy registration fee for basic life support first response agencies.

title: Provides for requirements for approval for merger and consolidation of certain health care providers by the public health and health planning council
abstract: Provides for requirements for approval for proposals to merge, consolidate, partner, acquire through the establishment of control or proposals for any other transaction or affiliation of certain health care providers.

title: Relates to proceedings with respect to designating and nominating petitions
abstract: Allows for limited three-day expansion of the statute of limitations where a proceeding to invalidate a designating or nominating petition has been commenced.

title: Authorizes camp operators and employees to administer medications and treatment to children under certain circumstances
abstract: Allows camp operators and employees to administer medications and treatment to children, under parent direction and authorization.

title: Prohibits the use of state aid by colleges and universities to fund or provide membership in academic institutions that are boycotting a country or higher education institutions of a country
abstract: Prohibits the use of state aid by colleges and universities to fund or provide membership in academic institutions that are boycotting a country or higher education institutions of a country.

title: Relates to the installation of solar canopies in certain parking facilities
abstract: Permits and encourages state owned parking facilities to install solar canopies in any parking garage, open parking lot or other parking facility owned and/or operated by the state of New York, that offers parking spaces for the purposes of public use, state employee use or pay-per-usage constructed prior to January first, two thousand twenty-eight; requires such installation after January 1, 2028.

title: Relates to directing the department of health to study the potential health risks and effects of glyphosate and its by-product aminomethylphosphonic acid
abstract: Relates to directing the department of health to study the potential health risks and effects of glyphosate and its by-product aminomethylphosphonic acid; requires the commissioner of health to prepare a report for the governor and the legislature that includes the findings of such study, and to conduct an outreach program to inform local governments, private organizations, schools and the public regarding the findings of such report.

title: Relates to tuition assistance program awards
abstract: Increases the minimum tuition assistance program award; increases the maximum parental income amount.

title: Relates to issuing a certificate of compliance to any employer who achieves a gender pay gap of 10% or less
abstract: Relates to issuing a certificate of compliance to any employer who achieves a gender pay gap of 10% or less.

title: Relates to patient counseling before issuing a prescription for a schedule II opioid
abstract: Relates to patient counseling before issuing a prescription for a schedule II opioid; requires practitioners to consult with the patient regarding the quantity of the opioid and the patient's option to fill the prescription in a lesser quantity, and to inform the patient of the risks associated with opiate addiction and document the reason for the prescription.

title: Relates to procedures and other matters related to the receipt or discontinuation of certain benefits
abstract: Requires that all procedures and other matters related to the receipt or discontinuation of benefits available under section two hundred seven-c of the general municipal law shall be mandatorily negotiable terms and conditions of employment.

title: Prohibits individuals under the age of twenty-one from gambling
abstract: Prohibits individuals under the age of twenty-one from gambling.

title: Relates to collection, storage or transmission of personal information collected from smart home systems
abstract: Requires express and affirmative consent prior to collection, storage or transmittal of any personal information obtained from the installation or use of a smart home connected system by certain persons.

title: Relates to authorizing early parole release for incarcerated individuals where substance abuse was a significant contributing factor in the commission of the offense
abstract: Relates to authorizing early parole release for incarcerated individuals where substance abuse was a significant contributing factor in the commission of the offense.

title: Waives the biennial attorney registration fee for New York attorneys who are employed in a public service job
abstract: Waives the biennial attorney registration fee for New York attorneys who are employed in a public service job.

title: Requires the city of New York to establish the New York city school safety fund
abstract: Requires the city of New York to establish the New York city school safety fund, which transfers fines collected from the city's photo speed violation monitoring program and fines from the overpassing of stopped school buses to the fund to be used for school initiatives relating to the safe travel of students.

title: Relates to actions for illegal and improper practices of commercial towing companies
abstract: Authorizes a lien against personal and real property of the owner of a commercial towing company for illegal and improper practices; creates personal liability for members of an LLC and certain corporate shareholders.

title: Relates to improvements in the state central register of child abuse and maltreatment
abstract: Relates to improvements in the state central register of child abuse and maltreatment; allows the central register to receive electronic reports alleging child abuse or maltreatment; provides for a single statewide internet address that all persons, whether mandated by the law or not, may use to send electronic communications alleging child abuse or maltreatment.

title: Establishes the task force on education funding and property tax reform
abstract: Establishes the task force on education funding and property tax reform within the education department to conduct a comprehensive study and provide recommendations on education funding and the role of property taxes in funding New York's education system.

title: Relates to presumptive evidence that a person committed a hate crime
abstract: Relates to presumptive evidence that a person committed a hate crime by evaluating a certain set of facts and circumstances.

title: Requires arrests be recorded or else such arrest is void and the defendant is discharged
abstract: Requires arrests be recorded or else such arrest is void and the defendant is discharged.

title: Relates to reporting on the metropolitan transportation authority's state of good repair
abstract: Relates to reporting on the metropolitan transportation authority's state of good repair; requires the reporting to be published on the authority's website, outlining the repairs and investments needed to restore the authority's existing transit systems to a state of good repair.

title: Provides a tax abatement for facilty-integrated carbon-to-value equipment
abstract: Provides a tax abatement for facility-integrated carbon-to-value equipment in a city with a population of one million or more.

title: Requires a criminal court to release a defendant charged with certain offenses involving marihuana on his or her own recognizance upon ordering a case adjourned in contemplation of dismissal
abstract: Requires a criminal court to release a defendant charged with certain offenses involving marihuana on his or her own recognizance upon ordering a case adjourned in contemplation of dismissal.

title: Requires the department of education to report information regarding counselors, social workers and psychologists in schools
abstract: Requires the department of education to report information regarding counselors, social workers and psychologists in schools and to implement a plan to increase the school counselor, school social worker and school psychologist to student ratio to nationally accepted standards and provide funding for such.

title: Requires the payment of regular wages to bay constables employed by the town of Hempstead, Nassau county, who have sustained injuries or illnesses in the line of duty
abstract: Requires the payment of regular wages to bay constables employed by the town of Hempstead, Nassau county, who have sustained injuries or illnesses in the line of duty.

title: Includes certain activity in transit and transportation facilities with the crime of criminal trespass in the second degree
abstract: Includes certain activity in transit and transportation facilities within the crime of criminal trespass in the second degree.

title: Increases penalties for violation of overtaking and passing a school bus and creates the crime of vehicular homicide in the third degree
abstract: Increases penalties for violation of overtaking and passing a school bus; allows permissive suspension of a driver's license for up to six months for such violation; creates the crime of vehicular manslaughter in the third degree.

title: Relates to amending the universal full-day pre-kindergarten program subscription amount for regions other than New York city; repealer
abstract: Relates to amending the universal full-day pre-kindergarten program subscription amount for regions other than New York city.

title: Relates to certain real estate syndication offerings
abstract: Exempts certain timesharing plans involving ten or fewer purchasers from certain filing requirements relating to real estate investments; excludes New York City.

title: Requires events held by the state or on state property which include alcohol to include alcohol produced within the state
abstract: Requires events held by the state or on state property which include alcohol to include alcohol produced within the state.

title: Grants Tier IV status in the New York state and local employees' retirement system to Vincent Stark
abstract: Grants Tier IV status in the New York state and local employees' retirement system to Vincent Stark.

title: Creates the "metropolitan transportation infrastructure financing authority act of 2023"
abstract: Creates the metropolitan transportation infrastructure financing authority to issue bonds for project capital costs or elements described in the two thousand seventeen through two thousand twenty-one capital program plans; imposes an additional tax within the metropolitan commuter transportation district.

title: Directs public welfare officials to withhold rent from a landlord for violation of the warranty of habitability
abstract: Directs public welfare officials to withhold rent from a landlord for violation of the warranty of habitability; directs public welfare officials to seek a diminution of rent owed based on the duration of such violation.

title: Relates to wage reporting in the unemployment insurance law
abstract: Provides that to achieve cost savings to businesses and the state, improve decision timeliness, and minimize wrong-sized payments to eligible beneficiaries the department of labor shall obtain current employment and income information from a third-party provider, supplementing current state wage reporting files from the department of taxation and finance.

title: Authorizes licensed clinical social workers to provide services to injured employees under workers' compensation coverage
abstract: Authorizes licensed clinical social workers to provide services to injured employees under workers' compensation coverage; establishes special authorization shall be provided by the clinical social work practice committee.

title: Provides for review of bail data reports by the state commission on judicial conduct
abstract: Provides for review of bail data reports by the state commission on judicial conduct to study such reports for evidence of bias or prejudice by any judge or justice, and where appropriate based on such reports, to initiate, investigate, and hear complaints and otherwise comment on matters of bias and prejudice evidenced therein.

title: Makes it a class B felony to be a straw purchaser for firearms or to allow the use of your firearm in the commission of a class A or B felony
abstract: Makes it a class B felony to be a straw purchaser for firearms or to allow the use of your firearm in the commission of a class A or B felony.

title: Relates to audits conducted by the office of Medicaid inspector general detecting ministerial or clerical errors that generate an overpayment
abstract: Relates to audits conducted by the office of Medicaid inspector general detecting ministerial or clerical errors that generate an overpayment to a vendor providing non-emergency medical transportation services.

title: Relates to the perimeter rule at LaGuardia airport
abstract: Provides that the port authority shall prohibit nonstop flights to or from points beyond one thousand five hundred miles, except on Saturdays and flights to Denver, Colorado, from flying to or from LaGuardia airport, an air terminal of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey.

title: Relates to requiring schools to conduct annual lead testing
abstract: Requires schools to conduct annual lead testing on pipes and paint in all schools in New York city that provide schooling for children ages six and under and to remediate any presence of lead immediately if detected.

title: Enacts the "health insurance preauthorization disclosure act"
abstract: Enacts the "health insurance preauthorization disclosure act"; requires health insurance companies to provide participating health care providers with a list of health care treatments and services that require preauthorization from the health insurance company.

title: Relates to motions for summary judgment
abstract: Relates to motions for summary judgment.

title: Relates to the duration of certain tests
abstract: Provides that any standardized test or examination shall not be subject to any time limitation when administered by the city district.

title: Enacts hazing offenses and anti-hazing educational programs at educational institutions; repealer
abstract: Enacts hazing offenses and anti-hazing educational programs at educational institutions and requires educational institutions to maintain a public report on hazing violations.

title: Establishes a pregnant persons' bill of rights
abstract: Establishes a pregnant persons' bill of rights; requires posting and disclosing such bill of rights; establishes a penalty for failure to post or disclose such bill of rights.

title: Provides home addresses of certain employees to employee organizations
abstract: Directs employers to provide the home address of employees of a bargaining unit to the employee organization.

title: Requires batteries for bicycles with electric assist and electric scooters to be tested and approved by and contain the seal of the Underwriters Laboratories
abstract: Requires batteries for bicycles with electric assist and electric scooters to be tested and approved by and contain the seal of the Underwriters Laboratories.

title: Relates to requiring the installation of intelligent speed assistance devices for repeated violation of maximum speed limits
abstract: Requires the installation of intelligent speed assistance devices if a driver accumulates eleven or more points on their driving record during an eighteen month period, or receives 6 speed camera or red light camera tickets during a twelve month period.

title: Relates to extending the authority for Nassau county to impose certain taxes and fees
abstract: Extends the authority of the county of Nassau to impose hotel and motel taxes; extends the expiration of certain provisions relating to a surcharge on tickets to places of entertainment in such county, a charge for copying and searching for police accident reports, and receipt of service charges by the Nassau county traffic and parking violations agency; extends the authority of Nassau County to impose additional sales and compensating use taxes and local government assistance programs in Nassau County.

title: Relates to the municipal sustainable energy loan program
abstract: Relates to the municipal sustainable energy loan program; includes water efficiency improvements and resiliency improvements in the municipal sustainable energy loan program.

title: Prohibits motor vehicle insurers from discrimination on the basis of socioeconomic factors in determining algorithms used to construct actuarial tables, coverage terms, premiums and/or rates
abstract: Prohibits motor vehicle insurers from discrimination on the basis of socioeconomic factors in determining algorithms used to construct actuarial tables, coverage terms, premiums and/or rates.

title: Permits animal-drawn vehicles to equip and use amber flashing lights
abstract: Permits animal-drawn vehicles to equip and use amber flashing lights; does not apply to such vehicles in a city with a population of one million or more.

title: Explicitly permits the standard utility interconnection of sub-transmission lines for particular projects
abstract: Permits the standard utility interconnection of sub-transmission lines for particular projects.

title: Directs the public service commission to review cellular service within the state
abstract: Enacts the "cellular mapping act"; requires the public service commission to review cellular services within the state; requires the expansion of cellular services.

title: Authorizes a person to petition for expungement of records of arrest, investigation, detention and computer databases in certain instances
abstract: Authorizes a person to petition for expungement of records of arrest, investigation, detention and computer databases in certain instances where such person may have been falsely arrested, whose case was dismissed, or where innocent.

title: Establishes the hospice and palliative care workgroup
abstract: Establishes the hospice and palliative care workgroup; provides for the repeal of such provisions upon expiration thereof.

title: Establishes the New York city housing authority repair certificate program to grant zoning benefits to developers which perform capital repairs to housing projects
abstract: Establishes the New York city housing authority repair certificate program to grant zoning benefits to developers which perform capital repairs to housing projects.

title: Relates to authorizing and establishing a training program for paramedics for the administration of buprenorphine
abstract: Relates to authorizing and establishing a training program for paramedics for the administration of buprenorphine.

title: Relates to the registration of electric personal mobility devices; repealer
abstract: Enacts the "responsible implementation of e-bike regulations for safe cycling (RIDERS) act; defines "electric skateboard" and "electric personal mobility device"; requires the registration of all electric personal mobility devices, including, but not limited to, bicycles with electric assist, electric scooters and electric skateboards; makes related provisions.

title: Permits doulas to be present in the operating room while a cesarean section is being performed
abstract: Requires maternal healthcare facilities to permit doulas to be present in the operating room while a cesarean section is being performed.

title: Provides for standardbred equine drug testing standards
abstract: Provides for standardbred equine drug testing standards by permitting the New York state gaming commission to participate in the interstate compact on anti-doping and drug testing standards.

title: Relates to prohibiting agreements between employers that directly restrict the current or future employment of any employee
abstract: Prohibits agreements between employers that directly restrict the current or future employment of any employee; allows for a cause of action against employers who engage in such agreements.

title: Limits the lookback period for insurance overpayment recovery from health care providers to three months
abstract: Limits the lookback period for insurance overpayment recovery from health care providers to three months.

title: Relates to establishing ground rent rebates for eligible homeowners and renters in the Battery Park project area
abstract: Relates to establishing ground rent rebates for eligible homeowners and renters in the Battery Park project area; provides for a rebate program; provides for a process for application and certification.

title: Requires the state to provide reimbursement of certain costs and benefits incurred as a result of an injury occurring during a mutual aid call
abstract: Requires the state to provide reimbursement of certain costs and benefits incurred as a result of an injury occurring during a mutual aid call.

title: Prohibits corporations that receive public financing from giving gifts to public officials
abstract: Prohibits corporations that receive public financing from giving gifts to public officials.

title: Extends the limitations on the shift between classes of taxable property in the town of Orangetown, county of Rockland
abstract: Extends the limitations on the shift between classes of taxable property in the town of Orangetown, county of Rockland for the 2023--2024 assessment rolls.

title: Prohibits the public use of cannabis, unless approved by the applicable local government
abstract: Prohibits the use of cannabis in public places, unless approved by the applicable local government.

title: Relates to the independent livery driver benefit fund
abstract: Prohibits local taxi and limousine commissions from allowing any base or other entity to dispatch to a livery without that base or other entity first becoming a member of the independent livery driver benefit fund.

title: Establishes the practice of telepharmacy
abstract: Establishes the practice of telepharmacy to allow for the practice of pharmacy provided by a pharmacist to one or more remote site pharmacies in which all sites are connected via computer link, video link and audio link, or other functionally equivalent telecommunications equipment.

title: Provides for warnings regarding two-point seat belts
abstract: Requires the commissioner of DMV to provide applicants for registration of vehicles manufactured before 2009 with informational materials informing them of the hazards associated with a two-point seat belt.

title: Relates to tampering with physical evidence
abstract: Includes a police or peace officers turning off his or her body camera or deleting a body camera recording in the crime of tampering with physical evidence.

title: Establishes incapacity to consent when a person is a witness to or subject of an investigation under certain circumstances
abstract: Establishes incapacity to consent when a person is a witness to or subject of an investigation under certain circumstances.

title: Grants constables on Fishers Island in the town of Southold in Suffolk county peace officer status
abstract: Grants constables on Fishers Island in the town of Southold in Suffolk county peace officer status.

title: Increases the minimum insurance coverage required for motor vehicles registered and/or operated within the state of New York
abstract: Increases the minimum insurance coverage required for motor vehicles registered and/or operated within the state of New York; for injury or death to one person in any one accident, increases the limits required from $25,000 to $50,000 for bodily injury and from $50,000 to $100,000 for death, for injury or death to more than one person in any one accident, increases the limits required from $50,000 to $100,000 for bodily injury and from $100,000 to $200,000 for death, and for third party property damage in any one accident, increases the limits required from $10,000 to $25,000.

title: Relates to establishing the statewide transportation network company drivers misconduct database
abstract: Relates to establishing the statewide transportation network company drivers misconduct database; requires the department of motor vehicles to establish a database and compile the names of any transportation network company drivers who have had their employment terminated due to misconduct.

title: Relates to the training requirements for prescribers of certain pain medications
abstract: Relates to the training requirements for prescribers of certain pain medications.

title: Enacts the Health Care Nondiscrimination Act of 2023
abstract: Enacts the Health Care Nondiscrimination Act.

title: Relates to commission hearings of racetrack ejectments and denials of access of commission licensees
abstract: Relates to commission hearings of racetrack ejectments and denials of access of commission licensees.

title: Relates to screening for gifted and talented students
abstract: Requires school districts to screen for gifted and talented students; provides the parents or guardians of such students the option to opt out of such screening.

title: Relates to the exercise of powers and duties of the board of elections of the city of New York and its executive management
abstract: Relates to the exercise of powers and duties of the board of elections of the city of New York and its executive management.

title: Relates to monetary penalties that a parking violations bureau may impose for illegally idling the engine of a motor vehicle
abstract: Relates to monetary penalties that a parking violations bureau may impose for illegally idling the engine of a motor vehicle.

title: Relates to a half fare rate program in the MTA for veterans
abstract: Directs the MTA to establish a half fare rate program for veterans.

title: Relates to surcharges for the installation or use of certain appliances in housing accommodations subject to rent control
abstract: Prohibits the imposition of any surcharge for the installation or use of a tenant-installed appliance where the tenant pays for electric utility service.

title: Relates to parole eligibility for felony offenders; repealer
abstract: Requires that all felony offenders shall be eligible for parole after serving no more than twenty-five years of their sentence; eliminates the possibility of serving consecutive terms of imprisonment which exceed a twenty-five year sentence.

title: Relates to drivers' license suspensions for traffic fatalities
abstract: Requires the suspension of the license to operate a motor vehicle of any person who was operating a motor vehicle at the time of an accident which resulted in a fatality.

title: Modifies the interest rate within the standard nonforfeiture law for annuities
abstract: Reduces the minimum nonforfeiture interest rate for annuities from one percent to one half of one percent for annuities during the surrender charge period, and from one percent to fifteen hundredths of one percent during any contract period with no surrender charge.

title: Authorizes conditional adult-use cultivator licensees to sell their own cannabis products and authorizes the office of cannabis management to create a program for licensees to process cannabis into distillate
abstract: Authorizes conditional adult-use cultivator licensees to sell their own cannabis products; authorizes the office of cannabis management to create a loan or grant program to help such adult-use cultivator licensees to process cannabis into distillate.

title: Prohibits certain agencies from charging for the process of a FOIL request made by state and local agencies or the state legislature
abstract: Prohibits agencies from charging for the process of a FOIL request made by state and local agencies or the state legislature.

title: Relates to funding early intervention services
abstract: Relates to funding early intervention services; provides that for the 2023 fiscal year there shall be an 11 percent increase in funding.

title: Relates to creating a task force on affordable housing lotteries
abstract: Creates a task force on affordable housing lotteries to review the affordable housing lotteries within New York state and determine the lotteries' effectiveness and recommend how the lotteries could be improved.

title: Requires primary care physicians to post information detailing how parents or guardians of children can subscribe to the US consumer product safety commission's e-mail subscription lists
abstract: Requires primary care physicians to post certain information detailing how parents or guardians of infants and children can subscribe to the United States consumer product safety commission's e-mail subscription lists.

title: Includes wildlife animals as those subject to the animal cruelty provisions
abstract: Includes wildlife animals as those subject to the animal cruelty provisions of the agriculture and markets law.

title: Provides for issuing non-driver identification cards to certain persons with suspended driving privileges
abstract: Issues non-driver identification cards to certain persons with suspended driving privileges due to a driving while intoxicated arrest.

title: Relates to the composition of boards of elections
abstract: Relates to the composition of boards of elections; provides that such boards shall have other qualifications for performing their duties as the legislature may direct.

title: Relates to the establishment of the wellness program privacy act
abstract: Establishes the wellness program privacy act; requires employers and insurers to take certain measures to protect the security of wellness program participants' private information.

title: Creates a temporary state commission to study and investigate issues affecting reentry of incarcerated individuals released from correctional facilities; appropriation
abstract: Creates a temporary state commission to study and investigate issues affecting reentry of incarcerated individuals released from correctional facilities; appropriates $250,000 therefor.

title: Authorizes the impoundment of vehicles operated by intoxicated or impaired persons
abstract: Authorizes the impoundment of vehicles operated by intoxicated or impaired persons; authorizes the release of impounded vehicles to owners of such vehicles if certain criteria is met; authorizes a reasonable fee for towing and storage of such vehicles.

title: Relates to providing funding for combating legionnaires' disease in N.Y. city; appropriation
abstract: Relates to providing funding for combating legionnaires' disease in cities having a population of one million or more; appropriates money therefor.

title: Relates to allowing for case workers to apply for education and training vouchers for children in foster care
abstract: Allows for case workers to apply for education and training vouchers for children in foster care.

title: Relates to disputes between a surrogate and a hospital or individual health care provider
abstract: Relates to disputes between a surrogate and a hospital or individual health care provider; cites when the requirement of a provider to provide life-sustaining treatment following a surrogate's directive does not apply.

title: Relates to eligible purchases by school lunch service programs receiving additional state subsidies
abstract: Permits a school food authority to attribute moneys spent on purchases of food products from New York state farmers, growers, producers or processors made for its school breakfast program to the thirty percent of costs for school lunch service programs.

title: Relates to the compulsory age for full time instruction from six to five years of age and certain exceptions for minor children
abstract: Relates to the compulsory age for full time instruction from six to five years of age and certain exceptions for minor children.

title: Relates to providing copies of medical records to patients
abstract: Allows for patients to make a written request to receive copies of their medical records.

title: Prohibits entry to gun shows to anyone under twelve years of age
abstract: Prohibits entry to gun shows to anyone under twelve years of age.

title: Directs a study on the feasibility of adjusting the compulsory attendance age of minors attending full time instruction
abstract: Directs a study on the feasibility of adjusting the compulsory attendance age of minors attending full time instruction; requires report and recommendations on or before July 1, 2025.

title: Requires certain school staff members to be trained in the Heimlich maneuver
abstract: Requires certain school staff members to be trained in the Heimlich maneuver and requires at least one such trained person to be present when and where students eat meals.

title: Provides for issuance of annual special hauling permits for trucking companies in certain circumstances on the New York state thruway in the Westchester area
abstract: Provides for issuance of annual special hauling permits for trucking companies in certain circumstances on the New York state thruway in the Westchester area.

title: Ends the local option of towns and cities to prohibit the sale of alcohol; repealer
abstract: Ends the local option of towns and cities to prohibit the sale of alcohol.

title: Requires insurance and Medicaid coverage for inpatient and outpatient substance abuse treatment for a period of not less than forty-five days
abstract: Requires insurance and Medicaid coverage for inpatient and outpatient substance abuse treatment for a period of not less than forty-five days.

title: Authorizes the taxation of state land in the county of Westchester
abstract: Authorizes the taxation of state land in the county of Westchester.

title: Relates to establishing limitations on bank accounts after such accounts have been closed
abstract: Relates to establishing limitations on bank accounts after such accounts have been closed including opening or re-opening such account, requesting a deposit or withdrawal or assessing certain fees.

title: Provides that candidates who have provided firefighting service may deduct up to a maximum of six years from their age for purposes of meeting the age requirements
abstract: Provides that candidates who have provided firefighting service may deduct up to a maximum of six years from their age for purposes of meeting the age requirements.

title: Prohibits insurer from increasing auto insurance premiums upon renewal for persons 60 years of age or over solely on the ground of insureds' age
abstract: Prohibits insurer from increasing auto insurance premiums upon renewal for persons 60 years of age or over based solely on the ground of the insured's age.

title: Allows for no fault separation
abstract: Allows for no fault separation.

title: Relates to assisting persons with medically diagnosed HIV infection; repealer
abstract: Relates to assisting persons with medically diagnosed HIV infection.

title: Allows domestic insurers to make certain records available by electronic means
abstract: Allows domestic insurers to make certain records available by electronic means that provides equivalent access to the superintendent.

title: Authorizes the creation and issuance of a distinctive license plate for fire police
abstract: Authorizes the creation and issuance of a distinctive license plate for fire police.

title: Limits the liability of a school
abstract: Limits the liability of schools holding in-person instruction in compliance with state approved plans.

title: Provides a real property tax exemption to agricultural lands that are used for certain purposes
abstract: Provides a real property tax exemption to agricultural lands that are used for certain purposes.

title: Allows certain previous investigations to be re-examined using a fair preponderance of the evidence standard
abstract: Allows previous investigations in which the subject was indicated for child abuse or maltreatment using a credible evidence standard and in which the subject of the report is a victim of domestic violence and the sole basis for such report is that such subject failed to provide adequate guardianship due to engaging in acts of domestic violence to be re-examined using a fair preponderance of the evidence standard.

title: Relates to public adjuster disclosures and financial or ownership interests
abstract: Prohibits an individual or entity that performs services, work, or repairs from performing the services, work, or repairs relating to any insurance claim for which a public adjuster represents the insured or has negotiated or effected a settlement where such public adjuster has a financial or ownership interest in such individual or entity that performs the services, work, or repairs; requires public adjusters to make certain disclosures.

title: Creates a tax credit for businesses that develop a "college to work" program, paying the tuition of individuals in exchange for future employment
abstract: Creates a tax credit for businesses that develop a "college to work" program, paying the tuition of individuals in exchange for the individual committing to work for the business after the individual's graduation from an institution of higher learning; provides the tax credit shall be for twenty-five percent of the individual's tuition expenses not to exceed five thousand dollars.

title: Limits the number of consecutive hours worked by certain employees of N.Y. city
abstract: Limits the number of consecutive hours worked by certain employees of cities of one million or more; provides that employees of cities of one million or more who are subject to a collective bargaining agreement shall not work more than 17 consecutive hours in a work day.

title: Provides for sick leave to employees following a miscarriage or stillbirth
abstract: Requires every employer to provide each employee with the equivalent number of hours as three full work days for such employee of paid sick leave for a miscarriage or stillbirth of an infant born to the employee.

title: Allows municipalities to regulate public places where cannabis can be consumed
abstract: Allows municipalities to regulate public places where cannabis can be consumed.

title: Provides maternity patients with information regarding births utilizing forceps
abstract: Provides maternity patients with information regarding births utilizing forceps including any potential injuries the mother or child could sustain due to the use of forceps and statistics on deaths resulting from the use of forceps.

title: Requires the transfer of medical records within sixty days of written request
abstract: Relates to requiring the transfer of medical records within sixty days of written request.

title: Provides for actuarially appropriate discounts on fire and homeowners insurance after completion of certified residential home safety and loss prevention course; repealer
abstract: Provides for the establishment of residential home safety and loss prevention courses certified by the superintendent of financial services; requires insurers to provide actuarially appropriate discounts on fire and homeowners insurance premiums to those homeowners who have completed a residential home safety and loss prevention course; directs the superintendent of financial services to promulgate such rules and regulations as are necessary to implement such program and specifies certain matters which must be included in such rules and regulations; requires the superintendent of financial services to issue a report thereon.

title: Extends the timeline for the return of security deposits for residential rental agreements from fourteen days to thirty days
abstract: Extends the timeline for the return of security deposits for residential rental agreements from fourteen days to thirty days.

title: Establishes a civil cause of action for employees who are subjected to an abusive work environment
abstract: Establishes a civil cause of action for employees who are subjected to an abusive work environment; employers shall be vicariously liable for such work environment.

title: Establishes a pilot program for the dispensing of hearing aids in the county of Westchester
abstract: Establishes a pilot program for the dispensing of hearing aids in the county of Westchester.

title: Relates to reimbursement of non-public and private schools where COVID testing is being mandated
abstract: Requires the state to reimburse non-public and private schools for the cost of testing where COVID-19 testing is being mandated by the state.

title: Provides for minimum wage requirements for miscellaneous industry workers
abstract: Provides for minimum wage requirements for miscellaneous industry workers.

title: Provides for calculating the area median income based on zip code for affordable housing programs in N.Y. city
abstract: Establishes that area median income shall be calculated per each zip code in the city of New York.

title: Relates to issuing temporary spousal support
abstract: Allows family court to issue temporary spousal support when issuing either a temporary order of protection or a temporary order for child support.

title: Establishes a deaf and hard of hearing outreach program to facilitate communication between hearing-impaired persons and law enforcement personnel
abstract: Establishes a deaf and hard of hearing outreach program to facilitate communication between deaf and hard of hearing individuals and law enforcement personnel.

title: Authorizes the Jamesport Fire District to file an application for exemption from real property taxes
abstract: Authorizes the Jamesport Fire District to file an application for exemption from 2021-2022 and 2022-2023 real property taxes.

title: Requires health insurance plans to provide coverage for epi-pens for individuals 18 years old and younger
abstract: Requires health insurance plans to provide coverage for epi-pens for individuals 18 years old and younger.

title: Enhances the penalties for crimes committed during a riot
abstract: Enhances the penalties for crimes committed during a riot.

title: Prohibits certain fees from being imposed by licensed wholesalers
abstract: Prohibits certain fees from being imposed by licensed wholesalers on licensed retailers.

title: Relates to Medicaid reimbursement rates for rural home health care providers
abstract: Increases Medicaid reimbursement rates for rural home health care providers to cover actual costs of delivery.

title: Establishes goals for participation by individuals with disabilities with respect to state employment, state contracts, legislative employment and judicial employment
abstract: Relates to establishing goals for participation by individuals with disabilities with respect to state employment, state contracts, legislative employment and judicial employment; establishes a goal of seven percent employment of individuals with disabilities within state agencies, the state legislature, unified court system and state contractors and subcontractors; defines terms.

title: Directs social services districts to contract with non-residential programs for victims of domestic violence to provide outreach and education in high schools
abstract: Directs social services districts to contract with non-residential programs for victims of domestic violence to provide outreach and education to students in public and private high schools; provides for state reimbursement therefor.

title: Relates to establishing a tax credit for electric vehicle charging stations task force
abstract: Establishes a tax credit for electric vehicle charging stations task force to recommend a program for a tax credit for commercial property owners who install electric vehicle charging stations on such property.

title: Establishes the department of oversight and investigation; repealer
abstract: Establishes the department of oversight and investigation, providing for its powers, duties and functions (Part A); relates to repealing provisions relating to the commission on ethics and lobbying in government; relates to repealing provisions relating to the office of the state inspector general (Part B); provides for the transfer of the functions, powers and duties of the commission on ethics and lobbying in government, the office of the state inspector general and the former temporary state commission of investigation to the department of oversight and investigation (Part C); relates to the commission on ethics and lobbying; relates to membership on the franchise oversight board; relates to the state inspector general; relates to the former temporary state commission of investigation; relates to the commission on ethics and lobbying in government and the legislative ethics commission; relates to the office of the state inspector general; creates a temporary state commission of investigation (Part D).

title: Provides that at the close of each fiscal year, five percent of any cash surplus in the general fund shall be transferred to the debt reduction reserve fund
abstract: Provides that at the close of each fiscal year, five percent of any cash surplus in the general fund shall be transferred to the debt reduction reserve fund.

title: Eliminates rent for homeless shelters; repealer
abstract: Relates to eliminating rent for homeless shelters; provides that a homeless individual or family applying for or receiving temporary housing assistance shall not be required to pay room and board or contribute any earned or unearned income, available benefits or resources to eliminate their need for temporary housing assistance or as a condition to receive temporary housing assistance from such provider.

title: Increases the amount in the tax stabilization reserve fund to 5% of state fiscal year disbursements
abstract: Increases the amount in the tax stabilization reserve fund to 5% of state fiscal year disbursements.

title: Allows previous investigations to be re-examined using a fair preponderance of the evidence standard
abstract: Allows previous investigations in which the subject was indicated for child abuse or maltreatment using a credible evidence standard to be re-examined using a fair preponderance of the evidence standard.

title: Relates to the establishment of a staffing plan for all uniformed and non-uniformed employees at correctional facilities
abstract: Relates to the establishment of a staffing plan for all uniformed and non-uniformed employees at correctional facilities to ensure adequate staffing.

title: Relates to reimbursement by Medicaid for services required by state law
abstract: Relates to reimbursement for Medicaid for services required by state law; provides department of health must pay 100% of the non-federal share for services required by state law, not federal.

title: Defines the term crossbow
abstract: Defines the term crossbow as a bow and string, either compound or recurve, that launches a bolt or arrow, mounted upon a stock with a trigger that holds the string and limbs under tension until released which shall have at least six inches of limb width.

title: Provides for the issuance of free hunting, fishing and trapping licenses to members of the Seneca nation who reside in the state
abstract: Provides for the issuance of free hunting, fishing and trapping licenses to members of the Seneca nation who reside in the state.

title: Creates the New York state entrepreneurial training act
abstract: Creates the NYS entrepreneurial training act to provide grants to eligible applicants to support and train entrepreneurial candidates.

title: Relates to modular construction work
abstract: Relates to modular construction work; provides that modular construction shall comply with any existing municipal licensing requirements for all electrical, plumbing, and fire suppression work.

title: Establishes a fire protection and emergency task force in rural areas
abstract: Establishes a fire prevention and emergency task force to develop a plan for training requirements and standards for fire prevention and emergency response services in rural areas and to examine the necessity of having uniform standards across the state.

title: Enacts the adjacent neighbors' bill of rights
abstract: Relates to enacting the "adjacent neighbors' bill of rights"; requires the department of buildings to develop a bulletin known as the "adjacent neighbors' bill of rights" advising homeowners who are adjacent to a property under development or construction of their rights and available resources and post such bulletin on the department's website.

title: Relates to the creation of an ATV trail fund and the use of ATVs
abstract: Relates to the creation of an ATV trail fund and the use of ATVs.

title: Allows a notice of dense breast tissue to be determination of medical necessity for coverage of a breast ultrasound
abstract: Allows a notice of dense breast tissue to be considered a determination of medical necessity for purposes of coverage of breast ultrasounds as recommended by a provider of mammography services.

title: Extends the timeframe for motor vehicle inspections for new motor vehicles sold within the state
abstract: Extends the timeframe for motor vehicle inspections for new motor vehicles sold within the state to five years from the date of sale.

title: Directs the public service commission to undertake a study of consumer protections adopted by electric corporations and utilities
