abstract: Directs the public service commission to undertake a study of consumer protections adopted by electric corporations and utilities; includes reporting on the adequacy of the public service commission's assistance to customers facing disconnection of utility service.

title: Establishes a New York state internet marketplace sales tax task force
abstract: Authorizes the department of financial services to establish a task force to provide the governor and the legislature with information on the potential effects of an internet marketplace sales tax in the state.

title: Relates to the assault on sports officials and aggravated harassment of a sports official and the provision of information to the spectators of such sporting events
abstract: Establishes the crime of assault on sports officials and aggravated harassment of a sports official; makes aggravated harassment of a sports official a class B misdemeanor; requires the state education department to establish an information campaign to be distributed to all youth and school sports programs requiring such programs to disseminate information to parents and other spectators of such programs on the protections afforded sports officials.

title: Prohibits the release of certain records of victims of police violence by a coroner, coroner's physician or medical examiner
abstract: Prohibits the release of criminal history or any mental health history records by a coroner, coroner's physician or medical examiner of individuals who were the subject of the use of force by a police or peace officer.

title: Establishes guidelines for DAs with regard to electronic conversion of certain records, books or papers in the care or custody of DAs that are more than ten years old
abstract: Relates to establishing guidelines for DAs with regard to electronic conversion of certain records, books or papers in the care, custody or control of DAs that are more than 10 years old.

title: Provides for the establishment of a method for determining the lowest responsible bidder when negotiating state contracts
abstract: Provides for the establishment of a method for determining the lowest responsible bidder when negotiating state contracts that would incorporate quantifiable fiscal benefits.

title: Authorizes a tax exemption and a tax abatement for alterations and improvements to multiple dwellings for purposes of preserving habitability in affordable housing
abstract: Authorizes a tax exemption and a tax abatement for alterations and improvements to multiple dwellings for purposes of preserving habitability in affordable housing.

title: Designates the uniformed court officers of the town of Busti, as peace officers
abstract: Designates the uniformed court officers of the town of Busti, in the county of Chautauqua, as peace officers.

title: Provides grant funding, where available, for broadband services in non-competitive locations
abstract: Provides grant funding, where available, for broadband services in non-competitive locations through the ConnectAll deployment program.

title: Initiates a five-year moratorium on the dissolution of any urban rental Mitchell-Lama company and establishes a Mitchell-Lama housing program study
abstract: Initiates a five-year moratorium on the dissolution of any urban rental Mitchell-Lama company; establishes a Mitchell-Lama housing program study.

title: Prohibits landlords from reporting a late rent payment to a consumer reporting agency
abstract: Prohibits any lessor or agent of a lessor from reporting to any consumer reporting agency, and prohibits consumer reporting agencies from maintaining such information.

title: Requires the state to reimburse municipalities for loss of real property tax revenue resulting from establishment of community residential facilities
abstract: Requires the state to reimburse municipalities for loss of real property tax revenue resulting from the establishment of community residential facilities for the disabled.

title: Allows current, active and retired military service members and reserve units of the state to qualify for distinctive license plates
abstract: Allows current, active and retired military service members and reserve units of the state to qualify for distinctive license plates; allows the spouse to also qualify for such distinctive plates.

title: Relates to grants to cover the costs of school resource officers and authorizes boards of cooperative educational services to enter into contracts with local police entities to provide school resource officers
abstract: Relates to grants to cover the costs of school resource officers; authorizes boards of cooperative educational services to enter into contracts with local police entities to provide school resource officers.

title: Removes the board of trustees of the state university of New York as a charter entity; repealer
abstract: Removes the board of trustees of the state university of New York as a charter entity.

title: Removes the requirement that a veteran served during wartime to be granted certain benefits
abstract: Removes the requirement that a veteran served during wartime to be granted certain benefits.

title: Protects the confidentiality of vaccine information; repealer
abstract: Protects the confidentiality of vaccine information; relates to the sharing of vaccine registry information; provides that anyone requiring an immunization passport shall accept a valid COVID-19 Vaccination Record Card.

title: Enacts the state and local government food waste prevention and diversion act
abstract: Enacts the state and local government food waste prevention and diversion act; requires facilities generating excess food waste to take measures to minimize such waste.

title: Relates to the installation of appliances or fixtures by tenants
abstract: Prohibits landlords from restricting the installation of appliances or fixtures by tenants; provides that the landlord is not compelled to change utilities for such installation; prohibits surcharge where tenant pays utilities directly to provider.

title: Establishes the empire state professional nursing scholarship program and grants for nursing education
abstract: Establishes the empire state professional nursing scholarship program to provide financial support to applicants to enter or continue in a registered nurse educational program and who agree to deliver nursing care in a specialty, setting or designated region of New York state having a shortage of nurses or to teach nursing students; establishes grants for nursing education to establish or expand training programs for nurses and to increase the opportunities for nursing education at community based sites.

title: Relates to training requirements for members of the board of ethics of a political subdivision or municipality
abstract: Provides that each member of the board of ethics of a political subdivision or municipality shall complete, at a minimum, four hours of training each year designed to enable such members to more effectively carry out their duties; makes related provisions.

title: Requires school bus drivers and attendants who ride with children attending preschool special education programs to complete training
abstract: Requires school bus drivers and attendants who ride with children attending preschool special education programs to complete training in the needs of such children.

title: Enacts the "emergency school relief act of 2023"
abstract: Enacts the "emergency school relief act"; makes changes in the percentages for disposition of revenue from lottery prize account to increase the percentage directed to state aid for education funding.

title: Relates to the development of a public anti-stigma mental health education program
abstract: Relates to the development of a public anti-stigma mental health education program targeting the general public and underserved populations.

title: Provides for definitions of mental health and family and youth peer and requires the office of mental health establish peer service qualification programs
abstract: Provides for definitions of mental health and family and youth peer advocates and requires the office of mental health to establish peer service qualification programs.

title: Relates to dismissal of teachers for sexual improprieties
abstract: Relates to dismissal of teachers for sexual improprieties; requires school districts to divulge reasons for dismissal to any school district which inquires into such teacher's dismissal.

title: Increases the household threshold income cap on tuition assistance
abstract: Increases the household threshold income cap on tuition assistance from $80,000 to $100,000.

title: Relates to creating the N.Y. State Health Care Consumer and Provider Protection and Equity Act
abstract: Establishes the NYS Health Care Consumer and Provider Protection and Equity Act to allow physicians and dentists to negotiate collectively with employers.

title: Requires a purchaser of any firearm, rifle or shotgun to submit to a mental health evaluation
abstract: Requires a purchaser of any firearm, rifle or shotgun to submit to a mental health evaluation and provide the seller with his or her approval to purchase such firearm.

title: Prohibits the imposition and collection of a fare, toll, rental, rate, charge or other fee on the Cross Bay Veterans Memorial Bridge
abstract: Prohibits the imposition and collection of a fare, toll, rental, rate, charge or other fee on the Cross Bay Veterans Memorial Bridge.

title: Prohibits increase in maximum rents unless essential tenant services are maintained
abstract: Prohibits any increase in the average monthly rental of a property by a limited-profit housing company unless the appropriate local housing agency certifies that there exists no recorded violations against such property or that all recorded violations have been cleared, corrected or abated, and that such company is maintaining all essential services required to be furnished.

title: Relates to leased vehicle protections
abstract: Relates to leased vehicle protections; provides that every lease shall itemize and set forth in detail all costs required to be paid by the lessee or purchaser of the rental vehicle upon termination of such lease.

title: Relates to authorizing certain sales of private label wine
abstract: Authorizes certain restaurants to sell sealed bottles of private label wine for off-premises consumption with the purchase of a substantial food item.

title: Relates to safe staffing levels at nursing homes
abstract: Relates to safe staffing levels at nursing homes; requires the department of health to give significant weight to labor supply shortages in particular regions during any declared statewide disaster emergency.

title: Establishes the senior housing accessibility study group; repealer
abstract: Establishes the senior housing accessibility study group to examine and make recommendations for amending the New York state uniform fire prevention and building code to improve and enhance accessibility requirements for all newly constructed or substantially reconstructed senior housing developments.

title: Authorizes religious observance as a cause for absentee voting
abstract: Authorizes religious observance as a cause for absentee voting.

title: Permits tenants in certain cities to take a rental offset for repair of hazardous conditions
abstract: Provides that in cities with a population of one million or more, a tenant or group of tenants, after proper notice to the landlord of the existence of a hazardous violation of housing codes and certification of the existence of such violation by the local agency charged with enforcement of housing codes, may contract for the repair of such condition and offset the price of such repair from his rental payments if the landlord fails to commence work to correct the condition within a certain period after notice is received.

title: Requires investigation of all reports of child abuse made to the statewide central register of child abuse by hospitals, or medical or law enforcement personnel
abstract: Provides that when the state central register of child abuse and maltreatment receives a report by means of a telephone call from a physician, registered nurse or registered physician's assistant or from a social worker or psychologist, or by a law enforcement official, such telephone calls shall not be screened by the hotline but shall be immediately transmitted to the appropriate child protective service for investigation; provides for the child protective service of each county to establish procedures for communication and cooperation with local hospitals and law enforcement to better protect the interests of at risk children and to better provide essential services to their families.

title: Relates to certain tuition payments by school districts for general education and special students residing in such school districts
abstract: Excludes certain tuition payments by school districts for general education and special students residing in such school districts from the calculation of the tax levy limit.

title: Relates to the service life requirement for painting, striping and other new infrastructure dedicated primarily for pedestrian or cyclist use
abstract: Enables federal aid municipal street and highway funding for projects for painting, striping and other new infrastructure dedicated primarily for pedestrian or cyclist use notwithstanding the ten year service life requirement.

title: Provides that the intentional murder of a child under the age of twelve shall be a first degree murder offense
abstract: Provides that the intentional murder of a child under the age of twelve shall be a first degree murder offense.

title: Relates to aggravated harassment in the first degree
abstract: Adds to the crime of aggravated harassment in the first degree when a person throws, tosses, spits, wipes, expels or transfers onto the person of another individual, without such person's consent, human or animal bodily fluids or matter, such as, but not limited to urine, blood, saliva, phlegm, feces, or any other substance defined as a bodily fluid or matter.

title: Establishes conviction integrity units
abstract: Establishes conviction integrity units; describes conviction integrity units; creates definitions; provides that a prosecution agency may create a conviction integrity unit to review convictions; provides that a conviction integrity unit may make recommendations for changes in convictions and sentences obtained by the prosecution agency; grants the prosecution agency discretion regarding the conviction integrity unit's recommendations; requires notice to the victim if a petition is filed by the prosecution agency; gives the superior court the discretion to provide relief.

title: Relates to the regulation of the sale of plastic trash bags
abstract: Regulates the sale of plastic trash bags; requires plastic trash bags be made of 30% post-consumer materials.

title: Removes the ability to petition for opportunity to ballot for public office or party position; repealer
abstract: Removes the ability to petition for opportunity to ballot for public office or party position.

title: Modifies the criteria for granting tuition assistance program awards
abstract: Modifies the criteria for granting tuition assistance program awards.

title: Establishes the nurse loan repayment program
abstract: Establishes the nurse loan repayment program; authorizes the commissioner to award loan repayment awards to nurses serving in underserved areas or nursing homes.

title: Requires cable television companies to offer cable television channels on an individual basis
abstract: Requires cable television companies to offer cable television channels on an individual basis; provides that the public service commission be responsible for approving rates.

title: Relates to immunization requirements for certain camp employees
abstract: Requires employees at children's overnight camps, summer day camps and traveling summer day camps to receive immunizations that have been recommended by the department of health.

title: Establishes a campsite reservation preference for state residents
abstract: Establishes a campsite reservation preference for New York state residents to permit state residents an opportunity to reserve space in state parks before such reservations are accepted from non-state residents.

title: Establishes unpaid leave of absence as a reasonable accommodation under the state's human rights law
abstract: Establishes unpaid leave of absence as a reasonable accommodation under the state's human rights law.

title: Exempts livestock guardian dogs and herding dogs from license fees
abstract: Exempts livestock guardian dogs and herding dogs from license fees relating to the licensing, identification and control of dogs.

title: Increases the personal needs allowance for residents of certain residential health care facilities
abstract: Increases the personal needs allowance for residents of certain residential health care facilities from fifty-five dollars to one hundred dollars per month.

title: Relates to the unlawful use of an unmanned aircraft
abstract: Relates to the unlawful use of an unmanned aircraft; defines unmanned aircraft as a device used for flight in the air which is operated remotely without the possibility of direct human intervention from within or on the aircraft.

title: Lowers the blood alcohol concentration required for driving while intoxicated from .08 of one per centum to .05, and for aggravated driving while intoxicated from .18 per centum to .12
abstract: Lowers the blood alcohol concentration required for driving while intoxicated from .08 of one per centum to .05, and for aggravated driving while intoxicated from .18 per centum to .12.

title: Relates to the members of the franchise oversight board and the duties and responsibilities of such board
abstract: Extends the oversight functions of the board to apply to the New York city off-track betting corporation.

title: Includes retirement plans in the exemption for pensions and annuities for certain persons and increases such exemption
abstract: Includes retirement plans in the exemption for pensions and annuities for certain persons; increases such exemption to one hundred thousand dollars as adjusted by the consumer price index annually.

title: Relates to the emergency use of epinephrine auto-injector devices
abstract: Relates to the emergency use of epinephrine auto-injector devices; increases the maximum population size for counties, cities, towns and villages which are permitted to purchase, acquire, possess and use epinephrine auto-injector devices.

title: Enables public libraries to access employment preparation education (EPE) funds to provide adult literacy education
abstract: Enables public libraries to access employment preparation education (EPE) funds to provide adult literacy education; sets aside three million dollars to be awarded through a competitive grant process; provides that half of such appropriation shall be set aside for libraries serving a population of one million or more.

title: Relates to conducting a study on the access of state public libraries and library systems to capital funding
abstract: Relates to conducting a study on the access of state public libraries and library systems to capital funding; provides the department of education, in consultation with the dormitory authority, the office of the state comptroller, and the public library systems of the state, shall assess and report on the capital needs of such public library systems, including public libraries and association libraries.

title: Relates to additional days of voting as a result of emergencies
abstract: Authorizes additional days of voting as a result of emergencies; includes state of emergency.

title: Relates to the return of abandoned property to owners by the state comptroller and the department of taxation and finance; repealer
abstract: Relates to the return of abandoned property to owners by the state comptroller and the department of taxation and finance; repeals the provision that a holder of abandoned property need not specify certain information identifying the owner of abandoned property amounting to twenty dollars or less when delivering such abandoned property to the state comptroller.

title: Increases penalties relating to the underage use of cannabis
abstract: Adds to the penalties for the underage use of cannabis the office of cannabis management contacting the person's parents and/or guardians and such person and their parents and/or guardians attending a cannabis diversion program.

title: Requires certain colleges and universities vet all information displayed on their websites and marketing materials to ensure the information is accurate and impartial
abstract: Requires certain colleges and universities vet all information displayed on their websites and marketing materials to ensure the information is accurate and impartial.

title: Requires approval of the salary plan for the chancellors, presidents and senior staffs of the state university of New York and the city university of New York
abstract: Requires approval of the salary plan for the chancellors, presidents and senior staffs of the state university of New York and the city university of New York by the chairs of the senate finance committee and the assembly ways and means committee and the director of the budget.

title: Relates to granting Gabrielle Tessler and Chana Witkes-Kaufman continued health coverage in retirement
abstract: Grants NYC board of education employees Gabrielle Tessler and Chana Witkes-Kaufman continued health coverage in retirement.

title: Requires eligible agencies that receive state funding for universal prekindergarten located in N.Y. city to accept administration for children's services child care vouchers
abstract: Requires eligible agencies that receive state funding for universal prekindergarten located in a city with a population of one million or more to accept administration for children's services child care vouchers if such eligible agency is a licensed or registered child care setting.

title: Repeals section 1020-dd of the public authorities law, relating to the prohibition of acceptance by the Long Island power authority of preference hydroelectricity
abstract: Repeals provisions relating to the prohibition of acceptance by the Long Island power authority of preference hydroelectricity.

title: Prohibits termination of electricity or heat service during forecasts of extreme temperatures; repealer
abstract: Prohibits termination of electricity or heat service during forecasts of more than ninety-five degrees or less than thirty-two degrees.

title: Enacts the "New York grid modernization act"
abstract: Enacts the "New York grid modernization act" to address the aging infrastructure; establishes the grid modernization program; defines terms; creates the smart grid advisory council; makes related changes.

title: Relates to the creation of a research program to determine the risks posed from chemicals in personal care products or feminine hygiene products
abstract: Relates to the creation of a research program to determine the risks posed from chemicals in personal care products or feminine hygiene products.

title: Requires choices of a question or proposal printed on a ballot include a brief phrase stating the effect of such choice should such choice win such question or proposal
abstract: Requires choices of a question or proposal printed on a ballot include a brief phrase stating the effect of such choice should such choice win such question or proposal.

title: Relates to the appointment of election inspectors and poll clerks
abstract: Relates to the appointment of election inspectors and poll clerks; provides that each board of elections submit a report detailing assignments of election inspectors and poll clerks; provides that each board of elections be required to fill vacancies by appointing individuals that appear on the additional inspector list.

title: Relates to the conditional examination of seniors before trial and a senior's participation in grand jury proceedings
abstract: Allows for the conditional examination of victims who are at least 75 years of age; amends the definition of larceny to ensure that alleged consent by a victim who is mentally disabled is a not a defense to larceny; permits a caregiver to accompany a vulnerable victim into the grand jury.

title: Relates to including certain out of home services such as transition from a hospital, nursing facility or other institutional setting to the home within home care insurance coverage
abstract: Includes certain out of home services such as transition from a hospital, nursing facility or other institutional setting to the home within home care insurance coverage.

title: Requires individuals who perform compliance functions, duties or tasks to obtain a compliance officer or compliance practitioner license
abstract: Requires individuals who perform compliance functions, duties or tasks to obtain a compliance officer or compliance practitioner license; establishes application and examination requirements to obtain, and continuing education requirements to maintain, licensure; permits the superintendent to issue licensing procedures and to prescribe regulations necessary for the proper supervision of compliance officers and practitioners.

title: Provides free hunting, fishing, and trapping licenses for volunteer instructors
abstract: Provides free hunting, fishing, and trapping licenses for qualified volunteer instructors.

title: Relates to creating a wholesale prescription drug importation program
abstract: Creates a wholesale prescription drug importation program which complies with federal standards and regulations for the purpose of generating substantial savings for consumers.

title: Increases the income eligibility threshold for the tuition assistance program
abstract: Increases the income eligibility threshold for the tuition assistance program up to one hundred fifty thousand dollars.

title: Requires the board of elections to notify absentee voters of the status of their ballot and to correct an unaccepted ballot
abstract: Requires the board of elections to establish an electronic system allowing absentee voters to monitor the status of their ballot and to correct an unaccepted ballot.

title: Increases the maximum penalty for concealing a license plate to a fine of one thousand dollars
abstract: Increases the maximum penalty for concealing a license plate to a fine of one thousand dollars; includes covering a license plate with glass or plastic material as part of the increased fine for concealing a license plate.

title: Authorizes school districts to establish an extraordinary needs reserve fund for the expenses of providing special education
abstract: Authorizes school districts to establish an extraordinary needs reserve fund for the expenses of providing special education.

title: Relates to aggravated harassment in the first degree
abstract: Relates to aggravated harassment in the first degree; includes the display of a swastika in public view in aggravated harassment in the first degree.

title: Requires the department of agriculture and markets to develop and maintain a database on the impact of climate change on agriculture
abstract: Requires the department of agriculture and markets to develop and maintain a database on the impact of climate change on agriculture; requires farmers to report to the department on the impact of climate change on agriculture, including but not limited to crops grown, outcomes and yield.

title: Requires property/casualty insurance policies to state the types and causes of damage that are covered by such policy
abstract: Requires property/casualty insurance policies to state the types and causes of damage that are covered by such policy; requires such information to be provided at or near the beginning of such policy.

title: Relates to process servers
abstract: Relates to process servers; enacts provisions relating to issuance, renewal, suspension and revocation of a license to do business as a process server.

title: Relates to prohibiting delivery services from guaranteeing thirty-minute delivery and prohibiting such services from penalizing workers for failure to deliver within thirty minutes
abstract: Requires a disclaimer to be included in any advertising for delivery services that advertise delivery within thirty minutes or less to say that delivery within such time is not guaranteed; prohibits delivery services from penalizing workers that fail to deliver within thirty minutes; requires disclosure to such workers that they are not required to deliver within thirty minutes.

title: Requires the preparation of reports on assignments of election inspectors and poll clerks
abstract: Requires the preparation of reports on assignments of election inspectors and poll clerks.

title: Establishes the crime of criminal sale of a controlled substance resulting in death
abstract: Establishes the crime of criminal sale of a controlled substance resulting in death, a class A-1 felony.

title: Relates to designating a portion of the state highway system as the "T Sgt. Walter Shearing Memorial Highway"
abstract: Designates a portion of the state highway system in the village of Gainesville as the "T Sgt. Walter Shearing Memorial Highway".

title: Imposes a moratorium on increasing gas and electric prices, rates and charges
abstract: Imposes a moratorium on increasing gas and electric prices, rates and charges.

title: Relates to hate crime reporting on college campuses
abstract: Requires colleges to post campus crime statistics on their website; requires colleges to implement a plan to provide investigation of hate crimes on campus; requires colleges to inform incoming students about hate crime prevention measures.

title: Relates to cemetery trust funds
abstract: Relates to cemetery trust funds and the maintenance and preservation of cemetery grounds.

title: Relates to authorizing residents of assisted living programs to receive hospice services
abstract: Authorizes residents of assisted living programs to receive hospice services, subject to the availability of federal financial participation.

title: Prohibits law enforcement officers from using racial and ethnic profiling
abstract: Prohibits police officers from using racial and ethnic profiling; requires that a procedure be established for the taking and review of complaints against police officers for racial and ethnic profiling; allows an action for injunctive relief and/or damages to be brought against a law enforcement agency, any agent of a law enforcement agency and the supervisor of an agent.

title: Establishes a product stewardship program for primary batteries
abstract: Relates to establishing a product stewardship program for primary batteries.

title: Establishes "Jeremiah's Law"
abstract: Enacts "Jeremiah's law"; establishes the offense of filing a false report concerning a minor.

title: Extends certain provisions relating to implementation of the federal individuals with disabilities education improvement act of 2004
abstract: Extends certain provisions relating to implementation of the federal individuals with disabilities education improvement act of 2004.

title: Requires schools to include instruction on the prevention of eating disorders as an integral part of their health education programs
abstract: Requires schools to include instruction on the prevention of eating disorders as an integral part of their health education programs.

title: Relates to applying the Housing Stability and Tenant Protection Act of 2019 to rent calculations and rent records maintenance and destruction
abstract: Relates to applying the Housing Stability and Tenant Protection Act of 2019 to rent calculations and rent records maintenance and destruction for all rent stabilized apartments.

title: Relates to requiring every residential lease to provide conspicuous notice of the availability of community solar for the provision of a tenant's electricity needs
abstract: Relates to requiring every residential lease to provide conspicuous notice of the availability of community solar for the provision of a tenant's electricity needs.

title: Relates to bail and domestic violence charges
abstract: Requires the consideration of certain domestic violence charges when imposing bail.

title: Relates to third-party food delivery service charges
abstract: Prohibits third-party food delivery services from charging a food service establishment a delivery fee that totals more than a certain percent of the total purchase price of an online order.

title: Authorizes a personal income tax credit for residential solar energy systems
abstract: Authorizes a personal income tax credit for solar energy systems purchased and installed on any residential property owned by a taxpayer.

title: Directs the creation of a document giving certain notice to parents and guardians of school age students who are diagnosed with a life-threatening medical condition or a certain medical condition
abstract: Enacts the "Shepherd Patterson law"; requires a physician who treats a minor patient with a medical condition that may cause a disability to provide certain educational information to such patient's parents or guardians indicating such minor is entitled to a free and appropriate public education as defined under section five hundred four of the federal rehabilitation act of nineteen hundred seventy-three; makes related provisions.

title: Relates to prohibiting members of law enforcement from using tear gas
abstract: Prohibits members of law enforcement from using tear gas at any time.

title: Designates the state of New York a purple heart state
abstract: Designates the state of New York a purple heart state.

title: Establishes the New York state independent budget office
abstract: Creates the New York state independent budget office with a director to be appointed, upon the recommendations of an independent budget office advisory committee, by the speaker of the assembly and the temporary president of the senate; such office shall provide objective, non-partisan and timely analyses of state revenue, expenditures and management practices to members of the legislature for any legislation with fiscal impact or at the request of a leader or a committee.

title: Relates to school suspension
abstract: Provides that where a pupil may be considered a dangerous threat to himself, herself, or others, such pupil may be suspended for no more than ten days prior to a hearing taking place to allow the school to have adequate time to make an evaluation on the pupil's mental health, which may include a psychiatric evaluation, and the risk of danger to others and to consult with law enforcement.

title: Suspends employer contributions to the interest assessment surcharge fund; appropriation
abstract: Suspends employer contributions to the interest assessment surcharge fund until December 31, 2025.

title: Creates of a toll-free hotline and a website where motorists can report potholes
abstract: Creates a toll-free hotline and a website where motorists can report potholes.

title: Relates to hospital care for mastectomy, lumpectomy, and lymph node dissection patients
abstract: Requires mastectomy surgery, lymph node dissection or lumpectomy counseling include information on going breastless or flat.

title: Relates to clinical standards for utilization review of care for medically fragile children; repealer
abstract: Creates clinical standards and special consideration and processes for utilization review related to care for medically fragile children; makes changes to the effectiveness thereof.

title: Includes lakes in adopt-a-municipal park, shoreline or roadway programs
abstract: Includes lakes in adopt-a-municipal park, shoreline or roadway programs.

title: Directs the New York State Department of Transportation to promulgate rules and regulations for the standardization of public charging stations for electric vehicles
abstract: Directs the New York State Department of Transportation, in conjunction with the New York State Energy Research and Development Authority and the New York Power Authority, to promulgate rules and regulations for the standardization of public charging stations for electric vehicles.

title: Designates the Montauk Point shoals as an important bird area, and directs the commissioner of environmental conservation to designate such area as part of the New York state bird conservation area program
abstract: Designates the Montauk Point shoals as an important bird area; directs the commissioner of environmental conservation to designate such area as part of the New York state bird conservation area program.

title: Exempts applications for an extreme risk protection order from requiring an index number fee
abstract: Exempts applications for an extreme risk protection order from requiring an index number fee.

title: Requires any hospital that provides birthing services to provide written, educational material containing information about premature, newborn infants
abstract: Requires any hospital that provides birthing services to provide written, educational material containing information about premature newborn infants.

title: Relates to the geriatric demonstration program
abstract: Relates to the geriatric demonstration program to promote mental health and home care collaboration; authorizes the commissioner of mental health to identify barriers to participation in the program and make recommendations to address such barriers.

title: Relates to findings of the state board of parole necessary for discretionary release of incarcerated individuals on parole
abstract: Provides for findings of the state board of parole necessary for discretionary release of incarcerated individuals on parole.

title: Enacts the child abuse reporting expansion act
abstract: Enacts the child abuse reporting expansion act; relates to making clergy members required reporters of child abuse or mistreatment.

title: Relates to the Incarcerated Individuals Responsibility and Fair Wages Act
abstract: Relates to the Incarcerated Individuals Responsibility and Fair Wages Act; establishes a minimum wage for incarcerated individuals of five dollars per hour; establishes a prison incarcerated individual fund where up to forty percent of an incarcerated individual's wages can be sent to his or her family to help pay for certain expenses.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim February 3, 2023, as Four Chaplains Day in the State of New York
Relates to photographing or recording a law enforcement officer
abstract: Relates to permitting the photographing or recording of a law enforcement officer as long as such person isn't under arrest; outlines unlawful retaliatory measures by law enforcement for such photography or recording.

title: Relates to the establishment of various programs for students in pre-kindergarten through third grade
abstract: Relates to the establishment of various programs for students in pre-kindergarten through third grade including programs for literacy, career readiness and financial literacy.

title: Relates to designating the Eltingville transit center as the Iraq War and Afghanistan War Veterans' Memorial Transit Center
abstract: Relates to designating the Eltingville transit center as the "Iraq War and Afghanistan War Veterans' Memorial Transit Center".

title: Requires landlord to grant access to engineer or architect hired by tenants to inspect major capital improvements in certain multiple dwellings
abstract: Provides that no landlord shall deny access to a licensed professional engineer or licensed registered architect hired by any tenant or tenant association representing tenants of a multiple dwelling of six units or more for the purpose of conducting an inspection of a major capital improvement for which an application for a maximum rent adjustment has been filed by the landlord; provides that such inspection shall be conducted after notice to the landlord and during normal business hours; provides for the filing of such inspection report by such tenants with the New York city rent agency for consideration in such application's determination.

title: Relates to expungement of records for certain juveniles convicted of a nonviolent offense after seven years
abstract: Relates to expungement of records for certain juveniles convicted of a nonviolent offense after seven years and satisfactory completion of his or her probation, parole, supervised release and payment of any fines imposed or restitution ordered, whichever is later.

title: Makes permanent certain provisions of chapter 22 of the laws of 2014, relating to expanding opportunities for service-disabled veteran-owned business enterprises
abstract: Makes permanent certain provisions relating to expanding opportunities for service-disabled veteran-owned business enterprises.

title: Repeals the rebates for stock transfer tax paid; dedicates funds of the stock transfer tax fund and stock transfer incentive fund to various funds
abstract: Repeals the rebates for stock transfer tax paid; dedicates funds of the stock transfer tax fund and stock transfer incentive fund to various funds; establishes the safe water and infrastructure action program.

title: Relates to the operation of games of chance by employees of authorized organizations
abstract: Relates to the operation of games of chance by employees of authorized organizations.

title: Relates to absentee voting
abstract: Extends certain chapters providing for expanded absentee voting until 2023.

title: Relates to public assistance applications
abstract: Requires the office of temporary and disability assistance to simplify the application process for public assistance benefits.

title: Commending veteran Stephen Lacki for his meritorious service to the United States Marines during the Korean War
Exempts low-emission and energy efficient vehicles from retail sales and compensating use taxes
abstract: Exempts low-emission and energy efficient vehicles from retail sales and compensating use taxes.

title: Prohibits persons convicted of murder or sentenced to life without parole from being eligible for commutation of sentence
abstract: Prohibits persons convicted of murder or sentenced to life without parole or where the defendant acting either alone or with one or more other persons, commits or attempts to commit robbery, burglary, kidnapping, arson, rape in the first degree, criminal sexual act in the first degree, sexual abuse in the first degree, aggravated sexual abuse, escape in the first degree, or escape in the second degree, and, in the course of and in furtherance of such crime or of immediate flight therefrom, he or she, or another participant, if there be any, intentionally causes the death of: a police officer; a peace officer; a firefighter, emergency medical technician, ambulance driver, paramedic, physician or registered nurse involved in a first response team, or any other individual who, in the course of official duties, performs emergency response; or an employee of a state correctional institution or was an employee of a local correctional facility, when such person was engaged in the course of performing their official duties, from being eligible for commutation of sentence.

title: Relates to the issuance of additional orders of protection when reviewing an extreme risk protection order
abstract: Authorizes a supreme court judge hearing a petition for an "extreme risk protection order" to also hear a petition for a regular order of protection pursuant to the criminal procedure law, the domestic relations law and/or the family court act.

title: Allows an operator of a motor vehicle to display or provide such operator's certificate of registration in electronic form
abstract: Allows an operator of a motor vehicle to display or provide such operator's certificate of registration to a magistrate, motor vehicle inspector, peace officer, acting pursuant to his or her special duties, or police officer in electronic form.

title: Includes the attacks on September 11, 2001 in courses of instruction in patriotism and citizenship
abstract: Includes the attacks on September 11, 2001 in courses of instruction in patriotism and citizenship; provides that such courses may include using educational resources provided by national and accredited institutions that are recommended for priority use.

title: Permits New York city voters to sign designating petitions for multiple candidates for the same New York city municipal public office or party position
abstract: Permits New York city voters to sign designating petitions for multiple candidates for the same New York City municipal public office or party position.

title: Undoes part A of chapter 60 of the laws of 2016, which provides for the transition of the school tax relief property tax exemption to a personal income tax credit; repealer
abstract: Prevents the transition of the school tax relief property tax exemption to a personal income tax credit.

title: Permits the detention of juveniles with adults in certain circumstances
abstract: Permits the detention of juveniles with adults when no other facility is available within fifty miles.

title: Allows schools to provide water safety instruction to students in grades kindergarten through twelve
abstract: Allows schools to provide water safety instruction to students in grades kindergarten through twelve; allows for the commissioner of education to provide technical assistance to develop curricula for water safety instruction.

title: Establishes a statewide youth mental health and social media campaign to promote public awareness of the impacts of social media usage on mental health
abstract: Establishes a statewide youth mental health and social media campaign to promote public awareness of the impacts of social media usage on mental health; requires a course of study on social media usage for all students.

title: Prohibits public funding to facilities using aversive interventions
abstract: Prohibits public funding to facilities or programs using aversive interventions on children; establishes a holistic autism spectrum disorder treatment center.

title: Preserves access to affordable drugs
abstract: Relates to preserving access to affordable drugs; provides that an agreement resolving or settling, on a final or interim basis, a patent infringement claim, in connection with the sale of a pharmaceutical product, shall be presumed to have anticompetitive effects if a nonreference drug filer receives anything of value from another company asserting patent infringement and if the nonreference drug filer agrees to limit or forego research, development, manufacturing, marketing, or sales of the nonreference drug filer's product for any period of time.

title: Honoring Bill Carpenter upon the occasion of his retirement after more than 11 years of distinguished service to Rochester Genesee Regional Transport Authority
Requires the commissioner of health to promulgate rules and regulations related to the timeframe for increases to patients' bills
abstract: Requires the commissioner of health, in conjunction with the superintendent of financial services, to promulgate rules and regulations requiring that any increase in a bill from a hospital or health system or health care provider shall be sent to a patient no later than ninety days after the original bill was paid in full by such patient and good cause be shown for such increase, unless such increase is the result of any action by such patient.

title: Provides voting materials and translators in French and Creole in the city of New York
abstract: Provides voting materials in French and Creole; requires translators in French and Creole in the city of New York at polling places in subdivisions where more than five percent of the citizens of voting age speak the language of French and/or Creole and are limited-English proficient.

title: Provides for payments for home and community based long term care services
abstract: Provides for payments for home and community based long term care services; provides that funds appropriated to compensate for minimum wage requirements, shall not be subject to managed care risk adjustment on insurers.

title: Permits the rendering of an estimated bill from a utility corporation or municipality under certain circumstances
abstract: Permits the rendering of an estimated bill from a utility corporation or municipality under certain circumstances; requires each utility corporation and municipality within six months to submit to the commission a model procedure for the calculation of estimated bills that incorporates best practices and technology and accounts for any barriers to the use of actual meter readings.

title: Provides for the sale, use and storage of nitric acid
abstract: Requires each retail sale of nitric acid to be recorded by the seller thereof; provides that such record shall include the photographic identification number, telephone number and address of the purchaser; provides for the secure storage of nitric acid by retailers, schools and institutions of higher education; makes the violation of such provisions a class A misdemeanor; establishes the class D felony of disseminating material on the manufacture of an explosive for using a computer network to disseminate information on how to make an explosive out of nitric acid.

title: Grants members or officers of the state police credit for service as a deputy sheriff, county corrections officer, or state corrections officer
abstract: Grants members or officers of the state police credit for service as a deputy sheriff, county corrections officer, or state corrections officer; two years credit; cost borne by member.

title: Creates distinctive license plates for the United States army 10th mountain division
abstract: Creates distinctive license plates for members and supporters of the United States army 10th mountain division.

title: Relates to establishing the New York state diplomas to home ownership program; appropriation
abstract: Establishes the New York state diplomas to homeownership assistance program; provides awards of up to fifteen thousand dollars to eligible applicants for repayment on student loans; makes an appropriation therefor.

title: Provides for the expungement of syringe convictions
abstract: Provides for the expungement of syringe convictions of criminally possessing a hypodermic instrument.

title: Prohibits landlords, lessors, sub-lessors and grantors from demanding brokers' fees from a tenant
abstract: Prohibits landlords, lessors, sub-lessors and grantors from demanding brokers' fees from a tenant.

title: Establishes separate taxes on inheritance income and on gift income
abstract: Relates to creating a separate tax on inheritance income, creating a separate tax on gift income, the computation of the estate tax, and creating a gift tax.

title: Provides free use of state parks for certified first responders who participated in the rescue effort at the World Trade Center on September 11, 2001
abstract: Relates to providing free use of state parks for certified first responders who participated in the rescue effort at the World Trade Center on September 11, 2001.

title: Relates to the removal of weight and height restrictions on vehicles traveling from the Ogdensburg bridge south to the Port of Ogdensburg
abstract: Removes the weight and height restrictions on vehicles traveling south on the route from the Ogdensburg bridge to the Port of Ogdensburg.

title: Relates to establishing a voluntary waiver of the right to purchase firearms, rifles or shotguns
abstract: Relates to establishing a voluntary waiver of the right to purchase firearms, rifles or shotguns; requires the division of state police to maintain statewide records of individuals who have waived the right to purchase firearms, rifles, or shotguns and any revocations of such waivers.

title: Relates to prohibiting the metropolitan transportation authority from promulgating rules or regulations that penalize a student for using a student MetroCard when school is not in session
abstract: Relates to prohibiting the metropolitan transportation authority from promulgating rules or regulations that penalize a student for using a student MetroCard when school is not in session.

title: Requires the board of regents to provide a live webcast of their meetings
abstract: Requires that each meeting of the Board of Regents be streamed live and be made available to the public.

title: Relates to the purchase of domestically produced personal protective equipment
abstract: Relates to the purchase of personal protective equipment and medical supplies produced or manufactured in the state of New York.

title: Relates to excluding expenditures for school resource officers employed by a municipality and assigned to a school district from tax levy limitations
abstract: Excludes expenditures for school resource officers employed by a municipality and assigned to a school district from tax levy limitations.

title: Provides for comprehensive care centers for autism spectrum disorders
abstract: Develops comprehensive assessment centers for autism spectrum disorders; provides grants for their development and lays out reporting and research requirements.

title: Enacts the "fairness in cooperative homeownership act"
abstract: Enacts the "fairness in cooperative homeownership act"; regulates the submission and determinations of applications for ownership of cooperative apartments.

title: Relates to creating the New York electronic communications privacy act; search and seizure of electronic devices and electronic communications
abstract: Creates the New York electronic communications privacy act; requires government agents and agencies to obtain a search warrant for physical or electronic access to electronic device information.

title: Establishes the task force on daylight saving time
abstract: Establishes the task force on daylight saving time to study the effects of New York state opting out of daylight saving time.

title: Provides for establishment of the New York Health plan
abstract: Establishes the New York Health program, a comprehensive system of access to health insurance for New York state residents; provides for administrative structure of the plan; provides for powers and duties of the board of trustees, the scope of benefits, payment methodologies and care coordination; establishes the New York Health Trust Fund which would hold monies from a variety of sources to be used solely to finance the plan; enacts provisions relating to financing of New York Health, including a payroll assessment, similar to the Medicare tax; establishes a temporary commission on implementation of the plan; provides for collective negotiations by health care providers with New York Health.

title: Requires insurance to cover a car seat to be provided upon discharge of a newborn from a hospital
abstract: Requires insurance to cover a car seat to be provided upon discharge of a newborn from a hospital.

title: Grants each of the representatives of the counties of Dutchess, Putnam, Orange and Rockland a vote during the proceedings of the metropolitan transportation authority
abstract: Grants each of the representatives of the counties of Dutchess, Putnam, Orange and Rockland a vote during the proceedings of the metropolitan transportation authority.

title: Establishes an online insurance verification system for motor vehicle insurance; repealer
abstract: Establishes an online insurance verification system for motor vehicle insurance; requires insurers to provide necessary information.

title: Authorizes distinctive license plates for recipients of the Bronze or Silver star
abstract: Authorizes distinctive license plates for recipients of the Bronze or Silver star.

title: Authorizes schools to possess and administer FDA approved opioid reversal agents in emergency situations
abstract: Authorizes schools to possess and administer FDA approved opioid reversal agents in emergency situations to negate or neutralize, in whole or in part, the pharmacological effects of an opioid in the human body.

title: Enacts the "just energy transition act"
abstract: Enacts the "just energy transition act"; requires a study of competitive options to facilitate the phase-out, replacement and redevelopment of New York state's oldest and most-polluting fossil fueled generation facilities and their sites by the year 2030.

title: Relates to the treatment of excess credits for the rehabilitation of historic barns
abstract: Relates to the treatment of excess credits for the rehabilitation of historic barns.

title: Relates to the salaries of certain teachers and aides employed by boards of cooperative educational services
abstract: Relates to the salaries of certain teachers and aides employed by boards of cooperative educational services; puts limits on certain administrative and clerical expenses.

title: Celebrating the life and accomplishments of Irene Wald Stein, humanitarian, distinguished citizen and devoted member of her community
Prohibits the use of chemical weapons and kinetic energy munitions on civilian populations
abstract: Requires the division of criminal justice services to establish a policy prohibiting police agencies from using chemical weapons and kinetic energy munitions on civilian populations and from acquiring and stockpiling such weapons or munitions.

title: Allows for the taking of deer with a crossbow in Suffolk county
abstract: Allows for the taking of deer with a crossbow in Suffolk county.

title: Allows certain minors to consent to certain medical, dental, health, and hospital services
abstract: Allows homeless youth to give effective consent to certain medical, dental, health, and hospital services; provides for insurance coverage of such health care services consented to by such youth.

title: Relates to providing increases of cost-of-living adjustments
abstract: Provides increases of cost-of-living adjustments for public retirees; allows increases of up to five percent.

title: Clarifies the definition of "tenant" to exclude squatters
abstract: Extends the time period for tenancy rights from 30 days to 45 days of possession; adds squatting to the definition of criminal trespass in the third degree.

title: Relates to the thoroughbred breeding and development fund
abstract: Extends the provisions relating to the New York state thoroughbred breeding and development fund until twelve years after the commencement of the operation of a video lottery terminal facility at Aqueduct racetrack.

title: Includes The Parma Public Library with libraries eligible for the financing of projects through the dormitory authority
abstract: Includes the Parma Public Library with libraries eligible for the financing of projects through the dormitory authority.

title: Enacts the stop civil discrimination act
abstract: Requires proof of service to include perceived gender and race in the description of the person to whom personal service of a summons was delivered.

title: Relates to services available to immigrants residing in certain family and adult shelter facilities
abstract: Relates to services available to immigrants residing in certain family and adult shelter facilities; requires the office of New Americans to establish a program to deliver comprehensive case management services to immigrants residing in certain shelters.

title: Requires all persons in a city having a population of one million or more operating a bicycle, electric bicycle or electric scooter to wear a helmet
abstract: Requires all persons in a city having a population of one million or more operating a bicycle, electric bicycle or electric scooter to wear a helmet; imposes a civil penalty for violation of such requirement.

title: Directs the New York state energy research and development authority to establish a rebate program for bikes with electric assist and electric scooters purchased for small businesses
abstract: Directs the New York state energy research and development authority to establish a rebate program allowing for a rebate of up to $1,100 for bikes with electric assist and electric scooters purchased for small businesses.

title: Permits certain licensed individuals to purchase or take possession of ammunition without requiring contacting the statewide license and record database
abstract: Permits those licensed to carry or possess a pistol or revolver or to purchase or take possession of a semi-automatic rifle or licensed to hunt wildlife to purchase or take possession of ammunition without requiring contacting the statewide license and record database.

title: Permits special education services and programs for preschool children with handicapping conditions to establish reserve funds
abstract: Permits special education services and programs for preschool children with handicapping conditions to establish reserve funds.

title: Includes exposing another person to fentanyl, a fentanyl derivative or an opiate containing fentanyl or fentanyl derivative in the definition of the offense of assault in the first degree
abstract: Includes exposing another person to fentanyl, a fentanyl derivative or an opiate containing fentanyl or a fentanyl derivative in the definition of the offense of assault in the first degree.

title: Requires the New York city department of corrections and the New York city health and hospitals corporation to adopt safety policies to protect health care workers who treat incarcerated individuals
abstract: Requires the New York city department of corrections and the New York city health and hospitals corporation to adopt safety policies to protect health care workers who treat incarcerated individuals.

title: Relates to residency requirements for village justice of Cayuga Heights
abstract: Relates to residency requirements for village justice and/or associate justice of Cayuga Heights; allows the village board of trustees of Cayuga Heights to appoint a person who resides in the county of Tompkins.

title: Establishes a user-friendly benefits cliff calculator tool
abstract: Establishes a user-friendly benefits cliff calculator tool that allows users to understand how changes to gross income can effect eligibility for public assistance programs and long-term financial self-sufficiency and sustainability.

title: Relates to the transfer of the regional state park police to the division of state police; repealer
abstract: Provides for the transfer of the regional state park police to the division of state police.

title: Removes the requirement for in person attendance at public meetings by community boards in N.Y. city
abstract: Removes the requirement for in person attendance at public meetings by community boards in a city with a population of over one million.

title: Creates a school budget tax cap exemption for expenditures resulting from settlements or jury awards under the child victims act
abstract: Creates a school budget tax cap exemption for expenditures resulting from settlements or jury awards for civil actions brought against school districts under the child victims act.

title: Prohibits cable television companies from collecting payment when an unsolicited reduction to service occurs
abstract: Prohibits cable television companies from collecting payment when an unsolicited reduction to service occurs; provides no request for future payment shall be made.

title: Establishes a COVID-19 pandemic response study commission
abstract: Establishes the COVID-19 pandemic response study commission to conduct a study of the state's response to the COVID-19 pandemic and to make recommendations on improvements to such response; provides for the repeal of such commission upon the completion of the commission's final report.

title: Allows individuals registered with a non-major political party or registered as independent to serve as election inspectors and poll clerks in certain circumstances
abstract: Allows individuals registered with a non-major political party or registered as independent to serve as election inspectors and poll clerks, so long as such individual makes a declaration of which particular party they intend to work on behalf of.

title: Prohibits vaping in educational institutions; requires educational institutions to educate communities about health risks associated with vaping
abstract: Prohibits vaping in educational institutions; requires educational institutions to educate communities about health risks associated with vaping and post no-vaping signage on educational institution premises.

title: Provides doula services at all correctional institutions and local correctional facilities
abstract: Provides doula services at all correctional institutions and local correctional facilities; requires the department of corrections and community supervision to retain an organization to make at least two doulas at any given time available to provide doula services twice a week, for four hours, at all correctional institutions and local correctional facilities that house incarcerated individuals who identify as female, as well as to provide doula services during labor and delivery, upon request.

title: Relates to requiring telephone corporations, cable television companies, and internet service providers to automatically refund their customers when their service is not working
abstract: Relates to requiring telephone corporations, cable television companies, and internet service providers to automatically refund its customers when their service is not working; provides such credit shall be given even when the service is not working for less than a twenty-four hour period.

title: Relates to transportation contracts of the Hicksville union free school district
abstract: Legalizes, validates, ratifies and confirms certain transportation contracts of the Hicksville union free school district.

title: Relates to access to appropriate drugs at reasonable prices, formulary exceptions, standing prior authorizations and external appeals
abstract: Relates to access to appropriate drugs at reasonable prices, formulary exceptions, standing prior authorizations and external appeals; to access to retail pharmacies, prescription synchronization, limits on patient drug costs, explanations of benefits and rebates; to prescription drug synchronization; to pharmacy benefit management; and to limits on copayments and drug substitutions.

title: Authorizes a weighted selection process for the allocation of certain prekindergarten seats
abstract: Authorizes a weighted selection process prioritizing children who would be eligible to receive free or reduced price lunch and/or who are English language learners for the allocation of certain prekindergarten seats in school districts where there are more eligible children than can be served in a given school year.

title: Allows certain judges, justices, and criminal prosecutors to carry a concealed firearm in court, where no magnetometer or security personnel is present
abstract: Allows certain judges, justices, and criminal prosecutors who are duly licensed to possess a concealed firearm, to carry such concealed firearm in court, where no magnetometer or security personnel is present.

title: Enacts the New York emergency responder act
abstract: Enacts the New York emergency responder act limiting the liability of certain emergency responders.

title: Increases certain disability payments and specifying payments for volunteer firefighters and ambulance workers injured in the line of duty on or after July first, two thousand twenty-four
abstract: Increases temporary and permanent disability payments for volunteer firefighters and ambulance workers, and specifies weekly payment amounts for volunteer firefighters and ambulance workers injured in the line of duty on or after July first, two thousand twenty-four.

title: Establishes a central business district toll exemption for first responders
abstract: Establishes a central business district toll exemption for first responders employed by the state or any municipality thereof who are performing their duties in the central business district.

title: Requires online sellers of books created with the use of generative artificial intelligence to contain a disclosure of such use
abstract: Requires online sellers of books created wholly or partially with the use of generative artificial intelligence to disclose such use of generative artificial intelligence before the completion of such sale; applies to all printed and digital books consisting of text, pictures, audio, puzzles, games or any combination thereof.

title: Requires municipal corporations to approve any facility intending to house asylum seekers
abstract: Requires municipal corporations to approve any facility intending to house asylum seekers prior to their establishment; establishes a review process that incorporates notice to the public and the opportunity for the public to comment; renders a decision within 8 weeks.

title: Enacts the "Finger Lakes watershed stewardship act"
abstract: Enacts the "Finger Lakes watershed stewardship act"; designates the department of health as the lead agency in governing watersheds of the eleven Finger Lakes that serve as a source of drinking water for surrounding communities; authorizes other state agencies to promulgate rules and regulations governing watersheds of the Finger Lakes that are not inconsistent with department of health rules and regulations.

title: Relates to protections and rights afforded to delivery network company workers
abstract: Relates to protections and rights afforded to delivery network company (DNC) workers; requires DNCs to create internal procedures for workers to challenge deactivations; provides certain notice and other rights to workers to challenge deactivation both internally in a DNC and externally; allows the Department of Labor to investigate unwarranted deactivation of workers; makes related provisions.

title: Adds impersonation of board of elections members or other election officers to the crime of criminal impersonation in the first degree
abstract: Adds impersonation of board of elections members or other election officers, or an employee thereof, to the crime of criminal impersonation in the first degree.

title: Permits certain schools to provide hemostatic agents for use during emergencies
abstract: Permits certain schools to provide hemostatic agents for use during emergencies.

title: Establishes extended producer responsibility for textiles
abstract: Establishes extended producer responsibility for textiles; requires a producer, either individually or cooperatively in a group or with a representative organization to submit to the department of environmental conservation a plan for the establishment of a collection program for textile covered products no later than December 31, 2024.

title: Establishes a supplemental burial allowance for certain first responders
abstract: Establishes a supplemental burial allowance for certain first responders.

title: Relates to implementing provisions to protect credit reports of certain consumers
abstract: Implements provisions to protect credit reports of certain consumers.

title: Defines humanitarian emergency response and relief centers
abstract: Defines humanitarian emergency response and relief centers as shelters that provide assistance to arriving asylees or that provide shared sleeping and bathroom facilities for more than 96 hours and includes such centers within the definition of homeless project.

title: Relates to the approval of policy forms
abstract: Identifies certain group policies, group contracts and certificates issued thereunder exempting them from filing and approval requirements.

title: Provides training to staff members accepting registrations, issuing licenses or conducting inspections of child day care homes, programs or facilities on the detection of controlled substances
abstract: Provides training to staff members accepting registrations, issuing licenses or conducting inspections of child day care homes, programs or facilities on the detection of controlled substances.

title: Requires piping supplies expense to be included as an acceptable expense for purposes New York State Energy Research and Development Authority energy efficiency programs
abstract: Requires piping supplies expenses to be included as an acceptable expense for purposes of calculating a financial benefit, tax credit or other incentive to an owner of real property to improve energy efficiency to a building or structure pursuant to any energy efficiency program overseen by New York State Energy Research and Development Authority.

title: Relates to succession rights for rent stabilized housing
abstract: Relates to succession rights for rent stabilized housing; reduces the succession residency requirement from two years to one.

title: Relates to free tuition for New York state residents serving as volunteer firefighters at certain colleges
abstract: Makes tuition free for New York state residents serving as volunteer firefighters at SUNY and CUNY schools and community colleges.

title: Relates to allowing for unlicensed individuals to collect throat or nasopharyngeal swab specimens and to perform certain nursing tasks during a state of disaster emergency
abstract: Allows for unlicensed individuals to collect throat or nasopharyngeal swab specimens and to perform certain nursing tasks during a state disaster emergency.

title: Classifies possession of firearms on school grounds or municipal park property as a class B felony
abstract: Classifies possession of firearms on school grounds or municipal park property as a class B felony.

title: Authorizes the county of Cattaraugus to discontinue as reforested lands certain reforested lands in the town of Perrysburg
abstract: Authorizes the county of Cattaraugus to discontinue as reforested lands certain reforested lands in the town of Perrysburg.

title: Establishes a task force to be called the office of asylum management
abstract: Establishes a task force to be called the "office of asylum management" to study, evaluate, and develop recommendations relating to the management of asylum seekers in this state; requires reporting to the governor and the legislature.

title: Increases the minimum tuition assistance program award
abstract: Increases the minimum tuition assistance program award from five hundred dollars to one thousand dollars.

title: Allows certain physically disabled individuals to complete the live-fire range training course for a concealed carry license while sitting
abstract: Allows physically disabled individuals who are not able to stand up to complete the two-hour live-fire range training course requirement for a concealed carry license while sitting.

title: Requires cardiopulmonary resuscitation instruction as a part of the health education curriculum in all senior high schools
abstract: Requires cardiopulmonary resuscitation instruction as a part of the health education curriculum in all senior high schools.

title: Prohibits operation of any motor vehicle equipped with any device which affects the operation of traffic-control signals
abstract: Prohibits the operation of any motor vehicle equipped with a device which affects the operation of traffic-control signals; provides that the possession of such a device shall constitute a traffic infraction, use thereof is a class A misdemeanor, and use which results in personal injury or death shall constitute a class E felony.

title: Authorizes the creation of a distinctive brain tumor awareness license plate; creates the brain tumor research and education fund
abstract: Authorizes the creation of a distinctive brain tumor awareness license plate; creates the brain tumor research and education fund.

title: Relates to compensation for information concerning fraudulent insurance transaction
abstract: Provides that any person who provides information to the attorney general, a district attorney or the insurance frauds bureau concerning a fraudulent insurance transaction or with information about a fraudulent insurance transaction that is about to take place may be entitled to an award of forty percent of the action or claim relating to such fraudulent action.

title: Relates to using a portion of the public safety communications surcharge to support volunteer fire department initiatives
abstract: Relates to using a portion of the public safety communications surcharge to support volunteer fire department initiatives; establishes the New York state volunteer fire department auxiliary fund.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim February 6-10, 2023, as Pride in Foodservice Week in the State of New York
Provides for a disability benefit for employees of the New York city transit authority who are disabled by reason of an assault sustained in the course of employment
abstract: Provides for a disability benefit for employees of the New York city transit authority, and its subsidiary corporations, who are disabled by reason of an assault sustained in the course of employment.

title: Relates to providing student onboarding and ongoing education on reproductive health services
abstract: Requires student onboarding and ongoing education on reproductive health services available to students including where the closest reproductive health clinics are located; all resources available to a student seeking reproductive health services including but not limited to financial assistance and mental health services and any reproductive health resources available to a student through the institution.

title: Establishes mandatory minimum medicaid coverage for hospital confinement for childbirth
abstract: Requires all insurance policies and health maintenance organization contracts to provide coverage for maternity patients and their newborns for hospital stays of at least 48 hours following childbirth by natural delivery and 96 hours following childbirth by caesarean section; provides such coverage for patients who are recipients of medicaid.

title: Provides for an exemption to limitations upon school district tax levies to certain school districts
abstract: Provides for a temporary exemption to limitations upon school district tax levies to school districts who experience a loss of a payment in lieu of taxes agreement due to the closure of a nuclear power plant.

title: Prohibits certain limits or bans on players
abstract: Prohibits certain licensed entities from limiting, prohibiting, or requiring certain bets or banning a player based, in any part, on the player's success, except in cases where the player exceeds certain threshold win and loss caps.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim April 2023, as Celebrate Diversity Month in the State of New York
Commemorating the 100th Anniversary of the building of the Castle Point Veterans Affairs Medical Center on September 15, 2023
Commending the Hobart Men's Ice Hockey Team upon the occasion of winning the NCAA Division III National Championship
Establishes the crimes of harassment of a law enforcement officer or a member of the officer's family in the first degree and second degree
abstract: Establishes the crimes of harassment of a law enforcement officer or a member of the officer's family in the first degree and second degree.
