title: Exempts from the mortgage recording tax mortgages executed by a veteran first time homebuyer
abstract: Exempts from the mortgage recording tax mortgages executed by a veteran first time homebuyer.

title: Requires two qualified psychiatrists to be employed by each school district
abstract: Requires two qualified psychiatrists to be employed by each school district to perform and coordinate the provision of mental health services in the public schools.

title: Relates to excused absence of a public employee for mental health purposes
abstract: Relates to excused absence of a public employee for mental health purposes.

title: Provides that any disability or death of a volunteer firefighter caused by Parkinson's Disease was caused by an accident and sustained in the performance and discharge of duty unless proven otherwise
abstract: Provides that any condition of impairment of health caused by Parkinson's Disease, resulting in total or partial disability or death to a volunteer firefighter is presumptive evidence that such disability or death was caused by the natural and proximate result of an accident and was sustained in the performance and discharge of duty.

title: Prohibits the banning of books or other materials by libraries or library systems
abstract: Prohibits the banning of books or other materials by libraries or library systems; provides that no library or library system shall receive state aid unless such entity adopts the American Library Association's Library Bill of Rights that indicates materials should not be proscribed or removed because of partisan or doctrinal disapproval or develops a written statement prohibiting the practice of banning books or other materials.

title: Relates to health facilities and services in correctional facilities
abstract: Relates to health facilities and services in correctional facilities.

title: Allows attendance at individualized education program (IEP) meetings to be covered under paid family leave
abstract: Allows attendance at individualized education program (IEP) meetings to be covered under paid family leave.

title: Establishes the legislative sunset advisory commission
abstract: Enacts the New York state legislative sunset act which establishes the legislative sunset advisory commission.

title: Permits dentists to administer vaccinations against human papillomavirus
abstract: Permits dentists to administer vaccinations against human papillomavirus.

title: Establishes a medical loss ratio for dental insurance
abstract: Establishes a medical loss ratio for dental insurance of not less than 82% for calendar year 2024 and thereafter.

title: Relates to providing net revenues from utility-owned large-scale renewable generation projects to low-income customers and authorizes utility companies to own such projects
abstract: Relates to providing net revenues from utility-owned large-scale renewable generation projects to low-income customers; authorizes utility companies to own such projects; provides that the commission shall require labor agreements and labor peace agreements.

title: Redefines the term "following" for a crime of stalking in the fourth degree
abstract: Redefines the term "following" for a crime of stalking in the fourth degree to include the use of certain devices or computers to gain access to, record, track or report the movement or location of a person or their property without the person's permission or authority to do so.

title: Requires the department of labor to study the long-term impact of artificial intelligence on the state workforce
abstract: Requires the department of labor to study the long-term impact of artificial intelligence on the state workforce including but not limited to on job performance, productivity, training, education requirements, privacy and security; prohibits any state entity from using artificial intelligence in any way that would displace any natural person from their employment with such state entity until the department's final report is received.

title: Relates to establishing a program of health care quality innovation and improvement through home care
abstract: Establishes a program of health care quality innovation and improvement through home care.

title: Enacts the New York state curriculum transparency and parental notification act
abstract: Requires each district school board of education to publish on its website a list of all instructional materials, including those used to provide instruction and to provide notice to parents of their rights to attend school board meetings, access all educational learning materials and make objection to learning materials they find objectionable; requires the commissioner of education to promulgate model policies for ensuring parental notification of any instructional material that includes explicit content.

title: Relates to including accountable care organizations within the definition of a managed care provider
abstract: Includes accountable care organizations within the definition of a managed care provider.

title: Relates to providing residents of municipal public housing in the state with free basic cable and high-speed internet service
abstract: Relates to providing residents of municipal public housing in the state with free basic cable and high-speed internet service, and reimbursing internet service providers and cable television companies for providing such service.

title: Establishes an advanced coursework and examination access program
abstract: Establishes an advanced coursework and examination access program to reimburse exam fees associated with the administration of an advanced coursework exam; defines terms; requires authorized schools to inform students and parents of all advanced coursework programs offered, their cost-free status, and the potential benefits of their successful completion as it relates to college credit and other academic opportunities; makes related provisions.

title: Excludes cigarettes on hand prior to September 1, 2023 from tax increase where a cigarette tax stamp has been affixed as of the close of business on August 31, 2023.
abstract: Excludes cigarettes on hand prior to September 1, 2023 from the tax increase where a cigarette tax stamp has been affixed as of the close of business on August 31, 2023.

title: Allows the town board of the town of North Hempstead to adopt a local law or ordinance providing for a residential parking permit system
abstract: Allows the town board of the town of North Hempstead to adopt a local law or ordinance providing for a residential parking permit system on a certain street within the town.

title: Provides for a line of duty presumption for disabilities of deputy sheriffs in certain cities
abstract: Provides for a line of duty presumption for disabilities of deputy sheriffs in a city with a population of one million or more.

title: Requires the state athletic commission to promulgate regulations for authorized combined professional and amateur mixed martial arts events
abstract: Requires the state athletic commission to promulgate regulations for authorized combined professional and amateur mixed martial arts events no later than June 30, 2023.

title: Provides for the appeal of disputes between shareholders and boards of directors of residential cooperative corporations to a hearing officer appointed by the attorney general
abstract: Provides for the appeal of disputes between shareholders and boards of directors of residential cooperatives to a hearing officer appointed by the attorney general.

title: Provides for protection of certain streams
abstract: Provides for protection of certain streams; adds class C streams to the list of protected streams; exempts soil and water conservation districts which have an MOU with the department of environmental conservation from certain permitting requirements.

title: Commemorating the 60th Anniversary of the Yorktown Volunteer Ambulance Corps
Establishes state procurement goals for New York state products throughout state agencies and private entities performing state contracts
abstract: Establishes state procurement goals for New York state products throughout state agencies and private entities performing state contracts; provides that every year after enactment, a certain percentage of products purchased by state agencies will be New York state products, with such percentage threshold increasing each year up until five years.

title: Establishes the water safety instruction working group
abstract: Establishes the water safety instruction working group to study appropriate standards for curriculum on water safety instruction for students in grades kindergarten through twelve in the state.

title: Provides respondents the option to repay a court ordered refund in installments of no more than five years
abstract: Provides respondents the option to repay a court ordered refund in installments of no more than five years.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim March 6, 2023, as Lymphedema Day in the State of New York, in conjunction with the observance of the Eighth Annual World Lymphedema Day
Relates to telecommunications equipment owned by other than a telephone company
abstract: Provides that all equipment used for the transmission and switching of radio signals for the provision of commercial mobile radio service or mobile internet access service no longer constitutes real property subject to the real property tax law.

title: Relates to the operation of vehicles on approach of vehicles displaying a blue light
abstract: Relates to the operation of vehicles on approach of vehicles displaying a blue light; requires vehicles to pull over on approach of vehicles displaying a blue light.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim January 26, 2023, as the 210th Anniversary of Juan Pablo Duarte Day in the State of New York
Honoring Andrea Weinreb for her outstanding advocacy, education, and fundraising efforts for lymphedema awareness
Regulates and requires issuance of raincheck by retailer where advertised merchandise is not available for sale
abstract: Mandates that any article of merchandise advertised, and not available throughout advertised period, must be supplied at advertised price by seller within sixty days from the date the purchaser of such article is notified of its availability; specifies terms of raincheck and limited exceptions.

title: Commemorating the 200th Anniversary of Wayne County, New York
Relates to the money deposited as bail by charitable bail organizations
abstract: Relates to the money deposited as bail by charitable bail organizations; removes maximum authorized amount of money allowed to be deposited by such organizations.

title: Precludes local criminal court from issuing a warrant of arrest based on any simplified information when the defendant has not been arraigned
abstract: Precludes a local criminal court from issuing a warrant of arrest based on any simplified information when the defendant has not been arraigned and has not come under the control of the court with respect to the charges in the simplified information; provides that this formerly applied only to simplified traffic information.

title: Relates to the powers of the commissioner of health in administering the elderly pharmaceutical insurance coverage program
abstract: Requires the commissioner of health to create an electronic online system for registration into the elderly pharmaceutical insurance coverage program.

title: Directs the office of fire prevention and control to conduct a study which evaluates the minimum recommended qualifications to becoming a volunteer firefighter
abstract: Directs the office of fire prevention and control to conduct a study, which evaluates the minimum recommended qualifications to becoming a volunteer firefighter; requires such office to provide a report to the governor, temporary president of the senate and the speaker of the assembly within twelve months of the effective date of this act.

title: Abolishes the minimum charge for the supply of water by the New York city municipal water finance authority and the New York city water board
abstract: Abolishes the minimum charge for the supply of water by the New York city municipal water finance authority and the New York city water board.

title: Requires reporting of positive cytomegalovirus results
abstract: Requires a local health department to report positive cytomegalovirus results.

title: Relates to the election to have federal and/or state income tax deducted and withheld from an individual's unemployment insurance benefits
abstract: Relates to the election to have federal and/or state income tax deducted and withheld from an individual's unemployment insurance benefits.

title: Relates to a parent's right to know if an employee, volunteer or an administrator of a school district is reprimanded for inappropriate conduct towards their child
abstract: Relates to a parent's right to know if an employee, volunteer or an administrator of a school district is reprimanded for inappropriate conduct towards his or her child; enacts "parent's right to know" act.

title: Establishes a model environmental curriculum in all public elementary and secondary schools
abstract: Establishes a model environmental curriculum in all public elementary and secondary schools which shall include various principles and concepts including environmental justice.

title: Relates to pistol permit applications for military personnel
abstract: Relates to pistol permit applications for military personnel; requires the licensing officer to act on an application for any member of the active or reserve component of the armed forces within 90 days of presentment.

title: Relates to creating autism teams in hospitals
abstract: Relates to creating autism teams in hospitals; requires the department of health to design a pilot program to develop one "autism team" who may be called upon should a patient with autism come to a hospital; provides that members of the autism team shall be knowledgeable about autism and communication difficulties many people with autism have and advise physicians and other staff on how to communicate with patients with autism.

title: Relates to the New York city housing authority and mold remediation
abstract: Relates to the New York city housing authority and mold remediation; after reporting such authority shall have 15 days to remediate such reported mold.

title: Relates to the utilization of a pressurized mixing and dispensing system
abstract: Relates to the utilization of a pressurized mixing and dispensing system; permits a retail licensee for on-premises consumption to prepare and keep drinks containing alcoholic beverages in dispensing machines, having a capacity of not less than a gallon, utilizing a pressurized mixing and dispensing system.

title: Authorizes a special account to create safe city streets, safe city, safe schools program in city of Yonkers
abstract: Authorizes the city of Yonkers to establish a separate fund into which revenue earmarked for the safe city streets, safe streets, safe schools program will be deposited.

title: Establishes the fire station construction grant program and the fire station construction fund; and makes an appropriation therefor
abstract: Establishes the fire station construction grant program and the fire station construction fund; makes an appropriation therefor.

title: Requires state and county inmates to make medical co-payments
abstract: Requires inmates in state and county-owned or operated correctional facilities to make medical co-payments of seven dollars upon receipt of medical treatment; provides that an inmate shall not be refused treatment for lack of ability to pay co-payment charges; directs all moneys collected to be made available for the operation of such correctional facility.

title: Requires consideration of union made commodities and services in the awarding of certain procurement contracts
abstract: Requires consideration as a quantitative factor whether the commodities or services were manufactured or will be performed by a labor union with respect to the awarding of certain procurement contracts.

title: Authorizes cities to request that railroad corporations perform railroad crossing, bridge and right of ways maintenance
abstract: Authorizes cities to request that railroad corporations perform railroad crossing, bridge and right of ways maintenance and to perform such maintenance if the corporation fails to do so.

title: Requires the state comptroller and the attorney general to conduct an annual audit of the office of cannabis management
abstract: Requires the state comptroller, the attorney general and independent certified public accountants to conduct an annual audit of the office of cannabis management.

title: Clarifies the definition of floor area
abstract: Relates to the definition of floor area and what is excluded in the measurement of floor area.

title: Limits the application of the "safe act" to the counties of Kings, Queens, Richmond, New York and Bronx; repealer
abstract: Limits the application of the "safe act" to the counties of Kings, Queens, Richmond, New York and Bronx.

title: Enacts the "solar panel collection act"
abstract: Enacts the "solar panel collection act" to require manufacturers of solar panels to collect such panels when they are taken out of use; requires educational outreach relating thereto; establishes collection goals therefor; requires reporting of collection efforts.

title: Authorizes the commissioner of environmental conservation to enter into contracts for maple tree tapping and sap production on state lands for a duration of up to ten years
abstract: Authorizes the commissioner of environmental conservation to enter into contracts for the lease or use of state lands for the purpose of maple tree tapping and sap production for a term of up to, but not to exceed, ten years.

title: Requires child protective services to document each home visit with photographs
abstract: Requires child protective services to document every home visit or contact with the child as part of a treatment plan, supervision and monitoring, with photographs of the child.

title: Commemorating Indian Arrival Day in Guyana to be celebrated May 5, 2023
Sets standards for addiction professionals
abstract: Relates to the scope of responsibilities of the office of addiction services and supports; defines addiction professional.

title: Relates to supplemental spousal liability insurance for married insureds
abstract: Requires that policy provisions regarding supplemental spousal liability insurance apply only to policies issued or delivered to an insured who is married.

title: Congratulating Sheriff Ron Spike upon the occasion of his retirement after more than 50 years of distinguished service to the Yates County Sheriff's Office
Relates to rent increases in certain cases; repealer
abstract: Relates to permitting certain rent increases for capital improvements to rent regulated buildings and apartments.

title: Authorizes retired firefighters to be employed as fire science instructors by career and technical education centers without a reduction of benefits
abstract: Authorizes retired firefighters to be employed as fire science instructors by career and technical education centers without a reduction of their retirement benefits.

title: Creates a state-wide literacy education advocacy program
abstract: Creates a state-wide literacy education advocacy program modelled after the Newburgh Armory Unity Center Literacy Education Advocacy Partnership to study the viability of the Newburgh Armory Unity Center Literacy Education Advocacy Partnership.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim May 2023, as Crossing Guard Appreciation Month in the State of New York
Relates to credit unions
abstract: Establishes a credit union deposit program for the state to deposit a portion of funds under its control into credit unions.

title: Relates to requiring all buses manufactured for sale in this state to have the exhaust pipe at the upper right corner of the vehicle
abstract: Provides that all buses manufactured for sale in this state after July 1, 2025, shall have an exhaust system whereby the point of emission from the exhaust pipe is at the upper right hand corner of the rear of such vehicle.

title: Relates to the disqualification of certain persons from acting as school bus monitors and drivers
abstract: Relates to the disqualification of certain persons from acting as school bus monitors and drivers upon the conviction for certain offenses.

title: Relates to refunds by public utility companies to overcharged customers
abstract: Requires the public service commission to conduct a review within fifteen days when a residential customer of a public utility company alleges that the public utility company has overcharged the customer for service and to refund the overcharge within thirty days; provides for penalties; requires the public service commission to promulgate rules and regulations.

title: Relates to the application of topical fluoride varnish by certain persons
abstract: Permits dental assistants and licensed practical nurses to perform the application of topical fluoride varnish.

title: Relates to the authority of the city of New York to install and operate traffic-control signal photo violation-monitoring devices
abstract: Increases the number of traffic-control signal photo violation-monitoring devices that may be installed in New York city to one thousand three hundred twenty-five intersections; extends certain provisions authorizing photo-monitoring devices until December 1, 2030.

title: Enacts the integrity in government act
abstract: Enacts the integrity in government act; expands the powers and duties of the committee on open government.

title: Relates to the provision of regulatory information to small businesses
abstract: Relates to the provision of regulatory information to small businesses through the establishment of a small business regulatory nexus by certain agencies.

title: Ensures proper administration and enforcement of the uniform fire prevention and building code and the state energy conservation construction code; and makes conforming technical changes
abstract: Ensures proper administration and enforcement of the uniform fire prevention and building code and the state energy conservation construction code; provides additional definitions; provides remedies for violations of the code; makes conforming technical changes.

title: Requires trucks to utilize commercial GPS
abstract: Requires trucks to utilize commercial GPS designed for use by a commercial vehicle which is able to provide audible and visual warnings when the truck is on a route where the height, weight, width, or length of the truck exceeds the limitations of such route when operating on public highways in the state.

title: Relates to the withholding of salaries of elected officials who have been indicted on charges of any crimes related to their public office
abstract: Relates to the withholding of salaries of elected officials who have been indicted on charges of any crimes related to their public office.

title: Expands remedies for violations of New York state uniform fire prevention and building code
abstract: Expands remedies for violations of New York state uniform fire prevention and building code.

title: Excludes a production using artificial intelligence in a manner which results in the displacement of employees from the definition of qualified film for the purposes of the empire state film production credit
abstract: Excludes a production using artificial intelligence in a manner which results in the displacement of employees whose salaries are qualified expenses from the definition of qualified film for the purposes of the empire state film production credit.

title: Relates to public petitions for rule making
abstract: Relates to public petitions for rule making.

title: Relates to the protection and promotion of the mental health of the residents of New York state
abstract: Requires parity in the mental and physical health treatment of the residents of New York state; provides that both mental and physical health "will be matters of public concern and provision therefor shall be made by the state and by such of its subdivisions".

title: Enacts "SUNY for all: the New York State higher education equality act" to provide free tuition to students who attend SUNY
abstract: Enacts "SUNY for all: the New York State higher education equality act" to provide free tuition to students who attend SUNY who are enrolled in academic coursework and are on track to graduate; establishes the state university tuition fund to reimburse the state university of New York for the cost of tuition for students who are eligible for free tuition.

title: Relates to the enforcement of violations
abstract: Prohibits state agencies from imposing or suggesting any enforcement quotas or from using quotas as a reward to evaluation method.

title: Relates to accessing records under the freedom of information law
abstract: Provides for accessing records under the freedom of information law including notification procedures and the release of names of natural persons and residential addresses.

title: Relates to penalties for owners of property who fail to file a proper or timely rent registration statement
abstract: Relates to penalties for owners of property who fail to file a proper or timely rent registration statement.

title: Relates to the office of state inspector general
abstract: Provides for increased independence of the office of state inspector general; requires annual reports to the legislature on the activities of the office.

title: Prohibits bank investments in bad faith landlords
abstract: Prohibits a state chartered banking institution from providing financing to a landlord who has engaged in certain bad faith acts.

title: Relates to authorizing the direct intrastate and interstate shipment of liquor
abstract: Authorizes the direct intrastate and interstate shipment of liquor.

title: Mourning the death of John F. McArdle, distinguished law enforcement officer, beloved family man, and devoted member of his community
Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim March 19-25, 2023, as Surveyors Week in the State of New York
Prohibits members of the state police, police officers, and peace officers from intentionally covering their badges
abstract: Prohibits members of the state police, police officers, and peace officers from intentionally covering their badges.

title: Allows beneficiaries of certain deceased members to elect to receive death benefits in a lump sum
abstract: Allows a beneficiary of a member whose death occurs on or after July 1, 2023 and who would have been entitled to a service credit at the time of such member's death to elect to receive a lump sum payment equal to the pension reserve that would have been established had the member retired on the date of such member's death.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim March 31, 2023, as NY FIRST Robotics Day in the State of New York
Prohibits a person from operating a motor vehicle with children under the age of 8 in the front seat in most cases
abstract: Prohibits a person from operating a motor vehicle with children under the age of 8 in the front seat in most cases; makes limited exceptions.

title: Establishes a third-party secure vendor mail program
abstract: Establishes a third-party secure vendor mail program for the delivery of all products to incarcerated individuals housed at correctional facilities.

title: Prohibits employers from asking job applicants about salary expectations and allowing job applicants to request the included benefits for the position they are applying for
abstract: Prohibits employers from asking job applicants about salary expectations; allows job applicants to request the included benefits for the position they are applying for.

title: Relates to permitting the Immanuel Evangelical Lutheran Church to file an application for a real property tax exemption
abstract: Relates to permitting the Immanuel Evangelical Lutheran Church to file an application for a real property tax exemption.

title: Requires the state to pass enabling legislation before entering into any compact, program or other legal agreement with any other state
abstract: Requires the state to pass enabling legislation before entering into any compact, program or other legal agreement with any other state.

title: Enacts the dark skies protection act
abstract: Regulates outdoor night lighting to preserve and enhance the state's dark sky.

title: Enacts the infant vision information, education and wellness program act
abstract: Enacts the infant vision information, education and wellness program act.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim March 2023, as Developmental Disabilities Awareness Month in the State of New York
Eases certain restrictions on the conducting of games of chance for charitable purposes
abstract: Eases certain restrictions on the conducting of games of chance for charitable purposes; authorizes the payment, out of the net proceeds of games of chance, of reimbursement for reasonable expenses of volunteers working at the games; expands the frequency upon which games of chance may be held; authorizes auxiliary members of authorized organizations to operate games of chance; authorizes persons convicted of crimes to operate games of chance when participating in a rehabilitation program; authorizes conducting of games of chance on Sundays; expands advertising of games of chance.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim March 2023, as Music in Our Schools Month
Enacts the "standing is tiring (sit) act"
abstract: Enacts the "standing is tiring (sit) act"; requires employers to provide suitable seats to all employees where the nature of such employees' work reasonably permits seated work; prohibits employers from artificially designing a work space to require standing; requires the department of labor to determine whether the nature of work reasonably permits seated work; creates a private right of action for employees whose employer does not provide seats.

title: Relates to lyme disease and tick-borne infection awareness and prevention in children's summer camps
abstract: Relates to lyme disease and tick-borne infection awareness and prevention for children's overnight, summer day and traveling summer day camps; provides guidelines for treatment and notification; provides for the development of materials.

title: Authorizes the posting by each municipality of turtle crossing signs on local roads located within such municipality
abstract: Authorizes the posting by each municipality of turtle crossing signs on local roads located within such municipality; empowers the state commissioner of transportation to develop and implement rules and regulations authorizing municipalities to post turtle crossing signs on local roads located within the municipality.

title: Relates to the crime of resisting arrest
abstract: Relates to the crime of resisting arrest; provides that a second violation within 5 years shall be a class E felony.

title: Provides elderly individuals water relief in N.Y. city
abstract: Provides that any qualified homeowner in the city of New York shall be eligible to be exempted from any future increases in water rate fees.

title: Establishes the crime of coercive control
abstract: Relates to establishing the crime of coercive control; provides that a person is guilty of coercive control when he or she engages in a course of conduct against a member of his or her same family or household, without the victim's consent, which results in limiting or restricting, in full or in part, the victim's behavior, movement, associations or access to or use of his or her own finances or financial information; and provides that coercive control is a class E felony.

title: Repeals certain provisions regarding adoption of new or revised city charter proposed by charter commission which limit submission of questions to city's electors
abstract: Repeals certain provisions regarding the adoption of a new or revised city charter proposed by a charter commission which limit the submission of questions to a city's qualified electors; eliminates the rule that provides that whenever a city charter commission puts a proposal on the local ballot, all other local referendum proposals are barred from the ballot.

title: Expands the health education curriculum to include breast cancer screenings
abstract: Expands the health education curriculum to include breast cancer screenings including age appropriate instruction in performing self-examinations.

title: Celebrating the life of Private Second-Class Roger Cordle, meritorious veteran, distinguished citizen, and devoted member of his community
Restricts automatic renewal of contracts for electronic and life safety alarm services
abstract: Restricts automatic renewal of contracts for electronic and life safety alarm services; makes such automatic renewal provisions unenforceable unless: the automatic renewal offer terms or continuous service offer terms are presented to the consumer in a clear and conspicuous manner; the business or person furnishing the electronic and life safety alarm service obtains the consumer's affirmative consent; and such renewal or continuous service offer provides an acknowledgment of the contract cancellation policy, and information regarding how to cancel in a manner that is capable of being retained by the consumer.

title: Prohibits the liquor authority from revoking, suspending, or canceling certain liquor licenses without a hearing
abstract: Prohibits the liquor authority from revoking, suspending, or canceling a retail licensee's license without a hearing when the holder of the license was issued a summons for a violation that is unrelated to the sale or consumption of alcohol on premises.

title: Grants retroactive membership in the New York state and local employees' retirement system to Justin Whitmore
abstract: Grants retroactive membership in the New York state and local employees' retirement system to Justin Whitmore.

title: Extends the authorization of the county of Hamilton to impose an additional one percent of sales and compensating use taxes
abstract: Extends the authorization of the county of Hamilton to impose an additional one percent of sales and compensating use taxes to November 30, 2025.

title: Authorizes James Unger to receive certain credit under section 384-d of the retirement and social security law
abstract: Authorizes James Unger, a town of West Seneca police officer, to receive certain credit under section 384-d of the retirement and social security law.

title: Enacts the "food retail establishment subsidization for healthy communities act"
abstract: Enacts the "food retail establishment subsidization for healthy communities act" (FRESH Communities); provides loans, loan guarantees, interest subsidies and grants to businesses, municipalities, not-for-profit corporations or local development corporations for the purpose of attracting, maintaining or permitting the expansion of food retail establishments in underserved areas.

title: Exempts from compensating use taxes purchases made outside the state and brought into the state
abstract: Exempts from compensating use taxes purchases made outside the state and brought into the state to the extent that the value of the purchase does not exceed $2,500.

title: Relates to the criminal sale of a controlled substance to a person less than fourteen years of age
abstract: Relates to the criminal sale of a controlled substance to a person less than fourteen years of age.

title: Relates to nominating and designating petitions and certificates
abstract: Provides that a candidate who files a certificate of acceptance for an office for which there have been filed certificates or petitions designating more than one candidate for the nomination of any party, may thereafter file a certificate of declination not later than the seventh day after the primary election.

title: Relates to service retirement benefits for certain members of the New York city employees' retirement system
abstract: Relates to service retirement benefits for certain members of the New York city employees' retirement system; provides that for New York city uniformed correction/sanitation revised plan members of the New York city employees' retirement system, the service retirement benefit shall not be reduced by the primary social security retirement benefit commencing at age sixty-two.

title: Relates to tuition assistance program awards
abstract: Increases the amount of income eligible for income base reductions in certain tuition assistance program awards for students who have been granted exclusion of parental income and are single with no dependent, or who have a spouse but no other dependent, for income tax purposes.

title: Prohibits the application of fail-first or step therapy protocols to coverage for the diagnosis and treatment of mental health conditions
abstract: Prohibits the application of fail-first or step therapy protocols to coverage for the diagnosis and treatment of mental health conditions.

title: Relates to applications for charter schools
abstract: Relates to requirements for applications for charter schools.

title: Relates to guidance to facilities and programs overseen by state agencies on interactions with federal immigration authorities
abstract: Relates to guidance to facilities and programs overseen by state agencies on interactions with federal immigration authorities.

title: Relates to culturally responsive lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender education standards
abstract: Relates to culturally responsive lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender education standards.

title: Designates March twenty-first as Down Syndrome Awareness Day
abstract: Designates March twenty-first as a day of commemoration to be known as "Down Syndrome Awareness Day".

title: Includes fuel-flexible linear generators which do not utilize a fossil fuel resource in the process of generating electricity as qualifying as renewable energy systems
abstract: Includes fuel-flexible linear generators which do not utilize a fossil fuel resource in the process of generating electricity as qualifying as renewable energy systems.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim May 7-13, 2023, as Drinking Water Week in the State of New York
Relates to guidelines for food and beverages purchased or sold by state agencies
abstract: Directs the department of health to develop state food guidelines for foods purchased, served, and sold by state agencies, programs, and institutions and on state property.

title: Relates to bystander reporting of stolen, false or fraudulent license plates
abstract: Directs municipalities to create a program for bystander reporting of stolen, false or fraudulent license plates.

title: Requires owners and agents of multiple residences and multiple dwellings to provide names and contact information of residents to emergency personnel
abstract: Requires owners and agents of multiple residences and multiple dwellings to provide names and contact information of residents to emergency personnel upon the request of such personnel, where the physical safety of such residents must be accounted for by ascertaining their whereabouts.

title: Relates to the remote conduct of witnessing health care proxies
abstract: Provides for the remote witnessing of health care proxies utilizing audio-video technology or telephone.

title: Relates to a study of the number of children in foster care who have a developmental disability
abstract: Relates to a study of the number of children in foster care who have a developmental disability; provides such study shall include, but shall not be limited to, the following: assessing the demographics of the children in foster care with a developmental disability, including, but not limited to, their county of residence, age, race and gender identity, and determining whether the placement of such individuals in foster care was voluntary or court ordered; evaluating the current guidelines and regulations used to oversee the placement and treatment of children with a developmental disability; and analyzing the extent to which such age-appropriate children are prepared for a transition from foster care to an independent living situation.

title: Provides that an automobile insurer may waive the inspection of a private passenger automobile prior to providing physical damage coverage
abstract: Provides that an automobile insurer may waive the inspection of a private passenger automobile prior to providing physical damage coverage.

title: Relates to the filing of financial disclosure statements
abstract: Relates to the filing of financial disclosure statements; relates to the definition of "filing rate".

title: Relates to sharing information obtained from applicants and licensees
abstract: Relates to sharing information obtained from applicants and licensees and requesting financial institutions for the purpose of consideration and compliance.

title: Enacts the New York State American Freedmen Equity Task Force on Reparations Remedies Act; appropriation
abstract: Enacts the "New York State American Freedmen Task Force on Reparations Remedies Act"; acknowledges New York state's role in the fundamental injustice and inhumanity of the institution of slavery; establishes the New York State American Freedmen Task Force on Reparations Remedies; examines all aspects of slavery, subsequent de jure and de facto racial, social and economic discrimination against American freedmen and the impact of these forces on living American freedmen and to make determinations regarding compensation and repair; establishes a New York state freedmen's bureau charged with the distribution of reparations and reparative justice passed in legislation by the state; makes an appropriation therefor.

title: Expands the eligibility period for indigent legal service attorneys to receive certain loan forgiveness and increases loan reimbursement for certain attorneys who work in legal services with indigent clients
abstract: Expands the eligibility period for indigent legal service attorneys to receive certain loan forgiveness; increases loan reimbursement for certain attorneys who work in legal services with indigent clients.

title: Honoring Clovis Point Vineyard upon the occasion of its designation as a Gold Medalist by the New York Wine and Grape Foundation on July 12, 2022
Relates to reimbursement for studies for districts subject to reorganization
abstract: Relates to reimbursement for studies for districts subject to reorganization when appropriated.

title: Grants fire marshals in the town of Shelter Island in Suffolk county peace officer status
abstract: Grants fire marshals in the town of Shelter Island in Suffolk county peace officer status.

title: Requires legislators and candidates for member of the legislature to provide a link to their financial disclosure statements on their official state and campaign websites
abstract: Requires legislators and candidates for members of the legislature to provide a link to their financial disclosure statements on their official state and campaign websites which shall direct website visitors to current and past financial disclosure forms that the legislator has submitted.

title: Provides for the seizure and forfeiture of vehicles, vessels and aircraft used in counterfeit goods
abstract: Provides for the seizure and forfeiture of vehicles, vessels and aircraft used in counterfeit goods; establishes this shall not apply to vehicles, vessels, or aircrafts that are used by any person as a common carrier in the transaction of business as such common carrier.

title: Requires notification procedures to be established giving advance notice of certain construction projects in school buildings or a district leasing school property
abstract: Requires notification procedures to be established requiring notice to be given prior to certain construction projects in school buildings or a district leasing school property.

title: Imposes a five-day time limit during which to disclose a breach in the security of a system
abstract: Relates to imposing a five-day time limit during which to disclose a breach in the security of a system.

title: Relates to capital apportionment to high need school districts bordering the city of New York
abstract: Provides the same adjustment for capital apportionment to high need school districts bordering the city of New York as used by school districts of the city of New York.

title: Exempts Staten Island residents from Verrazzano-Narrows bridge tolls
abstract: Exempts Staten Island residents from Verrazzano-Narrows bridge tolls; directs the Triborough bridge and tunnel authority to create applications for such exemptions.

title: Relates to authorizing the imposition of service charges upon certain real property
abstract: Authorizes the imposition of service charges upon certain real property.

title: Permits employees of authorized organizations to operate games of chance
abstract: Permits employees of authorized organizations to operate games of chance.

title: Relates to removing the statute of limitations in criminal and civil actions involving sex offenses committed against a minor
abstract: Removes the statute of limitations in criminal and civil actions involving sex offenses committed against a minor.

title: Relates to creating the proprietary college tuition reimbursement account
abstract: Relates to degree-granting proprietary colleges; creates the proprietary college tuition reimbursement account for the refund of tuition paid by eligible students asserting certain violations; establishes an assessment to be paid by proprietary schools to fund the account.

title: Prohibits certain surcharges on credit or debit card transactions
abstract: Prohibits certain surcharges on certain credit or debit card transactions in the city of New York; provides that no agency or department of the city of New York, or any tribunal located therein, shall be authorized to impose a surcharge on a holder who elects to use a credit or debit card in lieu of payment by cash, check, or similar means to pay any fine, civil penalty, or fee owed.

title: Relates to enacting "Todd's Law"
abstract: Relates to sentencing and larceny of property of the elderly or disabled.

title: Relates to minimum wage order increases
abstract: Requires legislative approval of minimum wage increases promulgated through wage orders.

title: Provides judges more discretion regarding securing orders and limiting the lengths of certain orders and increases the lengths of certain prison sentences; repealer
abstract: Provides judges more discretion regarding securing orders and limiting the lengths of certain orders; increases the lengths of certain prison sentences; repeals certain provisions relating to use of force by law enforcement; repeals certain provisions relating to access to premises for discovery by the defendant and motions to vacate judgments.

title: Requires the New York state cancer services program to provide various cancer screenings and diagnostic services at no cost; appropriation
abstract: Requires the New York state cancer services program to provide various cancer screenings and diagnostic services at no cost to certain persons and to provide informational pamphlets on such cancers.

title: Relates to establishing the animal abuse hotline
abstract: Establishes the animal abuse hotline.

title: Relates to the limit upon real property tax levies by local governments
abstract: Relates to the limit upon real property tax levies by local governments; exempts real property owned by a city, town or village from taxes for infrastructure, road maintenance, snow removal, capital projects, consent order and smart growth initiative expenses and any extraordinary expenses required to respond to public health emergencies and pandemics.

title: Requires human breast milk banks, companies and cooperatives to comply with certain standards and provides for education and support of certain breastfeeding mothers
abstract: Requires human breast milk banks, companies and cooperatives to comply with certain standards; provides for education and support of certain breastfeeding mothers.

title: Relates to liability for outside aid
abstract: Relates to liability for outside aid.

title: Allows residents who are employed by employers based in another state to obtain property/casualty or liability coverage under a policy issued to their employer
abstract: Allows residents who are employed by employers based in another state to obtain property/casualty or liability coverage under a policy issued to their employer in that state.

title: Authorizes a person to pass his or her guns to an immediate family member through his or her estate
abstract: Authorizes a person to pass his or her guns to an immediate family member through his or her estate.

title: Provides an exemption from suspension of driver's license for persons serving on fulltime active military duty
abstract: Provides exemption from suspension of a driver's license for persons serving fulltime active military duty who fail to pay fines from traffic or parking violations.

title: Establishes a senior dental services grant program
abstract: Establishes a senior dental services grant program; authorizes the director to establish the program and, upon the availability of appropriations, provide grants to eligible elderly persons who are in need of such services.

title: Relates to annual teacher and principal evaluations
abstract: Relates to annual teacher and principal evaluations; provides that in the event that a new evaluation system has not been adopted in accordance with the recommendations of the committee of experts as set forth in subdivision sixteen of section 3012-d of the education law by September 1, 2027, the date for compliance with the provisions of subpart E of part EE of chapter 56 of the laws of 2015, shall be suspended until such time that a new evaluation system is enacted.

title: Relates to local government authority to prohibit trade in real fur products
abstract: Relates to local government authority to prohibit trade in real fur products, including but not limited to any article of clothing, fashion accessory, or home decoration that is made in whole or part of real fur.

title: Relates to monies withdrawn from the revenue stabilization fund of the city of New York
abstract: Provides that monies may not be withdrawn from the revenue stabilization fund of the city of New York in any fiscal year unless the mayor has certified that there is a compelling fiscal need, including a national or regional recession of at least two quarters of declining real gross city product, a natural or other disaster, including terrorist attacks, or a declared state of emergency in the city of New York or the state of New York.

title: Relates to requirements for making of policy loans
abstract: Requires the terms and conditions of any individual life insurance policy loan to be in writing, be signed by the insured and the agent and contain a signed statement that the agent has explained the terms to the policyholder.

title: Requires the inspection of non-fireproof buildings and compliance with the New York city housing maintenance code and the New York city construction codes
abstract: Requires the inspection of non-fireproof buildings every three years; requires compliance with the New York city housing maintenance code and the New York city construction codes; requires those dwellings not in compliance with such code at the time of inspection to make repairs or improvements necessary to comply with such standards within six months of such inspection, or a lien shall be placed upon the dwelling.

title: Makes provisions relating to the suspension of licenses
abstract: Provides that the owner of a hazard vehicle service or of a taxicab, livery, bus, coach, limousine, van or wheelchair accessible van service, who has permitted an employee to operate such a vehicle when such employee has not been issued a valid state driver's license or whose license has been suspended or revoked shall have his business license suspended for thirty days.

title: Relates to the definition of all terrain vehicle or "ATV"
abstract: Amends the definition of all terrain vehicles to include certain vehicles of up to seventy inches long and 1500 pounds.

title: Relates to the election by certain counties to withdraw from the metropolitan commuter transportation district, and permits the counties of Orange and Rockland to make such election
abstract: Relates to the election by certain counties to withdraw from the metropolitan commuter transportation district; permits the counties of Orange and Rockland to make such election.

title: Relates to bills containing provisions requiring appointments to be made by the legislative leaders
abstract: Requires certain bills which establish a commission, task force, board, council or any similar body shall have not less than one position appointed by each of the legislative leaders.

title: Relates to the solicitation of donations on state highways
abstract: Relates to solicitation of donations on state highways.

title: Makes the theft of a package intentionally taken from the residence of another following delivery of the package to such residence by the postal service or a commercial carrier a felony
abstract: Makes the theft of a package intentionally taken from a porch, driveway, doorway or other area adjacent to the residence of another following delivery of the package to such residence by the postal service or a commercial carrier a felony.

title: Relates to limiting the power of the governor to make an executive order or otherwise direct an executive agency to take any action that contradicts state law; repealer
abstract: Relates to limiting the power of the governor to give an executive order or otherwise direct an executive agency to take any action that contradicts state law.

title: Provides an itemized deduction for expenses for course-mandated supplies for eligible college students paid by taxpayers
abstract: Provides an itemized deduction for expenses for course-mandated supplies for eligible college students paid by taxpayers.

title: Relates to requiring health insurers to offer coverage of health care provided by out-of-network providers
abstract: Requires health insurers to offer coverage of health care provided by out-of-network providers.

title: Relates to a moratorium on new licensed home care service agency approvals
abstract: Relates to a moratorium on new licensed home care service agency approvals.

title: Creates the division of regulatory review and economic growth
abstract: Creates the division of regulatory review and economic growth to review regulatory processes and permit requirements in order to facilitate economic growth.

title: Creates the "Commission on Battery Fire Safety Practices"
abstract: Creates the commission on battery fire safety practices to evaluate the need for resources for police, volunteer fire departments and emergency medical services concerning health and safety best practices when responding to lithium-ion battery incidents.

title: Relates to regulations implementing video lottery gaming in this state
abstract: Relates to regulations implementing video lottery gaming in this state.

title: Relates to assaults on nursing professionals and sanitarians
abstract: Relates to assaults on nursing professionals and sanitation workers while such person was performing an assigned duty.

title: Relates to granting peace officer status to park rangers in Erie county
abstract: Grants park rangers in Erie county peace officer status to issue appearance tickets, simplified traffic informations, simplified parks informations and simplified environmental conservation informations; provided that such shall not be deemed to authorize such officer to carry, possess, repair or dispose of a firearm unless the appropriate license has been issued therefor.

title: Authorizing licensing of bowling establishments to offer video gaming if structure allows for segregated areas from patrons under 21 years of age
abstract: Authorizes licensing of bowling establishments to offer video gaming if structure allows for segregated areas from patrons under 21 years of age; entitles the operators of bowling establishments to vendor fees where video lottery terminals are located.

title: Requires lifetime post-release supervision for certain offenders; prohibits good behavior allowances against certain determinate sentences
abstract: Requires lifetime post-release supervision for offenders convicted of rape in the first degree, criminal sexual act in the first degree, aggravated sexual abuse in the first degree, course of sexual conduct against a child in the first and second degrees or sexual abuse in the first degree when the other person is less than eleven years old; prohibits good behavior allowances against a determinate sentence for a person convicted of any such crimes.

title: Requires the commissioner of motor vehicles to create a bicycle with electric assist battery swapping pilot program in N.Y. city
abstract: Requires the commissioner of motor vehicles to create a bicycle with electric assist battery swapping pilot program in a city with a population of one million or more.

title: Authorizes certain vehicle registration refunds to be refunded on a prorated monthly basis
abstract: Authorizes vehicle registration refunds for the registration period commencing after the first twelve month period of such registration to be refunded on a prorated monthly basis.

title: Authorizes municipalities located in the county of Orange and county of Rockland to charge for the cost of providing additional police protection to paid-admission events
abstract: Authorizes municipalities located in the county of Orange and county of Rockland to charge for the cost of providing additional police protection to paid-admission events.

title: Excludes certain runaway youths from being able to consent to certain medical, dental health and hospital services
abstract: Excludes certain runaway youths from being able to consent to certain medical, dental, health and hospital services.

title: Clarifies provisions related to a state-level program of all-inclusive care for the elderly
abstract: Clarifies provisions related to a state-level program of all-inclusive care for the elderly.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim February 22, 2023, as Hypertrophic Cardiomyopathy Awareness Day in the State of New York
Commemorating the 50th Anniversary of the birth of Hip Hop, an American genre, on August 11, 2023
Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim February 19-25, 2023, as Grain Bin Safety Week in the State of New York
Prohibits eviction without good cause
abstract: Prohibits eviction without good cause; sets forth grounds for removal of tenants.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim February 20-26, 2023, as Eating Disorders Awareness Week in the State of New York
Congratulating Nancy Fox upon the occasion of her retirement after 12 years of dedicated service as Executive Director and Founder of the CNY Community Arts Center
Relates to maintaining a database of vacant residential housing units, imposing a real property tax on such vacant units, and funding affordable housing development
abstract: Directs the commissioner of housing and community renewal to create and maintain a database of vacant residential housing units, and to create an affordable housing development program; imposes a tax on vacant residential housing units; creates an affordable housing development program fund.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim June 21, 2023, as Yoga Day in the State of New York
Relates to conciliation and non-compliance with public assistance employment; repealer
abstract: Relates to conciliation and non-compliance with public assistance employment.

title: Relates to alcohol in certain motion picture theatres
abstract: Relates to alcohol in certain motion picture theatres; authorizes a person holding a retail on-premises license for a movie theatre to allow the purchase of alcoholic beverages under certain circumstances.

title: Clarifies the scope of protections against discrimination on the basis of disability
abstract: Clarifies the scope of protections against discrimination on the basis of disability under the New York state human rights law in the areas of employment, public accommodations and government services to be consistent with the federal Americans with Disabilities Act and the current policies and practices of the division of human rights.

title: Authorizes boards of cooperative educational services to enroll students in career and technical education courses
abstract: Authorizes boards of cooperative educational services to enroll students in career and technical education courses.

title: Enacts the health care consumer and provider protection act relating to collective negotiations by health care providers with certain health care plans
abstract: Enacts provisions relating to collective negotiations by health care providers with certain health care plans in certain counties; applies to health benefit plans that provide benefits for medical or surgical expenses incurred as a result of a health condition, accident or sickness, including an individual, group, blanket or franchise insurance policy or insurance agreement offered by certain enumerated entities.

title: Places a permanent moratorium on unfunded mandates
abstract: Places a permanent moratorium on unfunded mandates.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim March 3, 2023, as Employee Appreciation Day in the State of New York
Designates black dirt as the state soil and to designate the black dirt region as home to the most fertile soil
abstract: Designates black dirt as the state soil; designates the black dirt region as home to the most fertile soil.

title: Relates to the metropolitan transit authority
abstract: Relates to the metropolitan transit authority; provides that the members from the counties of Dutchess, Orange, Putnam and Rockland shall each cast one vote apiece, instead of one collective vote.

title: Relates to calculation of the earned income credit
abstract: Relates to calculation of the earned income credit for taxable years beginning in 2024, provides the applicable percentage shall be 45%.

title: Relates to a uniform presentation to students regarding applying for financial aid
abstract: Creates a uniform presentation for students regarding applying for financial aid; directs students to complete an affidavit certifying that the student attended the presentation and stating whether the student intends to apply for financial aid.

title: Provides for licensure of school psychologists
abstract: Provides for the licensure of school psychologists; authorizes the use of the title "school psychologist" to licensed or exempt individuals; defines practice of school psychology; sets forth requirements for professional licensure (including educational attainment, experience, exam and fee); provides for issuance of limited permits under specified circumstances; identifies exempt persons.

title: Relates to the handling fee paid to any dealer or operator of a redemption center
abstract: Increases the handling fee paid by a deposit initiator to a dealer or operator of a redemption center from three and one half cents to five cents per container; decreases the amount of quarterly payments a deposit initiator must pay the commissioner of taxation and finance from eighty to forty-seven percent of the balance of initiator's refund value account.

title: Requires state agencies to develop a 5-year accessibility plan providing full access to the physical facilities, services, programs, and activities for persons with disabilities
abstract: Requires each agency to develop and implement a five-year accessibility plan, to include: the steps the agency is taking and will be taking over the next 5 years to ensure accessibility to the agency's facilities, services, and programs for persons with disabilities, and information on ongoing projects and projects planned over the next 5 years related to improving physical, digital and programmatic access, and effective communications for persons with disabilities.

title: Relates to the terms of office of commissioners of elections
abstract: Increases the term of office of an election commissioner from two to four years beginning January first of each odd numbered year.

title: Establishes a community gardening grant program to strengthen local food chain resiliency
abstract: Establishes the food chain resiliency through community gardening grant program to expand, establish, or maintain community gardens for the purpose of strengthening the resiliency of local food supply chains.

title: Requires election for registration for organ, eye and tissue donations to be included upon certain state forms; repealer
abstract: Requires that space be provided on applications for a civil service examination, claims for unemployment benefits, applications for the practice of a profession or occupation, state income tax returns, and applications to register a motor vehicle, for the applicant to register in the "donate life registry" for organ, eye and tissue donation established pursuant to section 4310 of the public health law.

title: Creates a tax credit for employers who help reduce the governmental education loans of their employees
abstract: Creates a tax credit for employers who help reduce the governmental education loans of their employees.

title: Relates to requiring immunization information systems to record data on the number of vaccine exemptions reported by each health care provider
abstract: Requires immunization information systems to record data on the number of vaccine exemptions reported by each health care provider.

title: Creates the Brooklyn health care commission
abstract: Relates to creating the Brooklyn health care commission which shall be charged with examining the system of general hospitals, nursing homes, ambulatory and primary care facilities, and medical school facilities in Kings county and recommending changes to that system.

title: Provides for a personal income tax deduction for school supplies paid for out-of-pocket by K-12 teachers in public and nonpublic schools, up to $500 per year
abstract: Provides for a personal income tax deduction for school supplies paid for out-of-pocket by K-12 teachers in public and nonpublic schools, up to $500 per year.

title: Authorizes a study on proposed improvements of state route 303 in the town of Orangetown, county of Rockland
abstract: Authorizes and directs the department of transportation to conduct a study on proposed improvements of state route 303 in the town of Orangetown, county of Rockland.

title: Relates to requiring landlords of certain properties to furnish New York homes and community renewal with data pertaining to succession rights
abstract: Relates to requiring landlords of certain properties to furnish New York homes and community renewal with data pertaining to succession rights.

title: Relates to making technical corrections to ensure gender neutrality for the admission to practice law and preventing any required disclosure of mental health history
abstract: Relates to making technical corrections to ensure gender neutrality for the admission to practice law and preventing the character fitness questionnaire from inquiring into an applicant's mental health history.

title: Relates to the appointment and reporting duties of the superintendent of the state police and to the appointment of employees of the state police
abstract: Relates to the appointment and reporting duties of the superintendent of the state police and to the appointment of employees of the state police; requires the approval of certain duties of the state police by the superintendent of the state police.

title: Establishes the police canine vest fund for the purpose of purchasing, maintaining, repairing and replacing soft body ballistic armor vests and other protective equipment for police K9 officers
abstract: Establishes the police canine vest fund for the purpose of purchasing, maintaining, repairing and replacing soft body ballistic armor vests and other protective equipment for police K9 officers.

title: Relates to the definition of serious offense and felony offenses against animals for purposes of possession of a firearm
abstract: Relates to the definition of serious offense and felony offenses against animals for purposes of possession of a firearm.

title: Relates to notification in the case of a change to a workers' compensation claims representative
abstract: Relates to notification in the case of a change to the workers' compensation claims representative.

title: Relates to potential tenants with a criminal history; and relates to public housing applicants with a criminal history
abstract: Relates to protecting potential tenants with a criminal history; relates to protecting public housing applicants with a criminal history.

title: Requires comprehensive training for school bus drivers and school bus attendants in the discouragement, prevention and detection of harassment, bullying and discrimination
abstract: Requires comprehensive training at least one time per year for school bus drivers and school bus attendants in the discouragement, prevention and detection of harassment, bullying and discrimination.

title: Establishes the uniform debt-management services act
abstract: Provides for budget planning and debt settlement services; requires debt settlement companies to obtain a license.

title: Prohibits transportation network companies from enacting surge pricing during declared federal, state and local emergencies
abstract: Prohibits transportation network companies from enacting surge pricing during declared federal, state and local emergencies; subjects violators to a two hundred fifty dollar fine.

title: Enacts the healthy, safe and energy efficient outdoor lighting act to reduce harmful outdoor lighting
abstract: Enacts the healthy, safe and energy efficient outdoor lighting act to reduce harmful outdoor lighting; sets standards for outdoor lighting; provides for the designation of dark-sky preserves; provides for distribution to customers by electric corporations or municipalities providing electric service of an informational pamphlet relating to outdoor lighting.

title: Requires shareholders to approve corporate political expenditures
abstract: Requires shareholders to approve corporate political expenditures.

title: Requires certain training for all retailers, dealers and sellers of firearms in New York state
abstract: Requires training on how to identify illegal purchasers of firearms for all retailers, dealers and sellers of firearms in New York state; directs the state police to implement such program; makes related provisions.

title: Requires certain eligible persons or entities to acquire and possess opioid antagonists
abstract: Requires certain eligible persons or entities to acquire and possess opioid antagonists for emergency treatment of a person appearing to experience an opioid-related overdose.

title: Governs election of board by residents of cooperatives and condominiums
abstract: Requires that the board of directors or board of managers of a converted cooperative or condominium, as the case may be, must be comprised of a majority of members elected by shareholders or owners in occupancy so that control of the converted cooperative or condominium is turned over to the unit owners as soon as possible; applies only to plans of 20 or more units.

title: Relates to exempting certain statements relating to sexual abuse or misconduct from disclosure under FOIL
abstract: Exempts statements of victims and witnesses relating to sexual abuse or misconduct from disclosure under FOIL provisions.

title: Authorizes certain persons confined in institutions operated by the department of corrections and community supervision to apply for a sentence reduction
abstract: Authorizes certain persons confined in institutions operated by the department of corrections and community supervision to apply for a sentence reduction.

title: Relates to mutual companies in N.Y. city
abstract: Requires a Mitchell-Lama cooperative seeking to dissolve to offer cooperators who may not be able to afford the increased carrying charges the opportunity to sell.

title: Relates to communications by mercantile establishments attempting to settle civil actions deriving from larceny prosecutions
abstract: Requires certain notices in communications by mercantile establishments attempting to settle civil actions deriving from larceny prosecutions.

title: Provides for a residency program initiative to service medically underserved areas; appropriation
abstract: Directs the department of health to develop and implement a residency program initiative to service medically underserved areas; makes an appropriation therefor.

title: Provides that veterans who hold either a federal Golden Access Passport or federal Access Pass shall be granted use of public campsites, parks and other public places of recreation free of charge
abstract: Provides that veterans who hold either a federal Golden Access Passport or a federal Access Pass issued upon a determination of a permanent disability shall be granted use of public campsites, parks and other public places of recreation free of charge.

title: Extends the required publishing date for the first annual report regarding the impact of laws pertaining to discovery in criminal cases
abstract: Extends the required publishing date for the first annual report regarding the impact of laws pertaining to discovery in criminal cases to twenty-one months after the effective date of the section.

title: Relates to establishing a first permanent payroll employee tax credit
abstract: Establishes a first permanent payroll employee tax credit which allows a business to receive a tax credit for the three years following the employment of such business' first permanent payroll employee where such credit equals a portion of the amount it costs to employ such permanent payroll employee.

title: Relates to creating a tax abatement for geothermal well systems
abstract: Creates a tax abatement for geothermal well systems up to $62,500.

title: Adds ammunition to the list of prohibited items to purchase or dispose of after certain convictions
abstract: Relates to adding ammunition to the list of prohibited items to purchase or dispose of after certain convictions.

title: Includes offenses regarding school crossing guards to aggravated harassment in the second degree
abstract: Includes offenses against school crossing guards to aggravated harassment in the second degree.

title: Waives the fee for a commercial driver's license for a member of the military or a veteran
abstract: Waives the fee for a commercial driver's license for a member of the military or a veteran when they submit an application for military skills test waiver as part of his or her application.

title: Authorizes the county of Nassau to alienate and sell parklands to Lakeside Inn, Inc.
abstract: Authorizes the county of Nassau to alienate and sell parklands to Lakeside Inn, Inc.

title: Imposes a highway use fee on outdoor advertising; establishes a New York state urban reforestation fund and makes provisions supporting urban forestry
abstract: Imposes a highway use fee on outdoor advertising; establishes a New York state urban reforestation fund from fees imposed on outdoor advertising; makes provisions supporting urban forestry.

title: Expands health care plan contract coverage for any health care provider for one hundred twenty days after the termination of such contract
abstract: Expands health care plan contract coverage for any health care provider for one hundred twenty days after the termination of such contract.

title: Relating to requiring study abroad organizations to report crime and harm that occurs to participating students
abstract: Relates to requiring postsecondary institutions that participate in study abroad programs to report crime and harm that occurs to participating students.

title: Requires highway projects that receive state funding to include the installation of broadband conduits and provides for access to such conduits
abstract: Requires highway projects that receive state funding to include the installation of broadband conduits suitable for fiber optic cables or wireless facilities that support broadband services; provides for access to such conduits on a competitively neutral and nondiscriminatory basis, for a charge not to exceed a cost-based rate.

title: Relates to ovarian cancer research
abstract: Relates to ovarian cancer research; includes funding for ovarian cancer research and education programs.

title: Directs the Queens county board of elections to provide language assistance in Bengali, Punjabi and Hindi
abstract: Directs the Queens county board of elections to provide language assistance in Bengali, Punjabi and Hindi.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim May 6-12, 2023, as Nurses Week in the State of New York
Relates to certain benefits provided pursuant to collective bargaining agreements
abstract: Relates to certain benefits provided pursuant to collective bargaining agreements; provides that the temporary president of the senate and speaker of the assembly shall approve changes to health benefits for employees or retirees not subject to a collective bargaining agreement.

title: Prohibits a pharmacist from substituting any anti-epileptic drug for a prescribed anti-epileptic drug without the informed consent of the prescriber and patient
abstract: Prohibits a pharmacist from substituting any anti-epileptic drug for the prescribed anti-epileptic drug without notification of and the informed consent of the prescriber and patient or such patient's parent, guardian or spouse.

title: Allows persons participating in certain formal ceremonies to possess a firearm, rifle or shotgun
abstract: Allows persons participating in certain formal ceremonies to possess a firearm, rifle or shotgun, provided that such person has received prior approval from the municipality or other appropriate entity.

title: Increases the capacity needed to be considered a bottle club
abstract: Increases the capacity needed to be considered a bottle club from twenty persons to one hundred persons.

title: Relates to the election of school board members after the number of members has been increased
abstract: Provides that elections to fill an increased number of seats on a school board will be conducted at the first annual meeting after the meeting during which number of seats was increased.

title: Allows bars and restaurants to organize and manage sports squares pools
abstract: Allows bars and restaurants to organize and manage sports squares pools, provided that they do not take any profit from such pools.

title: Relates to the manufacturing of firearms
