abstract: Relates to detaining persons for longer than twenty-four hours.

title: Restricts election day duties of board of elections employees in the city of New York running for elected party positions
abstract: Relates to restricting election day duties of board of elections employees in the city of New York running for elected party positions; provides that no board of elections employee in the city of New York shall engage in any election day operations or management within any assembly district in which he or she is also a candidate for an elected party position.

title: Provides a reduction in insurance premium charges for insured volunteer firefighters and emergency personnel
abstract: Provides a reduction in insurance premium charges for insured volunteer firefighters and emergency personnel for a 3 year period after successfully completing the emergency vehicle operator's course as part of their training.

title: Relates to imposing an additional two percent sales tax on certain retail sales
abstract: Imposes an additional two percent sales tax on retail sales of motor vehicles over $70,000, excluding commercial vehicles and electric vehicles, jewelry over $5,000 and articles of clothing, footwear, handbags, luggage, umbrellas, wallets or watches sold for over $1,000; provides that such tax shall be distributed equally to the credit of the state university of New York and the city university of New York.

title: Relates to the disqualification of school bus drivers for certain offenses involving children
abstract: Relates to the disqualification of school bus drivers for certain offenses involving children.

title: Relates to requiring gender neutral bathrooms in state-owned buildings
abstract: Relates to requiring gender neutral bathrooms in state-owned buildings; requires at least one gender neutral multiple-occupancy bathroom in state-owned buildings and, where practicable, in state-leased buildings that do not have a gender neutral single-occupancy bathroom; defines terms.

title: Allows personal caregivers to visit residents of adult care facilities
abstract: Allows personal caregivers to visit residents of adult care facilities at any time, in compliance with federal and state laws and regulations.

title: Requires owners to provide prospective lessees with notification where lead-based paint or lead contaminated dust has been found in the rental unit
abstract: Requires owners to provide prospective lessees with notification where lead-based paint or lead contaminated dust has been found and any and all abatement measures that have been taken in the rental unit.

title: Requires hospitals to establish a violence prevention program and conduct an annual safety and security assessment
abstract: Requires hospitals to establish a violence prevention program and conduct an annual safety and security assessment for the purpose of protecting health care workers, patients, families and visitors.

title: Relates to service by citation
abstract: Provides that a copy of the petition, affidavits, affirmations and exhibits thereto upon which process was issued, shall be served with the citation or other process, except where service is by publication, and except in a proceeding for a voluntary accounting.

title: Creates the lupus research enhancement program and the lupus research enhancement fund
abstract: Creates the lupus research enhancement program; creates the lupus research enhancement fund.

title: Relates to the establishment of regional arts, cultural affairs, and parks accessibility and sustainability grants
abstract: Establishes regional arts, cultural affairs, and parks accessibility and sustainability grants for ten regions throughout the state.

title: Relates to prohibiting retail establishments from refusing to accept payment in cash
abstract: Relates to prohibiting retail establishments including food-service establishments from refusing to accept payment in cash; provides a civil penalty will be assessed for such actions.

title: Relates to autonomous vehicle driving
abstract: Provides that a person may operate a fully autonomous vehicle on the public roads of this state without a human driver provided that the automated driving system is engaged and the vehicle meets certain conditions; defines terms; requires insurance and that such vehicle is registered as a fully autonomous vehicle; makes related provisions.

title: Relates to observance of all religious holidays by institutions within the state university and the city university of New York, and includes the Asian Lunar New Year within the definition of such holidays
abstract: Relates to observance of all religious holidays by institutions within the state university and the city university of New York; includes the Asian Lunar New Year within the definition of such holidays.

title: Relates to removing the ten year time period from the crime of persistent sexual abuse
abstract: Relates to removing the ten year time period from the crime of persistent sexual abuse.

title: Relates to requiring orders of custody to state whether law enforcement is authorized to remove a child or children
abstract: Requires orders of custody to state whether law enforcement is authorized to remove a child or children in order to comply with and enforce such orders.

title: Relates to aggravated assault upon a police officer
abstract: Relates to aggravated assault upon a police officer or a peace officer.

title: Increases transparency in ticket reselling marketplaces
abstract: Increases transparency in ticket reselling marketplaces by requiring ticket resellers have accounts which show their name and a photo of them.

title: Relates to application and environmental assessment forms
abstract: Relates to application and environmental assessment forms and city and village planning commissions.

title: Establishes the employee privacy act prohibiting employers from using the federal electronic employment verification system to check the employment authorization status of an existing employee or an applicant
abstract: Prohibits employers from using the federal electronic employment verification system to check the employment authorization status of an existing employee or an applicant who has not been offered employment and prohibits municipalities from requiring employers to use the federal electronic employment verification system.

title: Directs the department of taxation and finance to create and implement an online program which will enable New York state taxpayers to electronically file income tax returns free of charge
abstract: Directs the department of taxation and finance to create and implement an online program which will enable each New York state taxpayer to prepare and electronically file his or her federal and state income tax returns free of charge.

title: Relates to the appointment of impartial hearing officers to hear appeals of determinations regarding children with handicapping conditions
abstract: Prohibits the appointment of certain state, municipal or agency employees as impartial hearing officers to hear appeals of determinations regarding children with handicapping conditions.

title: Relates to hunting and hunting licenses; repealer
abstract: Relates to hunting and hunting licenses.

title: Establishes an indirect source review for certain warehouse operations
abstract: Establishes an indirect source review for certain warehouse operations; requires the department of environmental conservation to conduct a study regarding zero emissions zones.

title: Requires broadband providers to offer high speed broadband service to certain low-income consumers
abstract: Requires broadband providers to offer high speed broadband service to certain low-income consumers at a cost of not more than five dollars per month.

title: Relates to the New York healthy vending act
abstract: Relates to the New York healthy vending act requiring a percentage of food in vending machines on state property to be healthy.

title: Relates to redefining science, technology, engineering and math education (STEM)
abstract: Relates to redefining science, technology, engineering and math education (STEM).

title: Allows the New York state AFL-CIO to select a member to the metropolitan transportation authority
abstract: Allows the New York state AFL-CIO to select one of the five voting members to the metropolitan transportation authority.

title: Requires retailers to post warning signs of the tracking of customers through cell phones or other electronic devices
abstract: Requires retailers to post warning signs of the tracking of customers through cell phones or other electronic devices; provides for civil penalties.

title: Restricts the formation of new development agencies in Erie county
abstract: Restricts the formation of new development agencies in Erie County; limits the authority of town industrial development agencies located within Erie County to exempt certain taxes.

title: Relates to additional requirements for licensing of drivers and motorcyclists
abstract: Requires proof of at least six hours of driving experience under a certified instructor prior to issuance of licenses for certain drivers and motorcyclists.

title: Relates to COVID-19 exposure during a state of emergency by volunteer firefighters and volunteer ambulance workers
abstract: Provides that if, as a result of services performed in line of duty during a state of emergency, a volunteer firefighter or volunteer ambulance worker is exposed to or comes in contact with COVID-19, the chief engineer or other executive officer of the fire department or fire company or the captain or other executive officer of the ambulance department, volunteer ambulance company or ambulance district of which he or she is a member may authorize such volunteer firefighter or volunteer ambulance worker to obtain such examinations, tests, treatment and care as are immediately necessary to determine whether he or she is injured; further grants a presumption that exposure to COVID-19 caused partial or total disability or death.

title: Establishes instruction in financial literacy for students in sixth through eighth grade
abstract: Establishes instruction in financial literacy for students in sixth through eighth grade; requires such instruction to include content on budgeting, savings, credit, debt, insurance, investment, and other issues associated with personal financial responsibility as determined by the education department.

title: Relates to establishing an electronic military ballot application and military ballot transmittal system
abstract: Establishes an electronic military ballot application and military ballot transmittal system through which applicants may apply for a military ballot and return a marked military ballot, online.

title: Relates to the imposition of sales and compensating use taxes with respect to certain aircraft; and repeals certain provisions of the tax law relating thereto
abstract: Relates to the imposition of sales and compensating use taxes with respect to certain aircraft; repeals provisions relating to the exemption from sales and compensating use taxes of general aviation aircraft, and machinery or equipment to be installed on such aircraft.

title: Authorizes school districts to enter into a lease outside of such school district
abstract: Authorizes school districts to enter into a lease outside of such school district when it is demonstrated to the satisfaction of the commissioner of education that extenuating circumstances exist which necessitate a lease outside of the school district.

title: Provides for a personal income tax deduction for student loan payments
abstract: Provides for a personal income tax deduction for student loan payments.

title: Relates to an assembly standing committee on ethics and guidance
abstract: Relates to an assembly standing committee on ethics and guidance.

title: Requires 10% of the penalties imposed by the superintendent of financial services to be deposited in the community development financial institution fund
abstract: Requires 10% of the penalties imposed by the superintendent of financial services to be deposited in the community development financial institution fund.

title: Includes offenses involving the possession, display or discharge of certain firearms as qualifying offenses for the purpose of allowing a principal to be eligible to be held on bail
abstract: Includes offenses involving the possession, display or discharge of a firearm, rifle, shotgun, machine-gun, or disguised gun as qualifying offenses for the purpose of allowing a principal to be eligible to be held on bail.

title: Relates to first responders coming into contact with saliva by spitting, throwing, tossing, or expelling from or by an individual
abstract: Relates to first responders coming into contact with saliva by spitting, throwing, tossing, or expelling from or by an individual or incarcerated individual.

title: Relates to the trustees of the Freeholders and the Commonalty of the town of Southampton, county of Suffolk
abstract: Relates to the trustees of the Freeholders and the Commonalty of the town of Southampton, county of Suffolk; provides that the trustees of the Freeholders and Commonalty of the town of Southampton have and shall continue to have the authority to enforce the public's easement and access upon the ocean beaches within the town of Southampton, including all rights of the public with respect to the said ocean beaches which were conferred upon them by the Dongan Patent of 1686; defines "ocean beaches".

title: Establishes a novel virus essential workers scholarship program
abstract: Establishes a novel virus essential workers scholarship program to award annual scholarships to essential employees who worked during the outbreak of novel coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) or during the outbreak of another novel virus and children of essential employees who have died as a result of contracting COVID-19 or another novel virus.

title: Relates to the payment of moneys due for prior years and the apportionment of moneys to school districts
abstract: Provides that state aid payments due for prior years shall be paid either from funds available in the general support for public school appropriation as a result of the deduction of excess payments of aid; or within the limit of the appropriation designated therefor.

title: Requires instruction on vaccine science in every middle school and every high school
abstract: Requires every middle school and every high school to provide instruction on vaccine science, including vaccine history and development, effects on the immune system, vaccine-preventable diseases and their spread, and vaccine safety and testing.

title: Requires human service providers that contract with the state to pay their employees a certain minimum wage
abstract: Requires that all human services contracts between any public entity and a human services provider stipulate that the public entity will pay no less than 150% of the higher of: the otherwise applicable minimum wage in the state or any otherwise applicable wage rule or order and that the necessary amounts have been appropriated to ensure payment of such minimum wage.

title: Requires disclosure in human rights claims of government funding by the respondent
abstract: Requires disclosure in human rights claims of government funding by the respondent; requires disclosure to government agencies of settlements notwithstanding nondisclosure agreements.

title: Establishes a tax credit for the purchase and installation of a security camera system on residential- and commercial-owned properties
abstract: Establishes a tax credit for the purchase and installation of a security camera system on residential- and commercial-owned properties.

title: Establishes the office of the independent intellectual and developmental disability ombudsman program
abstract: Establishes the office of the independent intellectual and developmental disability ombudsman program for the purpose of assisting individuals with intellectual or developmental disabilities to ensure that they receive coverage from managed care organizations that is appropriate in meeting their individual service needs; uses a request for proposal process to determine who shall be responsible for such program.

title: Requires the appointment of an assistant district attorney in each county to oversee the prosecution of animal crimes
abstract: Requires that the district attorney in each county appoint at least one assistant district attorney to be responsible for overseeing the prosecution of animal crimes.

title: Relates to the criminal facilitation of crimes involving firearms
abstract: Relates to the criminal facilitation of crimes involving firearms.

title: Requires the department of motor vehicles to approve certain out-of-state accident prevention courses
abstract: Requires the DMV to promulgate rules and regulations to approve certain out-of-state or national accident prevention courses.

title: Relates to creating the hospital and multiple dwelling energy loan fund
abstract: Relates to creating the hospital and multiple dwelling energy loan program.

title: Grants animal control officers in the town of Southampton in Suffolk county peace officer status
abstract: Grants animal control officers in the town of Southampton in Suffolk county peace officer status.

title: Relates to fees charged by municipal industrial development agencies
abstract: Requires fees charged by municipal industrial development agencies be the same as those charged by the county's industrial development agency.

title: Provides that trained personnel of the Physical Security Organization of a nuclear facility be given peace officer status
abstract: Provides that trained personnel of the Physical Security Organization of a nuclear facility be given peace officer status but shall not carry or possess a firearm.

title: Provides for thoroughbred equine drug testing standards
abstract: Relates to thoroughbred equine drug testing standards.

title: Allows prescriptions for controlled substances to be issued for greater than a thirty-day supply during a state of emergency
abstract: Relates to allowing prescriptions for controlled substances that are normally restricted to a thirty-day supply to be issued for greater than a thirty-day supply during a state of emergency.

title: Establishes a public awareness campaign for maternal depression; appropriation
abstract: Establishes a public awareness campaign for maternal depression; makes an appropriation therefor.

title: Relates to establishing a peer support program for veterans
abstract: Establishes a peer support program for veterans.

title: Provides eligibility of certain Afghan and Iraqi immigrants for education benefits
abstract: Provides eligibility for Afghan and Iraqi special immigrants for education benefits which shall include an Afghan or Iraqi citizen or national with the status of a special immigrant under the Immigration and Nationality Act.

title: Requires public institutions and buildings to be equipped with opioid antagonists
abstract: Requires public institutions and buildings to be equipped with opioid antagonists; directs the commissioner of general services to promulgate regulations to address the appropriate number of opioid antagonists for such buildings based on the size or occupancy of the buildings, the training of personnel and use of opioid antagonists, and any other matter deemed necessary.

title: Relates to violations and a mandatory surcharge for parking in a bicycle lane
abstract: Relates to violations and a mandatory surcharge for parking in a bicycle lane which shall be paid to the clerk of the court of administrative tribunal that made the determination of liability.

title: Relates to the definition of coal tar and its use in pavement products
abstract: Relates to the definition of coal tar and its use in pavement products.

title: Requires the division of criminal justice services and the chief administrator of the courts to track the number of permanent orders of protection issued annually
abstract: Requires the division of criminal justice services and the chief administrator of the courts to track the number of permanent orders of protection issued and violated annually.

title: Authorizes cities and villages to collect delinquent real property taxes
abstract: Authorizes cities and villages to collect delinquent real property taxes.

title: Requires health insurance policies to offer full coverage for annual testing for ovarian cancer and requires certain health care providers offer annual testing for ovarian cancer
abstract: Requires health insurance policies to offer full coverage for annual testing for ovarian cancer; requires certain health care providers offer annual testing for ovarian cancer.

title: Requires student suicide prevention training and policies in public school districts
abstract: Requires the commissioner of education to adopt rules to require that all public school personnel receive at least two hours of suicide awareness and prevention training each year and each public school district to adopt a policy on student suicide prevention.

title: Prohibits the preferred drug program, managed care programs and insurers from restricting or imposing delays in the distribution of antiretroviral prescription drugs prescribed to a person for HIV or AIDS
abstract: Prohibits the preferred drug program, managed care programs and insurers from restricting or imposing delays in the distribution of antiretroviral prescription drugs prescribed to a person for the treatment or prevention of the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) or acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS).

title: Relates to establishing an office of antibiotic resistance control and to establishing the antibiotics education fund
abstract: Relates to establishing an office of antibiotic-resistance control; establishes the antibiotics education fund; includes methicillin-resistant staphylococcus aureus (MRSA) and other antibiotic-resistant infections in the definition of airborne infectious disease.

title: Establishes the school district cyber crime prevention services program
abstract: Establishes the school district cyber crime prevention services program to provide school districts with information on strategies, best practices and programs offering training and assistance in the prevention of cyber crimes in school districts or otherwise affecting school districts; provides that information on eligibility and applications for financial assistance be made available to school districts; authorizes the New York state urban development corporation to provide loans, loan guarantees, interest subsidies and grants to school districts for the purpose of preventing cyber crimes against school districts.

title: Relates to the overpayment of insurance claims
abstract: Prevents health plans from engaging in overpayment recovery efforts that include contacting the patient to seek reimbursement for such overpayment of claims.

title: Authorizes a veteran's close friend or family member who is reasonably familiar with such veteran's wishes to request that such veteran be buried in a state veterans' cemetery
abstract: Authorizes a veteran's close friend or family who is reasonably familiar with such veteran's wishes to request that such veteran be buried in a state veterans' cemetery.

title: Establishes an Alzheimer's disease outreach and education program
abstract: Establishes an Alzheimer's disease outreach and education program for medical and non-medical professionals to promote earlier identification of Alzheimer's and to provide information and other assistance in finding community support for caregivers.

title: Relates to owner liability for failure of operator to move over when approaching a police, fire, or emergency vehicle
abstract: Relates to owner liability for failure of operator to move over when approaching a police, fire, or emergency vehicle.

title: Prohibits the packaging, sale and distribution of confectionery and candy designed to resemble a tobacco product
abstract: Prohibits the packaging, sale and distribution of confectionery and candy designed to resemble a tobacco product.

title: Increases the penalty for multiple convictions of torturing or failing to provide sustenance to an animal
abstract: Increases the penalty for multiple convictions of torturing, killing or failing to provide sustenance to an animal to a felony, if convicted within five years from the date of a prior conviction.

title: Relates to distribution of a decedent's estate
abstract: Prohibits a distributive share from passing to a person convicted of committing or attempting to commit a sex offense.

title: Relates to owner's policy of liability insurance
abstract: Relates to an owner's policy of liability insurance; increases the limits for liability arising out of bodily injury to or death of any person.

title: Amends the definitions of pet dealers
abstract: Amends the definitions of pet dealers; decreases the number of animals a person can distribute to fit under the exemption.

title: Requires all public secondary schools to provide the annual administration of the SAT during a school day
abstract: Requires all public secondary schools to provide the annual administration of the SAT during a school day.

title: Authorizes municipal legislative bodies to enact local laws and ordinances providing for mediation of land use decisions
abstract: Authorizes certain municipal legislative bodies, including towns and villages, to enact local laws and ordinances providing for non-binding mediation of land use decisions.

title: Relates to use of accrued sick time, compensation time or vacation time
abstract: Relates to use of accrued sick time, compensation time or vacation time.

title: Creates the rural suicide prevention council
abstract: Creates the twelve member rural suicide prevention council to examine the causes of rural suicides or attempts and to make recommendations for rural suicide reduction.

title: Prohibits exemptions for owners of vacant or unoccupied storefront properties
abstract: Relates to prohibiting exemptions for owners of vacant or unoccupied storefront properties.

title: Safeguards cash accounts for people with developmental disabilities in a facility
abstract: Safeguards cash accounts for people with developmental disabilities in a facility under the control of the commissioner of mental health, the commissioner of the office for people with developmental disabilities and the commissioner of alcoholism and substance abuse services.

title: Relates to obligations with respect to contracts with business enterprises which employ individuals with disabilities
abstract: Relates to obligations with respect to contracts with business enterprises which employ individuals with disabilities; defines qualified business enterprise as any business concern which employs a workforce consisting of at least fifteen percent employees with disabilities and has been certified under this section; sets goal of five percent of state contracts going to qualified business enterprises; establishes an office of statewide advocate, certification process, and enforcement mechanism.

title: Requires instruction on civic education for grades 5 through 12
abstract: Requires instruction in civic education for grades 5 through 12 including instruction on the NYS constitution; federal, state and local government; civic literacy; methods of public participation; and the rights and responsibilities of citizenship.

title: Relates to construction of voting machines and systems
abstract: Relates to construction of voting machines and systems.

title: Designates September 11th as a public holiday
abstract: Designates September 11th as a public holiday to be known as September 11th Memorial and Remembrance Day.

title: Relates to prohibiting certain conditions or preconditions of employment
abstract: Prohibits employers from requiring certain conditions or preconditions of employment.

title: Requires every assessing unit to conduct a revaluation of assessment at least every eight years
abstract: Requires every assessing unit to conduct a revaluation of assessment at least every eight years.

title: Relates to establishing a cancer treatment credit
abstract: Relates to establishing a cancer treatment credit.

title: Relates to the liability of an employee committing an unlawful discriminatory practice
abstract: Relates to the liability of an employee committing an unlawful discriminatory practice; creates joint and several liability for employers and employees responsible for unlawful discriminatory practices.

title: Requires assisted living facilities to notify residents of changes to medical and support services 180 days prior to such changes taking effect
abstract: Requires assisted living facilities to notify residents of changes to medical and support services 180 days prior to such changes taking effect.

title: Relates to the education and experience of members of the state board of parole
abstract: Relates to the education and experience of members of the state board of parole; provides that members can have either a degree and at least five years of experience in several fields or at least ten years of experience in such fields.

title: Relates to establishing the downstate New York power authority, and providing for its powers and duties
abstract: Establishes the downstate New York power authority to own and operate electricity service and acquire the distribution facilities formerly owned by any downstate utility corporation.

title: Relates to the creation of a prom and graduation safety program
abstract: Relates to the creation of a prom and graduation safety program; develops educational materials.

title: Requires instruction in anti-gun violence in all schools
abstract: Requires instruction in anti-gun violence in all schools.

title: Establishes the residential open green space tax abatement for certain properties in N.Y. city
abstract: Establishes the residential open green space tax abatement for certain properties in a city of one million or more; provides an abatement for owners who remove an impermeable surface from a residential yard and replace it with soil and vegetation.

title: Restricts sales tax exemptions on fur-bearing articles of clothing or footwear
abstract: Restricts sales tax exemptions on fur-bearing articles of clothing or footwear.

title: Relates to the disclosure and consideration of gender wage disparity in the awarding of state contracts
abstract: Relates to the disclosure and consideration of gender wage disparity in the awarding of state contracts; requires all offerors to provide the percentage of gender wage disparity by job title for all state contracts; requires agencies to compile data received on gender wage disparity and provide data to the office of general services for publication on its website; requires agencies to provide extra credit or weight to offerors with a gender wage disparity of ten percent or less.

title: Relates to professional misconduct of medical professionals
abstract: Relates to professional misconduct of medical professionals involving felonies committed in the course of the licensee's medical practice; provides for license revocation.

title: Establishes a division of the public administrator within the office of the corporation counsel for the city of New York; repealer
abstract: Establishes a division of the public administrator within the office of the corporation counsel for the city of New York.

title: Relates to the care and collection of animals on vacant property
abstract: Relates to the care and collection of abandoned animals on vacant property; requires notification to the appropriate authorities by anyone authorized to be on vacant land where such person finds an animal which based on its physical appearance or lack of available food or water appears abandoned, within six hours of an encounter.

title: Relates to adding veterans to protected classes for unlawful housing discrimination
abstract: Adds veterans to protected classes for unlawful housing discrimination regardless of discharge status.

title: Requires an official inspection station to post a sign or poster informing customers that it is not authorized to inspect certain vehicles
abstract: Requires an official inspection station to post a sign or poster informing customers that it is not authorized to inspect an altered motor vehicle unless the registrant presents a state DOT exemption letter, otherwise such vehicle shall report to the Department of Transportation.

title: Prohibits agencies from charging a fee for records where an electronic copy is already available from a previous request made within the past six months
abstract: Prohibits agencies from charging a fee for records where an electronic copy is already available from a previous request made within the past six months except for the actual cost of a storage device or media if provided to the requester.

title: Relates to the percentage responsibility of the state for federally assisted projects
abstract: Relates to the percentage responsibility of the state for federally assisted projects; relates to the state share of municipal projects where the municipality funds a complete street design.

title: Requires the commissioner of general services to maintain a list of all state boards and requiring each state board to maintain a publicly accessible website
abstract: Requires the commissioner of general services to maintain a list of all state boards; requires each state board to maintain a publicly accessible website; requires each website associated with a state board to include certain information about such state board; changes the effectiveness of chapter 219 to November 1, 2013.

title: Relates to requiring a plan for the delivery of medical supplies and medications to pharmacies, hospitals and nursing homes in affected areas during a state disaster emergency
abstract: Clarifies that a plan for the delivery of medical supplies and medications to pharmacies, hospitals and nursing homes in affected areas during a state disaster emergency is required.

title: Eliminates annual service charge of 25 dollars on issuance of special number plates to veterans of the armed forces
abstract: Eliminates the annual service charge on issuance of special number plates to veterans of the armed forces.

title: Prohibits the sale or delivery of candy products containing THC in the state
abstract: Prohibits the sale or delivery, or agreement of sale or delivery, or giving away of candy products containing THC in the state.

title: Direct the department of civil service to conduct a study on competitive examinations for public employment to determine whether the contents of such examinations have a discriminatory effect on minority examinee
abstract: Directs the department of civil service to conduct a study on competitive examinations for public employment held by the state department of civil service and by municipal commissions to determine whether the contents of such examinations have a discriminatory effect on minority examinees; requires a report on such findings to be delivered to the governor and legislature.

title: Allows taxpayers to contribute to the tuition assistance program on personal income tax forms
abstract: Allows taxpayers to contribute to the tuition assistance program fund on personal income tax forms; establishes the gifts to the tuition assistance program fund.

title: Relates to the authenticity, attribution and authorship of fine works of art
abstract: Relates to the authenticity, attribution and authorship of fine works of art; defines the term authenticator and stipulates that in a civil action regarding authenticity, the claimant must specify with particularity the facts and prove the elements by clear and convincing evidence; entitles the authenticator to recover reasonable attorneys' fees and expenses if he/she prevails.

title: Creates the crime of related use of a lethal or explosive device
abstract: Creates the crime of related use of a lethal or explosive device; provides for additional 10 years imprisonment for certain crimes where a lethal or explosive device is used; permits exemption from such additional sentence when the defendant provides court with the source of such lethal or explosive device.

title: Relates to the unlawful dissemination or publication of files or instructions for the digital manufacture of a firearm or components
abstract: Provides that it shall be unlawful to disseminate or publish files or instructions for the digital manufacture of a firearm or components.

title: Prohibits the formation of a subsidiary of a public authority without prior approval of the legislature
abstract: Prohibits the formation of a subsidiary of a public authority without prior approval of the legislature; allows the formation of a subsidiary of a public authority without prior approval of the legislature if such public authority files a written notice sixty days prior to the organization of such subsidiary with the governor and the legislature.

title: Requires financial security for reclamation for solar and wind electric generating systems
abstract: Requires financial security for reclamation for solar and wind electric generating systems.

title: Provides for the installment payment for the earned income credit
abstract: Provides for installment payment for the earned income credit.

title: Requires the establishment of a one hundred percent clean energy system by two thousand thirty-two
abstract: Requires the establishment of a one hundred percent clean energy system by 2032; requires the adoption of a climate action plan; establishes the renewable energy revolving fund; provides for legal standing to sue for enforcement of the state clean energy plan.

title: Authorizes the awarding of punitive damages to persons aggrieved by sexual harassment
abstract: Authorizes the awarding of punitive damages to persons aggrieved by sexual harassment.

title: Directs the department of environmental conservation to undertake a review of the regulations governing the permitting of landfills and transfer stations
abstract: Directs the department of environmental conservation to undertake a review of the regulations governing the permitting of landfills and transfer stations to ensure that such regulations integrate the latest scientific information.

title: Enacts the New York city Caribbean steel pan educational music program act
abstract: Enacts the "New York city Caribbean steel pan educational music program act"; requires community school boards in the city of New York to authorize the use of school grounds in the summer months for use by any steel pan music organization to practice for the Labor Day Parade (West Indian Carnival); establishes a steel pan music curriculum or instruction for community school districts.

title: Increases the fines imposed on a corporation for an offense defined within the penal law
abstract: Increases the fines imposed on a corporation for an offense defined within the penal law.

title: Commemorating the 75th Anniversary of Junius Volunteer Fire Department Inc.
Prohibits the mailing of credit card applications to persons under twenty-one years of age
abstract: Prohibits the mailing of credit card applications to persons under twenty-one years of age except when requested; provides for a penalty of no more than one thousand dollars per violation.

title: Relates to removing mandatory retirement age for certain judges and justices
abstract: Removes mandatory requirement age for certain judges and justices not otherwise required to retire by the state constitution.

title: Prohibits the sale of any vapor or tobacco products containing the substance ethyl menthane carboxamide
abstract: Prohibits the sale of any vapor or tobacco products containing the substance N-Ethyl-p-menthane-3-carboxamide, which creates a cooling sensation similar to menthol.

title: Relates to pharmacists administering medications approved by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration
abstract: Relates to pharmacists administering medications approved by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration.

title: Relates to the availability of training for state approved education or training programs required for certification of home health aides, personal care aides, and certified nurse aides
abstract: Requires state approved education or training programs required for certification or recertification of home health aides, personal care aides, and certified nurse aides to include training in working with patients of diverse sexual orientations and gender identities or expressions within twelve months; eliminates the requirement of such training for personal care staff.

title: Directs the department of agriculture and markets, in cooperation with NYSERDA, to produce and distribute guidance and educational materials for farmers on the use of agrivoltaics in farming
abstract: Directs the department of agriculture and markets, in cooperation with NYSERDA, to produce and distribute guidance and educational materials for farmers on the use of agrivoltaics in farming no later than one year after chapter 629 of the laws of 2022 takes effect.

title: Relates to the establishment and priorities of the New York state council on hunger and food policy
abstract: Clarifies the provisions relating to the establishment and priorities of the New York state council on hunger and food policy.

title: Authorizes certain health care professionals licensed to practice in other jurisdictions to practice in this state in connection with Double H Ranch
abstract: Authorizes certain health care professionals licensed to practice in other jurisdictions to practice in this state in connection with Double H Ranch.

title: Relates to the oversight of certain contracts by the comptroller
abstract: Relates to the oversight of certain contracts by the comptroller; provides for the oversight of contracts by the comptroller based upon the dollar amounts of such contracts.

title: Requires information about fentanyl test strips and their uses on information cards or sheets
abstract: Provides that when informational cards or sheets about opioid antagonists are distributed, such information shall include information about fentanyl strips and their uses.

title: Relates to awarding a contract for the purchase of rock salt or sodium chloride
abstract: Directs that when soliciting a contract for the purchase of rock salt or sodium chloride, any department or agency of the state, any department or agency of a political subdivision, any public authority, or the commissioner of transportation, may award such contract to the responsible and reliable bidder offering to supply rock salt or sodium chloride that is mined or hand harvested in the United States, and which offer is within ten percent of the lowest price or best value offer, rather than to the lowest responsible and reliable bidder.

title: Requires candidates for office to caption their video advertisements
abstract: Requires that all candidates for elected local, state or federal office shall be required to caption any video advertisement which is viewed by the general public.

title: Recognizing May 30, 2023, as the 10th Mountain Division and Fort Drum Day in the State of New York
Relates to increasing the penalties for passing a stopped school bus
abstract: Requires suspension of a driver's license for a period of 60 days when a driver is convicted of passing a stopped school bus twice in 18 months.

title: Authorizes city board councils, city-wide councils, community councils and school based management teams to conduct meetings via videoconferencing
abstract: Authorizes city board councils, city-wide councils, community councils and school based management teams to conduct meetings via videoconferencing.

title: Authorizes the Carmel Central School District to offer a separate referendum on the question of term limits for members of the Carmel Central School District board of education
abstract: Authorizes the Carmel Central School District to offer a separate referendum on the question of term limits for members of the Carmel Central School District board of education.

title: Authorizes an increase in the maximum speed limit for travel on certain roadways
abstract: Authorizes an increase in the maximum speed limit to 70 mph for travel on roadways that currently have a maximum speed limit of 65 mph.

title: Requires certain housing production information to be reported to the department of state
abstract: Requires local boards and the division of housing and community renewal to submit certain residential housing and zoning information to the department of state annually; requires such information to be published by the department of state on its website.

title: Prohibits the use of corporal punishment in schools
abstract: Prohibits the use of corporal punishment in schools; defines corporal punishment to include prohibiting the use of aversive interventions and time out rooms.

title: Exempts hot tubs or spas with safety covers from certain standards of the New York state uniform fire prevention and building code
abstract: Exempts hot tubs or spas with safety covers from certain standards of the New York state uniform fire prevention and building code.

title: Establishes a sales tax exemption for energy storage
abstract: Establishes sales tax exemptions for residential and commercial energy storage systems equipment.

title: Relates to access to mental health care services for emergency dispatchers
abstract: Provides that a collective bargaining agreement or employment contract shall not require that an emergency dispatcher employed by a municipality obtain approval from, or provide notice to, a supervisor to access mental or behavioral health care services.

title: Enacts the "Lead-Free Homes Act"
abstract: Enacts the "Lead Free Homes Act"; requires the department of health to promulgate standards for lead remediation and abatement of exemption; provides tax credits to class A multiple dwelling owners who undertake a successful lead remediation or abatement; requires lead testing on drinking water prior to the sale of residential property; requires owners of class A multiple dwellings to perform lead testing and provides for fines for violations.

title: Allows evidence of a defendant's prior sexual assault to be admissible in a sexual assault proceeding
abstract: Allows in a criminal proceeding in which a defendant is accused of a sexual assault admitting of evidence that the defendant committed other sexual assaults.

title: Directs the metropolitan transportation authority to identify flammable or hazardous materials near above-ground and grade level tracks
abstract: Directs the metropolitan transportation authority, in conjunction with the Long Island Rail Road, to identify flammable or hazardous materials near above-ground and grade level tracks and make recommendations for removal of such materials.

title: Relates to prohibiting financial institutions from charging a fee for periodic paper statements
abstract: Relates to prohibiting financial institutions from charging a fee for periodic paper statements when such statements are required for an application for public assistance.

title: Relates to designating the first Friday in February as the New York statewide school day to help people in need
abstract: Relates to designating the first Friday in February as the "New York statewide school day to help people in need".

title: Establishes the housing for an equitable reentry and opportunity (HERO) act
abstract: Establishes the housing for an equitable reentry and opportunity (HERO) act to prohibit housing discrimination on the basis of criminal legal system involvement; defines criminal legal system involvement.

title: Relates to prevailing wage requirements applicable to public works and certain construction projects performed under private contract
abstract: Relates to prevailing wage requirements applicable to public works and certain construction projects performed under private contract and paid for with public funds.

title: Requires social services districts to automatically re-enroll eligible persons or households for the low-income home energy assistance program
abstract: Requires social services districts to, every heating season, automatically re-enroll persons or households currently receiving assistance through the low-income home energy assistance program, so long as each person or household maintains eligibility.

title: Relates to adding spina bifida to the definition of developmental disability
abstract: Relates to adding spina bifida to the definition of developmental disability in the mental hygiene law.

title: Relates to eligibility for certain New York city transit authority members changing to transit operating positions from other positions to participate in the twenty-five-year and age fifty-five retirement program
abstract: Provides eligibility for certain New York city transit authority members changing to transit operating positions from other positions to participate in the twenty-five-year and age fifty-five retirement program.

title: Mourning the death of Robert Crocker Howe, distinguished citizen and devoted member of his community
Provides that the sale of real property owned by the N.Y. city housing authority to a private entity must be approved by the state legislature
abstract: Provides that the sale of real property owned by the NYC housing authority to a private entity must be approved by the state legislature.

title: Recognizing February 23, 2023, as Student Press Freedom Day
Provides for the performance of medical services by physician assistants
abstract: Permits the performance of medical services by a physician assistant without the supervision of a physician as appropriate to the physician assistant's scope of practice, education and training where such physician assistant has practiced for more than three thousand six hundred hours.

title: Authorizes school districts to establish an insurance reserve fund
abstract: Authorizes school districts to establish an insurance reserve fund in an amount and manner determined by a qualified and independent actuary certified by the American Academy of Actuaries to be reasonable and necessary.

title: Includes land used for processing or retail merchandising of agricultural products within the real property tax exemption for land used in agricultural production
abstract: Includes land used for processing or retail merchandising of agricultural products within the real property tax exemption for land used in agricultural production.

title: Relates to the disposition of scholarships declined by a student or revoked; provides for the granting of such scholarship to the next most qualified student
abstract: Provides that a scholarship for academic excellence that is declined by a student or is revoked for any reason shall be granted to the next most qualified student.

title: Relates to tax check-off boxes on personal income tax return forms; repealer
abstract: Relates to tax check-off boxes on personal income tax return forms.

title: Enacts the Justice for Rachael Act
abstract: Enacts the Justice for Rachael Act; creates dangerousness hearings.

title: Prohibits the use of DNA phenotyping in criminal prosecutions and proceedings
abstract: Prohibits the use of DNA phenotyping in criminal prosecutions and proceedings.

title: Implements a healthy food initiative for beneficiaries of the supplemental nutrition assistance program
abstract: Requires the department of social services to apply for a waiver or request authorization to create a list of healthy and nutritious foods and beverages that may be purchased with supplemental nutrition assistance program (SNAP) benefits.

title: Relates to exempting cranes from the petroleum business tax
abstract: Relates to exempting cranes from the petroleum business tax.

title: Relates to rights and obligations of a municipality electing integrated non-participating owner status in gas and oil wells
abstract: Relates to rights and obligations of a municipality electing integrated non-participating owner status in gas and oil wells; provides that such municipal owner shall not have obligations for taxes, charges, fees or liability for personal injury or damages.

title: Creates the district long-term care ombudsman council program
abstract: Creates the district long-term care ombudsman council program to coordinate volunteer ombudsmen in each assembly district.

title: Relates to the regulation of smoking and vaping on the grounds and other outdoor areas of public colleges and universities
abstract: Relates to the regulation of smoking and vaping on the grounds and other outdoor areas of public colleges and universities.

title: Establishes a pilot program for the prevention of and treatment for traumatic stress on volunteer first responders
abstract: Establishes a pilot program which shall provide support services to volunteer certified first responders suffering from the effects of traumatic stress related to the performance of their duties.

title: Relates to school safety measures
abstract: Establishes the New York state school resource officer program; provides for grants for school resource officers (Part A); relates to peace officers who are retired police officers employed by a school district as a school resource officer (Part B); allows retired police officers to be employed by a school district as a school safety officer, school security officer or any other substantially similar position for an annual salary of $50,000 or less to continue to receive their full retirement benefit (Part C).

title: Relates to promotions of detectives
abstract: Relates to promotions of detectives; grants detectives of the third grade and detectives of the second grade the same rights in respect to the police pension fund as detectives of a grade higher after a certain period of time.

title: Relates to granting employees access to personnel records
abstract: Grants employees access to personnel records; requires notice of negative information in such records and an opportunity for a review; permits employee to include certain information in personnel records.

title: Prohibits the knowing and reckless promotion of unlawful or false material and providing remedies for the violation of such prohibition
abstract: Prohibits the knowing and reckless promotion of unlawful or false material; provides remedies for the violation of such prohibition.

title: Relates to services for post-traumatic stress disorder for emergency dispatchers and correction officers
abstract: Requires the same benefits and services for post-traumatic stress disorder for emergency dispatchers and correction officers as are afforded police and firefighters.

title: Relates to extreme risk protection orders
abstract: Relates to who can be a petitioner for an extreme risk protection order.

title: Restores the legislative checks and balances to any emergency declaration that exceeds 45 days and ensures judicial due process rights for any action that impairs fundamental constitutional rights
abstract: Restores the legislative checks and balances to any emergency declaration that exceeds forty-five days; ensures judicial due process rights for any action that impairs fundamental constitutional rights by limiting the powers of the governor to suspend laws during a state disaster emergency; requires a specification and explanation of which municipalities are effected by such suspension of laws.

title: Disallows an application for a charter school to be approved if a state monitor or fiscal monitor is not operating in such school district
abstract: Disallows an application for a charter school to be approved if a state monitor or fiscal monitor is not operating in such school district.

title: Creates the state office of the utility consumer advocate
abstract: Creates the state office of the utility consumer advocate to represent interests of residential utility customers.

title: Establishes the "Safe Staffing for Hospital Care Act"
abstract: Establishes the "Safe Staffing for Hospital Care Act"; establishes minimum staffing levels for various health care workers in different health care facilities; requires submission of staffing plans; prohibits most mandatory overtime.

title: Provides that the issue of military deployment shall not be considered as a factor in the awarding of custody in marital actions where a suitable child care plan is presented
abstract: Provides that the issue of military deployment shall not be considered as a factor in the awarding of custody in marital actions where a suitable child care plan is presented.

title: Authorizes NYC to impose a fee on motor vehicles from states which do not cooperate with the enforcement of certain traffic laws
abstract: Authorizes the imposition of a fifty dollar fee on vehicles entering NYC which are registered in states which do not cooperate with New York in the enforcement of traffic infractions through the use of photo-monitoring devices or signal monitoring systems.

title: Relates to comptroller oversight of tribal-state compacts prior to federal approval
abstract: Directs the comptroller to review and provide a recommendation of approval or modifications, for submission for federal approval of any tribal-state compact approved or executed between the state of New York, the governor, or his or her designee and an Indian nation or tribe.

title: Requires places of public assembly to maintain epinephrine auto-injector devices and to have at least one employee who is trained in its use
abstract: Requires that functional epinephrine auto-injector devices be made available in places of public assembly and that at least one employee or volunteer of such place of public assembly be trained in its proper operation and use and be present at each facility function.

title: Enacts the "Modernized voter registration act of New York"
abstract: Enacts the "Modernized voter registration act of New York."

title: Relates to legal services insurance
abstract: Defines "legal services insurance" as insurance that pays or reimburses for specified legal services or specified legal expenses, in consideration of a specified payment, regardless of whether the payment is made by the beneficiaries individually or by a third person on their behalf.

title: Relates to designating Lactarius peckii as the official state fungus of the state
abstract: Designates Lactarius peckii as the official state fungus of the state.

title: Relates to the scheduling of a fact finding hearing after the issuance of a temporary order of protection in family court
abstract: Relates to the scheduling of a fact finding hearing after the issuance of a temporary order of protection in family court; provides that such hearing shall be scheduled no later than 14 days after the temporary order is issued.

title: Prohibits certain state and prospective state contractors to contribute to the campaigns and committees of statewide officials
abstract: Prohibits certain state and prospective state contractors to contribute to the campaigns and committees of statewide officials, including any candidate for governor, attorney general and comptroller, for a period of time; requires written notice of prohibitions.

title: Relates to establishing new fee rates for large estates
abstract: Relates to establishing new fee rates for large estates; raises the fee rate for estates with a value over $5,000,000 to $10,000.

title: Provides a tax credit for the installation of fire sprinkler systems
abstract: Provides a tax credit for the installation of fire sprinkler systems.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim June 12-18, 2023, as Infant Mental Health Awareness Week in the State of New York
Prohibits the governor, the legislature and state agencies from imposing residential housing zoning requirements on local governments without approval from the local government
abstract: Prohibits the governor, the legislature and state agencies from imposing residential housing zoning requirements on local governments without approval from the local government.

title: Establishes a no fare program for transportation on the Long Island Rail Road for individuals in active military service of the United States and active duty members of the New York national guard
abstract: Directs the metropolitan transportation authority, in consultation with the Long Island Rail Road, to establish a no fare program for transportation on the Long Island Rail Road for individuals in active military service of the United States and active duty members of the New York national guard, upon showing a military or national guard identification card.

title: Congratulating Isabella Gretzinger of Shenendehowa High School upon the occasion of capturing the 2023 New York State Public High School Athletic Association Girls Wrestling Championship
Relates to newborn screening for duchenne muscular dystrophy
abstract: Requires that newborns are tested for duchenne muscular dystrophy using a test validated by the Wadsworth center for laboratories and research; directs the Wadsworth center for laboratories and research to begin the process of testing validation upon the development of a test for duchenne muscular dystrophy.

title: Relates to amending the 2022 capital projects budget
abstract: Amends the 2022 capital projects budget to allow competitive grants to provide safety and security projects at nonprofit organizations at risk of hate crimes or attacks to be awarded to small businesses as defined by section 131 of the economic development law.

title: Relates to the Lorena Borjas transgender and non-binary (TGNB) wellness and equity program fund act
abstract: Makes technical corrections to the Lorena Borjas transgender and non-binary (TGNB) wellness and equity program fund act.

title: Relates to the veterans memorial registry
abstract: Authorizes public requests for information from any county, city, town, or village desiring to have a memorial located within their municipality listed within the veterans memorial registry; directs the department of veterans' services to establish a veterans memorial registry.

title: Relates to requirements for in-service training programs for code enforcement personnel
abstract: Modifies the requirements for in-service training programs designed to assist code enforcement personnel in maintaining skills and being informed of technological advances.

title: Relates to infection updates and infection control planning in residential health care facilities
abstract: Requires nursing homes to follow Federal CDC or medicare and medicaid guidance relating to infectious disease control planning and procedures.

title: Relates to establishing an adult cystic fibrosis assistance program
abstract: Re-establishes the adult cystic fibrosis assistance program to reimburse the cost of providing health care or health insurance to eligible individuals who have cystic fibrosis.

title: Relates to requirements associated with the New York city community school district system
abstract: Relates to requirements associated with the New York city community school district system.

title: Relates to guidelines for onsite opioid overdose response capacity in community centers
abstract: Directs the commissioner of health to establish guidelines for onsite opioid overdose response capacity in community centers; defines "community center".

title: Relates to the applicability of certain labor law requirements to construction projects involving parking facilities with EV charging capability
abstract: Exempts certain projects from requirements for providing EV charging capability and from certain labor law provisions for public projects.

title: Relates to the installation and maintenance of playground equipment by the New York city housing authority
abstract: Requires the installation and maintenance of playground equipment by the New York city housing authority to substantially comply with the guidelines and criteria contained in the handbook for public playground safety produced by the United States Consumer Products Safety Commission or any successor thereof.

title: Requires employment and consumer dispute arbitrations to be submitted to neutral third party arbitrators, and establishes prohibited arbitration agreements and provisions
abstract: Requires employment and consumer dispute arbitrations to be submitted to neutral third party arbitrators; establishes prohibited arbitration agreements and provisions; requires disclosure of information by certain arbitrators.

title: Relates to eligibility of community colleges for state aid
abstract: Requires that community colleges provide educational opportunity programs to eligible students in order to qualify for state aid for capital and operating expenditures.

title: Relates to price gouging
abstract: Relates to price gouging; imposes criminal penalties for price gouging; removes language relating to the declaration of a state of emergency; increases civil penalty; authorizes a district attorney to enforce provisions.

title: Suspends the registration of a vehicle which has been documented multiple times within a period by a photo violation monitoring device for failure to comply with traffic-control indications
abstract: Suspends the registration of a vehicle which has been documented multiple times within a period by a photo violation monitoring device for failure to comply with traffic-control indications.

title: Empowers the trust for cultural resources of the city of New York to designate East Harlem as a cultural district
abstract: Empowers the trust for cultural resources of the city of New York to designate East Harlem as a cultural district.

title: Provides for offering reward or incentive programs
abstract: Allows for insurance providers and corporations to create and offer reward or incentive programs to eligible members.

title: Relates to the approval of contracts awarded to owners of nuclear powered generating facilities
abstract: Relates to the approval of contracts awarded to owners of nuclear powered generating facilities; provides that certain exceptions to comptroller approval of contracts do not apply to a contract awarded by a public benefit corporation to the owner of a nuclear powered generating facility or facilities for the provision of zero-emissions attributes of generated electricity.

title: Grants the attorney general jurisdiction to investigate and prosecute police misconduct
abstract: Authorizes the attorney general to investigate and prosecute the alleged commission of any criminal offense or offenses committed by police officers in connection with the performance of their regular duties.

title: Prohibits the sale of gasoline powered leaf blowers and lawn mowers
abstract: Prohibits the sale of gasoline powered leaf blowers and lawn mowers in the state; requires the commissioner to promulgate rules to enact such prohibition by January 1, 2025.

title: Directs the commissioners of agriculture and markets and economic development to study and develop a long-term strategy for sustaining farming and food production in New York State
abstract: Directs the commissioners of agriculture and markets and economic development to study and develop a long-term strategy for sustaining farming and food production in New York state; bases such strategy on an analysis of land use and economic trends, soil and natural resources, food consumption needs and other factors necessary to develop a state-level blueprint for protecting farmland and strengthening food production in the state.

title: Provides for the licensure of lactation consultants and the establishment of a lactation consultant licensing board
abstract: Provides for the licensure of lactation consultants and the establishment of a lactation consultant licensing board.

title: Relates to payments made by school districts to charter schools
abstract: Relates to payments made by school districts to charter schools.

title: Requires counties to maintain a confidential registry of people of all ages with disabilities for disaster preparedness
abstract: Requires counties to maintain a confidential registry of people of all ages with disabilities for the purpose of evacuating and sheltering such persons during disasters.

title: Relates to excusing prospective jurors who are over the age of 75 or have a health condition putting such person at greater risk for severe illness from COVID-19
abstract: Excuses prospective jurors who are over the age of 75 or have a health condition putting such person at greater risk for severe illness from COVID-19 from service; establishes provisions expire after two years.

title: Relates to prohibiting pre-payment penalties for mortgages secured by real property owned in a cooperative form of ownership
abstract: Prohibits pre-payment penalties for mortgages secured by real property owned in a cooperative form of ownership where over fifty percent of the units are shareholder occupied.

title: Establishes a program and a fund to assist public service attorneys practicing public service law to repay their student loans
abstract: Establishes the "public interest legal services loan assistance fund" of the state of New York (to consist of a portion of bar examination fees and other funds appropriated by the legislature therefor and such other monies as may be credited or otherwise transferred from any other fund or source pursuant to law, including voluntary contributions); provides for administration of such fund to assist public service attorneys practicing public interest law in repaying their student loans; defines certain terms and adds other related provisions.

title: Relates to requiring consumer reporting agencies to provide a consumer's information to such consumer at no cost
abstract: Relates to requiring consumer reporting agencies to provide a consumer's information to such consumer at no cost.

title: Relates to flexible working arrangements
abstract: Relates to flexible working arrangements; provides that employees may submit a request for flexible working arrangements in good faith; requires the employer to notify the employee of the decision; prohibits employers from retaliating against employees for exercising rights under the section.

title: Relates to the age requirement for voting in a primary election
abstract: Allows a U.S. citizen, who is seventeen years of age, to vote in a primary election, including presidential, if he or she will turn eighteen by the date of the corresponding general election.

title: Relates to requiring the metropolitan transportation authority to create ten-year capital program plans
abstract: Requires the metropolitan transportation authority to create ten-year capital program plans.

title: Establishes antitrust exemptions for certain horse racing agreements
abstract: Provides that antitrust laws shall not apply to any joint agreement entered into, in consultation with and jointly approved by the state gaming commission and the attorney general, by or among non-profit associations, thoroughbred racing associations or corporations, harness racing associations or corporations, quarter horse racing associations or corporations and regional off-track betting corporations to coordinate the dates and times under which they will conduct programs of racing and offer pari-mutuel wagering; provides that such laws shall not apply to agreements entered into to sell, transfer, assign or purchase the rights to broadcast, simulcast, electronically transmit or offer pari-mutuel wagering on horse races.

title: Prohibits mandatory arbitration agreements in consumer and employment contracts; repealer
abstract: Prohibits mandatory arbitration agreements in consumer and employment contracts; repeals existing provisions prohibiting mandatory arbitration clauses in certain consumer contracts.

title: Relates to redetermination based on income for a tax abatement for rent-controlled and rent regulated property occupied by senior citizens or persons with disabilities
abstract: Relates to redetermination based on increases in income for a tax abatement for rent-controlled and rent regulated property occupied by senior citizens or persons with disabilities.

title: Exempts the sale of fire extinguishers, smoke alarms, heat sensors and carbon monoxide detectors from sales and use taxes
abstract: Exempts the sale of fire extinguishers, smoke alarms, heat sensors and carbon monoxide detectors for residential use only from state sales and compensating use taxes.

title: Relates to renaming the Queens Midtown tunnel the Jane Matilda Bolin tunnel
abstract: Relates to renaming the Queens Midtown tunnel the Jane Matilda Bolin tunnel.

title: Requires a parent, law guardian or person legally responsible for a minor to be present during questioning by a peace or police officer
abstract: Requires a parent or other person legally responsible for a minor and the law guardian appointed pursuant to law to be present during questioning by a peace or police officer.

title: Requires health insurance policies to cover comprehensive genetic screening for ovarian and prostate cancers
abstract: Requires health insurance policies to cover comprehensive genetic screening and FDA approved biomarker testing for ovarian and prostate cancers.

title: Requires the administration and the instruction in preparation of the TASC examination in the Chinese and Korean languages for pupils who are proficient in these languages
abstract: Requires the administration and the instruction in preparation of the TASC examination in the Chinese and Korean languages for pupils who are proficient in these languages and of limited English proficiency.

title: Establishes a tax credit for personal property replacement as a result of bedbug infestation
abstract: Establishes a tax credit for personal property replacement as a result of bedbug infestation; credit of 15% not to exceed $750; certification determined by commissioner.

title: Provides for the time period bases and manner of payment of employment preparation education apportionment state aid
abstract: Provides for the time period bases and manner of payment of employment preparation education apportionment state aid.

title: Relates to reregulating units that were illegally deregulated from rent control or rent stabilization
abstract: Reregulates units that were illegally deregulated from rent control or rent stabilization.

title: Prohibits prior peace officers or police officers whose position as such was terminated or vacated due to misconduct from again becoming a peace officer or a police officer
abstract: Prohibits prior peace officers or police officers whose position as such was terminated or vacated due to misconduct from again becoming a peace officer or a police officer.

title: Relates to providing for an initial hearing in every case for a claim of compensation
abstract: Provides for an initial hearing in every case for a claim of compensation.

title: Limits animal dealers exempt under the provision of article 7 of such law relating to the licensing, identification and control of dogs
abstract: Limits the animal dealers that are exempt under the provisions of article 7 of the agriculture and markets law relating to the licensing, identification and control of dogs; applies provisions to dealers licensed as a class A dealer under the Federal Animal Welfare Act that sells dogs exclusively to USDA registered research facilities.

title: Provides administrative remedy for persons whose vehicle is wrongfully towed
abstract: Provides recourse for a person whose vehicle was wrongfully towed in a city with a population of one million or more against the parking violations bureau in such city or the responsible agent of such bureau by granting such person the right to appear before a panel of administrative law judges which shall be empowered to order the correction of records, the refund of any fee paid to release the wrongfully towed vehicle and the reimbursement of out-of-pocket expenses, including lost wages; defines the term "wrongful tow."

title: Prohibits the use of credit history checks in certain cases
abstract: Prohibits the use of credit history checks to ascertain the payment status of a student loan of an applicant for employment for the purposes of making hiring decisions except where otherwise mandated by law.

title: Relates to providing a tax abatement for geothermal well systems in N.Y. city
abstract: Provides a tax abatement for geothermal well systems in cities of one million or more.

title: Relates to audio-visual coverage of judicial proceedings; repealer
abstract: Relates to audio-visual coverage of judicial proceedings.

title: Relates to permitting lessees the option to pay security deposits in installments
abstract: Relates to permitting lessees the option to pay security deposits in six or fewer equal installments.

title: Authorizes the correctional association to inspect residential juvenile detention facilities
abstract: Authorizes the correctional association to inspect residential juvenile detention facilities.

title: Dedicates and designates Jerome Park as parklands of the city of New York and establishes a working group for such park to enhance the use thereof
abstract: Dedicates and designates Jerome Park as parkland of the city of New York; establishes a working group for such park to enhance the use thereof.

title: Relates to allowing poll workers to be from any political party
abstract: Allows poll workers to be from any political party.

title: Establishes a one year moratorium on actions to foreclose a mortgage
abstract: Establishes a one year moratorium on actions to foreclose a mortgage.

title: Relates to mandating insurance coverage for medical devices to treat withdrawal symptoms
abstract: Relates to mandating insurance coverage for medical devices and products to treat withdrawal symptoms which are approved by the food and drug administration.

title: Relates to designating the fourth Thursday in March as "Tuskegee Airmen Commemoration Day"
abstract: Designates the fourth Thursday in March as "Tuskegee Airmen Commemoration Day".

title: Establishes a moratorium on the placement of registered sex offenders by the office for people with developmental disabilities in residential placements for individuals with developmental disabilities
abstract: Establishes a moratorium on the placement of registered sex offenders by the office for people with developmental disabilities in residential placements for individuals with developmental disabilities; requires the office to study the dangers and effects of such placements and whether there are any other alternatives to such placements and to report to the governor and the legislature on its findings and recommendations.

title: Specifies requirements for motor fuel advertising media
abstract: Specifies requirements for motor fuel advertising media; requires clearly visible signs relating to the pricing of motor fuels.

title: Relates to methods for cancelling contracts
abstract: Requires that a business allow a consumer to cancel a contract between the two parties using the same method that was used to enter into the contact.

title: Enables prosecutors to access orders of protection issued in association with sealed prior domestic violence cases
