abstract: Enacts the New York automobile insurance fraud and premium reduction act; provides that this act is aimed at reducing insurance fraud and thus lowering the cost of insurance premiums; provides a provision for compensation to a person that reports insurance fraud to the authorities; further provides that this act also increases the penalty for insurance fraud; appropriates $3,100,000 therefor.

title: Relates to permitting a plaintiff to recover directly against a third party defendant found to be liable in certain actions
abstract: Permits a plaintiff to recover directly against a third party defendant found to be liable to the defendant in certain actions.

title: Provides for decarbonization plans for state-owned fleet vehicles; repealer
abstract: Directs each state agency to prepare a state fleet decarbonization plan for purchase or lease of state agency vehicles.

title: Requires the provision of video communication devices to certain patients during any time when visitor access is limited
abstract: Requires video communication devices for patients or residents in nursing homes, hospitals or facilities providing health related services when visitor access is limited; requires that as part of a disaster preparedness plan that nursing homes, adult homes, enriched housing programs, and assisted living facilities provide video communication devices to patients for use when visitor access is limited, including, but not limited to during a designated state of emergency or a state disaster emergency.

title: Provides a personal income tax deduction for long term care insurnace riders
abstract: Provides a personal income tax deduction for long term care insurance riders under life insurance policies.

title: Relates to providing for the release of certain grand jury proceeding materials on the basis of enduring historical importance
abstract: Allows a person to petition the court for grand jury proceeding materials on the basis of enduring historical importance.

title: Requires that N.Y. city shall provide curbside composting collection sites
abstract: Requires that a city with a population of one million or more shall provide at least one curbside composting collection site for every five thousand people with bi-weekly collection days.

title: Enacts into law components of legislation relating to certain criminal justice reform in the state of New York; repealer
abstract: Enacts into law components of legislation relating to certain criminal justice reform in the state of New York; establishes law enforcement officer grant funds (Part A); provides judges more discretion regarding securing orders and limiting the lengths of certain orders (Part B); requires affirmative consent for the disclosure of contact information of witnesses to a defendant; provides that denial of such consent shall only be for good cause as determined by the court (Part C); relates to consideration of the death penalty for the commission of certain provisions of murder in the first degree (Part D).

title: Requires that an employee, who is transferred from one state agency to another because his or her previous position was eliminated, be entitled to certain benefits
abstract: Provides that an employee whose position is eliminated for certain reasons and who is subsequently transferred to a different agency be entitled to the same hourly salary; retain all accrued sick leave; retain, cash out or use all accrued vacation time; and be paid relocation expenses.

title: Relates to casting and counting absentee ballots without postmarked dates within three days following the day of election
abstract: Establishes provisions requiring absentee ballots that do not have postmarked dates that are received in the mail by the board of elections within three days following the day of election to be cast and counted.

title: Provides for the payment of state aid to the town of New Hudson and special districts therein for state land operated by the department of environmental conservation
abstract: Provides for the payment of state aid to the town of New Hudson and special districts therein for state land operated by the department of environmental conservation.

title: Permits awarding of reasonable attorneys' fees, costs and exemplary damages in court actions for unlawful discriminatory practices pursuant to the human rights law
abstract: Permits awarding of reasonable attorneys' fees and costs and exemplary damages in court actions for unlawful discriminatory practices pursuant to the human rights law; provides incentive to the employer not to discriminate against the employee knowing there will be financial repercussions for their actions.

title: Relates to increasing the penalties for assault on police officers, peace officers, firefighters and emergency medical technicians
abstract: Increases the penalties for assault on police officers, peace officers, firefighters and emergency medical technicians causing physical injury or serious physical injury.

title: Requires immunization of certain post-secondary students for COVID-19
abstract: Requires immunization of certain post-secondary students for COVID-19.

title: Establishes the crime of criminal possession of an image of a minor victim
abstract: Prohibits possession of an image of a minor victim by child sex offenders; prohibits any other person from disseminating to such person any image of a child victim of such sex offense.

title: Extends the authorization for the county of Seneca to impose an additional one percent sales and compensating use tax
abstract: Extends the expiration of the authorization for the county of Seneca to impose an additional one percent sales and compensating use tax for two years.

title: Prohibits the use of perfluoroalkyl and polyfluoroalkyl substances in apparel and outdoor apparel for severe wet conditions
abstract: Prohibits the use of perfluoroalkyl and polyfluoroalkyl substances in apparel and outdoor apparel for severe wet conditions.

title: Allows school districts to permit home-schooled students to participate in district interscholastic sports
abstract: Allows school districts to permit home-schooled students to participate in district interscholastic sports.

title: Relates to authorizing the Bellmore Fire District to file an application for exemption from real property taxes
abstract: Makes clarifying changes regarding the authorization for the Bellmore Fire District to file an application for exemption from real property taxes.

title: Relates to the imposition of sales and compensating use tax in Schenectady county
abstract: Relates to the imposition of sales and compensating use tax in Schenectady county; extends such authority until November 30, 2025.

title: Extends the authorization granted to the county of Franklin to impose an additional one percent of sales and compensating use taxes
abstract: Extends the authorization granted to the county of Franklin to impose an additional one percent of sales and compensating use taxes until November 30th, 2025.

title: Authorizes the county of Rockland to impose an additional rate of sales and compensating use taxes
abstract: Authorizes the county of Rockland to impose an additional rate of sales and compensating use taxes until November 30, 2025.

title: Establishes the warehouse worker protection act
abstract: Makes clarifications to the provisions of the warehouse worker protection act.

title: Provides for the issuance of distinctive "The Westchester Way" license plates for an additional $25 annual fee
abstract: Provides for the issuance of distinctive "The Westchester Way" license plates for an additional $25 annual fee; provides for the service charge collected to be credited to the department of motor vehicles distinctive plate development fund and the excess of six thousand dollars to be deposited in the "New York state 'The Westchester Way' fund" to be used to promote tourism in Westchester county; establishes the New York state "The Westchester Way fund" to administer such monies, which shall be made available to tourism promotion agencies.

title: Provides for the imposition of a fine for the failure of a cooperative apartment corporation to credit the STAR exemption to the tenant-stockholders thereof
abstract: Provides for the imposition of a fine for the failure of a cooperative apartment corporation to credit the STAR exemption to the tenant-stockholders thereof.

title: Relates to repeat violators who endanger the public health, safety or the environment
abstract: Relates to repeat violators who endanger the public health, safety or the environment; increases penalties for such violators.

title: Relates to the commissioners of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
abstract: Relates to the commissioners of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey; requires that at least one of whom shall be a resident voter from either the county of Dutchess, Orange, Putnam, Rockland, Sullivan, Ulster or Westchester and one of whom shall be a resident voter from either the county of Nassau or Suffolk.

title: Relates to terms and conditions of employment of certain nonjudicial officers and employees of the unified court system; repealer
abstract: Implements certain collective bargaining agreements relating to terms and conditions of employment of certain nonjudicial officers and employees of the unified court system.

title: Relates to classroom safety mechanisms, emergency medical equipment, and evidence-based best practices for school safety planning and training
abstract: Relates to classroom safety mechanisms, emergency medical equipment, and evidence-based best practices for school safety planning and training.

title: Authorizes the commissioner of motor vehicles to establish a pilot program to evaluate the use of optional mobile or digital alternatives to driver's licenses and non-driver identification cards
abstract: Authorizes the commissioner of motor vehicles to establish a pilot program to evaluate the use of optional mobile or digital alternatives to driver's licenses and non-driver identification cards if specified requirements are met; provides for the repeal of such provisions upon the expiration thereof.

title: Enacts the interstate nurse licensure compact and the advanced practice registered nurse compact
abstract: Adopts the interstate nurse licensure compact (Part A); adopts the advanced practice registered nurse compact (Part B).

title: Prohibits the use of social media websites, email or text messages for the purpose of debt collection
abstract: Prohibits the use of social media websites, email or text messages for the purpose of debt collection.

title: Enacts regulations of perchloroethylene dry cleaning facilities, including phase-out from residential buildings
abstract: Enacts regulations of perchloroethylene dry cleaning facilities; establishes equipment standards and specifications and operating requirements; provides for lead inspection and self monitoring and for management of perc-contaminated wastewater; makes numerous other regulatory provisions; includes phase-out from residential buildings.

title: Increases the value of homesteads which are to be exempt from civil judgments
abstract: Increases the value of homesteads which are exempt from civil judgments from one hundred fifty thousand to two hundred fifty thousand dollars.

title: Exempts community colleges from the imposition of the metropolitan commuter transportation mobility tax
abstract: Exempts community colleges from the imposition of the metropolitan commuter transportation mobility tax.

title: Relates to the tolling of bridges controlled or operated by the city of New York
abstract: Relates to the tolling of bridges controlled or operated by the city of New York.

title: Increases the threshold of employer's withheld taxes
abstract: Increases the threshold of employer's withheld taxes.

title: Relates to creating a distinctive plate for New York state licensed mental health counselors
abstract: Creates a distinctive plate for New York state licensed mental health counselors.

title: Requires the disclosure of income and expense statements upon a petition for an article 7 proceeding and imposes staggered dates for submissions of appraisal reports
abstract: Requires the disclosure of income and expense statements upon a petition for an article 7 proceeding; imposes staggered dates for submissions of appraisal reports.

title: Provides tax abatement related to the removal of leaded paint
abstract: Provides tax abatement related to the removal of leaded paint; defines terms.

title: Requires that all special education students attending schools scheduled to be closed or to undergo a significant change be assigned to new schools prior to the implementation of the closing or change
abstract: Requires that all special education students attending schools scheduled to be closed or to undergo a significant change be assigned to new schools prior to the implementation of the closing or change.

title: Relates to allowing for certain rules and regulations to be waived in order to promulgate collaboration between mental health providers to develop programs for the benefit of the mentally ill
abstract: Allows for certain rules and regulations to be waived in order to promulgate collaboration between mental health providers to develop programs for the benefit of the mentally ill.

title: Relates to transportation of children by school districts
abstract: Relates to transportation of children by school districts to non-public schools; authorizes apportionment to cover 90%.

title: Prohibits the use of intoxication of the victim as a defense in sex crimes
abstract: Prohibits the use of intoxication of the victim as a defense in sex crimes where the victim is under the extreme influence of any drug, intoxicant, or other substance to a degree which renders that person incapable of giving consent and that condition is known or reasonably should be known to a person in the defendant's situation.

title: Relates to including pain management medications on a death certificate where a death is caused by an opioid overdose
abstract: Includes pain management medications that the decedent was prescribed, such as gabapentin, on a death certificate where a death is caused by an opioid overdose.

title: Prohibits the sale of dry ice to individuals under eighteen years of age
abstract: Prohibits the sale of dry ice to individuals under eighteen years of age; provides a violation shall be punishable by a fine of not more than five hundred dollars.

title: Provides for establishing a demonstration program implementing a dual track child protective program in Westchester county
abstract: Enacts the "Westchester county dual track demonstration program"; provides for establishing a demonstration program implementing a dual track child protective program in Westchester county; provides that such program shall be supervised by the office of children and family services; also provides for the appointment of an advisory council and for various evaluations of the program; requires reports thereon.

title: Relates to acts of the Legislature having fiscal impacts on local governments
abstract: Requires the legislature to provide funding to reimburse localities for the costs associated with expenditures made as a requirement of any law which mandates the undertaking of a new program or increases the level of service of an existing program by a locality; requires the legislature to establish procedures for the allocation of funds among the local governments.

title: Relates to possession and sale of armor piercing ammunition; repealer
abstract: Makes possession and sale of armor piercing ammunition a class B felony; includes exchanging and disposing of armor piercing ammunition.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim March 21, 2023, as Agriculture Day in the State of New York
Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim March 21, 2023, as Forest Day in the State of New York
Grants a special apportionment to certain school districts for certain public pension liabilities
abstract: Grants a special apportionment to school districts having a population of between 195,000 and 219,000, for additional expenses incurred in the 2021-2022 and 2022-2023 school years associated with changes in public pension liabilities.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim March 21, 2023, as Down Syndrome Awareness Day in the State of New York
Relates to factoring domestic violence convictions into certain family court decisions
abstract: Factors domestic violence convictions into family court decisions regarding visitation, custody and parental rights; provides that any parent undergoing mandatory, batterer specific rehabilitation measures shall only be granted supervised visitation.

title: Prevents fees from being charged for the issuance of certain license plates
abstract: Prevents fees from being charged for the issuance of license plates where the vehicle has legible plates.

title: Relates to authorizing the city of Buffalo to adopt a local law requiring police officers in such city to be residents of Buffalo
abstract: Authorizes the city of Buffalo to adopt a local law requiring a member of the police force in such city to be a resident of Buffalo subsequent to the effective date of such local law.

title: Reduces the tax on combative sport event ticket sales to five percent
abstract: Reduces the tax on combative sport event ticket sales to five percent.

title: Establishes the small farm disaster recovery grant program
abstract: Establishes the small farm disaster recovery grant program; provides grants for the purchase and replanting of crops destroyed by natural disaster.

title: Relates to peace officers at institutions of higher education
abstract: Relates to peace officers at institutions of higher education.

title: Establishes the consolidated assistance program for EMS departments which creates a sustainable state financing mechanism for emergency medical services
abstract: Establishes the consolidated assistance program for EMS departments which creates a sustainable state financing mechanism for emergency medical services.

title: Directs the department of corrections and community supervision to test a program of supplying inmates with tablets for educational and recreational means
abstract: Directs the department of corrections and community supervision to test a program of supplying inmates with tablets for educational and recreational means.

title: Relates to exceptions from registration requirements for nonresident pharmacies in certain cases
abstract: Permits an exception from registration for nonresident pharmacies in cases of a specific patient need or a declared public health emergency under certain conditions.

title: Requires the court to provide a range of dates for a person pleading not guilty to a traffic infraction to appear
abstract: Requires the court to provide a range of at least three different dates and times for a person pleading not guilty to a traffic infraction to appear.

title: Relates to unconsented removal or tampering with a sexually protective device
abstract: Relates to unconsented removal or tampering with a sexually protective device.

title: Enables high school students to use public transportation without charge in order to ride to and from school
abstract: Enables high school students to use public transportation without charge in order to ride to and from school.

title: Relates to requiring incarcerated individual sexual harassment complaints made against department employees to be investigated by the attorney general
abstract: Requires incarcerated individual sexual harassment complaints made against department employees to be investigated by the attorney general; makes the findings and recommendations of the attorney general final and binding on the part of the department.

title: Subtracts from the federal adjusted gross income any income earned by election inspectors, poll clerks, or election coordinators
abstract: Subtracts from the federal adjusted gross income any income earned by election inspectors, poll clerks, or election coordinators earned while working in relation to a general, primary, run-off primary, or special election to the extent includable in gross income for federal tax purposes; exempts such income from being included in the calculation of the amount of benefits under public assistance programs.

title: Establishes representative requirements for district leadership teams and school leadership teams
abstract: Requires district leadership teams and school leadership teams to include student representatives.

title: Establishes the general aviation task force to improve general aviation operations in the state of New York
abstract: Establishes the general aviation task force to study measures that may be implemented to improve general aviation operations in the state of New York.

title: Relates to updating the driver's manual provided to accepted learner's permit applicants and driver education courses
abstract: Relates to updating the driver's manual provided to accepted learner's permit applicants and driver education courses to include a description of law enforcement procedures during traffic stops and the actions a motorist shall take during such stop including appropriate interactions with such officers.

title: Amends Assembly Rule V, relating to reconvening the Assembly
Relates to the dissolution of the town of Concord industrial development agency; repealer
abstract: Provides for the dissolution of the Town of Concord industrial development agency.

title: Creates new class E felony of fraudulent accosting in the first degree
abstract: Increases the penalties for larceny and fraudulent accosting when the victim is 65 years of age or older.

title: Allows the New York state thruway authority to provide a discounted toll rate to farmers transporting agricultural products
abstract: Allows the New York state thruway authority to provide a discounted toll rate to farmers transporting agricultural products.

title: Establishes the New York baby opportunity fund
abstract: Establishes the New York baby opportunity fund which deposits $1,000 into an account managed by the state comptroller to be available to eligible children when they reach the age of 18; provides such funds be used for education costs, the purchase of real estate, or entrepreneurship.

title: Enacts the "Michael K. Williams law" to establish a grant program to incentivize counties and municipalities to reduce prison populations
abstract: Enacts the "Michael K. Williams law" to establish a grant program to incentivize counties and municipalities to reduce prison populations; makes an appropriation therefor.

title: Authorizes full-time college students to act as election inspectors and poll clerks in the election district where their colleges are located
abstract: Authorizes, under certain circumstances, full-time college and university students to act as election inspectors and poll clerks in the election district where their college or university is located.

title: Relates to the establishment of ward systems for the election of councilmen
abstract: Relates to the establishment of ward systems for the election of councilmen.

title: Authorizes the department of environmental conservation to establish the Lake DeForest Flood Control Pilot Program
abstract: Authorizes the department of environmental conservation to establish the Lake Deforest Flood Control Pilot Program.

title: Ensures that parents and guardians of youth up to age 19 are notified when their child is arrested or issued an appearance ticket
abstract: Relates to the issuance of arrest warrants and appearance tickets upon a youth; provides for the police officer to immediately notify the parent or other person legally responsible for the care of such youth with whom the youth is domiciled that the youth has been arrested; provides further that the police officer need not notify the parent or other person legally responsible when such youth is not also a juvenile offender and the notification would endanger the health and safety of such youth; amends provisions relating to sexually exploited children to include persons under the age of nineteen.

title: Prohibits discrimination in government procurement
abstract: Prohibits discrimination in government procurement.

title: Relates to providing a tax credit to individuals with disabilities for using transportation network companies to get to work and/or school
abstract: Provides a tax credit of up to five hundred dollars to individuals with disabilities for using transportation network companies to get to work and/or school.

title: Relates to the regulation of municipal shooting ranges
abstract: Relates to the regulation of municipal shooting ranges, including limiting the hours of operation and addressing noise pollution; directs the department of health to conduct a study describing the contaminants and other pollutants in the ground and water bodies adjacent to certain shooting ranges.

title: Limits the initial prescription of a controlled substance for the alleviation of acute pain
abstract: Limits the initial prescription of a controlled substance for the alleviation of acute pain to a seven-day supply for users twenty years of age or older and to a three-day supply for users nineteen years of age or younger.

title: Creates the New York state public sector employee loan forgiveness program
abstract: Creates the New York state public sector employee loan forgiveness program for graduates of SUNY or CUNY schools employed in a state or local public sector position.

title: Establishing the time period during which to file a claim for sexual harassment against the state in cases when a complaint was filed with a state or local agency
abstract: Establishes the time period during which to file a claim for sexual harassment against the state in cases when a complaint was filed with a state or local agency.

title: Requires the department of health to develop rules for all courts in New York state to protect the court employees and the public from COVID-19
abstract: Requires the department of health to develop rules for all courts in New York state to protect the court employees and the public from COVID-19.

title: Relates to the time to file a claim in a toxic tort case
abstract: Provides that in toxic tort cases where the specific toxic etiological cause of injury is not known for up to ten years (instead of five years) after the injury itself is discovered a plaintiff shall have three years to file a claim from the time such specific cause is discovered.

title: Relates to non-insurance benefits
abstract: Relates to authorizing non-insurance benefits or services to be offered as part of group life or group or blanket accident or health insurance policies.

title: Provides for the use of glucagon emergency injection kits by persons other than licensed health care professionals
abstract: Provides for the use of glucagon emergency injection kits by persons other than licensed health care professionals; provides for expanded use of epinephrine auto-injector devices in schools in emergency circumstances.

title: Relates to a negotiated sentence of imprisonment
abstract: Provides that a pre-sentence investigation and written report thereon shall not be required where a negotiated sentence of imprisonment for a term of three hundred sixty-five days or less has been mutually agreed upon by the parties with consent of the judge, as a result of a conviction or revocation of a sentence of probation; removes the requirement of solely in a city with a population of one million or more.

title: Requires the board of directors of a cooperative apartment corporation to notify applicants seeking to purchase shares of the corporation of the reason or reasons the board of directors has refused such request
abstract: Requires the board of directors of a cooperative apartment corporation to notify applicants seeking to purchase shares of the corporation of the reason or reasons the board of directors has refused such request.

title: Relates to labeling prescription bottles of opioids
abstract: Requires prescription bottles containing opioids to have a label affixed concerning the addictive nature of the drug.

title: Relates to the compounding, dispensing and sale of pharmaceuticals to veterinarians
abstract: Permits the compounding, dispensing and sale of pharmaceuticals to veterinarians.

title: Authorizes the city of New York to impose a personal income surcharge on high income residents to fund transit improvements
abstract: Authorizes the city of New York to impose a personal income surcharge on high income residents to fund transit improvements.

title: Relates to saliva swabs and chemical tests in certain cases
abstract: Relates to saliva swabs and chemical tests in certain cases.

title: Establishes the New York working soldiers' assistance program and deals with the professional licenses of individuals serving on federal active duty
abstract: Establishes the New York working soldiers' assistance program; provides a grant to private employers for paying employees currently in active duty in the military.

title: Establishes the problem gambling advisory council
abstract: Establishes the problem gambling advisory council.

title: Requires businesses that purchase silver, gold and platinum to display current silver, gold and platinum prices
abstract: Requires businesses that purchase silver, gold and platinum to display current silver, gold and platinum prices.

title: Relates to the provision of criminal history background checks free of charge to mentoring programs operated by not-for-profit corporations
abstract: Relates to the provision of criminal history background checks free of charge to mentoring programs operated by not-for-profit corporations.

title: Requires a person in a parental relation to a child be physically present during any immunization
abstract: Requires a parent, guardian or person in a parental relation to a child under the age of eighteen to be physically present when any immunization is administered to such child.

title: Enacts the New York city department of buildings community accountability act
abstract: Enacts the New York city department of buildings community accountability act.

title: Provides for gifts for the support of New York state small businesses
abstract: Establishes the New York small business relief fund to provide grants to small businesses who have suffered economic hardship as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic; provides for a tax write-off for gifts made to such fund.

title: Relates to requiring one voting member of the metropolitan transportation authority be a transit dependent individual
abstract: Requires one voting member of the metropolitan transportation authority be a transit dependent individual.

title: Prohibits the sale or promotional distribution of machetes to minors
abstract: Prohibits the sale or promotional distribution of machetes to minors; defines machete as a large heavy knife with a broad blade, used primarily for cutting brush or vegetation.

title: Prohibits rental car companies and used car companies from renting, selling or leasing vehicles that have been recalled due to safety risks
abstract: Prohibits rental car companies and used car companies from renting, selling or leasing vehicles that have been recalled due to safety risks.

title: Provides the Board of Regents with final approval authority over all proposed and renewed charter schools
abstract: Provides the Board of Regents with final approval authority over all proposed and renewed charter schools.

title: Provides for accountability in state assessments to determine graduation, grade promotion or adequate yearly progress
abstract: Provides for accountability in state assessments by creating a regents review board to audit assessments used to determine grade promotion, graduation and adequate yearly progress by requiring a written report, implementation of an auditing and review of pilot and/or field testing of the standardized tests used to ensure validity, reliability, alignment to standards and appropriateness of use.

title: Relates to establishing a uterine fibroids awareness and education program
abstract: Establishes a uterine fibroids awareness and education program on the symptoms, diagnosis and treatment of uterine fibroids and the elevated risk for minority women.

title: Requires communities with traffic-control devices with photo monitoring to have uniform duration periods for all yellow signal lights on any traffic-control devices
abstract: Requires that in communities which include traffic-control devices outfitted with photo monitoring instruments, amber or yellow signal lights located on any traffic-control device in such community shall have uniform duration periods.

title: Allows localities to exclude disability pension in determining eligibility level for partial exemption from real property tax
abstract: Allows localities the option to exclude income from any disability pension or benefit in computation of income for purposes of determining eligibility for the partial real property tax exemption granted to persons 65 years of age or over.

title: Relates to providing loan forgiveness to CASACS
abstract: Provides loan forgiveness to credentialed alcoholism and substance abuse counselors (CASACs) who reside in the state and work in a facility licensed by the state.

title: Prohibits banks from holding for deposit state issued check
abstract: Prohibits banks from holding for deposit the funds from checks issued by the state.

title: Relates to providing education and outreach programs related to home visiting programs
abstract: Relates to providing education and outreach programs related to home visiting programs; provides that such information shall include information on services available from such programs, eligibility, and relevant contact information.

title: Establishes the protect our homes and communities, stop predatory housing speculation act of 2023
abstract: Establishes the protect our homes and communities, stop predatory housing speculation act of 2023; imposes a tax on the transfer of certain residential properties which are sold within two years of the prior conveyance of such property; exempts certain purchases of residential properties from mortgage recording taxes; imposes a tax on the transfer of certain properties in the city of New York  which are sold for one million dollars or more.

title: Allows employment of retired police officers as special security officers for school districts
abstract: Authorizes the trustees or board of education of any school district to employ retired former members of police or sheriff's departments as special security officers for such school district upon approval by the department of education; grants such officers peace officer status.

title: Relates to tenant security deposit accounts and administrative expenses to which a person may be entitled
abstract: Provides that a landlord depositing security deposits in an interest bearing account shall be entitled to receive as administration expenses a sum equivalent to 20 percent of the interest earned by such security money per annum, but not to exceed one percent per annum of the money so deposited.

title: Relates to appointments to the water board of the city of New York
abstract: Relates to appointments to the water board of the city of New York.

title: Makes an appropriation to the Island Park School District to offset a loss of tax revenue
abstract: Makes an appropriation of seven million dollars over seven years to the Island Park School District for the purpose of stabilizing the Island Park School District and offsetting a loss of tax revenue.

title: Requires the rent guidelines board to take other sources of income received by landlords from commercial rents and unregulated residential units into account when establishing annual calculations
abstract: Requires the rent guidelines board to take other sources of income received by landlords from commercial rents and unregulated residential units into account when establishing annual calculations.

title: Relates to recounts of ballots conducted by the board of elections or a bipartisan committee appointed by the board
abstract: Provides that recounts of ballots conducted by the board of elections or a bipartisan committee appointed by the board can be either done manually or via the use of any automated tool authorized for such use by the board of elections, which is independent from the voting system it is being used to recount, of all ballots for a particular contest where the margin of victory is less than or equal to 0.5% but greater than 0.25%; allows for losing candidates to deny a recount before any recount is conducted.

title: Relates to the department of buildings keeping records regarding fatal construction accidents
abstract: Relates to the department of buildings keeping records regarding fatal construction accidents and posting all fatal accidents in the incident list.

title: Relates to authorizing the assessor of the city of Long Beach to accept from New Beth El, Inc. an application for exemption from real property taxes
abstract: Authorizes the assessor of the city of Long Beach, county of Nassau, to accept from New Beth El, Inc. an application for exemption from real property taxes during the 2019-2020 assessment roll.

title: Requires landlords to provide fire extinguishers in all rented apartments
abstract: Requires landlords to provide fire extinguishers in all rented apartments; authorizes the promulgation of standards related thereto.

title: Imposes regulations for short-term rental units
abstract: Provides for the regulation of short-term rental units; authorizes short-term rental units; requires short-term rental hosts to register each unit with the division of housing and community renewal.

title: Relates to protecting the rights of Mitchell-Lama residents
abstract: Relates to protecting the rights of current and converted Mitchell-Lama residents.

title: Relates to increasing the maximum years of study under the tuition assistance program
abstract: Increases the maximum time limits for tuition assistance program awards.

title: Relates to the creation of the "Kids Deserve Justice" license plate and the "kids deserve justice fund"
abstract: Relates to the creation of the "Kids Deserve Justice" license plate and the "kids deserve justice fund".

title: Imposes an excise tax on the sale of ammunition to be deposited into the gun violence impact fund; establishing the gun violence impact fund
abstract: Imposes an excise tax on the sale of ammunition to be deposited into the gun violence impact fund; establishes the gun violence impact fund; authorizes the director of the office of victim services to administer grants from the gun violence impact fund.

title: Requires employees and independent contractors to notify employers and contractors upon receiving a positive result of a test for COVID-19 and provides penalties for violations
abstract: Requires employees and independent contractors to notify employers and contractors within three hours after receiving a positive result of a test for COVID-19; provides penalties for violations.

title: Directs the commissioner of education to establish a commission to study the needs of adolescents and the effect that school day start times have on students
abstract: Directs the commissioner of education to establish a commission to study the needs of adolescents and the effect that school day start times have on the health and academic performance of students.

title: Requires kindergarten instruction for Rockland and Westchester counties for minors who are five years of age on or before December first
abstract: Requires kindergarten instruction for Rockland and Westchester counties for minors who are five years of age on or before December first.

title: Establishes enhanced penalties for coercive threats to expose immigration status of witnesses and domestic violence victims
abstract: Establishes enhanced penalties for coercive threats to expose immigration status of witnesses and domestic violence victims.

title: Relates to including additional positions in the definition of employee for the purposes of health care and mental hygiene worker bonuses
abstract: Relates to including additional positions in the definition of employee for the purposes of health care and mental hygiene worker bonuses.

title: Relates to distinctive license plates for society for the prevention of cruelty to animals officers
abstract: Relates to distinctive license plates for society for the prevention of cruelty to animals officers.

title: Establishes a tax credit for rent paid on the personal residence of certain taxpayers
abstract: Establishes a tax credit for rent paid on the personal residence of certain taxpayers who lease the taxpayer's primary residence during the taxable year and who pay rent with respect to such residence in excess of thirty percent of such taxpayer's gross income for such taxable year.

title: Requires the reimbursement of certain novel coronavirus, COVID-19 costs and expenses
abstract: Requires the office for people with developmental disabilities, department of health and division of the budget to authorize voluntary providers of supports and services to individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities to bill and be reimbursed within thirty days of billing for novel coronavirus, COVID-19 related costs and expenses, including, but not limited to, increased staffing and personal costs, personal protective equipment expenses, and increased residential cost.

title: Requires the consent of the patient or an authorized individual to consent on the patient's behalf before a prescription is delivered
abstract: Requires the consent of the patient or an authorized individual to consent on the patient's behalf before a prescription is delivered.

title: Relates to requiring licensed slaughterhouses to have a closed circuit camera and television system in all areas with live animals
abstract: Relates to requiring licensed slaughterhouses to have a closed circuit camera and television system in all areas with live animals; establishes a reporting requirement pursuant to inspections where a violation is found.

title: Makes provisions regarding appointment of members of the board of education for the city of Buffalo
abstract: Increases from 9 to 11 the number of members on the board of education for the city school district of Buffalo; provides for appointment of two members by the Mayor of the city of Buffalo.

title: Requires the budget submitted by the governor to include an itemization, by each individual school district, of appropriations for the support of school districts
abstract: Requires the budget submitted by the governor to include an itemization, by each individual school district, of appropriations for the support of school districts.

title: Establishes March 13 as a day of commemoration to be known as "K9 Veterans Day"
abstract: Establishes March 13 as a day of commemoration to be known as "K9 Veterans Day".

title: Requires motor vehicle dealers to disclose price markups to the purchasers of motor vehicles
abstract: Requires motor vehicle dealers to disclose price markups to the purchasers of motor vehicles; provides failure to so disclose shall be grounds for revocation of the dealer's registration and imposes civil liability to purchasers for damages; authorizes the financial frauds and consumer protection unit of the department of financial services to study problematic practices in the price markups of motor vehicle dealers.

title: Establishes uniform waiting list priorities for domestic violence survivors applying for public housing
abstract: Establishes uniform waiting list priorities for domestic violence survivors applying for public housing.

title: Relates to the definition of an indoor area; and to repealing certain provisions of the public health law relating thereto
abstract: Relates to the definition of an indoor area.

title: Requires that subpoenas relating to election matters be served with a separate informational sheet that summarizes why the subpoena has been issued
abstract: Requires that subpoenas issued relating to election matters be served with a separate informational sheet that summarizes why the subpoena has been issued.

title: Relates to flags sold in the state of New York
abstract: Requires any American flag and New York state flag sold in New York state to be manufactured in the United States.

title: Requires mandatory continuing education for nurses
abstract: Requires 45 hours of mandatory continuing education in a three year period for registered professional nurses; permits exemptions for illness, military duty and nurses who are not engaged in the practice.

title: Provides that a court may require that a new election be held when there is clear and convincing evidence that the wrong candidate was determined to be the winner
abstract: Provides that a court may require that a new election be held when there is clear and convincing evidence that the wrong candidate was determined to be the winner.

title: Eliminates the ability of judicial candidates for office who are enrolled in a particular party to automatically be allowed to run as a candidate in another party's primary election
abstract: Eliminates the ability of judicial candidates for office who are enrolled in a particular party to automatically be allowed to run as a candidate in another party's primary election.

title: Relates to security deposits collected by child day care providers and notice given to day care providers for removal of a child
abstract: Limits security deposits collected by child day care providers to one month's fee and minimum notice given to day care providers for removal of a child to at most one month.

title: Relates to increasing the age required to use ultraviolet radiation devices
abstract: Increases the age required to use ultraviolet radiation devices to twenty-one years of age.

title: Relates to the use of a standardized immunization exemption form
abstract: Directs the use of a standardized immunization exemption form.

title: Relates to service contracts for accidental damages from handling and power surges
abstract: Relates to service contracts for accidental damages from handling and power surges.

title: Relates to the availability of buprenorphine in opioid treatment programs
abstract: Requires facilities that provide treatment for substance use disorders to have at least one practitioner qualified to administer or prescribe buprenorphine to individuals in their care with substance use disorders related to opioids.

title: Allows delivery of an application for an absentee ballot to the board of elections through and on the day of the election
abstract: Allows delivery of an application for an absentee ballot to the board of elections through and on the day of the election.

title: Relates to requests for proposals for voting machines
abstract: Relates to requests for proposals for voting machines and contracts for the purchase of voting machines or systems.

title: Allows for justices to reside in any town, village or city within the same assembly district as the court such justice serves
abstract: Allows for justices to reside in any town, village or city contained in whole or in part within the same assembly district as the court such justice serves.

title: Prohibits interactive computer service providers from knowingly developing or promoting content that is dangerous or injurious
abstract: Prohibits interactive computer service providers from knowingly promoting content to a targeted user and with the intention of developing the content, cause the user extreme emotional harm, physical injury or financial injury.

title: Requires hospitals and medical facilities to notify nursing homes or assisted living facilities of a positive COVID-19 test result for a resident of such nursing home or assisted living facility
abstract: Requires hospitals and medical facilities to notify nursing homes or assisted living facilities upon receipt of a positive COVID-19 test result for a resident of such nursing home or assisted living facility; provides penalties for violations.

title: Relates to the appointment for agricultural representation on the state fire prevention and building code council
abstract: Provides for the appointment of a member from an agricultural advocacy organization in the state for agricultural representation on the state fire prevention and building code council.

title: Relates to pension income and tax abatement for rent-controlled and rent regulated property occupied by senior citizens or persons with disabilities
abstract: Relates to pension income and tax abatement for rent-controlled and rent regulated property occupied by senior citizens or persons with disabilities.

title: Requires managed care providers that provide coverage for prescription drugs to provide coverage for home delivery of any covered prescription drug
abstract: Requires managed care providers that provide coverage for prescription drugs to provide coverage for home delivery of any covered prescription by any non-mail-order retail pharmacy in the managed care provider network.

title: Requires the use of gender-neutral terms in law
abstract: Requires the use of gender-neutral terms in law.

title: Moves the date of the presidential primary to the same date as the state primaries
abstract: Moves the date of the presidential primary to the same date as the state primaries.

title: Requires registration of general aviation aircrafts
abstract: Requires registration of general aviation aircrafts; aircrafts used for civil aviation; issuance of certificates of registration; proof of insurance.

title: Relates to the proper venue for an impounding organization to file a petition for a security
abstract: Relates to the proper venue for an impounding organization to file a petition for a security to be paid by the owner of a seized animal currently in the care of such organization.

title: Relates to grievance procedures for proceedings involving the New York City Housing Authority
abstract: Requires the New York City Housing Authority to create policies regarding administrative procedures that conform with Title 42 Sections 13661-13662 of the United States Code and any relevant guidance developed by the Office of Public and Indian Housing of the United States Department of Housing and Urban Development with respect to proceedings involving decisions of the Authority.

title: Relates to requiring mental health practitioners to receive training on substance use disorder, the specific needs of the substance use disorder community and co-occurring disorders
abstract: Requires mental health practitioners to receive training on substance use disorder, the specific needs of the substance use disorder community and co-occurring disorders.

title: Adds a school business official to the Teachers' Retirement System (TRS) Board
abstract: Adds a school business official to the Teachers' Retirement System (TRS) Board.

title: Requires the publication of the number of veterans on certain housing waiting lists
abstract: Requires the publication of the number of veterans or surviving spouses of veterans on certain housing waiting lists.

title: Requires return of a security deposit by a landlord within 30 days unless the landlord gives written notice of retention for legally authorized cause
abstract: Requires a landlord to return to a tenant the full security deposit within thirty days of the surrender of the premises by such tenant unless the landlord provides such tenant with a written statement listing the reasons for the retention of any portion of the deposit; sets forth particular situations for which the landlord may retain such security deposit; renders the landlord liable for treble damages for any violation.

title: Relates to requiring helicopters be equipped with flight recorders, cockpit voice recorders and terrain awareness and warning systems
abstract: Requires helicopters be equipped with flight recorders, cockpit voice recorders and terrain awareness and warning systems.

title: Increases the fine for tractor-trailer combinations that park on residential streets overnight
abstract: Provides for increased fines for overnight parking of tractor-trailer combinations, tractors, truck trailers and semi-trailers on residential streets in the city of New York.

title: Establishes a real property tax exemption for veterans with a 100 percent service connected disability
abstract: Establishes a real property tax exemption for the primary residence of veterans with a 100 percent service connected disability.

title: Relates to willful neglect of real property prevention
abstract: Relates to willful neglect of real property prevention.

title: Requires that internet providers who provide service in a municipality provide basic internet service to each residential dwelling or residential dwelling unit in that municipality at no cost
abstract: Requires that internet providers who provide service in a municipality provide basic internet service to each residential dwelling or residential dwelling unit in that municipality at no cost.

title: Relates to the rights of parties involved in foreclosure actions
abstract: Relates to the rights of parties involved in foreclosure actions; relates to the effect of discontinuance of actions based upon certain instruments related to real property.

title: Relates to paintless dent repair rate filing
abstract: Relates to paintless dent repair rate filing.

title: Relates to health care proxy information on driver's licenses
abstract: Provides space on a driver's license for health care proxy information.

title: Relates to prohibiting the use of funds, financial incentives or subsidies where facilities or property are used primarily for e-commerce storage and transfers, or the facilitation thereof
abstract: Relates to prohibiting the use of funds, financial incentives or subsidies where facilities or property are used primarily for e-commerce storage and transfers, or the facilitation thereof.

title: Relates to requiring qualification-based criteria for awarding certain contracts for services
abstract: Relates to requiring qualification-based criteria for awarding certain contracts for services.

title: Restricts individuals from owning a companion animal after being convicted of certain crimes involving animals
abstract: Restricts individuals from owning a companion animal after being convicted of certain crimes involving animals.

title: Relates to the powers and duties of the advisory council of the justice center for the protection of people with special needs
abstract: Relates to the powers and duties of the advisory council of the justice center for the protection of people with special needs; adds additional duties relating to investigations of allegations of abuse and neglect.

title: Creates a distinctive license plate for veterans honoring Borinqueneers
abstract: Creates a distinctive license plate for veterans honoring Borinqueneers; defines "veteran" as a person who is a resident of this state, who served in the armed forces of the United States, and was honorably discharged from the armed forces, or has a qualifying condition, as defined in section one of the veterans' services law, and has received a discharge other than bad conduct or dishonorable from such service, or is a discharged LGBT veteran, as defined in section one of the veterans' services law, and has received a discharge other than bad conduct or dishonorable from such service.

title: Restricts electioneering on the polling place property
abstract: Restricts electioneering on polling place property.

title: Reduces the number of hours in a work week to thirty-two for employers with at least five hundred employees
abstract: Reduces the number of hours in a work week to thirty-two for employers with at least five hundred employees who are not part of a collective bargaining agreement.

title: Requires colleges and universities to provide all incoming and current students with information relating to suicide prevention and resources
abstract: Requires public and private colleges and universities to provide all incoming and current students with information relating to suicide prevention and resources available to them on campus.

title: Requires fashion sellers to be accountable to standardized environmental and social due diligence policies, and establishes a fashion remediation fund
abstract: Requires fashion sellers to be accountable to standardized environmental and social due diligence policies; establishes a fashion remediation fund for the purpose of implementing one or more environmental benefit projects or labor remediation projects that directly and verifiably benefit the workers and communities directly impacted, to the extent practicable, at the location the injury has occurred.

title: Relates to annual teacher and principal evaluations
abstract: Relates to annual teacher and principal evaluations; provides that no school district shall be eligible for an apportionment of general support for public schools appropriated in excess of the amount apportioned such school district unless it has either adopted a plan for the annual professional performance review of its classroom teachers and building principals or has submitted documentation demonstrating that it has fully implemented the standards and procedures for conducting annual teacher and principal evaluations.

title: Expands the exemption provided to professional journalists and newscasters from contempt to include employment or association with a web log
abstract: Expands the exemption provided to professional journalists and newscasters from contempt to include employment or association with a web log; defines web log as a website or webpage that contains an online journal containing news, comments and offers hyperlinks provided by the writer.

title: Permits municipalities the local option of providing a tax exemption to National Guard members and reservists
abstract: Provides a tax exemption for U.S. military reservists and members of the National Guard.

title: Relates to the harassment of certain employees of a transit agency or authority
abstract: Relates to the harassment of certain employees of a transit agency or authority whose operation is authorized by New York state or any of its political subdivisions.

title: Requires that any disposition of land or buildings by the New York City Housing Authority be subject to and comply with the provisions of New York City's Uniform Land Use Review Procedure
abstract: Requires that any disposition of land or buildings by the New York City Housing Authority be subject to and comply with the provisions of New York City's Uniform Land Use Review Procedure.

title: Extends the boundaries of the Woodmere fire district to include the village of Woodsburgh
abstract: Extends the boundaries of the Woodmere fire district to include the village of Woodsburgh.

title: Authorizes tuition assistance program awards for students enrolled in short-term credential programs offered by certain public institutions
abstract: Authorizes tuition assistance program awards for students enrolled in short-term credential programs offered by certain public institutions.

title: Establishes a credit against income tax for service dogs
abstract: Establishes a credit against income tax for service dogs.

title: Establishes the city of White Plains industrial development agency and provides for its functions, powers, and duties
abstract: Establishes the city of White Plains industrial development agency and provides for its functions, powers, and duties.

title: Subtracts from federal adjusted gross income qualified transportation fringe benefits
abstract: Subtracts from federal adjusted gross income qualified transportation fringe benefits.

title: Establishes a pilot program for the field testing of mobile phones and portable devices for the county of Westchester
abstract: Establishes optional pilot programs for the county of Westchester, for local police departments to use electronic scanning devices to determine whether or not the operator of a vehicle was using a mobile phone or portable electronic device near the time of an accident or collision.

title: Precludes inadmissible statements made by defendants because of false information and requires data collection of recorded interrogations
abstract: Precludes inadmissible statements made by defendants because of false facts about evidence or because of a statement that undermines the reliability of the defendant's statement; requires data collection and analysis by the division of criminal justice services of recorded interrogations.

title: Requires child restraint systems to be equipped with sensors
abstract: Requires retailers to equip child restraint systems with sensors to notify drivers if a child has been left in the car.

title: Allows a claimant who voluntarily separates from employment during the COVID-19 emergency to receive unemployment benefits
abstract: Allows a claimant who voluntarily separates from employment during the COVID-19 emergency to receive unemployment benefits.

title: Permits tenants heat repair expense to be set off against rent
abstract: Allows tenants the right to offset rent with payments made for the repair or service maintenance of an oil fired or other heating device where reasonable efforts were made to notify the landlord of the heating failure, the agency used is reasonably engaged in the business of making such repairs and an itemized bill for such service is provided.

title: Relates to the unauthorized or unlicensed practice of massage therapy
abstract: Provides that neither the unauthorized or unlicensed practice of massage therapy, nor aiding or abetting of unauthorized or unlicensed practice of massage therapy, shall be deemed as the crime of unauthorized practice.

title: Provides increased penalties and education for hazing, underage drinking and drug use within athletic teams, fraternities and sororities at college campuses
abstract: Requires colleges to educate the campus community on bias-related crime, hazing, underage drinking and illegal drug use; expands authority of colleges to regulate conduct by college and student government organizations and clubs, athletic teams and clubs, alumni organizations, fraternities, sororities, and any other organization that has access to and use of the college facilities; requires colleges to adopt rules prohibiting hazing, underage drinking and illegal drug use; requires colleges to inform incoming students of and to train residence hall staff in the prohibitions against hazing, underage drinking and illegal drug use; requires colleges to establish penalties for hazing, underage drinking and illegal drug use.

title: Relates to interest rates on judgments
abstract: Relates to interest rates on judgments.

title: Relates to recurring contributions solicited by a candidate, political campaign, political committee, party committee, or not-for-profit or for-profit entity
abstract: Provides that entities soliciting a recurring contribution to a political campaign, political committee, party committee, or not-for-profit or for-profit entity shall receive the affirmative consent of the contributor at the time of arrangement of the recurring contribution; provides for refund of recurring contributions; provides penalties for violations.

title: Relates to the transparency and quality of care of operators of adult care facilities
abstract: Relates to the transparency and quality of care of operators of adult care facilities; requires certain applicants for adult care facilities to provide an opportunity for public comment on the application.

title: Exempts certain car-sharing organizations from the supplemental tax on passenger car rentals outside of the metropolitan commuter transportation district
abstract: Exempts certain non-profit car-sharing organizations from the supplemental tax on passenger car rentals outside of the metropolitan commuter transportation district.

title: Relates to the use of locomotive horns at private highway-rail grade crossings; repealer
abstract: Relates to the use of locomotive horns at private highway-rail grade crossings; establishes use of locomotive horn in the locomotive engineer's sole judgment, is appropriate in order to prevent imminent injury, death, or property damage.

title: Expands eligibility for the tuition assistance program
abstract: Expands eligibility for the tuition assistance program by restoring eligibility to graduate students; makes optional semesters, quarters or terms eligible for awards.

title: Designates certain streets in the city of Newburgh as state highways
abstract: Designates Broadway and Lake Street in the city of Newburgh as state highways.

title: Authorizes municipalities in the county of Orange to add unpaid housing code violation penalties, costs and fines to such municipalities' annual tax levy
abstract: Authorizes municipalities in the county of Orange to add unpaid housing code violation penalties, costs and fines to such municipalities' annual tax levy in accordance with applicable law.

title: Extends to commercial tenants the right to seek a stay of the issuance of a warrant in a proceeding to recover the possession of premises in the city of New York
abstract: Extends to commercial tenants the right to seek a stay of the issuance of a warrant and a stay of any execution to collect the costs of the proceeding in a proceeding to recover the possession of premises in the city of New York.

title: Authorizes treatment of workers' compensation injuries by an occupational therapy assistant and a physical therapist assistant
abstract: Authorizes treatment of workers' compensation injuries by an occupational therapy assistant and a physical therapist assistant.

title: Exempts certain first responders from vehicle registration fees
abstract: Exempts certain first responders from vehicle registration fees.

title: Creates a revolving loan fund authority for the purpose of building renewable energy storage systems scaled to function as microgrids to power housing owned by the New York city housing authority
abstract: Creates a revolving loan fund through the New York state energy research and development authority for the purpose of building renewable energy storage systems scaled to function as microgrids to power housing owned by the New York city housing authority.

title: Establishes an energy-related public utility mass real property central assessment program
abstract: Establishes an energy-related public utility mass real property central assessment program.

title: Relates to the discovery provisions applicable to juvenile delinquency proceedings in family court; repealer
abstract: Relates to the discovery provisions applicable to juvenile delinquency proceedings in family court with regard to the timing of discovery, disclosure prior to certain guilty pleas, DNA evidence, court orders, and the admissibility of discovery.

title: Waives certain fees for distinctive "September eleventh, two thousand one remembrance" license plates for certain first responders
abstract: Waives certain fees for distinctive "September eleventh, two thousand one remembrance" license plates for certain first responders.

title: Relates to certification of inspectors of motor vehicles
abstract: Relates to certification of inspectors of motor vehicles and the standards of competency and fitness they shall meet in order to be certified.

title: Relates to property tax exemptions for nonprofit organizations
abstract: Relates to property tax exemptions for nonprofit organizations; allows for nonprofit organizations to file an application for an exemption with the assessor no later than the taxable status date applicable to the following year's assessment roll where such nonprofit organization has purchased property after the taxable status date but prior to the levy of taxes.

title: Relates to second felony drug offenders; repealer
abstract: Relates to second felony drug offenders.

title: Authorizes the issuance of distinctive legion of valor license plates
abstract: Authorizes the issuance of distinctive legion of valor license plates for individuals who have received the army medal of honor, navy medal of honor, air force medal of honor, army distinguished service cross, navy cross, coast guard cross, or air force cross.

title: Increases the offense classification for certain assault offenses regarding police officers and peace officers
abstract: Increases the offense classification for certain assault offenses regarding police officers and peace officers.

title: Relates to establishing a crisis intervention team program
abstract: Relates to establishing a crisis intervention demonstration program.

title: Establishes a threshold for the amount of work needed to be performed by a preferred source which is an approved charitable non-profit-making agency for the blind; provides for the repeal upon expiration thereof
abstract: Requires that when the state is purchasing commodities and such commodities are available and purchased from approved charitable non-profit-making agencies for the blind, the preferred source shall perform fifty percent or more of the work.

title: Prohibits requiring parents or caretakers to earn a minimum wage or work a minimum number of hours to be eligible for child care assistance
abstract: Prohibits requiring parents or caretakers to earn a minimum wage or work a minimum number of hours to be eligible for child care assistance.

title: Requires stretch limousines to be retired from use after ten years from manufacture or the accumulation of three hundred fifty thousand miles
abstract: Requires stretch limousines to be retired from use after ten years from manufacture or the accumulation of three hundred fifty thousand miles, whichever comes first.

title: Relates to taxation of state correctional facility properties for schools
abstract: Relates to taxation of state correctional facility properties for schools.

title: Honoring The Clarence Central School District's Family Support Center upon the occasion of its designation as recipient of the Organization of the Year Award by the Clarence Chamber of Commerce on March 9, 2023
Relates to the taxation of property owned by a cooperative corporation
abstract: Relates to the taxation of property owned by a cooperative corporation.

title: Relates to enacting the "New York emergency expedited temporary work permit act"
abstract: Enacts the "New York emergency expedited temporary work permit act" to allow asylum seekers to apply for and be granted temporary work permits while their federal immigration status is being determined.

title: Includes the North Greenbush Public Library with libraries eligible for the financing of projects through the dormitory authority
abstract: Includes the North Greenbush Public Library with libraries eligible for the financing of projects through the dormitory authority.

title: Relates to the automatic expungement of records of arrest
abstract: Provides for the automatic expungement of records of arrest in certain situations.

title: Requires certain public schools in New York city to offer Halal food options during lunch
abstract: Requires public schools in any city with a population over one million to offer Halal food options during lunch.

title: Congratulating Paul C. Landers upon the occasion of his retirement after 40 years of devoted service to the field of disabilities services
Commemorating the observance of the 38th Annual Martin Luther King, Jr. Day in the State of New York, on January 16, 2023
Relates to certain recreational contests in establishments with licenses to sell alcoholic beverages for consumption on premise
abstract: Allows any person who holds a license to sell alcoholic beverages for consumption on premises to allow players to engage in certain recreational contests.

title: Establishes a program for certain elderly inmates
abstract: Establishes a program for adults over fifty who are under community supervision or who will be released from a state correctional facility.

title: Relates to crimes involving the death or serious physical injury of an employee
abstract: Relates to crimes involving the death or serious physical injury of an employee; defines employee; updates the effectiveness of such provisions.

title: Establishes the crimes of spoofing a police agency telephone number in the first and second degrees as a class E felony and a class A misdemeanor
abstract: Establishes the crimes of spoofing a police agency telephone number in the first and second degrees as a class E felony and a class A misdemeanor.

title: Relates to allowing courts to consider a principal's threat to public safety when determining bail
abstract: Allows courts to consider whether a principal poses a current physical danger to the safety of any crime victim, person or the community when determining bail.

title: Provides for insurance coverage of comprehensive annual medical examinations for firefighters
abstract: Provides for insurance coverage of comprehensive annual medical examinations for firefighters due to their increased risk for cancer and cancer-related diseases.

title: Clarifies that individuals have the ability to vote by absentee ballot where their maximum sentence of imprisonment has expired
abstract: Clarifies that individuals have the ability to vote by absentee ballot in certain elections where their maximum sentence of imprisonment has expired.

title: Authorizes a study by the department of corrections and community supervision pertaining to the treatment of aging prison populations
abstract: Authorizes a study by the department of corrections and community supervision pertaining to the treatment of aging prison populations.

title: Honoring John O'Hare upon the occasion of his designation as recipient of the Volunteer of the Year Award by the Clarence Chamber of Commerce on March 9, 2023
Requires health insurers to provide coverage for opioid antagonists and devices
abstract: Requires health insurers to provide coverage for opioid antagonists and devices.

title: Authorizes the issuance of licenses and non-driver identification cards containing a Lifetime Liberty Pass distinguishing mark
abstract: Authorizes the issuance of licenses and non-driver identification cards containing a Lifetime Liberty Pass distinguishing mark.

title: Authorizes the city of New York to provide for a residential parking permit system
abstract: Authorizes the city of New York to provide for a residential parking permit system to reduce hazards and pollution levels.

title: Honoring Palmer Vineyards upon the occasion of its designation as a Gold Medalist by the New York Wine and Grape Foundation on July 12, 2022
Relates to establishing the online consumer protection act
abstract: Relates to establishing the online consumer protection act; defines terms; provides that an advertising network shall post clear and conspicuous notice on the home page of its own website about its privacy policy and its data collection and use practices related to its advertising delivery activities; makes related provisions.

title: Requires employers to make a conditional offer of employment before inquiring about any criminal convictions of a prospective employee
abstract: Relates to unlawful discriminatory practices; requires employers to make a conditional offer of employment before inquiring about any criminal convictions of a prospective employee.

title: Exempts political subdivisions from the imposition of the metropolitan commuter transportation mobility tax
abstract: Exempts political subdivisions from the imposition of the metropolitan commuter transportation mobility tax.

title: Provides for statewide video arraignments
abstract: Provides that the court may, in its discretion, dispense with the defendant's personal appearance at an arraignment and conduct an electronic arraignment.

title: Commemorating the 200th Anniversary of the Town of Alden, New York
Establishes the municipal severe storm relief fund for Rockaway, Queens to be administered by the division of homeland security
abstract: Relates to establishing the municipal severe storm relief fund for Rockaway, Queens to be administered by the division of homeland security and emergency services for damages that occurred as a result of Hurricane Sandy which caused damage from October twenty-ninth through November third, two thousand twelve.

title: Relates to capital program plans
abstract: Relates to capital program plans; provides that the MTA shall submit to the MTA capital program review board two capital program plans on or before January 31, 2029 and every fifth year thereafter; provides that all future capital program plans be submitted January 31 of the required years.

title: Requires contracts with home care service providers to provide sufficient resources to ensure compensation to a qualified workforce providing high quality care
abstract: Requires contracts with home care service providers to provide sufficient resources to ensure compensation to a qualified workforce providing high quality care; authorizes the commissioner of health to establish a program to provide loans, through the dormitory authority, to home care facilities to finance health care reform efforts.

title: Establishes and authorizes telepharmacy in this state
abstract: Establishes and authorizes telepharmacy in this state; defines terms; creates telepharmacy satellite consultation sites and telepharmacy in hospitals; authorizes the filling of prescriptions at remote sites connected to central pharmacies via computer link, videolink and audiolink; makes exceptions.

title: Establishes the volunteer firefighters of New York higher education learning plan
abstract: Establishes the volunteer firefighters of New York higher education learning plan.

title: Enacts the New York State Iran divestment act; repealer
abstract: Enacts the New York State Iran divestment act; provides for sanctions against the financial and energy sectors of Iran unless a duly executed treaty is approved by two-thirds of the United States Senate.

title: Requires a local social services district to accept or deny an application for public assistance no later than thirty days after the date of the application; repealer
abstract: Requires a local social services district to accept or deny an application for public assistance as soon as possible but no later than thirty days after the date of the application.

title: Relates to the enactment of the student journalist free speech act
abstract: Enacts the student journalist free speech act to protect student speech at educational institutions unless such speech is libelous, an invasion of privacy, or incites students to commit an unlawful act, violate school policies, or to materially and substantially disrupt the orderly operation of the school.

title: Relates to the effectiveness of certain curriculum requirements curriculum related to human trafficking awareness to be included in alcohol training awareness programs
