title: Provides for the revocation of a person's driver's license who has been convicted of operating a vessel while under the influence of alcohol or drugs
abstract: Provides for the revocation of a person's driver's license who has been convicted of operating a vessel while under the influence of alcohol or drugs.

title: Relates to the non-therapeutic use of antimicrobial agents in animals
abstract: Imposes restrictions on non-therapeutic use of antimicrobial agents in animals in the absence of any clinical sign of disease in the animals.

title: Enacts safety requirements in stretch limousines including anti-intrusion bars and window break tools
abstract: Enacts safety requirements in stretch limousines including anti-intrusion bars and window break tools; reduces occupancy of omnibuses for purposes of being equipped with fire extinguishers and additional mirrors.

title: Establishes the youth in progress advisory board for adolescents in foster care
abstract: Establishes the youth in progress advisory board and regional teams for adolescents in foster care to provide mentorship of youths in foster care; requires reporting.

title: Relates to designating crimes against public protection professionals
abstract: Enacts the Lieutenant Alison Russo-Elling crimes against public protection professionals act; designates certain crimes against public protection professionals; enhances penalties.

title: Requires the use of canines for contraband screening at correctional facilities housing one hundred or more incarcerated individuals
abstract: Requires the use of canines for contraband screening at correctional facilities housing one hundred or more incarcerated individuals.

title: Relates to state assistance for food and vet expenses for guide dogs, hearing dogs and service dogs of individuals qualifying for social services; repealer
abstract: Relates to state assistance for food and vet expenses for guide dogs, hearing dogs and service dogs of individuals qualifying for social services; requires regulations set an amount of no less than $50 a month; clarifies that service dogs do not have to be certified to qualify for such benefits.

title: Establishes a coordinated law enforcement adult rescue "teal alert" for missing adults
abstract: Establishes a coordinated law enforcement adult rescue "teal alert" for missing adults; provides that local law enforcement agencies notify the division of criminal justice services about missing adults; provides that such division shall issue an alert about such missing adult.

title: Relates to imposing term limits for members of the assembly and senate of New York
abstract: Provides that members of the assembly and senate of New York shall not serve more than six two year terms in either house.

title: Relates to conviction sealing for eligible youth
abstract: Provides that eligible youth who were not given youthful offender status by the court be eligible for conviction sealing.

title: Ensures that the provisions governing liquor licenses are consistent with respect to public interest factors
abstract: Ensures that the provisions governing liquor licenses are consistent with respect to public interest factors.

title: Relates to the establishment of the water-based fire protection licensure act
abstract: Establishes the water-based fire protection licensure act, setting forth licensure requirements for contractors engaged in the business of the layout, installing, repairing, inspecting, testing, or maintaining of water-based fire protection systems and components.

title: Creates privacy standards for electronic health products and services
abstract: Creates privacy standards for electronic health products and services; requires consent to be given for the collection and/or sharing of personal health information or other personal data.

title: Directs the department of economic development to conduct a study regarding increasing public access to museums in New York state
abstract: Directs the department of economic development, in consultation with various departments and offices, to conduct a study regarding increasing public access to museums in New York state; directs a report on such study to be submitted no later than one year after the effective date.

title: Relates to the requirement for policyholders to provide 30 days notice to withdraw from the state insurance fund
abstract: Relates to the requirement for policyholders to provide notice to withdraw from the state insurance fund.

title: Establishes a central business district toll exemption for certain police officers
abstract: Establishes a central business district toll exemption for police officers employed in a police force of a city with a population of one million or more.

title: Directs the public service commission to prohibit the attachment of wireless equipment or any other like attachments to existing utility poles in certain circumstances
abstract: Directs the public service commission to prohibit the attachment of wireless equipment or any other like attachments to existing utility poles in certain circumstances.

title: Extends the solar electric generating system tax abatement
abstract: Extends the expiration of the solar electric generating system tax abatement.

title: Relates to establishing an electoral voting system for electing the governor, lieutenant-governor, comptroller and attorney general
abstract: Establishes an electoral voting system for electing the governor, lieutenant-governor, comptroller and attorney general.

title: Congratulating Sophie Pollack upon the occasion of capturing the 185-pound Division wrestling title at the first ever NYSPHSAA Girls State Wrestling Invitational
Requires a defendant who causes the death of a person with children due to driving while intoxicated or impaired to pay for child support
abstract: Requires a defendant who causes the death of a person with children due to driving while intoxicated or impaired to pay for child support of such children until they reach the age of 18 years old.

title: Relates to the ability of an individual collecting unemployment to obtain part-time work
abstract: Relates to allowing claimants collecting unemployment to obtain part-time work without losing their unemployment benefits.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim March 12, 2023 as Working Moms Day in the State of New York
Relates to advertising for bids and offers; letting of contracts
abstract: Relates to advertising for bids and offers; letting of contracts; raises the aggregate amount for sealed bids above the current levels for commodities from $20,000 to $80,000 and public works from $35,000 to $125,000.

title: Clarifies requirements for acknowledgments, proofs, oaths and affirmations without the state
abstract: Clarifies requirements for acknowledgements, proofs, oaths and affirmations without the state.

title: Creates city university of New York center for excellence in urban education to enhance the quality of teaching in public schools in N.Y. city
abstract: Creates city university of New York center for excellence in urban education to enhance the quality of teaching in public schools in NYC; establishes the regents public school teacher loan forgiveness program to allocate awards annually to teachers who agree to teach public school in an area of New York state designated by the board of regents as having a shortage of public school teachers.

title: Relates to cannabinoid hemp retail sales and retailers
abstract: Relates to cannabinoid hemp retail sales and retailers; makes technical changes to the definition of THC; provides specific requirements for labeling of cannabinoid hemp products.

title: Establishes a direct support professional worker registry
abstract: Establishes a direct support professional worker registry of persons who have successfully completed a direct support professional worker education or training program approved by the commissioner or the accrediting body of other states or federal authorities, including the military.

title: Permits voting at any polling place within the same county
abstract: Permits voting at any polling place within the same county or, within the city of New York, polling place within the city of New York as a voter is registered.

title: Provides benefits to Metro-North employees involved in or who witness a serious injury or fatality of another person in the course of an assigned duty
abstract: Provides benefits to Metro-North employees involved in or who witness a serious injury or fatality of another person in the course of an assigned duty.

title: Enacts the "American made flag act" to require that American flags purchased for use by the state government be made in the United States
abstract: Enacts the "American made flag act" to require that American flags purchased for use by the state government be made in the United States.

title: Repeals sections of law relating to private roads
abstract: Relates to private roads; repeals various provisions relating to the application for the creation of a private road.

title: Exempts daycare facility and childcare facility employers from providing for COVID-19 sick leave
abstract: Exempts daycare facility and childcare facility employers from providing for COVID-19 sick leave.

title: Makes life imprisonment without parole mandatory for defendants convicted of murder in the first degree and the victim is a police officer
abstract: Makes life imprisonment without parole mandatory for defendants convicted of murder in the first degree and the victim is a police officer.

title: Establishes additional penalties for conducting unlawful cannabis business
abstract: Establishes additional penalties for firms, partnerships, associations, corporations, and retailers for conducting unlawful cannabis business.

title: Relates to qualifying offenses for pre-trial detention
abstract: Relates to qualifying offenses for pre-trial detention; adds class B felonies under article two hundred twenty of the penal law as qualifying offenses.

title: Relates to the definition of caregiver for purposes of authorizing criminal history checks
abstract: Removes references to the number of hours of care provided by a caregiver each week from the definition of caregiver for purposes of authorizing criminal history checks.

title: Allows alcoholic beverages as prizes in any game of chance
abstract: Allows alcoholic beverages as prizes in any game of chance.

title: Exempts sales of bottled water from sales and use taxes
abstract: Exempts retail sales of bottled water from the imposition of sales and use taxes.

title: Relates to tax on sales of motor fuel and petroleum products; and repeals certain provisions of law relating thereto
abstract: Relates to tax on sales of motor fuel and petroleum products; repeals certain provisions of law relating thereto.

title: Decriminalizes possession of controlled substances, establishes the drug decriminalization task force; repealer
abstract: Eliminates criminal and civil penalties for possession of controlled substances; establishes the drug decriminalization task force to develop recommendations for reforming state laws, regulations and practices so that they align with the stated goal of treating substance use disorder as a disease, rather than a criminal behavior.

title: Relates to including traffic enforcement agents and city marshals within the category of persons protected while performing their lawful duties
abstract: Includes traffic enforcement agents or city marshals within the category of persons protected while performing their lawful duties along with peace officers, police officers, firefighters and EMTs; makes technical corrections.

title: Allows the establishment of continuing eligible lists when appropriate
abstract: Allows the civil service department or a municipal commission to establish continuing eligible lists when appropriate for any class of positions filled through open-competitive examination.

title: Relates to wrongful refusal of admission to and ejection from places of public entertainment and amusement
abstract: Includes sporting events within the definition of places of public entertainment and amusement for purposes of wrongful refusal of admission to and ejection from places of public entertainment and amusement.

title: Directs the department of health to conduct a study on opening three new veterans nursing homes in New York state and providing for the repeal of such provisions upon expiration thereof
abstract: Directs the department of health to conduct a study on opening three new veterans nursing homes in New York state; provides for the repeal of such provisions upon expiration thereof.

title: Allows brewery supply stores to sell New York state labelled beer for off-premises consumption
abstract: Allows brewery supply stores to sell New York state labelled beer for off-premises consumption.

title: Establishes the New York state violence in mass media research program
abstract: Establishes the New York state violence in mass media research program to study the effects of mass media reporting on violent crimes.

title: Relates to the examination of voting machines by the state board of elections
abstract: Authorizes the state board of elections to reject the use of voting machines or systems on the grounds that such machines or systems are not proper, safe, or secure.

title: Relates to notification and hearings for proposed construction or removal of bicycle lanes or racks
abstract: Relates to notification and hearings for proposed construction or removal of bicycle lanes or racks; requires a presentation at a public hearing when the department of transportations proposes to construct or remove a bicycle lane or rack; defines terms.

title: Creates the offense of operating as a major firearms trafficker
abstract: Establishes the class A-I felony of operating as a major firearms trafficker.

title: Relates to pre-arranged for-hire vehicle transportation services and universal design and accessibility
abstract: Relates to pre-arranged for-hire vehicle transportation services and the maximization of universal design and accessibility by persons with disabilities.

title: Creates a small business electric energy tax credit
abstract: Creates a small business electric energy tax credit; specifies that the amount of credit shall be equal to the product of $0.02 per kilowatt hour; sets limit of no more than 19 full-time employees in New York state; determines that if the business is located at the primary residence of a sole proprietor, the business is not eligible for the tax credit.

title: Relates to a state agency adopting emergency regulations
abstract: Requires a state agency to get approval from the senate and the assembly prior to adopting or readopting a rule on an emergency basis unless such rule is necessary on an emergency basis for the preservation of the public health, safety and general welfare of the public.

title: Relates to the obligations of a physician upon the termination of a relationship with a patient
abstract: Relates to the obligations of a physician upon the termination of a relationship with a patient; requires the physician to provide thirty days notice to the patient, to continue to provide care and prescriptions to the patient, and to provide referrals and copies of patient records.

title: Enhances the assisted outpatient treatment program and eliminates the expiration and repeal of Kendra's Law
abstract: Enhances the assisted outpatient treatment program; eliminates the expiration and repeal of Kendra's Law.

title: Relates to establishing certain requirements for the dormitory prior to such authority issuing bonds and notes to finance certain projects
abstract: Relates to establishing certain requirements for the dormitory authority of the state of New York prior to such authority issuing bonds and notes to finance projects for a private institution or organization.

title: Relates to including private, religious or denominational educational institutions to the "dignity for all students act"
abstract: Relates to including private, religious or denominational educational institutions in the "dignity for all students act".

title: Gives preference to accredited law enforcement agencies when awarding grant funds
abstract: Provides that the division of criminal justice services shall give preference when awarding grant funds to any law enforcement agency to law enforcement agencies who are accredited by the law enforcement agency accreditation council.

title: Relates to including statistics on childbirth complications, fetal loss, and other injuries in information for maternity patients
abstract: Includes statistics on childbirth complications, fetal losses, other injuries and other maternity outcomes in information for maternity patients.

title: Establishes a reproductive health services training grant program
abstract: Establishes a reproductive health services training and education grant program to train licensed providers and interns or residents who are employed by a hospital or otherwise enrolled in an accredited graduate medical education program in the performance of abortion and related reproductive health services; establishes the reproductive health training and education fund.

title: Relates to the operation of bingo games
abstract: Authorizes housing authorities to operate bingo games; adds guests invited by residents of any apartment, condominium or cooperative complex, housing authority, retirement community, or other group residential complex or facility to the scope of application; allows games to be conducted two days per week; makes related provisions.

title: Relates to requiring insurers insuring property in floodplains to include damages done by wave action or windblown waves
abstract: Requires insurers insuring property in floodplains to include damages done by wave action or windblown waves and make available to all insureds who reside in single family homes in a floodplain homeowners insurance covering such damage.

title: Enacts the Restrict Insurrectionists from Office Taking (RIOT) Act
abstract: Prohibits a person convicted of rebellion or insurrection against the authority of the United States or the laws thereof under 18 U.S.C. Section 2383 from holding civil office in the state.

title: Relates to subjecting the Caumsett State Historic Park Preserve and Planting Fields Arboretum State Historic Park to taxation for all purposes
abstract: Relates to subjecting the Caumsett State Historic Park Preserve in the county of Suffolk, and Planting Fields Arboretum State Historic Park in the county of Nassau to taxation for all purposes.

title: Authorizes the Hamburg Central School District to utilize certain payments related to video lottery gaming facilities to provide increased support to public schools
abstract: Authorizes the Hamburg Central School District to utilize certain payments related to video lottery gaming facilities to provide increased support to public schools; authorizes such school district in which a video lottery gaming facility is located to receive payments to increase support for public schools.

title: Relates to the approval of reimbursement methodologies for tuition and maintenance
abstract: Establishes that tuition rates shall grow by a percentage equal to the general support for public schools appropriation provided to schools.

title: Provides for the payment of retirement benefits to certain members of the New York state employees retirement system
abstract: Provides for the payment of retirement benefits to members of the New York state employees retirement system who reentered service after retiring before January 1, 1980, pursuant to chapter 666 of the laws of 1990.

title: Relates to falsely filing an extreme risk protection order
abstract: Establishes the crime of falsely filing an extreme risk protection order to be punishable as a class E felony.

title: Prohibits certain borrowing arrangements
abstract: Prohibits certain borrowing arrangements; relates to the authorization for the contracting of debt; relates to the manner by which payments are appropriated and paid.

title: Relates to the establishment and the reporting of residential water cost indexes
abstract: Requires the public service commission to develop a formula for the calculation of a residential water cost index; requires each water-works corporation and municipal water system serving one thousand customers or more to calculate and submit to the public service commission its residential water cost index; requires the public service commission to publish a report on the residential water cost index of each applicable water-works corporation and municipal water system.

title: Requires free education for grades pre-K through undergraduate
abstract: Requires free education for grades pre-K through undergraduate degree programs.

title: Refers individuals to appropriate service providers for substance use disorders
abstract: Refers individuals to appropriate service providers that are able to provide services to such individual within seventy-two hours for substance use disorders.

title: Provides for procedure in filling vacancies in the offices of comptroller and attorney-general
abstract: Provides for procedure in filling vacancies in the offices of comptroller and attorney-general.

title: Replaces the word rape with the term sexual battery
abstract: Replaces the word rape with the term sexual battery.

title: Relates to public awareness and involvement in the thirty by thirty conservation plan
abstract: Requires the department of environmental conservation to post draft strategies and methodology developed no later than July 1, 2024; requires at least one public hearing and posting of the final goal strategies and methodology on such department's website.

title: Includes in false registration the attempt to register as an elector knowing that he or she is not qualified due to lack of U.S. citizenship
abstract: Includes attempting to register as an elector knowing that he or she is not qualified due to lack of U.S. citizenship.

title: Establishes the empire state public bank
abstract: Relates to establishing the empire state public bank to use the state's depository assets to generate additional benefit for the people and the economy of the state.

title: Relates to hate crimes
abstract: Creates a rebuttable presumption of evidence and prima facie case; increases incarceration sentence; requires the court to impose a monetary fine for the cost of prosecution.

title: Enacts the "Save our New York state restaurants act"
abstract: Enacts the "Save our New York state restaurants act" authorizing a sales tax exemption for the sale of food and drink at restaurants and taverns during a specific one week period and grants certain municipalities the option to grant such limited exemption.

title: Establishes the COVID heroes grant program
abstract: Establishes the COVID heroes grant program to award a lump sum pay differential of $2,500 to essential SUNY hospital employees who worked during the COVID-19 state disaster emergency.

title: Enacts the "employment first choice act" to ensure that an individual with developmental disabilities in a nonintegrated setting shall have the right to remain in such a setting under certain circumstances
abstract: Enacts the "employment first choice act" to ensure that an individual with developmental disabilities in a nonintegrated setting shall have the right to remain in such a setting under certain circumstances.

title: Requires the New York city department of buildings to confirm that there are no tenants living at certain properties prior to approving or issuing permits for demolition or substantial alteration
abstract: Requires the New York city department of buildings to confirm that there are no tenants living at certain properties prior to approving or issuing permits for the demolition or the substantial alteration or renovation of such properties.

title: Facilitates compliance with the sex offender registry for offenders without a registerable residence
abstract: Facilitates compliance with the sex offender registry for offenders without a registerable residence; defines "homeless sex offender" and "sex offender registration officer"; makes related provisions.

title: Prohibits employers from discriminating against individuals based on such individual's status as a caregiver
abstract: Prohibits employers from discriminating against individuals based on such individual's status as a caregiver.

title: Relates to exemption from taxation of alterations and improvements to multiple dwellings
abstract: Relates to exemption from taxation of alterations and improvements to multiple dwellings by expanding certain provisions to include cities where the multiple residence law is applicable.

title: Provides a tax credit in the amount of certain fees charged in connection with loans under the federal home loan guarantee program to national guard and reserve vets
abstract: Provides a tax credit in the amount of certain fees charged in connection with loans under the federal home loan guarantee program to national guard and reserve veterans.

title: Relates to requiring the office of victim assistance to notify crime victims of the availability of victim support services
abstract: Requires the office of victim assistance to notify crime victims of the availability of victim support services by providing such victims with a written notice of the availability of statewide programs.

title: Prohibits regional off-track betting corporations from providing items of value exceeding fifteen dollars to certain associates of the corporation
abstract: Prohibits regional off-track betting corporations from providing items of value exceeding fifteen dollars to any board member, officer, or employee of the corporation, any contractor, subcontractor, consultant, or other agent of the corporation, or any spouse, child, sibling or parent of such persons; adds reporting requirements for regional off-track betting corporations.

title: Relates to the application of bail in certain prostitution and labor trafficking cases
abstract: Authorizes courts to order remand or bail in certain prostitution and labor trafficking cases.

title: Requires the governor to meet with the assembly and with the senate once a month to answer questions relating to the state
abstract: Requires the governor to meet with the assembly and with the senate once a month for the purpose of answering questions relating to the strategic direction, financial status and general governance of the state.

title: Authorizes and directs the metropolitan transportation authority to implement a fare refund program for canceled or delayed Long Island Rail Road trains
abstract: Authorizes and directs the metropolitan transportation authority to implement a fare refund program for canceled or delayed Long Island Rail Road trains.

title: Relates to the ability of government agencies in New York to claim copyright protection
abstract: Waives the ability of government agencies in New York to claim copyright protection except where the record reflects artistic, creative or scholarly works of authorship, academic course materials, or scientific or academic research, or if the copyright owner intends to distribute the record of derivative work based on it to the public by sale or other transfer of ownership.

title: Relates to ensuring net metering is a compensation floor for residential producers of energy
abstract: Relates to ensuring net metering is a compensation floor for residential producers of energy.

title: Allows the thruway authority to offer a discounted toll rate to residents of Rockland and Westchester counties for Mario M. Cuomo bridge crossings
abstract: Allows the thruway authority to offer discounted tokens to residents of Rockland and Westchester counties for Mario M. Cuomo bridge crossings.

title: Relates to establishing a gang assessment, intervention, prevention and suppression program
abstract: Relates to establishing a gang assessment, intervention, prevention and suppression program within the division of criminal justice services.

title: Relates to excavation of underground facilities; expands the definition of "excavation" for the purposes of the protection of underground facilities
abstract: Expands the definition of "excavation" for the purposes of the protection of underground facilities.

title: Prohibits the provision of licenses for firearms to persons on the federal no-fly list or terrorist screening database
abstract: Prohibits the provision of licenses for firearms to persons on the federal no-fly list or terrorist screening database; authorizes firearms licenses of persons on the federal no-fly list or terrorist screening database to be suspended or revoked; requires the superintendent of state police to search the federal no-fly list or terrorist screening database each year and report findings to appropriate enforcement agencies in order to suspend or revoke appropriate licenses.

title: Provides for tuition assistance program awards for students experiencing homelessness
abstract: Expands tuition assistance program awards for students experiencing homelessness.

title: Directs the department of state to establish a statewide registry of mental hygiene and child supervision residential facilities
abstract: Directs the department of state to establish and maintain a statewide registry of mental hygiene and child supervision residential facilities which shall include residential facilities for juvenile delinquents and persons in need of supervision subject to the supervision of the office of children and family services, for the mentally ill subject to the supervision of the office of mental health, for the developmentally disabled subject to the supervision of the office for people with developmental disabilities, and for the chemically dependent subject to the supervision of the office of alcoholism and substance abuse services.

title: Relates to the Mount Vernon public library
abstract: Relates to the Mount Vernon public library by deeming such library authorized by the city of Mount Vernon, allowing for trustees to be appointed by the mayor of the city of Mount Vernon, and requiring such trustees to report to the city council annually.

title: Relates to establishing additional state aid to certain merged public library systems
abstract: Creates additional state aid for public library systems which merge after January 1, 2024; provides formulas for increased aid based upon the number of library systems which result from mergers and the expanded geographic areas to be served by merged systems; requires a report on the impact of the merger.

title: Requires the New York city housing authority to provide adequate and reliable internet service for all housing authority residents
abstract: Requires the New York city housing authority to provide adequate and reliable internet service for all housing authority residents.

title: Includes mixed residential and commercial property within the affordable home ownership program
abstract: Includes mixed residential and commercial property within the provisions of the affordable home ownership development program thus authorizing the affordable housing corporation to fund the construction or rehabilitation of housing that also contains a commercial retailing business.

title: Directs the department of labor to post on its internet website and annually update the names of employers who employ 50 or more employees who receive public assistance
abstract: Directs the department of labor to post on its internet website and annually update the names of employers who employ 50 or more employees who receive public assistance.

title: Prohibits landlords from including additional services in a tenant's base rent
abstract: Prohibits landlords from including additional services in a tenant's base rent; provides that additional services include cable television, internet services, and garage usage.

title: Relates to limited-profit housing companies
abstract: Relates to limited-profit housing companies; authorizes certain companies to pay dividends or interest in excess of six percent per annum; relates to the dissolution of certain rental housing companies.

title: Relates to enacting the "Community Violence Intervention and Prevention Act"
abstract: Enacts the "Community Violence Intervention and Prevention Act"; provides findings for evidence-based and evidence-informed health programs from hospital-based and community-based programs.

title: Relates to disputes arising from collective negotiations
abstract: Relates to disputes arising from collective negotiations; addresses strikes which occur on a date or dates more than one year after the expiration of the last agreement between the employee's public employer and the public employee organization representing such employee; relates to impasse resolution.

title: Requires companies aided by loans under Mitchell-Lama to notify tenants of buy out from mortgage options and a report by the commissioner or supervising agency
abstract: Requires companies aided by loans under Mitchell-Lama to notify tenants of such housing of the possibility of buyout from mortgages held which would potentially result in rent increases not later than twelve months prior to proposed dissolution; provides such notice shall inform tenants of the nature of the action, the date intended, the applicable laws and a summary of the potential consequences including expenses and rent increases which may be charged; requires the commissioner or supervising agency to prepare a report to be made available to the tenants of the project.

title: Allows for the creation of a joint police department for the towns of Webb and Inlet
abstract: Allows for the creation of a joint police department for the towns of Webb and Inlet; outlines requirements for local laws establishing rules and regulations for such department.

title: Relates to the clean-up of petroleum discharges occurring during the delivery of home heating oil to a residence
abstract: Relates to the clean-up of petroleum discharges occurring during the delivery of home heating oil to a residence; provides any petroleum discharges shall be immediately cleaned up by the oil delivery company; if such spill affects soil then clean-up shall include replacing affected soil with new soil within 24 hours; provides fines for violation.

title: Requires local boards of elections to verify the number of enrolled members of a party in an election district
abstract: Requires local boards of elections to verify the number of enrolled members of a party in an election district and reject all petitions where there are no enrolled members of a party in such district.

title: Directs the department of public service to prepare a written report on the effect of the COVID-19 state of emergency on certain utilities and on the affordability of services
abstract: Directs the department of public service to prepare written reports on the effect the COVID-19 state of emergency has on certain utilities of electric, gas, water, wastewater, and telephone service to commercial and residential customers in the state and on the affordability of services.

title: Directs the state comptroller to implement the federal authorization to encourage the use of mass transportation
abstract: Directs the state comptroller to implement the federal authorization to encourage the use of mass transportation by state employees.

title: Relates to adding two more members to the Niagara Frontier transportation authority
abstract: Relates to adding two more members to the Niagara Frontier transportation authority.

title: Relates to requiring certain fees be deposited into the mental illness anti-stigma fund
abstract: Relates to requiring application fees for the issuance of operating certificates be deposited into the mental illness anti-stigma fund.

title: Commemorating the 275th Anniversary of St. John's Episcopal Church of Huntington, New York
Relates to aggravated unlicensed operation of a motor vehicle in the first degree
abstract: Makes it a class E felony to negligently cause the death of another person while operating a motor vehicle with a suspended, revoked or otherwise withdrawn license.

title: Provides for minimum registered nurse staffing for intensive care and critical care patients
abstract: Requires a minimum registered nurse staffing ratio of one nurse for every two intensive care or critical care patients.

title: Reimburses counties who have purchased or will purchase Medicaid fraud detection software
abstract: Reimburses counties who have purchased or will purchase Medicaid fraud detection software.

title: Relates to background clearances for prospective employees and volunteers of mentoring programs
abstract: Permits mentoring programs to conduct background clearances of prospective employees and volunteers to determine whether any such person has been reported for child abuse or maltreatment or is on the sex offender registry.

title: Relates to exemptions available to veterans
abstract: Relates to exemptions available to veterans; requires school districts to provide the veterans alternative exemption; establishes that costs associated with such exemption shall be borne by the state.

title: Requires housing affordability impact notes in relation to certain rules
abstract: Requires housing affordability impact notes in relation to rules with the purpose or effect to increase or decrease the cost of constructing, purchasing, owning or selling a single family residence or a multi-unit housing development, either directly or indirectly.

title: Provides that persons arrested for domestic violence forfeit bail when violating an order of protection
abstract: Provides that persons arrested for domestic violence forfeit bail when violating an order of protection.

title: Relates to the definition of the term "cremation"
abstract: Relates to the definition of the term "cremation".

title: Relates to the length of time that a person on a visa can hold a New York state driver's license or learner's permit
abstract: Relates to the length of time that a person on a visa can hold a New York state driver's license or learner's permit; provides that driver's license or learner's permit shall expire upon the expiration of a visa or upon the date the driver's license or learner's permit would normally expire whichever date first occurs.

title: Provides for state reimbursement for lost tax revenue due to devaluation of land as a result of toxic contamination
abstract: Provides for state reimbursement for lost tax revenue due to devaluation of land as a result of toxic contamination.

title: Clarifies the regulation of cemetery corporations
abstract: Clarifies that state regulated cemetery operations are under the sole jurisdiction of the state cemetery board.

title: Relates to medical use of psilocybin; appropriation
abstract: Relates to medical use of psilocybin; establishes a psilocybin assisted therapy  grant program; makes an appropriation therefor.

title: Requires a consultation prior to the discharge of medically fragile young adults
abstract: Relates to medically fragile young adults and pediatric specialized nursing facilities; allows for such young adults to remain in such facilities from age twenty-one until age thirty-six.

title: Excludes claims for unemployment insurance arising as a result of an employer closing his or her business because of novel coronavirus COVID-19, from an employer's experience rating charges
abstract: Excludes claims for unemployment insurance arising as a result of an employer closing his or her business because of novel coronavirus COVID-19, from an employer's experience rating charges.

title: Establishes the Supply Chain Transparency Assistance Program
abstract: Establishes the Supply Chain Transparency Assistance Program to encourage the shifting of the state's economy toward more ethical and sustainable supply chains.

title: Expands off-track betting to include the five counties comprising the city of New York; repealer
abstract: Expands off-track betting to include the five counties comprising the city of New York which shall now be considered part of the Catskill region.

title: Congratulating Tyler Adams for special recognition as a member of the United States Men's National Soccer Team at the 2022 World Cup Tournament in Qatar
Limits certain regulations or orders promulgated by the superintendent
abstract: Limits certain regulations or orders promulgated by the superintendent; provides that the department of financial services shall issue a report on the effects that its suitability and best interest in life insurance and annuity transaction regulations have had on the term life insurance market.

title: Relates to transfers of cable systems
abstract: Relates to transfers of cable systems.

title: Permits the electronic filing of papers in local criminal courts in certain instances
abstract: Permits the electronic filing of papers in local criminal courts in certain instances.

title: Relates to creating a tax credit for taxpayers who purchase and install a water filtration or purification system in their residence or business
abstract: Relates to creating a tax credit for taxpayers who purchase and install a water filtration or purification system in their residence or business.

title: Establishes a small business tax credit for certain efforts taken to improve such small business's facility in an effort to reduce the spread of infectious diseases
abstract: Establishes a small business tax credit for certain efforts taken to improve such small business's facility in an effort to reduce the spread of infectious diseases.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim February 2023, as Library Lover's Month in the State of New York
Establishes the Healthy Cardiac Monitoring Act
abstract: Establishes the Healthy Cardiac Monitoring Act; requires certain medical professionals that provide physical examinations to individuals nineteen years of age or younger to be periodically educated in cardiac health; requires students who participate in athletic programs to have an additional cardiac health physical examination prior to participating; makes various provisions relating thereto.

title: Establishes a distinctive plate honoring Eagle Scouts
abstract: Establishes a distinctive plate honoring the Eagle Scouts for which the regular registration fee will apply plus an initial one time service charge of $25.

title: Establishes a COVID-19 relief grant program for veterans service organizations impacted by COVID-19; and makes an appropriation therefor
abstract: Establishes a COVID-19 relief grant program for veterans service organizations impacted by COVID-19 to provide grants to eligible veterans service organizations to defray certain expenses of the organization including rent, utilities, scheduled mortgage payments, scheduled debt payments and other ordinary and necessary business expenses; makes an appropriation therefor.

title: Honoring Dr. John Rugge upon the occasion of his designation as recipient of the J. Walter Juckett Community Service Award
Clarifies the time in which the public service commission must act upon certain petitions
abstract: Clarifies the time in which the public service commission must act upon certain petitions; requires reporting to the legislature.

title: Makes provisions to preserve access to health care services by requiring that applications for construction not be approved without preservation
abstract: Makes provisions to preserve access to health care services by requiring that applications for construction not be approved unless the commissioner affirmatively finds that access to health care services will be preserved.

title: Eliminates certain restrictions on the right to eviction for landlord's personal use
abstract: Removes certain restrictions relating to the "immediate and compelling necessity" of the landlord on a landlord's ability in certain New York city apartments which are rent stabilized or rent controlled to recover possession of a housing accommodation for his own personal use and occupancy or for the use and occupancy of his or her immediate family.

title: Eliminates the cap on the maximum amount and the gross income requirement for the long-term care insurance credit
abstract: Eliminates the $1500 cap on the maximum amount and the gross income requirement for the long-term care insurance credit.

title: Excludes volunteer firefighters and emergency medical services employees from the permissive use of marijuana
abstract: Excludes volunteer firefighters and emergency medical services employees from the permissive use of marijuana.

title: Authorizes the superintendent of financial services to oversee and regulate car dealer transactions with consumers
abstract: Authorizes the superintendent of financial services to oversee and regulate car dealer transactions with consumers; requires motor vehicle retail installment contracts to include an itemized listing of all costs related to the purchase of a motor vehicle and disclosure of the prohibition of conditional delivery; requires motor vehicle dealers to provide credit applicants with copies of all credit application documents; prohibits the conditional delivery of a motor vehicle.

title: Relates to establishing a green alert system for missing military members
abstract: Relates to establishing a green alert system for missing military members.

title: Requires school districts to conduct mandatory early screening for dyslexia for all children
abstract: Requires school districts to conduct mandatory early screening for dyslexia for all children commencing in pre-kindergarten or kindergarten and continuing thereafter on an annual basis until each child successfully completes second grade; requires school districts to designate an individual to maintain complete and accurate records containing early screening reports for each child, and to provide resources and materials to the parent and/or guardian of any child who displays indications of dyslexia.

title: Relates to the child and dependent care credit
abstract: Relates to the child and dependent care credit; increases the percentage of the federal credit.

title: Relates to extending the time for reconsideration of parole for violent felony offenders
abstract: Permits the parole board to extend the time for reconsideration of parole for violent felony offenders to forty-eight months from a negative determination.

title: Allows veterans with a service-connected disability or Purple Heart free use of parks and campsites
abstract: Allows veterans with a service-connected disability or Purple Heart free use of parks and campsites; provides that such disability shall be 10 percent service-connected or greater.

title: Prohibits off-track betting corporation vehicles from being used as take-home vehicles
abstract: Prohibits off-track betting corporation vehicles from being used as take-home vehicles by board members, officers, employees, contractors, subcontractors, consultants, or agents of such corporation or by certain family members of such individuals; provides an exception therefor.

title: Establishes a statewide law enforcement officer misconduct database
abstract: Directs the division of criminal justice services to establish a statewide public database covering every local police department, each county sheriff's office, the division of the state police and every agency that employs a peace officer in this state, which shall compile the names of any police or peace officer who has had his or her employment terminated due to misconduct.

title: Relates to prohibiting the expenditure of moneys of the state to private institutions for projects that include the construction of a hotel
abstract: Prohibits the expenditure of moneys of the state by the dormitory authority to private institutions for projects that include the construction of a hotel or similar lodging facility, not including student housing.

title: Authorizes certain law enforcement personnel to apply for an exemption from the restrictions on employment with gaming activity entities
abstract: Authorizes certain law enforcement personnel to apply for an exemption from the restrictions on employment with gaming activity entities.

title: Requires instruction in agriculture
abstract: Requires instruction in agriculture in every elementary, middle, and high school under state control or supported wholly or partly by the state.

title: Relates to establishing the offense of aggravated rape and criminal sentencing for defendants convicted of certain sexual offenses
abstract: Establishes the offense of aggravated rape; provides criminal sentencing mandates for defendants convicted of certain sexual offenses.

title: Relates to pass-through manufacturers zero percent tax rate
abstract: Relates to pass-through manufacturers zero percent tax rate; extends a zero percent franchise tax to all manufacturers.

title: Imposes penalties for non-compliance of division of housing and community renewal orders
abstract: Imposes penalties for non-compliance of DHCR orders by owners of multiple dwelling units; provides a fine of $5,000 for each instance of non-compliance.

title: Relates to establishing a temporary state commission to rename any projects, infrastructure, facilities or sites within the state which are named after or include any reference to Robert Moses
abstract: Establishes a temporary state commission to rename any projects, infrastructure, facilities or sites within the state which are named after or include any reference to Robert Moses.

title: Relates to waiving the earning limitations for retired sworn officers employed by a district attorney as investigators
abstract: Relates to waiving the earning limitations for retired sworn officers employed by a district attorney as investigators.

title: Creates a grant program for school districts, institutions of higher education, nonprofit organizations, other entities to prepare students for postsecondary STEM education and careers; appropriation
abstract: Adjusts state qualitative skill education assessment standards; makes an appropriation therefor.

title: Honoring Moon Schwartz upon the occasion of their designation as a Young Entrepreneur of the Year Award nominee by the Clarence Chamber of Commerce
Requires school districts to have diversity officers
abstract: Requires school districts to have diversity officers to develop methods to diversify the personnel of the school district and to recommend changes to district policies and practices to reduce racial disparities in hiring school district employees, particularly teachers; requires boards of education to annually report information regarding such policies and practices to the department of education; requires the department of education to annually report such information to the legislature.

title: Requires third party oversight over the state's contracting agency's procurement procedure
abstract: Relates to requiring third party oversight over the state's contracting agency's procurement procedure specific to the use of minority- and women-owned businesses.

title: Establishes protection for senior citizens against unwarranted eviction
abstract: Establishes protection for senior citizens against unwarranted eviction; requires plaintiff/landlord to file an affidavit determining whether or not the respondent is a senior citizen and sets forth guidelines and procedures for a default eviction against a senior citizen, including representation of counsel; defines senior citizen as persons aged 62 or over for purposes of the real property actions and proceedings law.

title: Increases the personal income tax credit for college tuition expenses
abstract: Increases the personal income tax credit for college tuition from the first $10,000 to the first $20,000 of college tuition expenses.

title: Release of persons charged with certain crimes involving possession of a firearm on their own recognizance or under non-monetary conditions, bail or custody of the sheriff
abstract: Authorizes the court the discretion to release persons charged with certain crimes involving possession of a firearm on their own recognizance or under non-monetary conditions, fix bail, or commit the person to the custody of the sheriff.

title: Relates to coverage for prenatal vitamins
abstract: Requires certain health and casualty insurers to provide coverage for prenatal vitamins.

title: Authorizes Christopher Walser to take the competitive civil service examination for the position of police officer and be placed on the eligible list for employment as a full-time police officer for the Onondaga
abstract: Authorizes Christopher Walser to take the competitive civil service examination for the position of police officer and be placed on the eligible list for employment as a full-time police officer for the Onondaga County Sheriff's Office.

title: Relates to decreasing the tax rate on gaming revenues from slot machines on certain facilities
abstract: Decreases the tax rate on gaming revenues from slot machines in facilities in region 5 of zone 2; requires such facilities to report on the use of the retained funds for the creation of new jobs or rehiring laid-off employees.

title: Mandates a fixed percentage for annual harness horse breeders awards and requires that all sire stakes funds generated by a specific racetrack be returned as purses to such track at the same level
abstract: Mandates a fixed percentage of annual harness horse breeders awards; requires that all sire stakes funds generated by a specific racetrack be returned as purses to such track at the same level in order to allow New York to compete with states that have stronger awards programs.

title: Requires dental health certificates to be furnished by a student at the same time that health certificates are required
abstract: Requires dental health certificates to be furnished by a student at the same time that health certificates are required.

title: Authorizes the sale of merchandise other than beer by licensed breweries and licensed farm breweries and the operation of another business on a licensed premise
abstract: Authorizes the sale of merchandise other than beer by licensed breweries and licensed farm breweries and the operation of another business on a licensed premises; authorizes licensed breweries and farm breweries to charge for tours and tastings.

title: Creates climate negligence for dangers to safety and health caused by certain fossil fuel related activity
abstract: Creates climate negligence for dangers to safety and health caused by knowingly or recklessly creating, maintaining or contributing to a condition that causes such danger; creates a private right of action.

title: Relates to establishing the New York patients' right to know act
abstract: Establishes the "New York patients' right to know act"; requires physicians and certain licensed professionals to disclose findings of certain misconduct to patients.

title: Relates to cargo bicycles with electric assist
abstract: Adds cargo bicycles with electric assist to the types of bicycles with electric assist regulated under the vehicle and traffic law; provides that no person shall operate a cargo bicycle with electric assist unless it is accompanied by proof of financial security unless otherwise authorized by local law, ordinance, order, rule, or regulation or pursuant to an agreement made on behalf of the city, town, or village.

title: Requires schools to allow fire departments to make a recruitment presentation in a high school
abstract: Requires the principal of any high school to allow any local fire department, upon request, to enter the school for the purpose of fire department junior recruitment, including, but not limited to: making presentations; disseminating literature; and answering questions by students.

title: Relates to the HTLV-1 and HTLV-2 viruses
abstract: Includes the HTLV-1 and HTLV-2 viruses to the public health department's health care and wellness education and outreach program.

title: Enacts the sex trade survivors justice and equality act; repealer
abstract: Relates to certain prostitution offenses and fines relating thereto; relates to motions to vacate judgment and motions for new sentencing; relates to investigation into acts alleged to be the unauthorized practice of massage therapy by potential victims of human trafficking; prohibits the possession of reproductive or sexual health devices from being permitted in specified criminal or civil proceedings as evidence of prostitution; relates to services for exploited individuals, services for victims of human trafficking and the interagency task force on human trafficking; establishes the victims of sexual exploitation fund; makes conforming changes; repeals provisions relating to prostitution, prostitution in a school zone, defense against patronizing a person for prostitution and a motion to dismiss information, simplified information, prosecutor's information or misdemeanor complaint.

title: Authorizes actions and proceedings by unit owners against a condominium board of managers for certain violations of law or of resolutions adopted by such board of managers
abstract: Authorizes actions and proceedings by unit owners against a condominium board of managers for certain violations of law or of resolutions adopted by such board of managers.

title: Establishes the customized employment demonstration program whereby certain positions are divided into sub-positions by the civil service commission to provide for employment of disabled persons
abstract: Establishes the customized employment demonstration program whereby certain positions are divided into sub-positions by the civil service commission to provide for employment of persons with developmental disabilities who are able to perform a portion of the duties of such position.

title: Increases the penalties for sexual performances by a child and provides for consecutive sentencing upon certain multiple convictions
abstract: Increases the penalties for sexual performances by a child; increases age from 16 to 18 for application of existing sexual performance crimes; creates crimes of use of a child in a sexual performance in the first degree, promoting an obscene sexual performance by a child in the first degree, and promoting a sexual performance by a child in the first degree; provides for consecutive sentencing upon certain multiple convictions.

title: Authorizes the possession of certain antique rifles and their modern day replicas
abstract: Authorizes the possession of certain antique rifles and their modern day replicas.

title: Prohibits the hunting or taking of wildlife with the aid of an unmanned aerial vehicle
abstract: Prohibits the hunting or taking of wildlife with the aid of an unmanned aerial vehicle.

title: Relates to false representation of affiliation or approval of state or local agencies as false advertising
abstract: Provides that a false representation of affiliation or approval, or false implication of such affiliation or approval, of any official, state or local agencies or other official source, shall be false advertising.

title: Relates to the disposition of net revenues of regional off-track betting corporations to participating counties
abstract: Provides that the disposition of net revenues of regional off-track betting corporations to participating counties may be divided on an annual, bi-annual or quarterly basis as determined by such corporations.

title: Relates to excluding renewable energy pilot projects from the tax cap
abstract: Excludes renewable energy pilot projects from the tax cap.

title: Authorizes a statewide toll free hotline run by the state police with reward for information leading to conviction of drunk drivers; imposes an additional surcharge on convicted drivers
abstract: Authorizes a statewide toll free hotline run by the state police with reward for reporting conduct of drivers leading to conviction of the crime of driving under the influence of alcohol or drugs; imposes an additional surcharge upon conviction of all criminally drunk or drugged drivers to fund expenses and rewards.

title: Relates to establishing a temporary toll holiday for use of the thruway
abstract: Establishes a temporary toll holiday for use of the thruway from July 1, 2023 through August 31, 2023.

title: Relates to reports of substantial risk or threat of harm by mental health professionals; repealer
abstract: Relates to reports of substantial risk or threat of harm by mental health professionals.

title: Prohibits the denial of a building permit on the basis that such building will be a mixed-fuel building
abstract: Prohibits a municipal corporation from prohibiting the issuing of a permit for the construction of any new commercial, residential, or mixed-use building on the basis that such building will be a mixed-fuel building.

title: Relates to licensed pet breeders and brokers
abstract: Relates to licensed pet breeders and brokers; requires a pet dealer to only purchase a dog or cat for resale from a breeder or broker licensed by the United States department of agriculture or exempt from United States department of agriculture licensing per United States department of agriculture regulation, and such breeder or broker shall be in possession of all other licenses required for a breeder or broker by the state in which such breeder or broker is located.

title: Decreases the length of the term of office for the governor and lieutenant-governor to two years
abstract: Decreases the length of the term of office for the governor and lieutenant-governor to two years.

title: Provides lifetime, premium-free insurance through the New York state of health marketplace to a person who donates a kidney during the course of his or her lifetime
abstract: Provides lifetime, premium-free insurance through the New York state of health marketplace to a person who donates a kidney during the course of his or her lifetime; establishes the kidney donor insurance fund.

title: Relates to unlawful tenancies under the emergency tenant protection act of 1974
abstract: Relates to unlawful tenancies under the emergency tenant protection act of 1974; prohibits owners from entering or renewing leases where such owner has reason to know that such tenant will not occupy the housing accommodation as his or her primary residence.

title: Relates to certain payments of the horsemen's organization
abstract: Relates to certain payments to the horsemen's organization; extends such provision to 2024.

title: Relates to the continuation of the empire state stem cell board
abstract: Relates to the continuation of the empire state stem cell board.

title: Disqualifies public officers from holding a public office after a conviction of impeachment
abstract: Disqualifies public officers from holding a public office after a conviction of impeachment.

title: Provides for advance payment of the earned income credit by employers
abstract: Provides for advance payment of the earned income credit by employers, the commissioner of the department of tax and finance and the commissioner of New York City's department of finance.

title: Relates to requiring department of environmental conservation to establish guidelines for disqualification of stand-by contractors
abstract: Requires the department of environmental conservation to establish guidelines relating to the disqualification of contractors applying to perform stand-by contracts relating to past performance, reasonableness of pricing, acts of negligence and convictions for certain crimes reflecting on honesty, integrity and capability of any contractor.

title: Relates to posting of private property
abstract: Permits owners of private property to post such property to prevent trespass by painting purple markings on trees or markers.

title: Authorizes the purchase of construction mortgages by the state of New York mortgage agency
abstract: Authorizes the state of New York mortgage agency to purchase construction mortgages from banks within the state during periods when there is an inadequate supply of credit available for new residential mortgages or available for such loans at carrying charges within the financial means of persons and families of low and moderate income.

title: Provides for the administration of the state cemetery vandalism restoration, monument repair or removal and administration fund by the state cemetery board
abstract: Provides for the administration of the state cemetery vandalism restoration, monument repair or removal and administration fund by the state cemetery board; removes the state comptroller and commissioner of taxation and finance from administering the fund.

title: Grants the metropolitan transportation authority the power to suspend vehicle registration in certain cases
abstract: Grants the metropolitan transportation authority the power to suspend vehicle registration in certain cases.

title: Directs the commissioner of motor vehicles, in conjunction with the office of court administration, to redesign uniform traffic tickets
abstract: Directs the commissioner of motor vehicles, in conjunction with the office of court administration, shall redesign the uniform traffic tickets; such new design shall include, but not be limited, increasing the clarity of such ticket and providing clearly on the front of such ticket, the cancellation of the court appearance where a fine is paid prior to the date of such court appearance.

title: Requires the commissioner of the administration of children's services to obtain an order of consent before allowing experimental drug testing on certain children
abstract: Requires the New York city commissioner of the administration of children's services to obtain an order of consent from the court before allowing experimental drug testing on children under the care and/or control of the administration of children's services.

title: Relates to authorizing the city of Albany to add unpaid housing code violation penalties, costs and fines to such city's annual tax levy
abstract: Authorizes the city of Albany to add unpaid housing code violation penalties, costs and fines to such city's annual tax levy.

title: Provides for the reestablishment of the Westchester parkway commission, to advise the commissioner of transportation
abstract: Provides for the reestablishment of the Westchester Parkway Commission, to advise the commissioner of transportation regarding the operation and maintenance of the special parkways within the county of Westchester.

title: Establishes the commission on retired racehorses
abstract: Establishes the commission on retired racehorses, which shall be responsible for the oversight of retired racehorses including the creation of a registry to track such racehorses.

title: Prohibits the administration of psychoactive drugs to an animal in a zoo in certain situations
abstract: Prohibits the administration of psychoactive drugs to an animal in a zoo in order to allow another animal to procreate with such animal.

title: Increases the amount of years of military service credit a member may purchase
abstract: Increases the amount of years of military service credit a member may purchase from three years to ten years.

title: Requires the installation and maintenance of lockout devices on lottery vending machines by licensed lottery sales agents to prevent use by minors
abstract: Requires the installation and maintenance of lockout devices on lottery vending machines by licensed lottery sales agents to prevent use by minors.

title: Prohibits sex offenders whose victim was a child and level 3 sex offenders from knowingly being within 1,000 feet of a child care provider, preschool or any pre-kindergarten or kindergarten
abstract: Prohibits a sex offender whose victim was a child and level 3 sex offenders from knowingly being within 1,000 feet of a child care provider, preschool or any facility where pre-kindergarten or kindergarten instruction is provided.

title: Relates to excluding patios and other outdoor areas on the premises of any entity licensed to operate a video lottery gaming facility from restrictions of the Clean Indoor Air Act
abstract: Relates to excluding patios and other outdoor areas on the premises of any entity licensed to operate a video lottery gaming facility from restrictions of the Clean Indoor Air Act.

title: Relates to expanding service of process to the department of state in the city of New York
abstract: Expands service of process to the department of state in the city of New York.

title: Raises the tax rate on corporate income; increases the state conformity to federal taxation of corporate profit shifting; and imposes an additional tax on individual business income
abstract: Raises the tax rate on corporate income; increases the state conformity to federal taxation of corporate profit shifting; imposes an additional tax on individual business income in response to federal tax benefits for pass-through business income.

title: Mourning the death of Irene Klementowicz, distinguished citizen, environmentalist, and beloved community hero
Relates to photo speed violation monitoring systems in school speed zones in the city of New York
abstract: Reduces the radial distance from school buildings for such school speed zones.

title: Creates a racing fan advisory board, establishing an I Love NY Racing promotion and awarding the New York State Horse Racing Farm of the Year Award
abstract: Relates to creating a racing fan advisory board to provide advice to the state racing and wagering board on issues related to horse racing and wagering; establishes an I Love NY Racing promotion and the New York State Horse Racing Farm of the Year Award.

title: Relates to requiring lending institutions to supply customers with PINs to be used in conjunction with any chip-embedded credit card
abstract: Requires lending institutions to supply customers with PINs to be used in conjunction with any chip-embedded credit card.

title: Relates to the establishment of multi-year cost allowances for the Mount Vernon school district
abstract: Relates to the establishment of multi-year cost allowances for the Mount Vernon city school district.

title: Provides that absentee ballots shall not be mailed or delivered to a voter unless such voter has specifically requested to receive an absentee ballot
abstract: Provides that absentee ballots shall not be mailed or delivered to a voter unless such voter has specifically requested to receive an absentee ballot.

title: Establishes a one year temporary fuel tax holiday
abstract: Establishes a temporary fuel tax holiday for one year; requires the comptroller and the director of the budget to transfer from the general fund to the special obligation reserve and payment account an amount equal to the amount that would have otherwise been deposited if the fuel tax holiday had not been authorized.

title: Allows off-track betting corporations to set up special reserve funds
abstract: Allows off-track betting corporations to set up special reserve funds to use as an alternative to current capital acquisition funds.

title: Relates to the designation of workers' compensation coverage for certain employees
abstract: Prohibits workers compensation carriers from forcing policyholders to cover individuals who are not their employees.

title: Relates to nullifying agreements preventing dealers from purchasing from outside distributors
abstract: Nullifies agreements which prohibits a dealer, who either directly or through an affiliate owns a service station including the tanks and pumps or where a dealer provides environmental pollution insurance coverage for the tanks and pumps of not less than one million dollars in the aggregate and who dedicates a tank for sale of unbranded motor fuel, or any provision of a franchise with a refiner which prohibits a distributor from purchasing or selling unbranded motor fuel from a person or firm other than the refiner or limits the quantity of such unbranded motor fuel to be purchased from another person or firm or any provision of a franchise which directly or indirectly discourages a dealer or distributor from purchasing or selling such unbranded motor fuels from another person or firm.

title: Requires that used oil filters be source-separated and recycled
abstract: Requires that used oil filters be source-separated and recycled.

title: Enacts the Drink Up Act
abstract: Enacts the "Drink Up Act"; requires every public school to offer water in a sealed bottled container as an additional drink option to any student during lunch at no cost to such student.

title: Authorizes the town of Southampton, county of Suffolk, to enact a homestead exemption and cap on assessment increases for real property tax purposes
abstract: Authorizes the town of Southampton, county of Suffolk, to enact by local law a homestead exemption; provides that such exemption shall not exceed $50,000 in full assessed value; authorizes a cap on all annual assessment increases for residential property, not to exceed five percent.

title: Relates to addiction counseling services for incarcerated individuals
abstract: Relates to addiction counseling services for incarcerated individuals.

title: Relates to authorizing early parole release for inmates where substance abuse was a significant contributing factor in the commission of the offense
abstract: Relates to authorizing early parole release for inmates where substance abuse was a significant contributing factor in the commission of the offense.

title: Provides that the winnings from off-track betting, remaining unclaimed by April 1 each year, shall become part of the regional off-track betting corporation's operating account; repealer
abstract: Provides that the winnings from off-track betting, remaining unclaimed by April 1 each year, shall become part of the regional off-track betting corporation's operating account.

title: Relates to prohibiting the taking of zoo, petting zoo, carnival or circus animals
abstract: Prohibits the taking of zoo, petting zoo, carnival or circus animals; provides that violations shall be punishable by a fine of not less than five hundred dollars nor more than two thousand dollars.

title: Prohibiting the taking of non-native big game mammals in a fenced or other area from which there is no means for such mammal to escape
abstract: Prohibits the taking of non-native big game mammals in a fenced or other area from which there is no means for such mammal to escape.

title: Relates to brand-name drugs with and without an AB generic equivalent
abstract: Relates to brand-name drugs with and without an AB generic equivalent; amends the effective date from January to July next succeeding the date on which it shall have become a law.

title: Encourages the participation of minority and women-owned business enterprises in state contracts
abstract: Encourages the participation of minority- and women-owned business enterprises in state contracts by avoiding unnecessary and unjustified bundling of contract requirements that preclude minority- and women-owned business participation.

title: Relates to paid family leave and bereavement for fetal death, still birth, and an infant being medically not viable to survive
abstract: Relates to paid family leave and bereavement for fetal death, still birth, and an infant being medically not viable to survive.

title: Relates to indemnity bonds and insurance policies for ambulettes
abstract: Relates to the minimum and maximum amounts of indemnity bonds or insurance policies for ambulettes.

title: Provides that where a senior citizen purchases real property after the taxable status date, such person shall be eligible for the enhanced STAR exemption
abstract: Provides that where a person who meets the requirements for an enhanced exemption for property owned by senior citizens purchases real property after the levy of taxes, such person may file an application for exemption to the assessor within thirty days of the transfer of title to such person for such exemption.

title: Establishes a task force to investigate the position of city marshal in the city of New York
abstract: Establishes a task force to investigate the position of city marshal in the city of New York regarding claims of defrauding creditors and the feasibility of abolishing the position.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim February 18-25, 2023, as National FFA Organization Week in the State of New York
Relates to contact information on motor vehicle accident reports for commercial enterprises
abstract: Relates to motor vehicle accident reports; requires contact information including names, addresses, telephone numbers, and email addresses where available, for all parties and telephone numbers and email addresses where available for all witnesses, for a commercial enterprise where a vehicle or bicycle involved in an accident is operated by an employee or independent contractor of such commercial enterprise.

title: Requires applicants for the renewal of a driver's license to prove they have acceptable vision to operate a motor vehicle
abstract: Requires applicants for the renewal of a driver's license to prove they have acceptable vision to operate a motor vehicle.

title: Relates to the definition of "immediate family" for the transfer of certain commercial fishing licenses
abstract: Removes the provision that an immediate family member needs to be domiciled in the house of the license or permit holder for the purpose of commercial fishing license transfers.

title: Authorizes park-and-ride development as construction or improvement by the department of transportation partly at municipal expense
abstract: Authorizes park-and-ride development as construction or improvement by the department of transportation partly at municipal expense.

title: Grants immunity to law enforcement employees who intervene against police misconduct
abstract: Grants immunity from liability and professional retaliation against a law enforcement employee who intervenes against police misconduct committed by another member of law enforcement.

title: Relates to the Amistad Commission
abstract: Relates to the Amistad commission; moves it from the department of state to the state education department.

title: Prohibits the addition or change to certain wage orders which would have the effect of requiring an employer to pay an employee for time not actually worked
abstract: Prohibits the addition or change to certain wage orders which would have the effect of requiring an employer to pay an employee for time not actually worked.

title: Relates to notice to unsuccessful minority- or women-owned business enterprise bidders on state contracts
abstract: Requires public corporations and agencies to provide notice to each minority- or women-owned business enterprise that unsuccessfully bid on a contract of the reason or reasons why the business enterprise was unsuccessful in obtaining the contract.

title: Requires the Department of Homeless Services to notify the affected community board prior to locating transitional housing for the homeless
