title: Relates to establishing a claim for fraudulent inducement to enter into an employment relationship
abstract: Establishes a claim for fraudulent inducement to enter into an employment relationship based on false promises as to wages, benefits, or intentions as to the duration of employment.

title: Repeals and reenacts provisions on time limitations on certain actions against professional engineers, architects, other designers and construction contractors; repealer
abstract: Repeals and reenacts statute of limitation provisions on wrongful death, personal injury and property damage actions against professional engineers, architects, landscape architects, land surveyors and construction contractors to provide for a limitations period of ten years after completion of improvement to real property; "completion", which constitutes the accrual date for the limitations period, is defined; provides for a one year extension for injuries to person or property or wrongful death which occur during the tenth year after completion.

title: Establishes domestic abuse offenses, provides for special information for certain felony domestic abuse offenses and designates such offenses as family offenses
abstract: Establishes domestic abuse offenses for assaults upon spouses, former spouses, fellow parents of a child in common and domestic partners; provides for issuance of a special information for domestic abuse in the first degree requiring a predicate criminal conviction; designates such domestic abuse offenses as family offenses for purposes of the criminal procedure law and the family court act.

title: Relates to requiring drivers approaching stationary emergency vehicles, tow or recovery trucks, or highway maintenance vehicles to switch lanes or reduce the speed of a motor vehicle
abstract: Requires a driver approaching stationary emergency vehicles, tow or recovery trucks, or highway maintenance vehicles displaying flashing lights to switch lanes or reduce the speed of the driver's vehicle, and be prepared to stop the vehicle; institutes a fine for failing to move over or slow down.

title: Requires nonpublic and private elementary and secondary schools to require their prospective employees to submit fingerprints for the purpose of criminal background checks
abstract: Requires nonpublic and private elementary and secondary schools to require their prospective employees to submit fingerprints through the commissioner of education for the purpose of criminal background checks; authorizes conditional appointment of employees by such schools pending determination of the criminal background check.

title: Requires the board of elections in the city of New York to release certain data relating to ranked choice elections
abstract: Requires the board of elections in the city of New York to release data on how voters ranked all candidates in a ranked choice election, even if a single candidate received a majority of highest rank votes and the tabulation process was not triggered.

title: Establishes the empire state performance commission
abstract: Establishes the empire state performance commission in the executive department for the purpose of designing and advising the governor and the legislature on the implementation of a performance-management and performance-budgeting system.

title: Creates the office of the correctional ombudsman
abstract: Creates the office of the correctional ombudsman to achieve transparency, fairness, impartiality and accountability in New York state correctional facilities; relates to reports by coroners; designates investigators of the office of the correctional ombudsman as peace officers; authorizes the attorney general to investigate the alleged commission of any criminal offense committed by an employee of the department of corrections and community supervision in connection with his or her official duties; relates to the confidentiality of certain records; includes the office of the correctional ombudsman records within the definition of public safety agency records; makes related provisions.

title: Utilizes funds from the capital acquisition fund
abstract: Relates to utilizing funds from the capital acquisition fund for the payment of salaries and benefits of employees and other expenses of regional off-track betting corporations.

title: Establishes restrictions on consumer and employment contracts
abstract: Establishes restrictions on consumer and employment contracts.

title: Relates to establishing a reduction of federal adjusted gross income, for state personal income tax purposes, for student loan interest payments made by taxpayers
abstract: Establishes a reduction of federal adjusted gross income, for state personal income tax purposes, for student loan interest payments made by taxpayers.

title: Relates to establishing minimum standards for payment plans for eligible customers
abstract: Relates to establishing minimum standards for payment plans for eligible customers; requires the public service commission to set standards for payment plans for certain customers including reasonableness of agreements and timelines for payment; establishes eligibility.

title: Provides that people arrested in connection with felonies relating to sex offenses where the victim is less than 13 years old must submit a DNA sample
abstract: Provides that people arrested in connection with certain felonies must submit a DNA sample.

title: Includes gender equality in the social and economic equity plan of the New York state cannabis control board
abstract: Includes transgender, gender non-conforming and non-binary individuals in the social and economic equity plan of the New York state cannabis control board relating to the awarding of adult-use cannabis licenses.

title: Provides information regarding medicare part B coverage to certain individuals
abstract: Provides information regarding termination of medicare part B coverage for the duration of incarceration to individuals committed to the department of corrections and community supervision.

title: Provides for the licensing of apartment information vendors; defines such vendors as people who, for a fee, provide information on available apartments; repealer
abstract: Provides for the licensing of apartment information vendors; defines such vendors as persons who, for a fee, furnish information concerning the location and availability of rental real property.

title: Establishes the green building credit for construction or rehabilitation of property in conformity with certain energy efficiency standards
abstract: Establishes the green building credit for construction or rehabilitation of property in conformity with certain energy efficiency standards.

title: Exempts traps set in water from the requirement that they be visited once every 24 hours
abstract: Exempts traps set in water from the requirement that they be visited once every 24 hours; requires such traps shall be visited once every 48 hours or a shorter interval as determined by the department of environmental conservation.

title: Includes the theft of dogs and cats within the crime of grand larceny in the fourth degree (a class E felony) in certain cases
abstract: Includes the theft of a pet within the crime of grand larceny in the fourth degree in certain instances; defines "pet" as a licensed dog or cat harbored by the owner or lawful custodian of such dog or cat in a dwelling or within an enclosure or yard.

title: Prohibits foreign agents from holding public office and political party positions
abstract: Prohibits persons who are or have ever been foreign agents from holding public office and political party positions; defines "foreign agent".

title: Removes restrictions on crossbow size and draw weight when used for hunting
abstract: Removes restrictions on crossbow size and draw weight when used for hunting.

title: Relates to the unlawful discharge of a loaded firearm toward any police officer, firefighter, corrections officer, peace officer, or emergency medical services personnel
abstract: Relates to the unlawful discharge of a loaded firearm toward any police officer, firefighter, corrections officer, peace officer, or emergency medical services personnel.

title: Relates to creating provisions regarding the unlawful sale of law enforcement identification
abstract: Prohibits the sale of any badge, shield, identification card or other insignia of any police department or law enforcement agency or a facsimile of such a badge or shield; imposes a civil penalty not to exceed $250 for each violation.

title: Establishes a direct service professional credit and career ladder tuition assistance grant program
abstract: Establishes a direct service professional credit and career ladder tuition assistance grant program to develop training programs and improve existing workforce development programs for the purpose of training direct support professionals and establishing a career ladder for individuals working with individuals with developmental disabilities.

title: Relating to the timeliness of judicial decisions
abstract: Relates to the timeliness of judicial decisions; establishes the failure to make a timely decision shall be considered misconduct.

title: Provides for inclusion of the school district's regional cost index in calculating the supplemental education improvement plan grant amount for Yonkers city schools
abstract: Provides for inclusion of the school district's regional cost index in calculating the supplemental education improvement plan grant amount for Yonkers city school district.

title: Modifies provisions for the payment of delinquent taxes by permitting any person or entity to lend money to the taxpayer and pay the taxing jurisdiction; repealer
abstract: Modifies provisions for the payment of delinquent taxes by permitting any person or entity to lend the money to the property owner therefor, with the lender to pay the taxing jurisdiction and receive a conditional tax receipt; requires recording of tax liens; provides for foreclosure of a conditional tax receipt like a mortgage.

title: Alters the definition of a qualified historic home for the purposes of the historic homeownership rehabilitation credit
abstract: Alters the definition of a qualified historic home for the purposes of the historic homeownership rehabilitation credit.

title: Enacts the "MTA board member attendance act"
abstract: Enacts the "MTA board member attendance act"; requires members of the metropolitan transportation authority to attend the majority of public hearings on fare hikes in order to cast a vote.

title: Designates that portion of interstate eighty-four that lies within the county of Putnam as the "Putnam County Purple Heart Highway"
abstract: Designates that portion of interstate eighty-four that lies within the county of Putnam as the "Putnam County Purple Heart Highway".

title: Establishes alternative living arrangements for children who are at a substantial risk of abuse
abstract: Establishes alternative living arrangements for children who are at a substantial risk of abuse; defines an alternative living arrangement as a temporary, written and agreed upon out of home living arrangement developed as a result of an investigation of child maltreatment by the child protective service that would allow for a relative or suitable person to temporarily care for a child who is at a substantial risk of abuse or in imminent danger of neglect; requires annual reporting.

title: Requires insurance coverage for the HALO breast pap test to detect risk of developing breast cancer
abstract: Requires insurance coverage for the HALO breast pap test to detect risk of developing breast cancer.

title: Relates to the enforcement of taxes in certain school districts
abstract: Relates to the enforcement of taxes in certain school districts.

title: Creates a veterans' clearinghouse for purposes of identifying veterans eligible for benefits
abstract: Creates a veterans' clearinghouse for purposes of identifying veterans eligible for benefits; requires the division of veterans' affairs to enter into a memorandum of understanding with the US department of veterans' affairs that allows sharing of information; requires entities of the state and political subdivisions thereof to report information regarding veterans receiving aid to the clearinghouse; provides that such entities make such reports on a quarterly basis; provides that disclosure of any information held by the clearinghouse comply with article 6-A of the public officers law; provides that collection and maintenance of such information comply with HIPAA; provides that the director of veterans' affairs shall promulgate rules and regulations to implement the clearinghouse.

title: Relates to written notification to schools of a student's placement in foster care
abstract: Relates to written notification to schools of a student's placement in foster care.

title: Relates to the denial of an application for a license to install, service or maintain security or fire alarm systems submitted by persons convicted of certain felonies
abstract: Relates to the denial of an application for a license to install, service or maintain security or fire alarm systems submitted by persons convicted of certain felonies; increases the period of a license suspension.

title: Requires county medical examiners or coroners to give the state police forensic laboratory DNA samples of unidentified dead or alive and missing persons upon request
abstract: Requires county medical examiners or coroners to give the state police forensic laboratory DNA samples of deceased persons or unidentified body parts for the purpose of classification and for the state police to forward the samples to the state division of criminal justice services for the purpose of comparison to attempt to determine identity and for the purpose of filing; provides for the forwarding of records to the National Crime Information Center upon such center adopting a policy to accept such records.

title: Relates to the execution of a warrant of arrest and establishes educational programs for judicial personnel on the law of searches, arrests and seizures
abstract: Relates to the execution of a warrant of arrest; authorizes the commissioner of the division of criminal justice services to establish a system to record and monitor the issuance and execution of search warrants; authorizes the chief administrator of the court system to establish educational programs for judicial personnel on the law of searches, arrests and seizures.

title: Provides for the disposal of certain information or data maintained by agencies of government including electronic records
abstract: Provides for the disposal of certain information or data maintained by agencies of government including electronic records.

title: Relates to the full-time status of the district attorney of Hamilton county
abstract: Relates to the full-time status of the district attorney of Hamilton county.

title: Expands requirements for public notification of public meetings
abstract: Establishes when a public body has the ability to do so that the time and place of a public meeting shall be conspicuously posted on an internet website and sent by electronic mail to any individuals who have registered with the public body to receive such by electronic mail.

title: Relates to a housing authority's disposition of property
abstract: Relates to a housing authority's disposition of property.

title: Relates to authorizing community colleges offering an associates degree program in nursing to offer a four-year bachelors degree program in nursing
abstract: Authorizes community colleges offering an associates degree program in nursing to offer a four-year bachelor degree program in nursing.

title: Relates to the provision of patient health information and medical records
abstract: Relates to the provision of patient health information and medical records; expands the definition of medical records to include all health related records; prohibits fees for providing certain records.

title: Exempts certain veterans service organizations from taxes on the sales of beer, wine and soda
abstract: Exempts certain veterans service organizations from taxes on the sales of beer, wine and soda.

title: Prohibits the sale of covered license plate frames
abstract: Prohibits the sale of covered license plate frames; a covered license plate frame means any glass or plastic material, artificial or synthetic material or substance that conceals or obscures a license plate or that distorts a recorded or photographic image of such license plate.

title: Establishes the state financial literacy fund
abstract: Establishes the state financial literacy fund which provides funding for project grants to organizations in order to establish financial capability and financial literacy programs. products content and/or services for at-risk populations in New York.

title: Provides a tax exemption on real property owned by members of volunteer fire companies or voluntary ambulance services in a certain county
abstract: Provides a tax exemption on real property owned by members of volunteer fire companies or voluntary ambulance services in counties with a population of more than 338,000 but less than 339,000.

title: Declares the waters of the state to be public trust resources
abstract: Declares the waters of the state to be public trust resources.

title: Relates to the definition and registration of mobility dealers
abstract: Relates to the definition and registration of mobility dealers.

title: Commemorating the 225th Anniversary of the Chenango County Sheriff's Office
Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim January 27, 2023, as Holocaust Remembrance Day in the State of New York
Congratulating Cullen Cole upon the occasion of capturing the Boys 50-Yard Freestyle title at the NYSPHSAA Boys Swimming and Diving Championship
Requires the state university trustees to establish a process to eliminate or reduce duplication of academic degree programs within the state university system
abstract: Requires the state university trustees to establish a process to eliminate or reduce duplication of academic degree programs within the state university system.

title: Relates to prohibited combative sports that result in the injury of an individual
abstract: Relates to criminal penalties for persons who knowingly advance or profit from prohibited combative sports that result in the injury of any individual.

title: Relates to the definition of imitation weapon
abstract: Makes clarifying changes to the definition of imitation weapon.

title: Establishes the sanitary retail food store grant program
abstract: Establishes the sanitary retail food store grant program to provide funding to retail food stores that fail inspections to correct deficiencies if such stores are unable to sustain the costs to immediately correct critical deficiencies, are located in food deserts, and would otherwise be unable to stay in operation due to their inability to meet and maintain sanitary standards.

title: Relates to the coordination of no-fault benefits for persons injured in motor vehicle accidents
abstract: Requires that insurers providing no-fault coverage reimburse other insurers for the payment of claims to providers which should have been covered by a no-fault insurer.

title: Relates to membership warehouse stores
abstract: Prohibits membership warehouse stores from selling to a retailer.

title: Relates to authorizing the creation of an air rights database for the city of New York
abstract: Authorizes the commissioner of the New York city department of finance to create an air rights database recording transfers of such unused development rights.

title: Designates the month of September as firefighter, police officer and emergency medical technician appreciation month
abstract: Designates the month of September as firefighter, police officer and emergency medical technician appreciation month.

title: Relates to prohibiting colleges from denying formerly incarcerated individuals admittance to college based solely on their incarceration
abstract: Relates to prohibiting colleges from denying formerly incarcerated individuals admittance to college based solely on their incarceration.

title: Creates a tax credit for manufacturing companies that have one established place of business in the state and relocate at least fifty employees from outside the state
abstract: Creates a tax credit for manufacturing companies that have one established place of business in the state and relocate a minimum of fifty employees from outside the state to the state; provides that manufacturing companies shall be allowed a credit in the amount of 2.5 percent of the average salaries of newly created manufacturing jobs multiplied by number of new jobs brought to the state.

title: Relates to creating a written policy on the use of sustained auditory dispersal tools
abstract: Creates a written policy prohibiting the use of sustained auditory dispersal tools by police agencies.

title: Removes limits on licensed physical therapists treating patients without a referral
abstract: Removes limits on the duration of treatment by a licensed physical therapist when a patient does not have a referral.

title: Relates to the transfer of certain funds from the licensed private career schools tuition reimbursement account to the proprietary vocational school supervision account
abstract: Provides that if the net balance of the reimbursement account exceeds two million five hundred thousand dollars, any amount over two million five hundred thousand dollars shall be transferred to the proprietary vocational school supervision account.

title: Enacts the health care professional transparency act
abstract: Enacts the health care professional transparency act; prohibits health care professionals from using deceptive or misleading advertising.

title: Relates to creating a distinctive plate for combat veterans having served in the navy, marine corps, air force or coast guard
abstract: Relates to creating a distinctive plate for combat veterans having served in the navy, marine corps, air force or coast guard.

title: Provides for ULURP to apply to the locating of any charter schools in New York city
abstract: Provides for uniform land use review procedure to apply to the locating of any charter schools in New York city.

title: Relates to requiring police officers to maintain liability insurance
abstract: Requires police officers to maintain liability insurance; excludes police officers from provisions requiring defense and indemnification of state officers and employees.

title: Establishes training and registration requirements for kidney dialysis patient care technicians
abstract: Establishes training and registration requirements for kidney dialysis patient care technicians.

title: Relates to monies received and expenditures made by a party committee or constituted committee
abstract: Relates to monies received and expenditures made by a party committee or constituted committee; such monies shall not be transferred or contributed unless it is to the segregated account of another party committee or constituted committee to be used only for non-candidate expenditures.

title: Relates to confidentiality of certain investigations and proceedings relating to a medical or a quality assurance review or a medical or dental malpractice prevention program
abstract: Expands confidentiality provisions relating to certain investigations of medical or quality assurance or a medical or dental malpractice prevention program, to include statements made by any persons at such reviews who are a party to an action which was reviewed at such proceedings.

title: Requires the New York State Office of Mental Health to study the effects that awareness of or exposure to police shootings or killings of unarmed African Americans has on the mental health of African Americans
abstract: Requires the New York State Office of Mental Health to study the effects that awareness of or exposure to police shootings or killings of unarmed African Americans has on the mental health of African Americans in New York state and to deliver a finding of the results of such study to the governor and the legislative leaders.

title: Waives certain requirements of the special supplemental nutrition program for women, infants and children during a state of emergency declared as a result of a public health crisis
abstract: Waives certain requirements of the special supplemental nutrition program for women, infants and children during a state of emergency declared as a result of a public health crisis, including: allowing any unused portions of any monthly allowances to carry over from month to month; increasing the amount of the monetary limit of not less than sixty percent for the purchase of fresh fruit and vegetables.

title: Establishes audits of state agency expenditures to recover overpayments and lost discounts
abstract: Establishes audits of state agency expenditures to recover overpayments and lost discounts.

title: Relates to prenatal trisomy diagnosis awareness
abstract: Relates to prenatal trisomy diagnosis awareness; requires certain information to be provided to pregnant women following trisomy testing.

title: Relates to the imposition of sales taxes on goods or services purchased from businesses which employ 20 or less persons
abstract: Provides that the tax imposed upon the sales on goods or services purchased from businesses which employ twenty or less persons, are resident in this state, are independently owned and operated and not dominant in their field, shall be two percent.

title: Relates to the maintenance, improvement and repair of certain town highways
abstract: Permits the designation of low volume roads and minimum maintenance roads by town boards; enacts provisions relating to the maintenance, improvement and repair of such roads.

title: Establishes voluntary licensure of master electricians by the department of state
abstract: Establishes voluntary licensure of master electricians by the department of state.

title: Creates a disabled person retrofit tax credit
abstract: Creates a disabled person retrofit tax credit.

title: Establishes the YMCA distinctive license plate
abstract: Establishes the YMCA distinctive license plate; creates the YMCA foundation fund.

title: Relates to decisions by the state board on electric generation; repealer
abstract: Relates to decisions by the state board on electric generation; requires approval through public referendum prior to certification for establishing a major electric generating facility.

title: Provides that dogs engaged in hunting and training as authorized by the environmental conservation law, shall not be deemed to be running at large
abstract: Provides that dogs engaged in hunting and training as authorized by the environmental conservation law, shall not be deemed to be running at large in violation of any local law or ordinance.

title: Requires certain watercraft, aircraft, and trains to be zero emissions; requires the study of certain clean energy sources; requires certain monetary incentives for clean energy vehicles
abstract: Requires certain watercraft, aircraft, and trains to use clean energy, including ensuring such vehicles are zero-emissions; requires NYSERDA to study zero-emission commercial vehicles, the use of renewable energy in publicly funded airports, and the use of sustainable aviation fuel; requires NYSERDA to administer a grant program to flying schools and clubs that install charging infrastructure; provides for a rebate for zero emission boats.

title: Repeals section 470 of the judiciary law relating to allowing attorneys having offices in the state to reside in an adjoining state
abstract: Repeals provisions relating to allowing attorneys having offices in the state to reside in an adjoining state.

title: Requires the posting of broker and management information on commercial property
abstract: Requires the posting of broker and property management information on the window of commercial property that has been vacant for at least one month.

title: Relates to mandating bystander intervention training
abstract: Mandates that all state employees attend bystander intervention training for sexual harassment prevention annually.

title: Prohibits certain sex offenders from entering a school bus or within one thousand feet of a school bus stop
abstract: Prohibits certain sex offenders from entering a school bus or within one thousand feet of a school bus stop.

title: Establishes the Lake Ontario assessment increase exemption
abstract: Establishes the Lake Ontario assessment increase exemption; provides exemptions on any increase in assessments due to preventative measures taken at the expense of property owners to mitigate potential flood damage due to rising lake levels in the areas surrounding Lake Ontario.

title: Requires hepatitis C virus testing of newborns
abstract: Requires hepatitis C virus testing of newborns.

title: Requires SUNY and CUNY schools to refund students for housing credits and boarding charges used or charged for the period of time when such schools are closed or shut down due to the coronavirus pandemic
abstract: Requires SUNY and CUNY schools to refund students for housing credits and boarding charges used or charged for the period of time when such schools are closed or shut down due to the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Relates to prohibiting illegal dumping on public property
abstract: Prohibits illegal dumping on public property; provides a reward for any evidence which leads to a fine for illegal dumping.

title: Requires that academic credit toward a high school diploma be given for practical experience gained outside of school during high school
abstract: Requires that academic credit toward a high school diploma be given for practical experience gained outside of school during high school.

title: Requires a nominal bail informational proceeding for any defendant being held solely due to a bail amount of less than ten dollars
abstract: Requires a nominal bail informational proceeding for any defendant being held solely due to a bail amount of less than ten dollars within 48 hours.

title: Provides veterans free use of cabins and cottages located in public places of recreation within the state
abstract: Provides veterans free use of cabins and cottages located in public places of recreation within the state.

title: Establishes a student loan borrower bill of rights
abstract: Establishes the student loan borrower bill of rights to protect borrowers and ensure that student loan servicers act more as loan counselors than debt collectors.

title: Relates to school districts evaluating capital improvement projects for such school district in the state
abstract: Relates to school districts evaluating capital improvement projects for such school district in the state for: compliance with the New York state climate leadership and community protection act, upgrading heating, ventilation or air conditioning to be more energy efficient, including, but not limited to upgrading to an active solar heating system; installing solar panels or other sources of alternative energy; improving broadband accessibility and reliability; upgrading technology so that it is more resistant to security risks; structural improvements, including, but not limited to windows, roofs, foundations and walls; purchasing hybrid or electric school buses; and upgrading plumbing and electrical systems.

title: Allows volunteer firefighters to attend training without being penalized by their employer; and creates tax incentives for employing volunteer firefighters
abstract: Allows volunteer firefighters to attend training required under 19 NYCRR 426 without being penalized by their employer; creates tax incentives for employing volunteer firefighters.

title: Relates to residency and verification requirements for certain sex offenders
abstract: Relates to residency and verification requirements for certain sex offenders; creates a permanent residency restriction for sex offenders from residing within 1000 feet of school grounds.

title: Relates to prohibiting the sale or purchase of minor children
abstract: Prohibits the sale or purchase of minor children; makes such crime a class B felony.

title: Waives the thirty day residency requirement for certain hunting licenses for active duty military members and their families on permanent orders to be stationed within the state
abstract: Waives the thirty day residency requirement for certain hunting licenses for active duty military members and their families on permanent orders to be stationed within the state.

title: Provides for transparency in long term care insurance rates
abstract: Provides for transparency in long term care insurance rates.

title: Repeals article 26 of the tax law known as the estate tax
abstract: Repeals the estate tax.

title: Establishes the interagency task force on health literacy
abstract: Establishes the interagency task force on health literacy, to study health literacy and develop recommendations for improving health literacy in this state.

title: Relates to warranties and protections for purchasers of new and used motor vehicles
abstract: Provides certain warranties and protections for purchasers of new and used motor vehicles; includes commercial and business purchasers under the Lemon Law.

title: Establishes the Brooklyn-Queens expressway authority
abstract: Establishes the Brooklyn-Queens expressway authority for the purposes of the continuance, further development and improvement of transportation along the Brooklyn-Queens expressway and other services related thereto.

title: Establishes the retrain and employ unemployed persons program
abstract: Establishes the retrain and employ unemployed persons program providing grants to community colleges to develop training programs or improve existing workforce development programs for the purposes of training unemployed individuals for jobs in the regions surrounding such community colleges.

title: Establishes the "health care information management act"
abstract: Relates to establishing the "health care information management act"; requires an annual report by the commissioner to the governor, the temporary president of the senate and the speaker of the assembly.

title: Relates to the Volunteer and Exempt Firemen's Benevolent Association of Lewiston Fire Company No. 1
abstract: Expands the use of foreign fire insurance premium taxes by the Volunteer and Exempt Firemen's Benevolent Association of Lewiston Fire Company No. 1.

title: Establishes a no fare program for students traveling on ferries
abstract: Establishes a no fare program for students in grades kindergarten through twelve traveling on ferries.

title: Relates to requiring bills with a threshold level of co-sponsorship to be brought to the floor for a vote to be taken thereon
abstract: Relates to requiring bills with a threshold level of co-sponsorship to be brought to the floor for a vote to be taken thereon.

title: Relates to prohibiting the New York city board of elections from entering into contracts for certain services related to the conduct of elections with any entity that does not employ union labor
abstract: Relates to prohibiting New York city boards of elections from entering into contracts for certain services related to the conduct of elections with any entity that does not employ union labor.

title: Creates a tax deduction for certain expenses of health care professionals and emergency medical technicians relating to the COVID-19 declared emergency
abstract: Creates a tax deduction up to five thousand dollars for transportation and personal protective equipment expenses of health care professionals and emergency medical technicians relating to the COVID-19 declared emergency.

title: Requires a study on the height of overhead utility lines and communication lines as such relate to the height of agricultural equipment and other heavy duty equipment
abstract: Requires a study on the national electric safety code line height standard for overhead utility lines and communication lines as such relate to the height of agricultural equipment and other heavy duty equipment.

title: Relates to not-for-profit lease of real property
abstract: Relates to not-for-profit lease of real property; provides that when real property not used exclusively to carry out one or more exempt purposes is leased or otherwise used for commercial for-profit purposes, such property shall be subject to taxation and no portion shall be exempt.

title: Relates to support of living organ donation
abstract: Clarifies certain provisions of the New York state living donor support act.

title: Establishes the crime of criminally negligent use of real property
abstract: Establishes the crime of criminally negligent use of real property; establishes that the commission of such crime shall constitute a class A misdemeanor.

title: Relates to exempting certain public school buildings from being designated as early polling locations
abstract: Exempts public school buildings with instructional space from being designated as early polling locations; allows school districts to decline school building designations as early polling locations.

title: Establishes the bystander protection act
abstract: Establishes the bystander protection act which increases the punishment for an offense when a member of the public is harmed, but the intended target is a public official.

title: Relates to the ceremonial designation of the Franklin Delano Roosevelt Mid-Hudson bridge as the "Franklin and Eleanor Roosevelt Mid-Hudson Bridge"
abstract: Designates the Franklin Delano Roosevelt Mid-Hudson bridge as the "Franklin and Eleanor Roosevelt Mid-Hudson Bridge".

title: Authorizes a parking permit system for park-and-rides in the borough of Staten Island in the city of New York
abstract: Authorizes a parking permit system for park-and-rides in the borough of Staten Island in the city of New York; requires residents of Staten Island to receive a permit free of charge and out-of-state residents to pay an annual fee for such permit.

title: Requires the division for small-business to publish a small business compliance guide
abstract: Requires the division for small-business to publish a small business compliance guide and post such guide to the division for small-business's website.

title: Enhances support and services for students with disabilities for postsecondary success
abstract: Provides grants to SUNY schools, CUNY schools, and certain other degree-granting colleges and universities in NY to provide support and services for students with disabilities for postsecondary success.

title: Relates to discovery restrictions for photographs of minors depicting sexual or other intimate parts
abstract: Relates to discovery restrictions for photographs of minors depicting sexual or other intimate parts; provides such photographs shall be subject to in camera review and certain other restrictions.

title: Requires the estimated cost of mandated expenditures and appropriations within the body of the bill
abstract: Requires the estimated cost of mandated expenditures and appropriations within the body of the bill.

title: Prohibits secondary schools and colleges from withholding student transcripts for failure to pay tuition
abstract: Prohibits secondary schools and higher education institutions from withholding student transcripts for failure to pay tuition.

title: Establishes the Non-Degree Proprietary School Supervision and Student Protection Act
abstract: Establishes the Non-Degree Proprietary School Supervision and Student Protection Act.

title: Requires e-mail service providers to implement a procedure to authenticate an individual's identity when such individual creates an e-mail account
abstract: Requires e-mail service providers to implement a procedure to authenticate an individual's identity when such individual creates a new e-mail account.

title: Requires ad hoc members to be appointed in order to constitute a quorum
abstract: Requires ad hoc members to be appointed in order to constitute a quorum on the board of electric generating facilities; includes ad hoc members as part of the board.

title: Prohibits the withholding of state funding for service providers for people with developmental disabilities due to the receipt of certain COVID-19 federal funds
abstract: Prohibits the withholding of state funding for service providers for people with developmental disabilities due to the receipt of certain COVID-19 federal funds.

title: Provides exemption for first time home buyer from a mortgage or recording tax imposed by a municipality
abstract: Provides exemption for first time home buyers from a mortgage or recording tax imposed by a municipality pursuant to article 11 of the tax law; directs commissioner of taxation and finance to establish qualifications and procedures for obtaining such exemption.

title: Exempts real property of an applicable battery park city property from payments in lieu of taxes
abstract: Makes clarifying changes to the exemption of real property of an applicable battery park city property from payments in lieu of taxes (PILOT).

title: Provides for small wireless facility development
abstract: Relates to small wireless facility development; defines terms and sets standards and fees; provides a municipal corporation may require a wireless provider to repair all damage to a right of way directly caused by the activities of the wireless provider; provides courts of competent jurisdiction shall have jurisdiction to determine all disputes arising under this article.

title: Commemorating the 19th Annual Susan B. Anthony Day in the State of New York
Requires landowners to be notified of a petroleum discharge
abstract: Provides that upon notification of a petroleum discharge, the department of environmental conservation shall notify the municipal chief executive and landowners or tenants adjacent to or neighboring the site of the discharge whose property or drinking water supply may be potentially impacted by such discharge.

title: Directs the commissioner of education to promulgate regulations providing for the decertification of a teacher convicted of a felony
abstract: Requires the commissioner of education to promulgate regulations that provide for the immediate decertification of any teacher who is convicted of a felony under NY law or any offense under the laws of another jurisdiction that would be a felony under NY law.

title: Requires air quality monitoring of certain major mass transportation projects that involve an excavation operation within N.Y. city
abstract: Requires air quality monitoring of certain major mass transportation projects that involve an excavation operation within a city having a population of one million or more.

title: Requires certain safety devices at public boat launches
abstract: Requires owners of public boat launches to maintain at least one ring buoy or life preserver and a life-belt device on the premises.

title: Relates to establishing gang courts pilot program
abstract: Relates to establishing gang court pilot programs in the counties of Orange, Nassau, and Suffolk.

title: Relates to certain labelling requirements when substitute drug products are dispensed
abstract: Requires the brand name of a prescribed drug to be indicated on the label when substitute drug products are dispensed.

title: Allows retired state police officers to serve as police officers for local police departments without diminution of retirement benefits
abstract: Allows retired state police officers to serve as police officers for local police departments without diminution of retirement benefits; empowers the superintendent of state police to approve such service.

title: Authorizes Ministerio Sion New York, Inc. to retroactively apply for a real property tax exemption for certain property
abstract: Authorizes Ministerio Sion New York, Inc. to retroactively apply for a real property tax exemption for the 2022-2023 school year and 2023 general taxes for certain property located at 97 New Hyde Park Road in the hamlet of Franklin Square, town of Hempstead, county of Nassau.

title: Relates to police staffing at certain parks
abstract: Relates to police staffing at certain parks; bases the number of officers deployed to regions upon a percentage of the region's park attendance average.

title: Relates to payments in support of racing
abstract: Relates to payments in support of racing; sets up a payment applicants must pay if they are issued a gaming facility license and they do not possess either a pari-mutuel wagering license or franchise award.

title: Relates to imposing a specific tax on all corporate stock buybacks of issued shares
abstract: Relates to imposing a tax of one-half of one percent on all corporate stock buybacks of issued shares.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim February 2023, as Dominican Heritage Month in the State of New York
Relates to waivers of rent adjustments attributable to major capital improvements
abstract: Relates to waivers of rent adjustments attributable to major capital improvements.

title: Provides for the automated identification of affordability program participants
abstract: Provides for the automated identification of affordability program participants to enable such participants to be automatically entered into utility corporation energy affordability programs.

title: Requires oil companies to clean up any spillage occurring during oil delivery
abstract: Requires oil companies to clean up any spillage occurring during oil delivery within 24 hours; imposes a fine of $500 for the first offense with $1000 for each additional offense.

title: Requires training for teachers, administrators and instructors in the area of mental health first aid
abstract: Requires training for teachers, administrators and instructors in the area of mental health first aid; requires office of mental health to assist in development of curriculum for training.

title: Requires certain health insurance policies and contracts to provide coverage for human leukocyte antigen testing for use in tissue typing for bone marrow testing
abstract: Requires certain health insurance policies and contracts to provide coverage for human leukocyte antigen testing, also referred to as histocompatible locus antigen testing, for A, B, and DR antigens, for utilization in tissue typing for bone marrow testing.

title: Increases the penalties for criminal impersonation in the first and second degrees
abstract: Increases the penalties for criminal impersonation in the first degree from a class E felony to a class D felony; increases the penalty for criminal impersonation in the second degree from a class A misdemeanor to a class E felony.

title: Relates to sanctions and penalties for operating a motor vehicle while under the influence of alcohol; repealer
abstract: Relates to sanctions and penalties for operating a motor vehicle while under the influence of alcohol; creates new offenses of criminal intoxication and aggravated criminal intoxication; provides for stiffer penalties for such violations; makes all violations felonies.

title: Relates to negotiations between a governing board and a labor organization
abstract: Relates to negotiations between a governing board and a labor organization.

title: Authorizes reduced cost on hunting; fishing and big game fees for certain disabled persons
abstract: Provides that a resident of the state for a period of three months prior to the date of application and who is otherwise qualified for certain hunting, fishing and big game licenses and who has a disability as defined in the executive law shall be entitled to receive such license at 50% of the cost set by statute.

title: Requires law enforcement agents and peace officers to record information pertaining to the race of persons they have meaningful interactions with in their memo books
abstract: Requires law enforcement agents and peace officers to record information in their memo books pertaining to the race of persons with whom they have meaningful interactions.

title: Requires certain health insurance policies to provide coverage for diagnostic testing for ovarian cancer
abstract: Provides that every health insurance policy which provides coverage for hospital, surgical or medical care shall provide coverage for the standard diagnostic testing for ovarian cancer upon the recommendation of a physician; provides that such standard diagnostic testing shall include a pelvic examination, a sonogram and a CA 125 blood test and related laboratory and diagnostic services.

title: Relates to funding for the office for people with developmental disabilities
abstract: Relates to funding for the office for people with developmental disabilities; transfers one billion dollars to such office from funds appropriated to the MTA; appropriates funds therefor.

title: Provides test preparation for certain students intending to apply to take the specialized high school admissions test
abstract: Provides test preparation for students in the seventh grade and eighth grade intending to apply to take the specialized high school admissions test.

title: Prohibits the imposition of a surcharge by a seller in a sales transaction on a holder who uses a debit card
abstract: Prohibits the imposition of a surcharge by a seller in a sales transaction on a holder who uses a debit card.

title: Authorizes the towns of Harmony and North Harmony in Chautauqua county to elect a single town justice to preside in the town courts of such towns
abstract: Authorizes the towns of Harmony and North Harmony in Chautauqua county to elect a single town justice to preside in the town courts of such towns.

title: Commemorating the 40th Anniversary of the LOFT LGBTQ+ Community Center in White Plains, New York
Requires passengers on school buses equipped with seat belts to wear such belts when the bus is in motion
abstract: Provides that all passengers of school buses must wear seat belts; exempts school bus attendants and others acting in a supervisory capacity from such requirement; requires that drivers announce "Everybody fasten your seat belts" before a school bus is placed in motion; empowers the commissioner of education to enforce such provisions; assigns a school bus attendant to each special needs student unable to comply with the seat belt requirement.

title: Relates to the appointment of parole board members
abstract: Removes the complete authority of the governor to appoint the entire parole board; provides that the parole board shall consist of twenty-four members of whom four shall be appointed by the governor, four members shall be appointed by the chief judge of the court of appeals, four members shall be appointed by the speaker of the assembly, four members shall be appointed by the temporary president of the senate, four members shall be appointed by the minority leader of the senate, and four members shall be appointed by the minority leader of the assembly.

title: Relates to securing orders for certain firearms offenses
abstract: Permits courts to remand a principal to the custody of the sheriff for felony offenses involving the possession of firearms and weapons.

title: Permits school board members who have served ten years to elect to receive state health insurance
abstract: Allows retired and current school board members who have served for ten years to receive state health insurance benefits.

title: Enacts the student suicide prevention act
abstract: Enacts the student suicide prevention act; requires the governing board or body of every local educational agency serving students in grades seven to twelve, to adopt policies, procedures and guidelines on student suicide prevention, intervention and postvention for students in such grades.

title: Relates to transferring any unspent funds from the regents health care professional opportunity scholarship program to the regents physician loan forgiveness program
abstract: Transfers any unspent funds from the regents health care professional opportunity scholarship program to the regents physician loan forgiveness program; provides direction to distribute these funds to meet the same purposes as originally intended.

title: Removes certain residential programs, residential facilities and child care institutions from the definition of the term "youth shelter" for certain purposes
abstract: Removes certain residential programs, residential facilities and child care institutions from the definition of the term "youth shelter" for purposes of the education of persons in youth shelters.

title: Creates the crime of prosecutorial misconduct
abstract: Provides that if a prosecutor withholds information proving the innocence of an individual convicted of or charged with a crime, he or she shall be guilty of a felony with the term of imprisonment being twice that of the term of imprisonment the individual charged with the crime is faced with or twice that which the individual has been sentenced to.

title: Requires legislative approval of any increased fees, rental or charges for the use of the thruway
abstract: Requires legislative approval of any increased fees, rental or charges for the use of the thruway; provides that any shortfalls in revenue resulting from a denied proposal shall be made whole by the general fund.

title: Prohibits the passage of bills by the legislature between the hours of midnight and eight o'clock a.m. unless two-thirds of the legislature is present and requires two-thirds approval for messages of necessity
abstract: Prohibits the passage of bills by the legislature between the hours of midnight and eight o'clock a.m. unless 2/3 of the legislature is present; requires two-thirds approval for messages of necessity.

title: Prohibits the production, sale and use of adhesive-based rodent traps
abstract: Prohibits the importation, manufacture, sale, distribution and use of glue traps, glue boards, and other adhesive-based rodent traps.

title: Establishes a residential condominium owner's bill of rights
abstract: Enacts a bill of rights for owners of residential condominium units to provide fair and equitable treatment of all unit owners; directs the attorney general to promulgate a handbook summary of the rights of unit owners vis-a-vis condominium associations and the procedures and processes available to unit owners to enforce such rights.

title: Relates to advanced recycling and advanced recycling facilities
abstract: Relates to advanced recycling and advanced recycling facilities.

title: Prohibits the appointment of paid employees of the city of Yonkers as members of the board of education of the city school district of such city
abstract: Prohibits the appointment of paid employees of the city of Yonkers or any public benefit corporation thereof as members of the board of education of the city school district of such city; requires the appointment of members of such board to reflect the diversity of such city.

title: Establishes a legal services veterans tax credit for attorneys who perform certain services for veterans and disabled veterans
abstract: Establishes a legal services veterans tax credit of up to $1,500 for any attorney who performs a minimum of fifty hours of pro bono legal services to a veteran or disabled veteran during a taxable year; provides that such services shall include, but not be limited to, veteran's benefits and appeals, military discharges and upgrades, public benefits, evictions and foreclosures, and consumer debt issues.

title: Authorizes a court to direct filing of non-family offense order of protection with the computerized registry for such orders and warrants
abstract: Authorizes a court issuing a non-family offense temporary order of protection or an order of protection to direct that such order be filed with the computerized registry for orders of protection and warrants, if it is necessary to fulfill the purposes of such order; directs the superintendent of state police to include such orders on computerized registry.

title: Requires that websites providing incarcerated individual information be searchable by the incarcerated individual's name, former name or alias
abstract: Requires that websites providing incarcerated individual information be searchable by the incarcerated individual's name, former name or alias.

title: Provides for the sharing of revenue from gaming devices located within the counties of Oneida and Madison
abstract: Provides for the sharing of thirty percent of revenue from gaming devices located within the county of Oneida; provides for the sharing of twenty-five percent of revenue from gaming devices located within the county of Madison.

title: Eases certain restrictions on the conducting of games of chance and bingo for charitable purposes
abstract: Eases certain restrictions on the conducting of games of chance for charitable purposes; authorizes auxiliary members of authorized organizations to operate games of chance; authorizes conducting of games of chance on Sundays; expands advertising of games of chance; eases certain restrictions on the conducting of bingo games for charitable purposes; expands the frequency upon which bingo games may be held; authorizes auxiliary members of authorized organizations to conduct bingo games; authorizes the conducting of bingo games on Sundays; expands advertising of bingo games.

title: Relates to certain medical record requirements for participants in the World Trade Center rescue, recovery, or cleanup operations
abstract: Relates to certain medical record requirements for participants in the World Trade Center rescue, recovery, or cleanup operations; extends the registration period for participation in the World Trade Center rescue, recovery and clean-up operations to September 11, 2027.

title: Relates to the naturally occurring retirement community supportive service program
abstract: Relates to the naturally occurring retirement community supportive service program.

title: Authorizes the county of Jefferson to impose additional sales tax
abstract: Authorizes the county of Jefferson to impose additional sales tax until November 30th, 2025.

title: Establishes a small business tax credit for the employment of disabled persons
abstract: Establishes a small business tax credit for the employment of disabled persons.

title: Relates to a real property tax exemption for property owned by a limited liability company
abstract: Permits a STAR exemption for property owned by a limited liability company where the limited liability company is owned by a person to whom the exemption would have otherwise been granted.

title: Creates the Eastchester creek intermunicipal economic revitalization agency
abstract: Creates the Eastchester creek intermunicipal economic revitalization agency.

title: Requires all individuals pawning goods to present identification and for pawnbrokers to keep records of such person
abstract: Requires all individuals pawning goods to present two forms of identification and for pawnbrokers to keep records of such person; requires pawnbrokers to report new goods within 24 hours of their receipt to the sheriff and they may not be sold or destroyed for 15 days; requires the sheriff to compile a list of goods stolen within the county.

title: Relates to comptroller approval of certain contracts during a declared state disaster emergency
abstract: Provides that where the governor suspends provisions relating to approval of certain contracts by state agencies, the comptroller shall review emergency contracts above a set threshold amount and submit a report to the chairs and ranking minority members of the senate finance committee and the assembly ways and means committee on such emergency contracts, noting any concerns and recommendations, within fourteen days of the submission of such emergency contract.

title: Establishes a rental assistance loan-to-grant program to assist landlords due to the COVID-19 pandemic
abstract: Establishes a rental assistance loan-to-grant program to assist landlords of small rental properties who have lost rental income due to the inability of the landlords' tenants to pay rent during the COVID-19 state disaster emergency; provides for the repeal of such provisions upon the expiration thereof.

title: Authorizes the Westchester county board of elections to merge any election district with 50 or fewer registered voters into an existing election district
abstract: Authorizes the Westchester county board of elections to merge any election district with 50 or fewer registered voters into an existing election district.

title: Requires accident and health insurance policies to cover the cost of genetic testing of persons with a family history of cancer
abstract: Requires accident and health insurance policies to cover the cost of genetic testing of persons with a family history of cancer when the attending physician determines such person has a significant risk thereof.

title: Relates to applications under the economic transformation and facility redevelopment program
abstract: Relates to extending the date for certain applications under the economic transformation and facility redevelopment program.

title: Requires the installation of safety netting on all new and renovated bridges
abstract: Requires the installation of safety netting to prevent falling objects on all new and renovated bridges, including bridges that cross over other roadways, within the state.

title: Designates the tenth day of March of each year as a public holiday, to be known as Harriet Tubman day
abstract: Designates the tenth day of March of each year as a public holiday, to be known as Harriet Tubman day.

title: Relates to the definition of assault weapons
abstract: Relates to the definition of assault weapons; removes certain characteristics from the definition of assault weapons.

title: Adjusts the regional labor force cost index for the Hudson Valley region
abstract: Adjusts the regional labor force cost index for the Hudson Valley region for the 2023-2024 school year and thereafter.

title: Relates to the sale of cosmetic products containing trace amounts of mercury
abstract: Provides that no person shall sell or offer for sale any cosmetic product or personal care product containing mercury, other than in trace amounts allowed by the food and drug administration as unavoidable under conditions of good manufacturing practice or necessary for use as a preservative in the absence of an effective and safe nonmercurial preservative substitute.

title: Criminalizes the operation of a school bus by a person having any amount of alcohol in his or her blood and providing sanctions for violations
abstract: Criminalizes the operation of a school bus by a person having any amount of alcohol in his or her blood and provides sanctions for violations.

title: Allows for NYSTRS retirees to change their retirement plan beneficiary to a spouse at any time either prior to or after retirement
abstract: Allows for NYSTRS retirees to change their retirement plan beneficiary to a spouse at any time either prior to or after retirement.

title: Relates to commencing a study on the relationship between the corrections system and the child welfare system
abstract: Relates to commencing a study on the relationship between the corrections system and the child welfare system.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim 8:30pm-9:30pm on Saturday, March 25, 2023, as Earth Hour in the State of New York
Provides veterans of the armed forces of the United States access to all state parks and recreational facilities without the charge of any admission
abstract: Provides veterans of the armed forces of the United States access to all state parks and recreational facilities without the charge of any admission.

title: Requires the installation and periodic inspection of water detector alarms in residential dwellings and certain commercial buildings
abstract: Requires the installation and periodic inspection of water detector alarms in residential dwellings and certain commercial buildings; defines a "water detector alarm" as an electronic device that detects the presence of water and sets off an audible and visual alarm when its sensors are triggered; defines a "commercial building" as a building in which individuals are employed.

title: Relates to the transferring of monies held in the non-escrowed account for payment of outstanding winning tickets and for payment of refunds to ticket holders; repealer
abstract: Relates to the transferring of monies held in the non-escrowed account for payment of outstanding winning tickets and for payment of refunds to ticket holders; any amount that remains unclaimed after April first of each year shall be transferred to the regional corporation's operating account.

title: Relates to the abandonment of certain town roads in the towns of Pike and Genesee Falls, in the county of Wyoming
abstract: Authorizes that the commissioner of transportation is authorized and directed to assume jurisdiction for state highway purposes over the town road described as follows: all of Griffith road from the intersection with state routes 19 and 39 in the town of Pike easterly to its terminus at state route 19A in the town of Genesee Falls.

title: Relates to enacting the New York child data privacy and protection act
abstract: Enacts the New York child data privacy protection act to prevent the exploitation of children's data; requires data controllers to assess the impact of its products on children for review by the bureau of internet and technology; bans certain data collection and targeted advertising.

title: Relates to home stability support supplement programs
abstract: Relates to the creation of home stability support supplement programs.

title: Relates to conditional release for eligible offenders who complete post-secondary degrees or programs
abstract: Relates to conditional release for eligible offenders who complete post-secondary degrees or programs; provides release twelve months before the completion of the controlling minimum period of imprisonment for eligible offenders who complete post-secondary degrees or programs.

title: Requires health care providers and practitioners to provide patients with a list of ingredients contained in vaccines
abstract: Requires health care providers and practitioners to provide patients with a list of ingredients contained in vaccines, the manufacturer product insert, the vaccines' potential side effects and where to report vaccine-adverse events forty-eight hours prior to immunization.

title: Enacts the school anti-violence education act
abstract: Enacts the "school anti-violence education act"; creates a school anti-violence education program; establishes a school anti-violence education fund.

title: Relates to the rights of former outpatients of mental health facilities to have files sealed after ten years
abstract: Authorizes former outpatients of mental health facilities to request a court of competent jurisdiction to render an order to have their files sealed when more than ten years have elapsed since the last treatment in such facility, they are not currently being treated for mental illness and it would be in the best interests of the petitioner and society to seal such record without the requirement of a special proceeding.

title: Relates to the purchase of cleaner vehicles for use by state agencies
abstract: Relates to the purchase of cleaner vehicles for use by state agencies; defines terms; provides that on and after January 1, 2024, one hundred percent of all new light-duty vehicles purchased by state agencies shall be alternative fuel motor vehicles with the exception of specialty, police or emergency vehicles as designated by the division of the budget; requires the governor's clean vehicle council to prepare a report detailing how such agencies shall purchase, allocate, distribute and utilize bio-diesel in state vehicles; makes related provisions.

title: Relates to the participation by free association libraries in the New York state and local employees' retirement system
abstract: Authorizes the participation by free association libraries in the New York state and local employees' retirement system.

title: Relates to operation of an authorized emergency vehicle
abstract: Relates to operation of an authorized emergency vehicle.

title: Relates to establishing the COVID-19 children scholarship
abstract: Relates to establishing the COVID-19 children scholarship; provides that children whose parent, primary caretaker or sibling died or was disabled as a result of contracting COVID-19 shall be eligible for such scholarship.

title: Relates to increasing penalties for violations relating to test agencies and standardized testing
abstract: Increases penalties from $1000 to $2000 for violations relating to test agencies and standardized testing.

title: Relates to sales and compensating use taxes in the county of Livingston
abstract: Authorizes the county of Livingston to impose an additional one percent sales tax.

title: Allows an affirmation by any person, wherever made, in a civil action
abstract: Allows an affirmation by any person, wherever made, subscribed and affirmed by that person to be true under the penalties of perjury, to be used in a civil action in New York in lieu of and with the same force and effect as an affidavit.

title: Relates to establishing the professional practice of certified midwifery
abstract: Establishes the professional practice of community midwifery; defines as the management in the home, birth center, or community setting, of normal pregnancies, child birth, and postpartum care, including newborn evaluation, resuscitation and referral for infants; sets requirements for license and practice.

title: Grants tax credit for downpayment made on residential housing
abstract: Grants credit against personal income tax to purchasers of residential housing in the amount of any downpayment made on such housing; provides that the maximum credit shall not exceed 5 percent of the purchase price of the residential housing; requires taxpayers to meet eligibility requirements imposed by the state of New York mortgage agency.

title: Relates to certain real property to be conveyed to the town of Huntington
abstract: Extends provisions relating to certain real property to be conveyed to the town of Huntington for one year.

title: Establishes the volunteer fire departments capital fund; appropriation
abstract: Establishes the volunteer fire departments capital fund under the office of fire prevention and control; appropriates funds for such capital fund.

title: Permits the Cleveland Hill union free school district to establish an insurance reserve fund
abstract: Permits the Cleveland Hill union free school district to establish an insurance reserve fund.

title: Grants Lawrence Korzeniewski, the statutory beneficiary of Janice Korzeniewski, accidental death benefits
abstract: Grants Lawrence Korzeniewski, the statutory beneficiary of Janice Korzeniewski, accidental death benefits because Janice Korzeniewski was directed by her employer to return to work and contracted COVID-19 within 45 days of reporting to work and died from such disease.

title: Relates to permitting farmers markets in state and local parks
abstract: Permits farmers markets in state and local parks.

title: Removes labor market attachment requirements for certain disability cases
abstract: Removes labor market attachment requirements for cases of permanent partial disability.

title: Repeals the crime of adultery
abstract: Repeals the crime of adultery.

title: Permits the village of Woodbury to impose a hotel and motel tax
abstract: Permits the village of Woodbury to impose a hotel and motel tax; provides for the repeal of such provisions upon the expiration thereof.

title: Authorizes Michael Telesca to take the competitive civil service examination and be placed on the eligible civil service list for employment as a full-time police officer for the county of Livingston
abstract: Authorizes Michael Telesca to take the competitive civil service examination and be placed on the eligible civil service list for employment as a full-time police officer for the county of Livingston.

title: Requires public agencies to establish preliminary license application procedures to determine whether an applicant for a license would be ineligible for such license based on criminal history
abstract: Requires public agencies to establish preliminary license application procedures to determine whether an applicant for a license would be ineligible for such license based on criminal history; establishes time frames for public agencies to respond to such applications; requires public agencies to report information regarding granting licenses annually.

title: Relates to the tolling of charges imposed by meter for residential use of the water supply when such charges are disputed
abstract: Relates to the tolling of charges imposed by meter for residential use of the water supply when such charges are disputed.

title: Creates New York state regulatory review council; expands scope of regulatory impact statements
abstract: Expands requirements for regulatory impact statements to include discussion of potential benefits and cost savings; creates New York state regulatory review council to review every promulgation, repeal or amendment of every rule or regulation; provides that no new rule, unless critical to health, safety, or welfare, may become effective without the approval of the council; provides for the procedures of the council; provides for an annual report by the council on its actions.

title: Commemorating the 200th Anniversary of the First Presbyterian Church in Lockport, New York
Extends the benefits of the variable supplements fund to all New York city police officers, firefighters, housing police, transit police, correction officers and registered domestic partners
abstract: Extends the benefits of the variable supplements fund to all New York city police officers, firefighters, housing police, transit police, correction officers and registered domestic partners.

title: Relates to appointing a fiscal monitor for the metropolitan transportation authority
abstract: Appoints a fiscal monitor for five years; defines terms; provides for such appointment; provides for the duties of such fiscal monitor.

title: Waives the state application fee for all civil service examinations for all veterans
abstract: Waives the state application fee for all civil service examinations for all veterans.

title: Relates to the continuation of death benefits to a surviving spouse regardless of remarriage
abstract: Relates to the continuation of death benefits to a surviving spouse regardless of remarriage.

title: Directs the New York state energy research and development authority to conduct a study of the technical and economic feasibility and ratepayer impact of a zero emission electrical system
abstract: Directs the New York state energy research and development authority to conduct a study of the technical and economic feasibility and ratepayer impact of a zero-emission electrical system and a reduction in greenhouse gas emissions.

title: Authorizes Kevin Donohue to take the civil service examination for the position of police officer for the town of Goshen
abstract: Authorizes Kevin Donohue to take the competitive civil service examination for the position of full-time police officer for the town of Goshen.

title: Divides the one hundred ninth precinct of the New York city police department into subdivisions
abstract: Divides the one hundred ninth precinct of the New York city police department into two separate subdivisions.

title: Enacts the single opportunity for legislative equality (SOLE) act
abstract: Entitles each member of the legislature to bring one statewide piece of legislation of his or her choosing to the floor for a vote without a home rule message and committee review during each two-year term.

title: Prohibits discrimination in promotion of police officers who fail to meet their employer's ticket quotas
abstract: Prohibits discrimination in the promotion of police officers who fail to meet their employer's traffic ticket quota.

title: Excludes unemployment compensation from state income tax
abstract: Excludes unemployment compensation from being included in the computation of state income tax.

title: Requires New York State health benefit plan hospital pricing report
abstract: Directs the president of the civil service commission to collect health care claims data relating to the price and utilization of hospital benefits by active employees, retired employees and their dependents and to publish a New York State health benefit plan hospital pricing report.

title: Establishes an emergency heating energy assistance program benefit
abstract: Establishes an emergency heating energy assistance program benefit to provide emergency assistance to certain households where such household is threatened with shut-off or an energy emergency due to nonpayment.

title: Provides for the authority of the department of health to engage in or support research on the health effects of artificial night light
abstract: Provides for authority of the department of health to engage in or support research on the health effects of artificial night light.

title: Enacts the "cobalt and lithium mining and production divestment act"
abstract: Enacts the "cobalt and lithium mining and production divestment act" to prevent monies or assets of the common retirement fund from being invested in the stocks, securities or other obligations of any institution or company engaging in cobalt and lithium mining or production for the manufacture of batteries used in large-scale battery storage power stations and the primary propulsion systems for electric vehicles, if such company cannot establish through approved independent monitoring that their mining operation does not use child labor and that adult miners and other workers are employed under conditions that meet accepted criteria.

title: Removes provisions prohibiting N.Y. city from strengthening rent regulation laws to provide more comprehensive coverage than state laws
abstract: Removes provisions that prohibit cities of one million or more from strengthening rent regulation laws to provide more comprehensive coverage than state laws.

title: Relates to a cost of living adjustment for human services programs
abstract: Establishes an annual cost of living adjustment for human services programs indexed to inflation.

title: Waives the residency requirement for the commissioner of planning, development, and public transportation for Putnam county
abstract: Waives the residency requirement for the commissioner of planning, development, and public transportation for Putnam county, provided that such person resides in Putnam county or an adjoining county within the state of New York.

title: Extends the authorization of the county of Greene to impose an additional mortgage recording tax
abstract: Extends the authorization of the county of Greene to impose an additional mortgage recording tax.
