title: Expands the emergency medical technician re-certification demonstration program throughout the state and extends the length of such re-certification; extends the authorization of such program
abstract: Expands the emergency medical technician re-certification demonstration program throughout the state; extends the length of such re-certification from five years to seven years; extends the authorization of such program from 2023 to 2025.

title: Makes reclassification of rent controlled dwelling retroactive to time of decrease in income of members of household of dwelling
abstract: Makes reclassification of rent controlled dwelling retroactive to time of decrease in income of members of household of dwelling.

title: Commemorating the 101st Anniversary of the Mohegan Volunteer Fire Association
Establishes a separate states working group to conduct a study on Long Island statehood
abstract: Establishes a separate states working group to conduct a study on Long Island statehood which includes a cost benefit analysis on Long Island statehood.

title: Relates to requiring landlords to return security deposits within a reasonable time
abstract: Limits security deposits to one month's rent; requires landlords to return the full security deposit and any accrued interest to which the tenant is entitled less any amount retained by the landlord within 21 days of the end of the lease.

title: Establishes the "secure our data act"
abstract: Establishes the "secure our data act"; relates to state entities preparing for and protecting against a ransomware attack.

title: Grants a retroactive parity payment to certain management and confidential retirees
abstract: Grants a retroactive parity payment to certain management and confidential retirees who retired between April 1, 2009 and March 31, 2015, not to exceed $5,000.

title: Relates to railroad rolling stock
abstract: Exempts railroad rolling stock from sales and compensating use taxes; defines "railroad rolling stock" as a device, which is used exclusively upon stationary rails or tracks to transport goods, commodities, or equipment, including, but not limited to, flat cars, box cars, gondolas, hopper cars, or other freight railroad cars.

title: Grants retroactive membership with Tier IV status in the New York state teachers' retirement system to Peter Guarino
abstract: Grants Peter Guarino retroactive membership with Tier IV status in the New York state teachers' retirement system.

title: Establishes the commission of the deaf, deafblind and hard of hearing; repealer
abstract: Establishes the commission of the deaf, deafblind and hard of hearing; requires the commission of the deaf, deafblind, and hard of hearing to transmit complaints in matters affecting the deaf, deafblind, and hard of hearing communities to the vulnerable persons' central register; repeals provisions relating to the New York state interagency coordinating council for services to persons who are deaf, deaf-blind, or hard of hearing.

title: Relates to community preservation funds for the town of Wawayanda
abstract: Authorizes the town of Wawayanda to establish community preservation funds; establishes a real estate transfer tax with revenues therefrom to be deposited in said community preservation fund.

title: Expands the veterans tuition awards program
abstract: Expands the veterans tuition awards program to include all persons who were honorably discharged and were residents of the state before and after serving in the armed forces of the United States; provides veterans an award equal to the in-state tuition paid at a state university for each semester the veteran is engaged in undergraduate, graduate or vocational study.

title: Authorizes bail for principals charged with aggravated cruelty to animals
abstract: Authorizes bail for principals charged with aggravated cruelty to animals.

title: Makes eligible for provisional appointment and authorizes Paul Strobel to take the competitive civil service examination for the position of part-time police officer for Columbia county
abstract: Makes eligible for provisional appointment and authorizes Paul Strobel to take the competitive civil service examination for the position of police officer and be placed on the eligible list for employment as a part-time police officer for the Columbia County Sheriff's Office.

title: Establishes a tax on digital ads
abstract: Establishes a tax on annual gross revenue derived from digital ads.

title: Provides for the establishment of a forty-five dollar fee for all motions made in pending proceedings and for ex parte applications in the surrogate's court
abstract: Provides for the establishment of a forty-five dollar fee for all motions made in pending proceedings and for ex parte applications in the surrogate's court.

title: Requires all commercial buildings be retrofitted with motion detectors for controlling lighting
abstract: Requires all commercial buildings be retrofitted with motion detectors for controlling lighting.

title: Relates to persons authorized to visit inmate-patient facilities of the department of mental hygiene
abstract: Authorizes the governor and lieutenant-governor, commissioner of general services, secretary of state, comptroller and attorney-general, members of the legislature and any employee of the inmate-patient facility as requested by the member of the legislature if the member requests to be so accompanied, provided that such request does not impact upon the department's ability to manage its facilities as determined by the commissioner, judges of the court of appeals, supreme court and county judges, district attorneys and county sheriffs to visit inmate-patient facilities of the department of mental hygiene.

title: Creates the task force on early childhood education in public education
abstract: Creates the task force on early childhood education in public education to study the feasibility of incorporating younger age levels into the state public education system and extending the public education system to start at the age of six months and incorporate aspects of childcare and early childhood education into the existing public education system.

title: Restores judicial discretion relating to bail reform; repealer
abstract: Restores judicial discretion relating to bail reform; provides that when the defendant is charged with a felony, the court shall request of the applicable county pre-trial services agency a risk and needs assessment be conducted on the eligible defendant for the purpose of determining whether such defendant should be released on the defendant's own recognizance, released under non-monetary conditions or, where authorized, bail or commit the defendant to the custody of the sheriff; defines risks and needs assessment; makes related provisions.

title: Provides for the adjustment of the minimum amount of tax delinquency for which the driver's license of a taxpayer may be suspended
abstract: Provides for the adjustment of the minimum amount of tax delinquency for which the driver's license of a taxpayer may be suspended, based on inflation; prohibits inclusion in the license suspension program of a taxpayer who receives public assistance or supplemental security income, or whose income does not exceed 250% of the poverty level; authorizes the commissioner to grant exemptions to taxpayers whose payment of past due tax liabilities would create a hardship to the taxpayer in meeting necessary living expenses.

title: Increases the length of the term of office to four years for members of the legislature
abstract: Increases the length of the term of office to four years for members of the legislature.

title: Relates to substance abuse prevention personnel in New York city schools
abstract: Relates to substance abuse prevention personnel in New York city schools.

title: Directs the liquor authority to create a standardized form for use by municipalities and community boards for comment on renewal applications
abstract: Directs the liquor authority to create a standardized form for use by municipalities and community boards for comment on renewal applications, to be used by the liquor authority in consideration of granting such renewals.

title: Relates to tuition assistance for students completing programs of micro-credentialing
abstract: Provides tuition assistance program awards for students completing programs of micro-credentialing; includes micro-credential programs in reports which determine community college funding.

title: Relates to licensing and other provisions relating to firearms; repealed
abstract: Relates to licensing and other provisions relating to firearms.

title: Extends provisions relating to the mortgage tax in the county of Yates
abstract: Extends provisions relating to the mortgage tax in the county of Yates until December 1, 2025.

title: Makes migrant youth under the age of 25 eligible to receive housing vouchers under the family homelessness and eviction prevention supplement ("FHEPS") program
abstract: Makes migrant youth under the age of 25 who are receiving runaway and homeless youth services eligible to receive housing vouchers under the family homelessness and eviction prevention supplement ("FHEPS") program.

title: Establishes the office of nonprofit development within the empire state development corporation
abstract: Establishes the office of nonprofit development within the empire state development corporation to assist nonprofit organizations with business development, capacity building, technical support and education.

title: Establishes September twenty-second of each year as a day of commemoration known as Veteran Suicide Awareness and Remembrance Day
abstract: Establishes September twenty-second of each year as a day of commemoration known as Veteran Suicide Awareness and Remembrance Day.

title: Requires the state pay taxes on the assessed value of properties of closed state prisons
abstract: Requires the state pay taxes on the assessed value of properties of closed state prisons until such prison is reopened, used by another state agency, or is conveyed to a non-governmental entity.

title: Authorizes the acceptance of an application for a retroactive property tax exemption from the Center for Jewish Life of Hewlett Inc.
abstract: Authorizes the acceptance of an application for a retroactive property tax exemption from the Center for Jewish Life of Hewlett Inc. for the 2021--2022 school year and the 2022 general year assessment roll.

title: Honoring Clarence Center Preschool, Inc. for its designation as recipient of the Small Business of the Year Award by the Clarence Chamber of Commerce
Enacts the interstate medical licensure compact
abstract: Enacts the interstate medical licensure compact; provides a streamlined process that allows physicians to become licensed in multiple participating states, thereby enhancing the portability of a medical license and ensuring the safety of patients.

title: Relates to a state flag for raising awareness of veteran suicide
abstract: Provides that the "Suicide Awareness and Remembrance Flag" shall be the official state flag for the raising of awareness of veteran suicide; directs the commissioner of general services to establish a protocol for the flying of such flag.

title: Relates to enabling constitutionally-qualified electors to register to vote and to cast a ballot on the same day at a polling location
abstract: Enables constitutionally-qualified electors to register to vote and to cast a ballot on the same day at a polling location.

title: Relates to the dismissal of members on the panel for educational policy
abstract: Prohibits the discharge or dismissal of a member of the panel for educational policy without providing such member with a thirty day notice of such discharge or dismissal.

title: Amends section 4 of Rule IV of the Assembly Rules, relating to committees
Provides for a priority call system for use in connection with emergency disconnections of utilities, service coverage and oversight of response time
abstract: Provides for a priority call system for use in connection with emergency disconnections of utilities, service coverage and oversight of response time in connection with the emergency disconnection of utilities.

title: Provides for the protection of the air quality at day care centers licensed by the state and head start day care centers funded pursuant to federal law
abstract: Provides for the protection of the air quality at licensed day care centers and head start day care centers funded pursuant to federal law; requires the office of children and family services to consult with the commissioners of environmental conservation and health regarding the air quality and environmental hazards that may be involved with any new day care center or head start day care center; requires such office to consult with the department of health if any new environmental or environmental health hazard arises.

title: Directs the commissioner of taxation and finance to conduct a study of assessments, fees and tax rates, and associated policies of the state of New York relating to providers of telecommunications services
abstract: Directs the commissioner of taxation and finance to conduct a study of assessments, fees and tax rates, and associated policies of the state of New York relating to providers of telecommunications services to ensure a more fair and proportional distribution of the assessments, fees and taxes imposed on telecommunications service providers and their end-use delivery customers.

title: Directs the commissioner of education to require public schools to report on compliance with art education instruction requirements
abstract: Directs the state education commissioner to require public school districts to report on compliance with art education instruction requirements.

title: Establishes a spending cap and increases the maximum capacity of the rainy day fund
abstract: Establishes a spending cap; increases the maximum capacity of the rainy day fund.

title: Requires the county seat in Herkimer county to have at least one polling place designated for early voting
abstract: Requires the county seat in Herkimer county to have at least one polling place designated for early voting.

title: Prohibits the application of fail-first or step therapy protocols to coverage for the diagnosis and treatment of serious mental health conditions
abstract: Prohibits the application of fail-first or step therapy protocols to coverage for the diagnosis and treatment of serious mental health conditions; defines serious mental health condition.

title: Relates to the definition of a day student for the purposes of employment
abstract: Relates to the definition of a day student for the purposes of employment.

title: Excludes certain actions from reporting requirements relating to environmental quality reviews
abstract: Excludes from reporting requirements relating to environmental quality reviews actions to approve the siting or construction of housing in cities with a population of one million or more.

title: Enacts the "Wandering Officers Act"
abstract: Enacts the "Wandering Officers Act" prohibiting provisional or permanent appointment of a person as a police officer if such person has previously been fired as a police officer from any jurisdiction within or without the state, if such person left a position as a police officer either while under an investigation or while being the subject of a disciplinary action which could result in termination from any jurisdiction within or without the state, or if such person resigned while criminal charges were pending stemming from actions committed while on duty as a police officer in any jurisdiction within or without the state.

title: Provides for the creation of a drug guide for seniors regarding the drugs commonly used by people over 62 years of age
abstract: Provides for the creation of a drug guide for seniors regarding the drugs commonly used by people over 62 years of age; provides that such guide will include functions and drug interactions.

title: Provides alternative sentence of impounding the vehicle operated by a person upon conviction of driving while ability impaired by alcohol or drugs
abstract: Grants the court an additional sentencing option of impoundment of the vehicle operated by a person convicted of driving while intoxicated (DWI) or driving while ability impaired (DWAI), for definite periods of time depending on the seriousness of the crime; establishes procedure for impounding vehicles driven while under the influence of alcohol or drugs and for the redemption of such vehicles following such impoundment.

title: Requires gas and electric corporations to provide sixty days' notice to customers whenever there is a service rate or charge increase
abstract: Requires gas and electric corporations to provide sixty days' notice to customers whenever there is a service rate or charge increase.

title: Directs the commissioner of agriculture and markets to establish a program to provide funding to emergency food providers to purchase prepared meals from New York restaurants and deliver them to families in need
abstract: Directs the commissioner of agriculture and markets, in consultation with the commissioner of the office of temporary and disability assistance, to establish a grant program to provide funding to emergency food providers to purchase prepared meals from New York restaurants and deliver them to families in need.

title: Designates a portion of the state highway system as the "SP4 Herman Emil Anders, Jr. Memorial Bridge"
abstract: Designates a portion of the state highway system constituting the bridge on state route 79, crossing over the Chenango River and connecting the town of Greene, county of Chenango, with the town of Fenton, county of Broome, as the "SP4 Herman Emil Anders, Jr. Memorial Bridge".

title: Provides for rules and regulations for strip searches in correctional facilities
abstract: Directs the state commission of correction to promulgate rules and regulations for strip searches in correctional facilities which at a minimum include a requirement that no fewer than two staff members shall be present for any strip search.

title: Prohibits smoking in private passenger cars, vans or trucks where minors less than 14 years of age are passengers in such vehicles; penalties for violation
abstract: Prohibits smoking in private passenger cars, vans and trucks where a minor less than 14 years of age is a passenger in such vehicles; provides for rebuttable presumption; provides that violations of such provisions shall be subject to a fine of not more than $100.

title: Relates to the rate paid by the state to a city for maintenance and repair of highways
abstract: Relates to the rate paid by the state to a city for maintenance and repair of highways.

title: Relates to the Syracuse regional airport
abstract: Provides that the Syracuse regional airport authority may acquire, hold, own, lease, establish, construct, effectuate, operate, maintain, renovate, improve, extend or repair any of its facilities through, and cause any one or more of its powers, duties, functions or activities to be exercised or performed by, no more than two wholly owned subsidiary corporations of the authority for the purposes of operating parking and concessions including food, beverage, and retail services, and airline and aircraft services including ticketing, baggage and fueling services and other services for the operation of the airport.

title: Exempts from disclosure on the freedom of information law, the issuance of pistol permits to active and retired police officers, peace officers and correction officers
abstract: Exempts from disclosure, under the freedom of information law, the issuance of pistol permits to active and retired police officers, peace officers and correction officers.

title: Relates to publication of legal notices on the official Westchester county website
abstract: Relates to publication of legal notices on the official Westchester county website.

title: Relates to peace officers appointed by The Sea Gate Association
abstract: Removes certain restrictions on peace officers appointed by The Sea Gate Association.

title: Imposes an excise tax on sugary drinks
abstract: Imposes an excise tax on sugary drinks; establishes a community health equity fund to utilize the revenues generated by such tax.

title: Allows for the admission of a defendant's previous declarations or statements when the crime committed is a hate crime
abstract: Allows for the admission of a defendant's previous declarations or statements when the crime committed is a hate crime.

title: Relates to tax lien foreclosure
abstract: Relates to tax lien foreclosure; caps the interest rate charged on all taxes received after the interest free period and all delinquent taxes at 16% per year; creates a taxpayer bill of rights and requires compliance therewith by each county, city and town.

title: Provides for payments to licensed harness tracks by regional off-track betting corporations
abstract: Provides for payments to licensed harness tracks by regional off-track betting corporations.

title: Changes the official name of the Staten Island Expressway to the POW-MIA Memorial Highway
abstract: Changes the official name of the Staten Island Expressway to the "POW-MIA Memorial Highway".

title: Extends the authorization granted to the county of Warren to impose an additional mortgage recording tax
abstract: Extends the authorization granted to the county of Warren to impose an additional mortgage recording tax until December 1, 2025.

title: Relates to the crime of official misconduct for sexual harassment
abstract: Relates to the crime of official misconduct for sexual harassment for members of the New York state legislature; makes it a class A misdemeanor.

title: Creates the real property regulatory impacts act
abstract: Creates the real property regulatory impacts act; provides that the owner of any real property may bring an action against the state whenever the application of any state statute, rule or regulation to such property causes a diminution in value of fifty percent or more.

title: Directs a pilot program for the use of digital license plates
abstract: Directs a pilot program for the use of digital license plates on motor vehicles.

title: Requires industrial development agencies to only include jobs filled by residents of New York state when assessing the progress of projects that are provided financial assistance
abstract: Requires industrial development agencies to only include jobs filled by residents of New York state when assessing the progress of projects that are provided financial assistance.

title: Requires that the city council appoint members to, designate the chairman of, fill vacancies of and remove members of the rent guidelines board
abstract: Requires that the city council appoint members to, designate the chairman of, fill vacancies of and remove members of the rent guidelines board.

title: Relates to electronic bell jar vending machines
abstract: Relates to authorizing and regulating the use of electronic bell jar vending machines.

title: Relates to delaying the implementation of class size reduction plans and including additional exemptions to class size targets
abstract: Relates to delaying the implementation of class size reduction plans and including additional exemptions to class size targets; provides such plans shall begin in September 2029 and be achieved by September 2034; adds gifted and talented schools and programs, screened admissions schools and programs, portfolio and specialized high schools and advanced placement classes.

title: Establishes the bureau of the senior tenants' advocate in the state office for the aging
abstract: Establishes the bureau of the senior tenants' advocate within the state office for the aging; provides that the senior tenants' advocate shall assist senior citizen tenants in resolving complaints they may have with the New York state division of housing and community renewal, landlord disputes, rent increases, and other housing related matters; provides that the governor shall appoint the senior tenants' advocate.

title: Provides that the borough of Staten Island shall also be known and designated as the "borough of parks"
abstract: Provides that the borough of Staten Island shall also be known and designated as the "borough of parks".

title: Permits the commissioner of education to include graduate programs as programs eligible for approval under the state tuition assistance program
abstract: Permits the commissioner of education to include graduate programs as programs eligible for approval under the state tuition assistance program.

title: Relates to implementing automatic enrollment for the tax abatement program for rent-controlled and rent-regulated property occupied by senior citizens
abstract: Implements automatic enrollment for the tax abatement program for rent-controlled and rent-regulated property occupied by senior citizens; provides for a check box for a taxpayer to opt-out of data sharing and automatic enrollment on their tax return.

title: Relates to transfer of sick time
abstract: Allows certain employees to transfer or receive sick time from a fellow employee.

title: Establishes distinctive "Long Island Sound" license plates
abstract: Establishes distinctive "Long Island Sound" license plates; creates the "Long Island Sound environmental fund" for the department of environmental conservation to distribute moneys to not-for-profit corporations, educational organizations or local governments undertaking projects aimed at the beautification of and environmental improvements to the Long Island Sound.

title: Recognizing March 3, 2023, as World Hearing Day
Relates hydraulic dredging for commercial purposes in the waters of Mill Neck Creek in the town of Oyster Bay, county of Nassau
abstract: Prohibits any new permits, leases or any other agreements authorizing the hydraulic dredging for commercial purposes in the waters of Mill Neck Creek in the town of Oyster Bay, county of Nassau.

title: Relates to undisclosed self-dealing
abstract: Prohibits conduct in an official capacity in connection with the award of a public contract or public grant that is intended to confer an undisclosed benefit on a public servant, a person with whom a public servant has a business or other financial relationship.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim February 2023, as Career and Technical Education Month in the State of New York
Establishes a uniform ambulance assessment fee
abstract: Establishes a uniform ambulance assessment fee on the annual revenues of certain ambulance services to be expended for increasing medical assistance payment rates for ambulance services.

title: Establishes the electronic open auction public bond sale pilot program for counties, cities, towns, villages and school districts
abstract: Establishes the electronic open auction public bond sale pilot program for counties, cities, towns, villages and school districts; provides such provisions shall remain in effect for 3 years.

title: Relates to reporting requirements on small nonprofits
abstract: Relates to reporting requirements on small nonprofits which lobby before the government.

title: Relates to limitations on the granting of custody of a minor
abstract: Prohibits a court from granting custody of a minor to anyone who has been convicted of any of the enumerated sex crimes except where a court finds there is no significant risk to the child.

title: Relates to the effect and rebuttal of certain medical presumptions relating to heart disease
abstract: Relates to the effect and rebuttal of certain medical presumptions relating to heart disease; provides that, for certain members, any condition of impairment of health caused by a disease of the heart, resulting in disability, shall be presumptive evidence that such disability was incurred in the performance and discharge of duty and the natural and proximate result of an accident.

title: Relates to authorizing bail and pre-trial detention for arson felonies
abstract: Authorizes bail and pre-trial detention for all arson felonies.

title: Enacts the New York state nursing shortage correction act
abstract: Enacts the New York state nursing shortage correction act; establishes the New York state nursing recruitment incentive and retention program; defines terms; provides for tuition benefits and the reimbursement of student loans if a person is a registered and licensed nurse; provides that SUNY and CUNY shall pay for a person's education if such person signs a contract stating that he or she shall work in New York state as a registered nurse; makes related provisions; establishes the New York state nursing recruitment incentive and retention account.

title: Expands aggravated cruelty to animals to include all animals
abstract: Expands aggravated cruelty to animals to include all animals.

title: Creates a "purple alert system" for missing victims of domestic violence
abstract: Creates a "purple alert system" for missing victims of domestic violence.

title: Directs a full cost benefit analysis of the technical and economic feasibility of renewable energy systems in the state of New York and to compare such directly with other methods of electricity generation
abstract: Directs the public service commission in consultation with NYSERDA to conduct a full cost benefit analysis of the technical and economic feasibility of renewable energy systems in the state of New York and to compare such directly with other methods of electricity generation within nine months after the effective date and every four years thereafter.

title: Requires the deposit, into the dedicated highway and bridge trust fund, of a portion of the sales tax collected on each gallon of motor fuel sold at retail; repealer
abstract: Requires the deposit, into the dedicated highway and bridge trust fund, of a portion of the sales tax collected on each gallon of motor fuel sold at retail; increases the amount to be deposited over time.

title: Establishes the East of Hudson watershed road salt reduction task force, pilot plan and test program
abstract: Establishes the East of Hudson watershed road salt reduction task force, pilot plan and test program to conduct a comprehensive review of road salt contamination and road management best practices within the East of Hudson watershed.

title: Provides public access to epinephrine auto-injector devices at schools
abstract: Provides public access to epinephrine auto-injector devices at schools; establishes public access epinephrine auto-injector device providers.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim March 2023, as Pure New York State Maple Month in the State of New York
Establishes Davina's driver accountability law which requires a uniform curriculum for accident prevention courses; repealer
abstract: Establishes Davina's driver accountability law which requires the commissioner of motor vehicles to establish a uniform curriculum for accident prevention courses for use by all sponsoring agencies, delivery agencies and instructors in this state; provides for the repeal of certain provisions upon the expiration thereof.

title: Relates to the issue of non-commercial drivers' licenses and learners' permits in counties which contain in whole or in part boundary land; repealer
abstract: Relates to the issue of non-commercial drivers' licenses and learners' permits in counties which contain in whole or in part boundary land.

title: Enacts Retain-NY by implementing tuition tax credits and increasing the amount of an allowable deduction
abstract: Relates to a tuition tax credit; increases the amount of an allowable deduction (Part A); reduces income by the amount of interest paid for student loans (Part B).

title: Celebrating the life and legacy of Matthew Hoose, Ontario County Clerk, devoted family man and distinguished member of his community
Designates sheriffs, under-sheriffs and deputy sheriffs of the city of New York as police officers
abstract: Designates sheriffs, under-sheriffs and deputy sheriffs of the city of New York as police officers.

title: Relates to legal challenges to the constitutionality of provisions of the election law
abstract: Provides that for any legal challenge to the constitutionality of a provision of the election law, venue shall be brought in the following designated court in the judicial department within which at least one plaintiff is located: first judicial department: New York county; second judicial department: Westchester county; third judicial department: Albany county; and fourth judicial department: Erie county.

title: Relates to underground electrical services in Suffolk and Nassau counties
abstract: Requires all new residential and commercial units in Suffolk and Nassau counties, including all structures that have realized repairs or improvements that are equal to or greater than fifty percent of the structure's value, to install underground service drops at such locations.

title: Authorizes Carl Spatola to receive a refund from the New York state teachers' retirement system
abstract: Authorizes Carl Spatola to receive a refund from the New York state teachers' retirement system due to overpayment.

title: Requires full family service restroom facilities in public buildings
abstract: Requires full family service restroom facilities in public buildings to permit a caregiver to attend to the sanitary and hygienic needs of any person affected by any combination of physical and/or cognitive disabilities.

title: Requires that certain school personnel are properly trained in the treatment of severe allergies and anaphylaxis and the administration of glucagon or an emergency epinephrine auto injector
abstract: Requires that every licensed nurse, nurse practitioner, physician assistant, or physician employed by a school shall have completed proper training in the assessment, management and treatment of severe allergies and anaphylaxis; requires that every school shall have at least two unlicensed school personnel who are trained to administer glucagon or an emergency epinephrine auto injector; requires in elementary schools and other schools where students learn in a single classroom that the teacher of such class be trained in the administration of glucagon or an emergency epinephrine auto injector.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim March 2023 as Social Work Month in the State of New York
Designates a portion of the state highway system as the "General Colin Powell Thruway"
abstract: Designates a portion of interstate eighty-seven as the "General Colin Powell Thruway".

title: Establishes a one-stop farming hotline with the Cornell cooperative extension
abstract: Establishes a one-stop farming hotline with the Cornell cooperative extension.

title: Provides a heart disease presumption for correction officers, correction supervisors, deputy sheriff patrol or deputy sheriff patrol supervisors
abstract: Provides a heart disease presumption for correction officers, correction supervisors, deputy sheriff patrol or deputy sheriff patrol supervisors.

title: Prohibits geofencing by digital advertisers at health care facilities
abstract: Prohibits digital advertisers from establishing a virtual "geofence" around a health care facility that enables the advertiser to send targeted advertisements to any cellphones or mobile devices that enter such health care facility; prohibits the delivery of digital advertisements to persons in a health care facility using geofencing technology.

title: Requires hotel, motel and inn keepers to offer condoms for sale to registered guests
abstract: Requires hotel, motel and inn keepers to offer, in the registration office, condoms or similar prophylactic devices for sale to registered guests of such hotel, motel or inn.

title: Provides that each member of the legislature is entitled to have at least one substantive piece of legislation discharged from committee and brought to a vote during each two year term
Relates to the use of injurious physical force by public servants
abstract: Relates to the use of injurious physical force by public servants; directs the commissioner of criminal justice services and the commissioner of health to prescribe standards for the use of physical force and for devices and substances used in the exercise of physical force.

title: Relates to the description of the arms of the state and the state flag
abstract: Removes the phrase E pluribus unum from the arms of the state and the state flag.

title: Relates to requiring affordable housing projects to calculate and only use the area median income for the specific zip code that the project is located in
abstract: Relates to requiring affordable housing projects to calculate and only use the area median income for the specific zip code that the project is located in for determining affordability.

title: Relates to the purposes and powers of industrial development agencies, local development corporations and certain other not-for-profit corporations and to improving the accountability; repealer
abstract: Relates to the purposes and powers of industrial development agencies and to improving the accountability and transparency of such agencies; makes conforming changes to the general municipal law; extends the bond issuance charge to the debt issued by not-for-profit corporations acting on behalf of the state or its political subdivisions; relates to the purposes and powers of local development corporations and certain other not-for-profit corporations thereof.

title: Relates to penalties for intent to cause injury to an animal
abstract: Relates to penalties for intent to cause injury to an animal.

title: Requires duly incorporated humane society, pound or shelter to make reasonable efforts to locate the owner of certain animals or provide for the fostering or adoption of such animals
abstract: Requires duly incorporated humane society, pound or shelter to make reasonable efforts to locate the owner of certain animals or provide for the fostering or adoption of such animals; provides that such efforts shall include, but not be limited to, checking such animals for identification, social media, placing a photograph and general description, and other identifying information on the internet.

title: Establishes a private right of action against gun industry members for marketing firearms and firearm related products to minors
abstract: Prohibits gun industry members from marketing firearms and firearm related products to minors; establishes a private right of action for violations.

title: Relates to authorizing the New York city transit authority to provide a minimum twenty-five percent discount on mass transit for college students
abstract: Authorizes the New York city transit authority to contract with mass transit entities including the Long Island Rail Road and the Metro-North Commuter Railroad Company to provide a minimum twenty-five percent discount for college students.

title: Enacts "Officer Randolph Holder's law"
abstract: Enacts "Officer Randolf Holder's law"; modifies how eligibility is determined for the judicial diversion program for certain felony offenders.

title: Relates to community preservation funds for the town of Chester
abstract: Authorizes the town of Chester to establish community preservation funds; establishes a real estate transfer tax with revenues therefrom to be deposited in said community preservation fund.

title: Relates to official misconduct for sexual harassment
abstract: Creates the crime of official misconduct for sexual harassment by a public servant; makes it a class A misdemeanor.

title: Requires the forfeiture by state officers or local officers of STAR exemption eligibility upon conviction of a felony related to public employment
abstract: Requires the forfeiture by state officers or local officers of STAR exemption eligibility upon conviction of a felony related to public employment.

title: Relates to procedures for certain temporary custody orders
abstract: Establishes procedures for temporary custody orders that include a fifty-fifty rebuttable presumption that the parents shall have temporary joint legal and shared physical custody and shall share equal parenting time.

title: Requires applicants for certain nursing licenses and certifications to complete training in the prevention of human trafficking
abstract: Requires applicants for certain nursing licenses and certifications to complete a course in the prevention of human trafficking; directs the commissioners of education and health to develop such training and regulations; directs that certain forfeited funds be used to reimburse actual costs expended for the development of such training.

title: Establishes the previously owned zero emission vehicles rebate program
abstract: Establishes the previously owned zero-emission vehicles rebate program to provide an incentive of an amount up to $2,000 for individuals who purchase used or previously owned zero-emission vehicles.

title: Establishes the statewide childcare workforce living wage fund; appropriation
abstract: Establishes the statewide childcare workforce living wage fund to improve workforce conditions for employees of childcare services and programs through grants for salary increases, workforce retention bonuses and recruitment bonuses, indirect costs associated with implementing salary increases and bonuses, costs associated with employee health and fringe benefits and provider pay in certain circumstances; makes an appropriation therefor.

title: Directs the commissioner of taxation and finance to grant an automatic extension until May 15, 2023 for counties affected by a severe winter storm in December 2022
abstract: Directs the commissioner of taxation and finance to grant an automatic extension until May 15, 2023 for counties affected by a severe winter storm in December 2022; authorizes such extension for individuals and households who reside or have a business in the counties of Erie, Genesee, Niagara, St. Lawrence, and Suffolk counties.

title: Relates to purchasing restrictions and investment of certain public funds in persons that elect not to dispense mifepristone
abstract: Relates to purchasing restrictions and investment of certain public funds in persons that elect not to dispense mifepristone; requires the commissioner to develop and publish, using credible information available to the public, a list of persons determined by the commissioner, that have elected not to dispense mifepristone.

title: Prohibits health insurers from requiring insureds purchase prescribed drugs from mail order pharmacy
abstract: Prohibits health insurers from requiring that the insured purchase prescribed drugs from a mail order pharmacy or pay a co-payment fee when such purchases are not made from a mail order pharmacy if a similar fee is not charged for drugs from a mail order pharmacy.

title: Requires victims of firearm violence be offered and/or provided psychiatric care
abstract: Requires victims of firearm violence be offered and/or provided psychiatric care.

title: Relates to establishing the crime of domestic violence
abstract: Establishes the crime of domestic violence punishable as a class A misdemeanor.

title: Relates to unlawful strikes by public employees
abstract: Relates to unlawful strikes by public employees; provides for the settlement of certain disputes relating to terms and conditions of employment of certain transit and transportation authorities.

title: Allows salary and civil service exam credits for police officers in certain cities and property tax credits for resident officers
abstract: Allows salary and civil service exam credits for police officers in certain cities and property tax credits for resident officers and student loan forgiveness program for certain police officers.

title: Relates to reverse mortgage loans; repealer
abstract: Relates to reverse mortgage loans for persons 62 years of age and older.

title: Relates to the placement of school crossing guards
abstract: Relates to the placement of school crossing guards; requires school crossing guards to be placed on each of the corners of streets adjacent to public and private schools in New York City serving students in grades K-8 and on each side of streets with more than four lanes.

title: Relates to limiting the number of shelters in council districts
abstract: Relates to limiting the number of shelters in council districts.

title: Requires notice be provided to any officer or employee of the department of corrections and community supervision whose personal information is the subject of a subpoena duces tecum
abstract: Requires that notice be provided to any officer or employee of the department of corrections and community supervision whose personal information is the subject of a subpoena duces tecum.

title: Congratulating the Waverly High School Boys 200-Yard Freestyle Relay Team upon the occasion of capturing the NYSPHSAA Boys Swimming and Diving Championship
Extends the authorization of the county of Genesee to impose a county recording tax on obligation secured by a mortgage on real property
abstract: Extends the authorization of the county of Genesee to impose a county recording tax on obligation secured by a mortgage on real property from 2023 to 2025.

title: Provides that the thruway authority shall issue permits for ambulances and emergency medical services vehicles
abstract: Provides that the thruway authority shall issue permits for ambulances and emergency medical services vehicles exempting such vehicles from paying tolls on the thruway when engaged in an emergency operation; defines emergency medical services vehicle.

title: Exempts income earned by persons from certain job training or adult education programs from the determination of need for public assistance programs
abstract: Exempts income earned by a head of household or any person in the household from certain job training or adult education programs from the determination of  need for public assistance programs.

title: Provides for the sale of salvaged airbags; repealer
abstract: Provides for the sale of salvaged airbags; allows for the sale of non-deployed recycled airbags in New York, provided that such airbags meet required safety standards.

title: Relates to increasing the mandatory retirement age of New York state regional park police
abstract: Relates to increasing the mandatory retirement age of New York state regional park police from 62 to 65 years old.

title: Establishes civil liability for anyone subjecting another person to the deprivation of any rights, privileges or immunities secured by law
abstract: Establishes civil liability for anyone subjecting another person to the deprivation of any rights, privileges or immunities secured by law; establishes that the supreme court shall have jurisdiction over such matters and that the prevailing party shall be awarded reasonable attorney's fees as part of the costs; provides that the state waives sovereign immunity for violations of such law.

title: Relates to the New York state dental faculty loan forgiveness incentive program
abstract: Relates to the New York state dental faculty loan forgiveness incentive program.

title: Requires testing the radon level of gas produced, sold, purchased, acquired, stored or injected and prohibits certain gas from entering the distribution system
abstract: Requires testing the radon level of gas produced, sold, purchased, acquired, stored or injected; prohibits gas with a radon content greater than 2 pCi/L from entering the distribution system.

title: Provides that crimes committed against a person on school grounds shall be deemed to be one category higher than the specified crime the person committed
abstract: Provides that crimes committed against a person on school grounds shall be deemed to be one category higher than the specified crime the person committed; enacts "Suzanne's Law".

title: Relates to the recovery of deceased domesticated animals on public roads
abstract: Requires the department of transportation to attempt to identify and notify the owners of deceased domesticated animals recovered on public roads.

title: Removes references to the terms "masseur" and "masseuse"
abstract: Removes references to the terms "masseur" and "masseuse".

title: Requires the owner of certain sites to establish and maintain an environmental maintenance trust fund
abstract: Requires the owner of sites where any action is or was taken which may have a significant impact on the environment to establish and maintain an environmental maintenance trust fund.

title: Relates to the monetary penalties for the crime of aggravated harassment or for discrimination
abstract: Increases the monetary penalties for the crimes of aggravated harassment in the first or second degrees or for discrimination; provides that such penalty shall be not less than five hundred dollars nor more than twenty-five hundred dollars for the first violation and not less than twenty-five hundred dollars nor more than twelve thousand five hundred dollars for each subsequent violation.

title: Relates to the qualification to hold the position of assistant district attorney in the county of Rensselaer
abstract: Relates to removing the residency requirement to hold the position of assistant district attorney in the county of Rensselaer, provided that such assistant district attorney resides in an adjoining county.

title: Expands the definition of aggravated cruelty to animals
abstract: Expands the definition of aggravated cruelty to animals to include serious physical injuries or the use of a weapon.

title: Relates to the eligibility of occupants of public housing authorities for rental assistance
abstract: Relates to the eligibility of occupants of public housing authorities for rental assistance; authorizes occupants of public housing authorities to receive rental assistance at the same times as all other eligible populations.

title: Permits the town board of the town of East Hampton to provide health insurance coverage for enrolled members of the East Hampton Volunteer Ocean Rescue and Auxiliary Squad
abstract: Permits the town board of the town of East Hampton to provide health insurance coverage for enrolled members of the East Hampton Volunteer Ocean Rescue and Auxiliary Squad as is currently authorized for volunteer firefighters and volunteer ambulance workers.

title: Increases reimbursement rates paid by the state to cities for repair and maintenance of state arterials
abstract: Increases reimbursement rates paid by the state to cities for repair and maintenance of state arterials; provides rate would be raised to one dollar and eighty cents from eighty-five cents per square yard of the pavement area that is included in the state highway system and an additional twenty cents, up from ten cents, per square yard of such pavement area where such pavement area is located on any elevated bridge.

title: Extends and enhances the empire state film production credit and the empire state film post production credit
abstract: Extends and enhances the empire state film production credit and the empire state film post production credit.

title: Relates to consolidated local highway assistance payments
abstract: Relates to consolidated local highway assistance payments; increases the amount of the current cost threshold to $750,000 over which local highway and bridge construction work under the CHIPS program must be contracted through a competitive bid.

title: Relates to untested sexual offense evidence kit collection reports
abstract: Requires law enforcement agencies to conduct an inventory of all untested sexual offense evidence collection kits; requires a report to the legislature and the governor.

title: Provides a lung disease presumption for correction officers, correction supervisors, deputy sheriff patrol or deputy sheriff patrol supervisors
abstract: Provides a lung disease presumption for correction officers, correction supervisors, deputy sheriff patrol or deputy sheriff patrol supervisors.

title: Relates to the processing of health claims
abstract: Requires the use of the current edition of American medical association's current procedural terminology (CPT) with respect to claims for evaluation and management codes.

title: Requires development and implementation of a comprehensive education campaign regarding the dangers of cannabinoid use
abstract: Requires development and implementation of a comprehensive education campaign regarding the dangers of cannabinoid use.

title: Honoring Deputy Chief Robert Dedominick upon the occasion of his designation for special recognition after 50 years of dedicated service to the Watkins Glen Fire Department
Relates to enacting the taxpayer voter registration act
abstract: Allows taxpayers to register to vote upon paying their taxes or changing their address.

title: Requires certain facilities to have a staff member specifically trained in filing assisted outpatient treatment petitions
abstract: Requires certain hospitals and correctional facilities to have a staff member specifically trained in filing assisted outpatient treatment petitions.

title: Authorizes the governor to fill vacancy in the office of lieutenant-governor on confirmation of both houses of the legislature
abstract: Authorizes the governor to fill vacancy in the office of lieutenant-governor on confirmation of both houses of the legislature; allows the governor to leave the state without transmitting power to lieutenant-governor; establishes the process for lieutenant-governor to act as governor during incapacitation of the governor.

title: Relates to member contribution per centum increases
abstract: Increases the salary ranges tied to member contribution requirements; ties salary amount to inflation.

title: Prohibits the sale of single-use plastic water bottles in certain port authority facilities
abstract: Prohibits the sale of single-use plastic water bottles that hold twenty-one ounces of water or less in port authority facilities in New York; requires such facilities install water fountains within one year.

title: Exempts certain paratransit eligible individuals from recertification requirements
abstract: Allows for paratransit eligible for paratransit eligible individuals who are at least eighty years old, to be required only to present correspondence from a licensed physician, dated within the preceding thirty days, indicating that the paratransit service is still necessary for the individual to make a single application for paratransit services; provides that once approved, such individuals shall be exempt from all certification requirements.

title: Relates to extensions of order of protection
abstract: Allows family and criminal courts to extend orders of protection for up to two years beyond the expiration date of an issued order of protection if the court finds reason for an extension and places such reasoning on the record.

title: Provides for the pension benefits for first grade police officers of the city of New York who have served for 25 or 30 years
abstract: Provides for the pension benefits for first grade police officers of the city of New York who have served for 25 or 30 years.

title: Limits the amount of rent increases for residential ground lease cooperative apartment buildings and establishes certain rights upon the expiration of such leases
abstract: Limits the amount of rent increases for residential ground lease cooperative apartment buildings; establishes certain rights upon the expiration of such leases.

title: Requires the county seat in Steuben county to have at least one polling place designated for early voting
abstract: Requires the county seat in Steuben county to have at least one polling place designated for early voting.

title: Provides a $500,000 supplemental valuation impact grant to the West Valley central school district during the 2023-2024 school year
abstract: Provides a $500,000 supplemental valuation impact grant to the West Valley central school district during the 2023--2024 school year.

title: Relates to the filing of approved applications for licenses for the possession of firearms
abstract: Provides for the confidentiality of applications for licenses for the possession of firearms.

title: Requires consideration of the New York state climate leadership and community protection act in certain procurement contracts
abstract: Requires consideration of an offerer's compliance with the New York state climate leadership and community protection act in certain procurement contracts.

title: Relates to adjournments for right to counsel
abstract: Provides that in any jurisdiction in which a party is eligible under local law for free legal counsel, if such party has in good faith attempted to secure such counsel and is unable to obtain counsel through no fault of their own, the court shall adjourn the trial of the issue for consecutive periods of not less than fourteen days each until the party is able to secure counsel.

title: Relates to prohibiting the sale of live genetically modified salmon
abstract: Relates to prohibiting the sale of live genetically modified salmon.

title: Relates to accessibility requirements in certain procurement contracts
abstract: Relates to accessibility requirements in certain procurement contracts; requires contracts that include information and communication technologies (ICTs) are accessible to people with disabilities; requires that the ability of a prospective contractor to meet such requirement be considered in making the contract award.

title: Provides a one time fee for the registration of historic motor vehicles
abstract: Provides a one time fee of one hundred dollars for the registration of historic motor vehicles.

title: Authorizes the county of Nassau assessor to accept an application for a retroactive real property tax exemption from the Incorporated Village of Hempstead Community Development Agency
abstract: Authorizes the county of Nassau assessor to accept an application for a retroactive real property tax exemption from the Incorporated Village of Hempstead Community Development Agency for the 2020--2021 school taxes and the 2021 general taxes for the property at 40 Byrd Street.

title: Includes the Olean Public Library with libraries eligible for the financing of projects through the dormitory authority
abstract: Includes the Olean Public Library with libraries eligible for the financing of projects through the dormitory authority.

title: Relates to service retirement benefits for uniformed correction members of the New York city employees' retirement system
abstract: Provides that for New York city uniformed correction revised plan members of the New York city employees' retirement system, the service retirement benefit shall not be reduced by the primary social security retirement benefit commencing at age sixty-two.

title: Establishes the NY food insecurity, farm resiliency and rural poverty initiative; repealer; appropriation
abstract: Establishes the NY food insecurity, farm resiliency and rural poverty initiative to provide financial assistance in the form of matching grants, hiring assistance, purchasing assistance, tax credits, tax exemptions, and reimbursements.

title: Provides for revocation of drivers' licenses and registrations for multiple driving while intoxicated convictions
abstract: Relates to revocation of drivers' licenses and registrations for multiple driving while intoxicated convictions; provides an automatic 10 year license revocation for 3rd offense.

title: Updates provisions relating to dignity for all students and makes an appropriation therefor
abstract: Updates provisions relating to dignity for all students including establishing the student suicide prevention act which includes curriculum and teacher training requirements designed to prevent student suicide with a focus on LGBTQ students; makes an appropriation therefor.

title: Creates a public umbilical cord blood banking program
abstract: Creates a public umbilical cord blood banking program within the department of health to promote public awareness of the potential benefits of public cord banking, to promote research into the uses of cord blood, and to facilitate pre-delivery arrangements for public banking of cord blood donations.

title: Designates Xylazine as a schedule III depressant
abstract: Designates Xylazine as a schedule III depressant.

title: Allows withdrawals from family tuition accounts to pay for treatment of substance use disorder for the designated beneficiary
abstract: Allows withdrawals from family tuition accounts to pay for treatment of substance use disorder, including detoxification and rehabilitation for the designated beneficiary.

title: Requires public schools to provide at least one plant- or nut-based milk option
abstract: Requires each public school offering a dairy-based milk option during scheduled meal periods to provide at least one plant- or nut-based milk option.

title: Relating to notice of a tax exemption for persons with disabilities and limited incomes
abstract: Requires an assessor to send a second copy of the application and notice for a real property tax exemption to persons with disabilities and limited incomes thirty days prior to the appropriate taxable status date.

title: Directs the department of transportation to conduct a traffic and planning study on the feasibility of transforming the Harriman campus in connection with the relocation of the Wadsworth Laboratory at Harriman
abstract: Directs the department of transportation to conduct a traffic and planning study on the feasibility of transforming the Harriman campus in connection with the relocation of the Wadsworth Laboratory at Harriman; directs a report on the findings of such study to be delivered within one year of effectiveness.

title: Authorizes the town of Brookhaven, county of Suffolk to amend a conservation easement
abstract: Authorizes the town of Brookhaven, county of Suffolk to amend an existing conservation easement to allow for rail access and service.

title: Requires the disclosure of prices and additional charges at appearance enhancement businesses which practice nail specialty
abstract: Requires the disclosure of prices and additional charges at appearance enhancement businesses which practice nail specialty.

title: Creates a citizen advisory panel
abstract: Creates a citizen advisory panel consisting of six permanent and three rotating members to prepare a report on any application for certificate of any major electric generating facilities.

title: Prohibit weapon promotion and sale on public property
abstract: Prohibits the promotion, sale, transfer, exchange, giving or disposing of a weapon on property owned by the state or any political subdivision thereof.

title: Relates to the state board of parole membership, interviews with incarcerated individuals, and determination of parole
abstract: Allows for the removal of members of the state board of parole by a majority vote in the senate and the assembly; requires three or more members of such board personally interview potential parolees; requires that the determination to parole an incarcerated individual be unanimous.

title: Establishes a direct support wage enhancement to employees that provide direct care support or any other form of treatment, to individuals with developmental disabilities
abstract: Establishes a direct support wage enhancement to employees that provide direct care support or any other form of treatment, to individuals with developmental disabilities and whose income is less than $125,000.

title: Provides for the return of fines, restitution and reparation payments where there was an unjust conviction
abstract: Provides for the return of fines, restitution and reparation payments and any interest thereon where a defendant is subsequently pardoned upon the ground of innocence or the conviction is reversed or vacated.

title: Provides for the humane destruction or other disposition of certain animals
abstract: Provides for the humane destruction or other disposition of certain animals by shelters; requires animals to be made available for adoption for 90 days unless a veterinarian certifies that such animal should be humanely destroyed for health reasons.

title: Directs the New York state department of transportation and the New York city department of transportation to conduct a study on parking availability
abstract: Directs the New York state department of transportation and the New York city department of transportation to conduct a study on parking availability along the portion of 8th Avenue between 39th street and 73rd street in the borough of Brooklyn in the city of New York.

title: Relates to the period of limitation for the prosecution of sex offenses committed against children; repealer
abstract: Relates to the period of limitation for the prosecution of sex offenses committed against children; such actions may be commenced within 15 years after such child has reached the age of 18.

title: Requires lottery sales agents to return previously purchased lottery tickets to the persons submitting them to such agents for verification of prizes
abstract: Requires lottery sales agents to return previously purchased lottery tickets to the persons submitting them to such agents for verification of prizes won or lost; requires lottery ticket dispensing machines used for verifying if a ticket is a winner or not to return the ticket submitted for verification.

title: Increases salaries for foster care direct care workers; appropriation
abstract: Increases salaries for foster care direct care workers; makes an appropriation therefor.

title: Requires rent concessions to be reported to the division of housing and community renewal
abstract: Requires rent concessions to be reported to the division of housing and community renewal; requires the inclusion of a statement of net effective rent for units with concessions; requires certain annual statements filed to include reporting of rent concessions.

title: Relates to qualification for certain contracts relating to the consumer directed personal assistance program by applicants who provide fiscal intermediary services
abstract: Relates to qualification for certain contracts relating to the consumer directed personal assistance program by applicants who provide fiscal intermediary services.

title: Establishes an office of special education services to administer programs for children with disabilities
abstract: Establishes an office of special education services within the state education department to administer programs for children with disabilities to be headed by an assistant commissioner appointed by the board of regents.

title: Creates an office of healthcare accountability
abstract: Creates an office of healthcare accountability to provide recommendations regarding healthcare and hospital costs; audit expenditures for state employees and retirees; and to provide public information relating to hospital costs and the transparency of hospitals with regard to disclosure of costs.

title: Relates to the mandatory retirement age of judges and justices
abstract: Provides a mandatory retirement age of 76 for judges and justices.

title: Enacts the "packaging reduction and recycling infrastructure act"
abstract: Enacts the "packaging reduction and recycling infrastructure act" to require companies selling, offering for sale, or distributing packaging materials and products to register with a packaging reduction organization to develop a packaging reduction and recycling plan.

title: Directs the state fire prevention and building code council to update the state fire prevention and building code and the state energy conservation construction code
abstract: Directs the state fire prevention and building code council to update the state fire prevention and building code and the state energy conservation construction code within 18 months of the publication of any updated or revised edition of the international and national codes relating thereto, so as to ensure that the state's codes reflect such revisions and updates.

title: Establishes that guardians ad litem in Westchester county are considered employees under the public officers law
abstract: Establishes that guardians ad litem in Westchester county are considered employees for the purposes of representation and indemnification in civil actions resulting from actions taken during the scope of their employment.

title: Relates to enabling public employers to offer certain temporary retirement incentives for certain public employees
abstract: Enables public employers to offer an age fifty-five with ten years of service or age fifty with twenty-five years of service temporary retirement incentives for certain public employees.

title: Relates to determining the capacity of a defendant to stand trial
abstract: Provides for the use of restoration services when determining the capacity of a defendant to stand trial.

title: Expands requirements of sheltering of dogs outside
abstract: Enacts stricter requirements for sheltering of dogs outside including protection from wind and loss of body heat.

title: Requires a mandatory settlement conference in cooperative apartment unit foreclosure actions
abstract: Requires a mandatory settlement conference in cooperative apartment unit foreclosure actions; makes related provisions.

title: Prohibits the sale and distribution of anti-fogging sprays and wipes containing perfluoroalkyl and polyfluoroalkyl substances; and provides penalties for violations
abstract: Prohibits the sale and distribution of anti-fogging sprays and wipes containing perfluoroalkyl and polyfluoroalkyl substances; provides penalties for violations.

title: Relates to assault in the second degree
abstract: Elevates an assault of a retail worker to the class D felony of assault in the second degree.

title: Commemorating the 246th Anniversary of Sybil Ludington's legendary ride, alerting the American Militia that British forces were approaching
Relates to including providing onsite child daycare facilities by a project into a uniform tax exemption policy
abstract: Includes providing onsite child daycare facilities by a project into a uniform tax exemption policy.

title: Requires fair business practices in franchises
abstract: Requires fair business practices in franchises.

title: Creates the utility consumer advocate of the Long Island office of the department of public service
abstract: Creates the utility consumer advocate of the Long Island office of the department of public service to advocate and to represent the interests of residential Long Island utility customers.

title: Establishes the disaster-related latent damage recovery grant program
abstract: Establishes the disaster-related latent damage recovery grant program to repair latent damage to public infrastructure, including publicly-owned roads, bridges, drainage and flood mitigation systems, electrical and mechanical systems and communication systems, and any ancillary infrastructure necessary for the safe operation of the components thereof, where such damage was the result of a natural disaster.

title: Mourning the untimely death and paying tribute to the life and heroic service of Firefighter Jason Arno who died in the line of duty on March 1, 2023
Provides parity to durable medical equipment providers by requiring Medicaid managed care organizations to reimburse such providers
abstract: Provides parity to durable medical equipment providers by requiring Medicaid managed care organizations to reimburse such providers at no less than one hundred percent of the medical assistance durable medical equipment and complex rehabilitation technology fee schedule for the same service or item.

title: Relates to the calculation of past service credit for deputy sheriffs transferring between the state and local employees' retirement system to the state and local police and fire retirement system
abstract: Relates to the calculation of past service credit for members in the title of deputy sheriff transferring between the New York state and local employees' retirement system to the New York state and local police and fire retirement system.

title: Relates to the offenses of rape in the first, second and third degrees; repealer
abstract: Relates to the offenses of rape in the first, second and third degrees.

title: Relates to the practice of veterinary medicine
abstract: Excludes the use of equine pulsed electromagnetic field therapy from the practice of veterinary medicine.

title: Creates a computer science course requirement for graduation from high school
abstract: Creates a computer science course requirement for graduation from high school; directs the department of education to design and implement such program.

title: Relates to expenses borne by counties outside of the city of New York for the issuance and maintenance of record books utilized by authorized gunsmiths in the sale and disposition of firearms in the state
abstract: Relates to expenses borne by counties outside of the city of New York for the issuance and maintenance of record books utilized by authorized gunsmiths in the sale and disposition of firearms in the state.

title: Repeals provisions of law requiring certain cities pay for certain charter school rents
abstract: Repeals provisions of law requiring certain cities pay for certain charter school rents.

title: Provides for the employment of mental health professionals by school districts
abstract: Provides for the employment of mental health professionals by school districts.

title: Relates to exempting farm laborer internships earning college credit from the definition of employee and employment
abstract: Exempts service as a farm laborer where such service is an internship granting college course credit from the definition of employee and employment for the purposes of certain workers' compensation benefits.

title: Authorizes Kim Bowers to receive certain service credit with the New York state and local employees' retirement system
abstract: Authorizes Kim Bowers to receive certain service credit with the New York state and local employees' retirement system for her employment with the town of Orchard Park Zoning Board of Appeals.

title: Enacts the universal stop false police reporting act
abstract: Enacts the "universal stop false police reporting act"; establishes the crimes of offering a false report for filing in the second degree and offering a false report for filing in the first degree; includes falsely reporting an incident as a specified offense for the purposes of hate crimes; requires the creation of public databases for false reporting.

title: Relates to school district unexpended surplus funds
abstract: Relates to school district unexpended surplus funds; provides that for the 2025--2026 school year and thereafter, surplus funds shall mean any operating funds in excess of six percent of the current school year budget, and shall not include funds properly retained under other sections of law.

title: Provides for mental health screening and creating a presumption that post-traumatic stress disorder is proximately caused by employment for law enforcement officers and emergency medical personnel
abstract: Provides for mental health screening; creates a presumption that post-traumatic stress disorder is proximately caused by employment for law enforcement officers and emergency medical services personnel.

title: Relates to involuntary emergency admission of persons alleged to be mentally ill
abstract: Enacts "Jesse's law" to provide that a person subject to involuntary emergency admission for immediate observation, care, and treatment of mental illness shall have the right to select the hospital they are admitted to.

title: Enables taxpayers to donate money towards horse retirement and rescue programs; directs the commissioner of agriculture and markets to compile a list of approved horse retirement and rescue programs
abstract: Enables certain taxpayers to donate money towards horse retirement and rescue programs by providing a tax check-off box; establishes the gift for the New York state horse retirement and rescue fund; directs the commissioner of agriculture and markets to compile a list of approved horse retirement and rescue programs.

title: Directs the metropolitan transportation authority to study the transportation and housing needs of Randalls and Wards Islands
abstract: Directs the metropolitan transportation authority, in consultation with the New York city department of transportation and New York city department of housing preservation and development, to study the transportation and housing needs of Randalls and Wards Islands.

title: Requires insurers offering renewal of Medicare supplemental insurance policies to notify holders of the availability of similar policies
abstract: Requires insurers offering renewal of certain Medicare supplemental insurance policies or providing notification of a change in premiums of such policies to notify policyholders of the availability of policies offered by such insurer with similar benefits at a comparable premium or the ability of such policyholder to purchase a different policy without the pre-existing condition waiting period; applies to policies for which such insurers no longer accept new contracts but continue to renew for existing policyholders.

title: Relates to the supervision of transfilling of medical oxygen
abstract: Relates to supervising the transfilling of medical oxygen; requires registered wholesalers who transfill medical oxygen to ensure any person responsible for supervising such process meets certain qualifications.

title: Relates to the collection of supplemental vehicle registration fees for New York City registrants
abstract: Relates to the collection of supplemental vehicle registration fees for New York City registrants.

title: Relates to the physician loan repayment program and medical malpractice rate relief program in designated physician shortage areas
abstract: Relates to funds used for the physician loan repayment program and the regents physicians loan forgiveness program for physicians practicing in designated physician shortage areas and creates the medical malpractice rate relief program within the regents physician loan forgiveness program in designated physician shortage areas.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim March 5-11, 2023, as School Social Worker Week in the State of New York
Relates to increasing penalties for public urination or defecation
abstract: Increases penalties for public urination or defecation to $500 for any violation.

title: Relates to accidental disability retirement for deputy sheriffs
abstract: Relates to accidental disability retirement for deputy sheriffs; provides that deputy sheriffs shall receive a pension of three-quarters of their final average salary.

title: Relates to requiring the commissioner of the department of civil service to prepare a report on mental health practitioner classification
abstract: Relates to requiring the commissioner of the department of civil service to prepare a report on mental health practitioner classification.

title: Statewide disparity study regarding the participation of minority and women-owned business enterprises in state contracts
