abstract: Requires development of a statewide disparity study regarding the participation of minority and women-owned business enterprises in state contracts.

title: Congratulating the Burnt Hills-Ballston Lake High School Girls Relay Team and Head Coach Megan James for capturing the 2023 New York State 4 x 400 Relay Title
Relates to the justified use of physical force
abstract: Relates to the justified use of physical force; removes requirement that a person facing an imminent physical threat must retreat; provides immunity from civil and criminal liability.

title: Establishes an accessory dwelling unit incentive program
abstract: Establishes an accessory dwelling unit incentive program to encourage the creation of accessory dwelling units; includes accessory dwelling units in the definition of the term housing accommodations in the human rights law; provides for a temporary property tax exemption on the increase in value of property resulting from the addition of an accessory dwelling unit.

title: Allows counties to opt out of providing certain optional Medicaid benefits to prospective beneficiaries
abstract: Authorizes the state to allow counties to opt out of the county cost of medical assistance payments to any new enrollees who have either never received such benefits or who have reenrolled after a period of absence; directs the commissioner of health to apply for any and all federal waivers required to implement the provisions of this subdivision.

title: Relates to requirements for affidavit ballots and absentee ballots
abstract: Requires voters voting by affidavit ballot to produce an identification document to verify residency in the election district; requires absentee ballots to be received by election day, or be post-marked by the first day of early voting.

title: Provides for eminent domain reform and creates the "home and property protection act"; appropriation
abstract: Provides for eminent domain reform; creates the "home and property protection act"; creates a temporary state commission to examine eminent domain laws.

title: Relates to collective bargaining rights for college athletes and authorizes the public employment relations board to exercise jurisdiction over collective bargaining matters
abstract: Relates to collective bargaining rights for college athletes; authorizes the public employment relations board to exercise jurisdiction over institutions of higher education and college student athlete employees of such institutions in relation to all collective bargaining matters.

title: Authorizes the carrying of firearms by military personnel at recruiting centers
abstract: Authorizes the carrying of service-issued firearms by military personnel at recruiting centers while on duty.

title: Provides that persons with a disability shall be eligible to receive a fishing license for a reduced fee
abstract: Provides that persons with a disability shall be eligible to receive a fishing license free for five dollars.

title: Relates to notification of a senior real property tax exemption
abstract: Requires a second notification to persons previously eligible for a senior real property tax exemption.

title: Authorizes a personal income tax deduction for home heating expenses
abstract: Authorizes a personal income tax deduction for expenses paid during the taxable year by a qualified taxpayer attributable to the cost of residential heating, including, but not limited to amounts paid for fuel oil, coal, wood, propane, natural gas, electricity, steam, kerosene and any other fuel used to heat such taxpayer's primary residence.

title: Relates to requiring that genetically modified salmon that is sold or offered for sale be labeled
abstract: Relates to requiring genetically modified salmon that is sold or offered for sale be labeled.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim March 20-24, 2023, as Agriculture Week in the State of New York
Relates to unlawful strikes by public employees
abstract: Relates to unlawful strikes by public employees; provides for the settlement of certain disputes relating to terms and conditions of employment of certain transit and transportation authorities.

title: Relates to enacting the "State Police Retention act"
abstract: Enacts the State Police Retention act; provides a deferred retirement option plan payable to members and officers of the division of state police.

title: Directs the department of veterans' services to establish and operate an electronic database of the number of openings in each of the 4 state veterans' homes and the number of persons on the waiting lists
abstract: Directs the department of veterans' services to establish and operate an electronic database of the number of openings in each of the 4 state veterans' homes and the number of persons on the waiting list for each such veterans' home.

title: Creates a New York state route 878, Nassau Expressway study
abstract: Creates a New York state route 878, Nassau Expressway study to evaluate the costs of completing the construction of state route 878 in Nassau and Queens counties; makes related provisions.

title: Establishes a task force to identify evidence-based and evidence informed solutions to reduce children's exposure to adverse childhood experience
abstract: Establishes a task force to identify evidence-based and evidence informed solutions to reduce children's exposure to adverse childhood experiences.

title: Relates to amending the New York City Charter in relation to expanding the investigative scope of the Civilian Complaint Review Board
abstract: Expands the investigative powers of the Civilian Complaint Review Board to include complaints alleging bias-based profiling.

title: Congratulating Cole Evans of Ballston Spa High School upon the occasion of capturing the 2023 NYSPHSAA Boys Giant Slalom Championship
Requires that the siting, construction and establishment of methadone program facilities in New York city be proportionately dispersed in the boroughs of such cities
abstract: Requires that the siting, construction and establishment of methadone program facilities in cities with a population of one million or more be dispersed in the boroughs of such cities in proportion to the population of each such borough.

title: Requires at least one member of the state board of parole be a formerly incarcerated person
abstract: Relates to requiring at least one member of the state board of parole be a formerly incarcerated person.

title: Requires periodic reviews of pending applications for material change in the coverage status of certain matters relative to new health technology assessment or medical evidence
abstract: Requires periodic reviews of pending applications for material change in the coverage status of certain matters relative to new health technology assessment or medical evidence.

title: Allocates fines imposed on real estate appraisers to the anti-discrimination in housing fund
abstract: Allocates fines imposed on real estate appraisers to the anti-discrimination in housing fund; provides that a fine not exceeding two thousand dollars may be imposed on real estate appraisers for certain acts or omissions.

title: Prohibits the sale of second-use lithium-ion batteries
abstract: Prohibits the sale of second-use lithium-ion batteries intended for use in a bicycle with electric assist, an electric scooter or a limited use motorcycle;  provides penalties for violations.

title: Provides for a taxpayer assistance authorization for households in the county of Schenectady
abstract: Provides for a taxpayer assistance authorization for households in the county of Schenectady; provides for a $250 rebate for property owners in Schenectady county with a qualifying STAR exemption or school tax relief credit.

title: Enhances criminal investigations and prosecutions in relation to the integrity of statements of those accused of crimes
abstract: Enhances criminal investigations and prosecutions in relation to the integrity of statements of those accused of crimes and to promote confidence in the criminal justice system.

title: Relates to insurance reimbursement for cost of vaccinations
abstract: Requires insurance reimbursement for the total direct and indirect practice expenses associated with vaccinations.

title: Relates to excise tax on telecommunication services
abstract: Relates to excise tax on telecommunication services (Part A); relates to temporary municipal assistance sales and compensating use taxes for cities of one million or more on telecommunication services (Part B).

title: Includes fires caused by the manufacture of a controlled substance within the crime of arson in the first degree
abstract: Includes fires caused by the manufacture of a controlled substance within the crime of arson in the first degree.

title: Authorizes retail licensees to purchase alcohol with a business payment card
abstract: Authorizes retail licensees to purchase alcohol with a business payment card.

title: Enacts the "Nurse of Tomorrow Act of 2023" to provide for grants to certain hospitals, schools and other entities for nurse recruitment, education and retention
abstract: Enacts the "Nurse of Tomorrow Act" to provide for grants from the state commissioner of education to public and not-for-profit hospitals, skilled nursing facilities, schools and other entities for nurse recruitment, education and retention costs and activities as described herein.

title: Commemorating the Bicentennial Anniversary of the opening of the Champlain Canal
Requires the state university of New York and the city university of New York to adopt certain provisions related to student mental health
abstract: Requires the state university of New York and the city university of New York to adopt certain provisions related to student mental health such as administering student mental health surveys, establishing a mental health committee, administering mental health training to faculty and staff, and improving university policies regarding mental health.

title: Congratulating Ben Jenkin upon the occasion of capturing the 2023 NYSPHSAA Nordic Boys 7.5K Individual Championship
Relates to the mandatory age of retirement for judges
abstract: Raises the mandatory age of retirement for judges to seventy-six, with the ability of certain judges and justices to serve under a certified appointment until the age of eighty.

title: Relates to additional credit allowed veterans in competitive examinations
abstract: Relates to additional credit allowed veterans in competitive examinations; expands the definition of "veteran" and "non-disabled veteran" to include the spouse and/or children of a member of the armed forces of the United States who served therein in time of war and was subsequently killed in the line of duty.

title: Prohibits a member of the legislature from disbursing moneys pursuant to memoranda of understanding regarding certain line item appropriations prior to an election
abstract: Prohibits a member of the legislature from disbursing or making public moneys pursuant to a memoranda of understanding regarding certain line item appropriations prior to such member's election.

title: Expands protections regarding violations of safety conditions in adult care facilities
abstract: Expands protections regarding violations of safety conditions in adult care facilities; provides penalties for safety violations and operating without a valid license; prohibits reductions in fines in certain circumstances where a patient is endangered or harmed.

title: Extends the authority of the county of Madison to impose an additional rate of sales and compensating use taxes
abstract: Extends the authority of the county of Madison to impose an additional rate of sales and compensating use taxes for two years.

title: Prohibits corporate entities, developers, and contractors from converting single-family homes into a rental property unit
abstract: Prohibits corporate entity, real estate developer, or residential building contractor from directly or indirectly purchasing, owning, building, acquiring, or otherwise obtaining any interest in any single-family private dwelling and converting such property into residential real estate containing one rental unit.

title: Requires certain entities when relying on statistics in planning, policy enforcement and reporting be based on the worst-case scenario
abstract: Requires every department, bureau, board, commission, authority, or any other agency or instrumentality of the state, when relying on statistics in planning, policy enforcement and reporting, to base such planning, policy enforcement and reporting on the worst-case scenario.

title: Relates to the disclosure of monies received by members of the legislature for purposes of legal defense
abstract: Provides that contributions made by any person, firm, association or corporation to a member of the state legislature which are intended to be used by such member or on behalf of such member for the payment of legal services and other charges in connection with the legal defense of such member in any past or pending civil or criminal action shall be subject to similar monetary limitations and disclosure requirements set forth in the election law pertaining to campaign contributions.

title: Relates to giving and/or receiving unlawful benefits
abstract: Makes it a felony to give or receive unlawful benefits in excess of $3000.

title: Expands the scope of the temporary operator program
abstract: Expands the scope of the temporary operator program permitting the commissioner of health to appoint an operator if a facility experiences serious financial instability or conditions that seriously endanger the life, health or safety of residents or patients.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim March 10, 2023, as Bagpipe Day in the State of New York
Relates to credits for charges in which services were not supplied
abstract: Relates to credits for charges in which services were not supplied; requires the city of New York to make certain that there are no charges being levied for services which were not supplied to a covered entity; requires accounts to be credited for services not provided.

title: Relates to the common core state standards initiative
abstract: Relates to the common core state standards initiative; establishes the department shall discontinue implementation of the common core state standards.

title: Requires certain buses and trucks to be equipped with commercial GPS devices
abstract: Requires certain buses and trucks to be equipped with commercial GPS devices.

title: Relates to filing requirements for the annual statement of financial disclosure
abstract: Relates to filing requirements for the annual statement of financial disclosure.

title: Requires two-thirds vote of legislature for any change in tax rates, budget bills and appropriations
abstract: Requires approval by 2/3 vote of membership of the senate and assembly voting separately to increase or decrease any tax rate, impose a new state tax, extend or delete existing state tax.

title: Relates to school bus parking on New York City streets
abstract: Prohibits school bus parking on city streets on weekdays between the hours of 5 p.m. and 5 a.m. and on weekends from 5 p.m. on Friday to 5 a.m. on Monday.

title: Relates to repealing the driver's license access and privacy act
abstract: Repeals the driver's license access and privacy act.

title: Requires a weigh-in to take place the day of a combative sports event
abstract: Requires a weigh-in of all participants shall occur on the date of a combative sports event.

title: Relates to awards made to crime victims
abstract: Increases the amount for awards made to crime victims; specifies certain items of personal property which are necessary and essential to the welfare of a claimant.

title: Relates to the determination of adjusted base proportions in special assessing units which are cities
abstract: Relates to the determination of adjusted base proportions in special assessing units which are cities.

title: Establishes a wildlife corridor action plan
abstract: Establishes a wildlife corridor action plan to identify and protect species that are at risk from habitat fragmentation or barriers to movement and reduce collisions between wildlife and vehicles; authorizes the designation and protection of wildlife corridors.

title: Prohibits members of the legislature from obtaining funding to provide to any business entities in which such members, domestic partners or certain relatives hold official or legal positions
abstract: Prohibits members of the legislature from obtaining funding through state grants or member items and subsequently providing such funding to any business entities or not-for-profit entities in which such officials, members, domestic partners or certain relatives hold official or legal positions.

title: Provides for any city, town or village in the state of New York to control the town speed limits
abstract: Provides for any city, town or village in the state of New York to control the town speed limits.

title: Amends the definition of special populations to include persons who are in the first eight weeks of the post-partum recovery period, regardless of how the pregnancy ended
abstract: Prohibits the placement in segregated confinement of any person in the first eight weeks of the post-partum recovery period regardless of pregnancy outcome by amending the definition of special populations to include such persons.

title: Establishes in the city of New York a bicycle lane safety program to enforce certain restrictions on the use of bicycle lanes by means of bicycle lane photo devices
abstract: Establishes in the city of New York a bicycle lane safety program to enforce certain restrictions on the use of protected bicycle lanes by means of bicycle lane photo devices.

title: Provides notifications for E-ZPass transactions
abstract: Provides notifications for E-ZPass transactions that notifies the holder of an E-ZPass that he or she has passed through a toll plaza operated by the New York state thruway authority and a transaction has posted to such holder's account for his or her electronic toll collection device.

title: Relates to establishing a commission to rename the Robert Moses State Park to reflect on the history of Long Island
abstract: Establishes a nine member commission to rename the Robert Moses State Park to reflect on the history of Long Island.

title: Directs the division of criminal justice services to accept electronic submission of reports or other information from local law enforcement agencies
abstract: Directs the division of criminal justice services to accept electronic submission of reports or other information from local law enforcement agencies.

title: Requires notice to crime victims that he or she has the right to attend interviews between the board of parole and incarcerated individual; requires the board of parole to review victim impact statements
abstract: Requires the notice to crime victims of case disposition to inform the victim that he or she has the right to attend interviews between the board of parole and the incarcerated individual in cases where the final disposition includes a felony defined in article one hundred twenty-five of the penal law that results in the commitment of the defendant to the custody of the department of corrections and community supervision for an indeterminate sentence; requires the board of parole to review victim impact statements, failure to review such statements shall make a hearing by the board of parole invalid.

title: Prohibits the creation of fake electronic communication service accounts and prohibits the collection and use of account information by law enforcement and other governmental entities
abstract: Prohibits police and other governmental entities from creating fake electronic communication service accounts, or from collecting or using an individual's account information; establishes a private right of action for a violation of such provisions.

title: Requires insurers to send notices of renewal of certain policies to the insured no later than thirty days prior to the expiration of the policy
abstract: Requires insurers to send a notice of renewal or extension of certain policies to the insured no later than thirty days prior to the expiration of the policy.

title: Authorizes industrial development agencies to provide assistance to qualified residential facilities
abstract: Authorizes industrial development agencies to provide technical and financial assistance to qualified residential facilities; defines "qualified residential facility" as any multi-family residential facility with units that are for sale, in any municipality located within the county of Westchester, and which is located in an urban renewal area.

title: Prohibits persons convicted of murder or sentenced to life without parole from being eligible for commutation of sentence
abstract: Prohibits persons convicted of murder or sentenced to life without parole or where the defendant acting either alone or with one or more other persons, commits or attempts to commit robbery, burglary, kidnapping, arson, rape in the first degree, criminal sexual act in the first degree, sexual abuse in the first degree, aggravated sexual abuse, escape in the first degree, or escape in the second degree, and, in the course of and in furtherance of such crime or of immediate flight therefrom, he or she, or another participant, if there be any, intentionally causes the death of: a police officer; a peace officer; a firefighter; emergency medical technician, ambulance driver, paramedic, physician or registered nurse involved in a first response team, or any other individual who, in the course of official duties, performs emergency response; or an employee of a state correctional institution or was an employee of a local correctional facility, when such person was engaged in the course of performing their official duties, from being eligible for commutation of sentence.

title: Relates to the failure to produce records in response to a FOIL request; and criminalizes the failure to comply with the freedom of information law
abstract: Relates to the failure to produce records in response to a FOIL request; criminalizes the failure to comply with the freedom of information law.

title: Establishes the joint insurance fund
abstract: Provides that the governing body of municipal corporation, may by resolution agree to join together with any municipal corporation or corporations to establish a joint insurance fund for the purpose of insuring against liability, property damage, and workers' compensation, insuring against loss or theft of moneys or securities, providing blanket bond coverage of certain county or municipal officers and employees for faithful performance and discharge of their duties under the public officers' law, insuring against bodily injury and property damage claims arising from environmental impairment liability and legal representation therefor to the extent that such coverages; makes related provisions.

title: Establishes a task force for the review of the state administrative procedure act
abstract: Establishes a task force for the review of the state administrative procedure act to ensure that administrative rulemaking, adjudication and licensing is consistent, uniform, and not unnecessarily burdensome for regulated entities.

title: Relates to the establishment of notice requirements for credit card fees or surcharges; repealer
abstract: Establishes notice requirements for fees or surcharges imposed by sellers when a credit card is used as payment for the sale of goods or services.

title: Requires the incorporation of structured, explicit, language-based multisensory approaches to literacy instruction for current and prospective teachers
abstract: Requires the commissioner of education to establish and enforce rules and regulations to incorporate at least a three credit course devoted to the instructional techniques necessary for effective literacy instruction which shall include delivering structured, systematic, explicit, evidence-based instruction in reading, including but not limited to those incorporating multisensory instruction for current and prospective teachers.

title: Provides for the creation of an online, searchable database to catalogue workforce development programs in the state
abstract: Provides for the creation of an online, searchable database to catalogue workforce development programs and funding available in the state.

title: Provides for the licensing and regulation of the practice of neurofeedback therapy
abstract: Provides for the licensing and regulation of the practice of neurofeedback therapy; defines practice of neurofeedback therapy; establishes state board of neurofeedback therapy and the requirements to qualify for a license as a neurofeedback therapist.

title: Relates to creating a cyber security enhancement fund and restricting the use of taxpayer moneys in paying ransoms
abstract: Creates a cyber security enhancement fund to be used for the purpose of upgrading cyber security in local governments, including but not limited to, villages, towns and cities with a population of one million or less; restricts the use of taxpayer moneys in paying ransoms in response to ransomware attacks.

title: Enacts "Paula's law"
abstract: Provides that being eighteen years old or more, while in the course of committing rape in the first, second or third degree, criminal sexual act in the first, second or third degree, sexual abuse in the first degree, aggravated sexual abuse in the first, second, third or fourth degree, or incest in the first, second or third degree, against a person less than eighteen years old, he or she intentionally causes the death of such person.

title: Directs the discontinuance of the Yonkers toll plaza on the New York state thruway
abstract: Directs the New York state thruway authority to discontinue and remove the Yonkers toll plaza on the New York state thruway.

title: Expands the scope of records which shall be preserved by the executive chamber
abstract: Expands the scope of records which shall be preserved by the executive chamber, executive departments, agencies, divisions, offices and commissions, which shall be retained for a minimum of two years; and in the event litigation is reasonably anticipated against the executive or any executive branch departments, divisions, offices or commissions, the executive shall have a duty to cause and direct that all records reasonably related to such anticipated litigation be retained for at least five years or until two years after litigation is no longer reasonably anticipated, whichever is later.

title: Establishes the veterans' organization relief fund; appropriation
abstract: Establishes the veterans' organization relief fund to be expended only for the aid and assistance of veterans' organizations; establishes the gift for the veterans' organizations relief fund; makes a one hundred million dollar appropriation therefor; makes related provisions.

title: Relates to employer contributions to the unemployment insurance fund and establishes the unemployment insurance solvency reserve fund
abstract: Provides for the rate of employer contributions to the unemployment insurance fund in the 2024 fiscal year; establishes the unemployment insurance solvency reserve fund.

title: Repeals congestion pricing
abstract: Repeals congestion pricing.

title: Exempts antique motor vehicles from annual motor vehicle safety inspections
abstract: Exempts antique motor vehicles from annual motor vehicle safety inspections; modifies the definition of antique or historical motor vehicles.

title: Enacts "Lindsey's Law"
abstract: Enacts "Lindsey's law" criminalizing the disclosure of confidential government records by a public employer as retaliation for a victim making a sexual harassment complaint or claim.

title: Creates the crime of crimes against a delivery person when a specified offense is committed against a restaurant delivery person
abstract: Creates the crime of crimes against a delivery person when a specified offense is committed against a restaurant delivery person; establishes for purposes of this crime a delivery person shall mean a person employed by a restaurant or put into service by a restaurant to deliver prepared food to a location outside the restaurant pursuant to an order placed by the purported recipient of the food.

title: Establishes real property tax exemption for persons in armed forces serving in hostile areas
abstract: Establishes a real property tax exemption for the primary residence of a member of the armed forces engaged in hazardous service; provides the state shall compensate municipalities for lost tax revenue resulting from such exemption.

title: Relates to county-wide shared services panels
abstract: Relates to county-wide shared services panels; includes library districts within county-wide shared services panels; establishes the municipal efficiency fund to provide counties with awards of matching funds upon certification by the department of state.

title: Provides for licensing of a dental therapist and an advanced dental therapist
abstract: Requires individuals who practice the profession of dental therapy or advanced dental therapy to be licensed and registered in the state; provides Medicaid reimbursement for dental therapy services.

title: Creates the short-term military service guardian
abstract: Creates the short-term military service guardian; allows parent without joint custody to appoint service guardian; provides for a maximum appointment of 180 days.

title: Relates to flood insurance notice in communities bordering Lake Ontario
abstract: Relates to flood insurance notice in communities bordering Lake Ontario; requires the department of financial services to publish an annual notice with the department's contact information and a statement about flood insurance and how it relates to standard homeowners insurance policies in local newspapers that serve the communities bordering Lake Ontario.

title: Relates to establishing a housing part of the city court for the city of Yonkers
abstract: Establishes a housing part for city court of Yonkers to have jurisdiction of such actions and proceedings; including but not limited to enforcement and foreclosure of liens, injunctions and restraining orders for the enforcement of housing standards and special proceedings to vest title in the city of Yonkers to abandoned multiple dwellings; makes various other provisions.

title: Provides for a credit against personal income tax for volunteer firefighters who complete qualifications to become a training instructor
abstract: Provides for a credit against personal income tax for volunteer firefighters who complete qualifications to become a training instructor; provides that such credit shall be equal to the sum of five hundred dollars or the total amount of the tax owed by the taxpayer if less than five hundred dollars, whichever is lower.

title: Relates to establishing the New York state loan redemption program for certain public school teachers
abstract: Relates to establishing the New York state loan redemption program for certain public school teachers.

title: Requires hands-free gas dispensing at self-service gas stations in Nassau county
abstract: Allows for hands-free gas dispensing at self-service gas stations in Nassau county by equipping hold open clips on gasoline and diesel fuel dispensing nozzles.

title: Provides for the issuance of free hunting, fishing and trapping licenses to persons who are active or reserve members of the armed forces or the organized militia, and to certain veterans thereof
abstract: Provides for the issuance of free hunting, fishing and trapping licenses to persons who are active or reserve members of the armed forces or the organized militia, and to honorably discharged veterans thereof who have ten or more years of military service.

title: Requires the notification of individuals that certain work-study, internship, externship or other work placements meet the work requirements of title nine-B of the social services law
abstract: Requires the notification of individuals that certain work-study, internship, externship or other work placements offered by institutions of higher education meet the work requirements of title nine-B of article five of the social services law.

title: Establishes a carbon farming tax credit for farmers
abstract: Establishes a tax credit for farmers who maximize carbon sequestration potential through a "carbon farming" land management strategy; directs DEC to develop regulations related to certifying the amount of carbon sequestered or emissions reduced.

title: Provides for personal caregiving visitors for general hospital patients
abstract: Provides for regulations to require general hospitals to allow personal caregiving visitors for patients.

title: Relates to environmental assessment of historic preservation plan
abstract: Relates to the environmental assessment of a historic preservation plan; addresses environmental impact statements, dates for filing drafts of such statewide comprehensive historic preservation plan, funds available for historic preservation purposes, and the New York state archaeological survey assistance fund.

title: Provides person/entity with authority to operate a hospital shall be subject to approval by public health and health planning council for establishment of hospital
abstract: Makes various provisions regarding establishment of a hospital: provides that any person and various other listed entities (i.e., partnership, company, stockholder, member, corporation or other entity) with authority to operate a hospital, shall be subject to approval for establishment by the public health council (unless otherwise authorized to operate a hospital without such establishment approval); provides that any assignment or delegation of any authority to operate a hospital shall be subject to approval for establishment by the council (with certain specified exceptions); specifies circumstances under which a person, partnership, company, etc. shall be deemed to have authority to operate a hospital subject to approval for establishment by the council (with certain specified exceptions); specifies circumstances under which a person, partnership, company, etc. shall be deemed to have authority to operate a hospital (i.e., if it has decision-making authority over listed matters).

title: Prohibits the use of corporal punishment in an educational setting
abstract: Prohibits the use of corporal punishment in an educational setting; defines corporal punishment as an act of physical force upon a pupil for the purpose of punishing the pupil.

title: Establishes a work group to set reimbursement rates for doulas in the state Medicaid program and address other criteria related to their practice
abstract: Establishes a 14 member doula Medicaid reimbursement work group within the department of health to set reimbursement rates for doulas in the state Medicaid program and address other criteria related to their practice; requires the work group to conduct a study and evaluate the costs, benefits and issues that may be associated with Medicaid reimbursement for doulas and for providing doula care to Medicaid recipients; makes related provisions.

title: Relates to the unlawful wearing of a body vest
abstract: Makes it unlawful to wear a body vest while committing any crime while possessing a deadly weapon.

title: Requires the commissioner of environmental conservation to promote education in hunting, fishing and outdoor education in high school physical education courses
abstract: Requires the commissioner of environmental conservation to promote education in hunting, fishing and outdoor education in high school physical education courses.

title: Creates the under-grounding of electrical power or telecommunications lines fund
abstract: Creates the under-grounding of electrical power or telecommunications lines fund to provide for the purpose of moving overhead electrical power or telecommunications lines underground from monies appropriated, including, but not limited to, any funds supplied by the Federal Emergency Management Agency for disaster recovery and hazard mitigation which may be used for state infrastructure repair.

title: Increases the portion of real property taxes that a manufacturer may take as a business franchise or personal income tax credit
abstract: Increases from 20% to 100% the portion of real property taxes that a manufacturer may take as a business franchise or personal income tax credit.

title: Prohibits parking, standing, or stopping within ten feet of a bus stop
abstract: Prohibits parking, standing, or stopping within ten feet of a bus stop.

title: Relates to disclosing personal information
abstract: Relates to disclosing personal information; limits disclosures of personal information to law enforcement; expands information sharing in response to emergencies; provides for statutory damages for violations and that any information disclosed to a law enforcement agency in violation of the privacy law shall be inadmissible in a criminal or civil court, or administrative proceeding.

title: Relates to shared renewable energy facilities
abstract: Relates to shared renewable energy facilities; provides for the determination of credits of subscribers to such facilities.

title: Relates to clarifying the status of certain persons exempt from optometrist license requirements
abstract: Clarifies the status of certain persons exempt from optometrist license requirements.

title: Allows a suspending authority to condition the early return of a student on such student's voluntary participation in counseling or certain classes
abstract: Allows a suspending authority to condition the early return of a student on such student's voluntary participation in counseling or specialized classes, including anger management or dispute resolution, where applicable.

title: Grants retroactive membership in the New York state and local police and fire retirement system to Paul Valentine Jr.
abstract: Grants retroactive membership in Tier II of the New York state and local police and fire retirement system to Paul Valentine Jr.

title: Allows for certain disability benefits to continue in the event an individual who is receiving such benefits gets married
abstract: Allows for certain disability benefits to continue in the event an individual who is receiving such benefits gets married; provides that the marriage to another individual which would otherwise make an individual ineligible for certain disability benefits shall not be considered if such individual is already receiving disability benefits at the time of becoming married and continues to meet certain criteria.

title: Prohibits the use of state funds for non-residents seeking an abortion or related procedures
abstract: Prohibits the use of state funds for non-residents seeking an abortion or any other procedure that results in the intentional termination of a pregnancy at any stage of gestation.

title: Authorizes the Schuyler correctional facility to also be used for the detention of persons under arrest and being held for arraignment in any court located in the county of Schuyler
abstract: Authorizes the Schuyler correctional facility to also be used for the detention of persons under arrest and being held for arraignment in any court located in the county of Schuyler.

title: Relates to enacting the New York state thruway authority accountability act
abstract: Enacts the New York state thruway authority accountability act; names the commissioner of DOT as chair of the thruway authority board; directs the commissioner of DOT to submit a plan to merge the thruway authority into the department of transportation.

title: Increases civil service credits given to veterans currently returning from service
abstract: Increases civil service credits given to veterans currently returning from service.

title: Relates to the creation of Melinda's Law in relation to the basis for removal of children
abstract: Protects a parent who is a victim of domestic violence from having children removed from their custody if they reported the abuse.

title: Relates to providing a tax exemption for volunteer firefighters and volunteer ambulance workers
abstract: Relates to providing a tax exemption for volunteer firefighters and volunteer ambulance workers in a county with a population of more than 250,000 and less than 500,000 persons.

title: Relates to providing transparency in the retail prices of prescription drugs
abstract: Requires pharmacies to provide customers directly with the retail (before insurance) price of a prescription, in writing and electronically prior to purchase.

title: Increases the period of supervision required for certain real estate license applications
abstract: Increases the period of supervision to five years for real estate brokers applying for a license.

title: Expands hepatitis C screening testing
abstract: Expands hepatitis C screening testing.

title: Adds a representative of freestanding ambulatory surgery centers to the public health and health planning council
abstract: Increases the number of members of the public health and health planning council from 25 to 26; requires that a representative of freestanding ambulatory surgery centers be selected as a member of the public health and health planning council.

title: Requires the state police to investigate accusations of police misconduct
abstract: Requires the superintendent of state police to investigate accusations of police misconduct filed against town or village police.

title: Relates to the governance of the Westchester county health care corporation
abstract: Relates to the governance of the Westchester county health care corporation to twenty-one voting directors and provides for the appointment of such members.

title: Establishes the crime of making a terroristic threat against a police officer
abstract: Establishes the crime of making a terroristic threat against a police officer; makes such crime a class C felony.

title: Relates to including bodegas and delicatessens in the definition of food service establishment
abstract: Requires the department of agriculture and markets to post the results of its graded inspections of retail food stores on their website and provide information as to where a customer may file a consumer report.

title: Requires shelter allowances be set at up to one hundred percent of the fair market rent for the local social services district
abstract: Requires shelter allowances be set at up to one hundred percent of the fair market rent for the local social services district.

title: Allows for unlicensed personnel to administer seizure rescue medication in schools
abstract: Allows for unlicensed personnel to administer certain seizure rescue medication in schools, on school grounds and at school events; provides that such medicine may be left with a school health official to be used as needed.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim March 2, 2023, as Read Across America Day in the State of New York
Congratulating Ward Melville High School upon the occasion of being named a 2022 National Blue Ribbon School by the United States Department of Education
Creates the "I love NY outdoors" program; appropriation
abstract: Creates the "I love NY outdoors" program; such program shall require the commissioner of economic development to develop a marketing strategy that would promote New York as a premiere destination for hunting and fishing; appropriates $2,500,000 therefor.

title: Commending Colleen Kain Martin upon the occasion of her designation as Grand Marshal of the 2023 Utica St. Patrick's Day Parade
Commemorating the Anniversary celebration of the Birthday of the revered Lubavitcher Rebbe, Rabbi Menachem M. Schneerson
Establishes the green air travel tax, the green fund, and the state airline community resiliency board
abstract: Establishes a green air travel tax for all passengers who fly to or from an airport located in a city having a population of one million or more persons; establishes the green fund to be used for the purpose of providing grants to non-profits, qualified community-based organizations and local governments in communities disproportionally impacted by the health detriments and quality of life issues associated with airline communities; establishes the state airline community resiliency board to make determinations regarding how to spend monies from the green fund.

title: Provides for corporate franchise tax and personal income tax check-offs for taxpayer gifts for diabetes research and education; establishes diabetes fund
abstract: Provides for a corporate franchise tax check-off and a personal income tax check-off for taxpayer gifts for diabetes research and education; establishes the diabetes research and education fund.

title: Relates to the award of competitive civil service status for the spouse or children of military service persons killed in the line of duty
abstract: Relates to the award of competitive civil service status for the spouse or children of military service persons killed in the line of duty.

title: Relates to criteria for the establishment of banking development districts
abstract: Provides that a community which is underbanked shall be criteria for the establishment of banking development districts.

title: Requires the commissioner of health to establish and maintain a list of toxins which members of the military may have come into contact with
abstract: Requires the commissioner of health to establish and maintain a list of toxins which members of the military may have come into contact with; requires doctors to ask patients whether they have served in the military.

title: Repeals section 3 of article 16 relating to the taxation of moneys, credits, securities and other intangible personal property in the state that is not employed in carrying on any business therein
abstract: Relates to the taxation of moneys, credits, securities and other intangible personal property in the state that is not employed in carrying on any business therein.

title: Allows certain parties of releases and covenants involving PFAS to seek contribution from other responsible parties
abstract: Allows certain parties of releases and covenants involving PFAS to seek contribution from other responsible parties.

title: Relates to hunting, fishing and outdoor education in high school physical education courses
abstract: Relates to hunting, fishing and outdoor education in high school physical education courses.

title: Relates to the presumption of intent to sell heroin
abstract: Creates the presumption of intent to sell when a person is in possession of forty or more individual packages containing heroin with an aggregate weight of 4.0 grams.

title: Requires subsidiaries of the Niagara Frontier transportation authority and their employees to submit all unresolvable contract negotiations to binding arbitration
abstract: Requires subsidiaries of the Niagara Frontier Transportation Authority and their employees to submit all unresolvable contract negotiations to binding arbitration.

title: Increases the jurisdictional limits for small claims to fifteen thousand dollars
abstract: Increases the jurisdictional limits for small claims to fifteen thousand dollars.

title: Requires five percent of affordable housing units to be offered to veterans
abstract: Requires five percent of affordable housing units to be offered to veterans.

title: Congratulating the Utica University Men's Ice Hockey Team upon the occasion of capturing the United Collegiate Hockey Conference Men's Ice Hockey Championship
Relates to administering asthma rescue medications and authorizing schools to have asthma rescue medications for emergency situations
abstract: Relates to administering asthma rescue medications and authorizing schools to possess and administer asthma rescue medications in emergency situations to pupils with a requirement that the parent or guardian of such pupils are notified in writing of such emergency situation.

title: Relates to including used vehicles in the drive clean rebate program
abstract: Relates to including used vehicles in the drive clean rebate program; provides that such rebate for a used vehicle shall not exceed one thousand dollars.

title: Extends the authorization granted to the county of Clinton to impose an additional one percent of sales and compensating use taxes
abstract: Extends the authorization granted to the county of Clinton to impose an additional one percent of sales and compensating use taxes until November 30th, 2025.

title: Increases the tax exemption amount on clothing and apparel items from one hundred ten dollars to two hundred fifty dollars
abstract: Increases the tax exemption amount on clothing and apparel items from one hundred ten dollars to two hundred fifty dollars.

title: Designates certain offenses against law enforcement officers as hate crimes
abstract: Designates certain offenses against emergency medical services personnel, firefighters, and law enforcement officers as hate crimes; includes the definition of emergency medical services personnel, firefighters, and law enforcement officers.

title: Enacts the Come Home to Hunt Act
abstract: Relates to enacting the Come Home to Hunt Act, which provides for the purchase of a two-day hunting license for non-residents to hunt domestic game bird, migratory game bird, big game, and small game.

title: Relates to handicapping tournaments
abstract: Specifies who can operate a handicapping tournament; requires handicapping tournament operators to distribute no less than eighty percent of entry fees as prizes to the winners of a handicapping tournament; requires that five percent of the portion of the gross revenue collected by an operator on handicapping tournament entry fees from New York participants that is not distributed as prizes to the winners of a tournament be distributed quarterly by such operator to the horsemen's organization for welfare and medical plans for regularly employed backstretch employees.

title: Relates to refunds of excess long term care insurance credit
abstract: Provides for a refund of any excess amount of tax paid after reduction of other credits and the credit for long-term care insurance.

title: Relates to the crime of aggravated assault upon a police officer or a peace officer
abstract: Relates to the crime of aggravated assault upon a police officer or a peace officer.

title: Extends the expiration of the authorization to the county of Wyoming to impose an additional one percent sales and compensating use tax
abstract: Extends the expiration of the authorization to the county of Wyoming to impose an additional one percent sales and compensating use tax from November 30, 2023 to November 30, 2026.

title: Adjusts the compensation of formerly incarcerated individuals who were unjustly convicted
abstract: Retroactively adjusts the compensation of formerly incarcerated individuals who were unjustly convicted; exempts such adjusted income from state income taxes.

title: Eliminates mandatory minimum sentences; repealer
abstract: Eliminates mandatory minimum sentences.

title: Requires the department of buildings to maintain a registry of all deeds containing restrictive covenants
abstract: Requires the department of buildings to maintain a registry of all deeds containing restrictive covenants.

title: Clarifies certain provisions related to excess use or wear and tear of a vehicle leased for personal use for purposes of service contracts
abstract: Clarifies certain provisions related to excess use or wear and tear of a vehicle leased for personal use for purposes of service contracts.

title: Relates to minority depository institutions which apply to establish a home or branch office in an unbanked or underbanked community
abstract: Relates to minority depository institutions which apply to establish a home or branch office in an unbanked or underbanked community; provides that such institutions shall be entitled to receive deposits from the state comptroller and the commissioner of taxation and finance.

title: Commemorating the 50th Anniversary of the Patterson Historical Society
Relates to providing notice to the crime victim or victim's representative that a parolee or releasee is being discharged or released
abstract: Requires the parole board to provide notice to the crime victim or victim's representative that a parolee or releasee is being discharged or released.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim March 24, 2023, as Women in Agriculture Day in the State of New York
Amends section 7 of Rule III of the Assembly Rules, in relation to acceptance of a message of necessity
Commending Clarence W. Dart posthumously upon the occasion of his designation for special recognition by Saratoga County at its Honor a Deceased Veteran Ceremony on March 21, 2023
Relates to early intervention reimbursement rates
abstract: Provides that on and after April first, two thousand twenty-three, the department of health shall reimburse municipalities in an amount of sixty-six percent or more for the costs of early intervention services; directs the commissioner of health to review rates of reimbursement for early intervention services.

title: Requires the office of parks, recreation and historic preservation to prohibit the use or sale of single use plastic straws and beverage stirrers in state parks
abstract: Requires the office of parks, recreation and historic preservation to prohibit the use or sale of single use plastic straws and beverage stirrers in state parks.

title: Relates to the minimum age for certain lifeguards
abstract: Provides that lifeguards at swimming pools, bathing beaches, and children's camps may be a minimum of fifteen years of age if directly supervised.

title: Congratulating the Section III Girls Gymnastics Team upon the occasion of capturing the NYSPHSAA Girls Gymnastics Team Championship on March 4, 2023
Repeal paragraph (e) of subdivision 3 of section 2853 and subdivision 6-g of section 3602 of the education law, relating to an aid rollback for charter schools; repealer
abstract: Relates to an aid rollback for charter schools.

title: Reimburses counties who have purchased or will purchase document management software designed specifically for the child welfare industry
abstract: Reimburses counties who have purchased or will purchase document management software designed specifically for the child welfare industry.

title: Relates to requiring the department of health to prepare a report on the number of surplus ventilators within the state at the conclusion of the COVID-19 state of emergency
abstract: Requires the department of health to prepare a report on the number of surplus ventilators within the state at the conclusion of the COVID-19 state of emergency.

title: Relates to party nominations for candidates by county party committees
abstract: Relates to party nominations for candidates by county party committees.

title: Relates to payment rates for managed long term care plans
abstract: Provides for supplemental quality improvement payments for managed long term care plans that meet certain criteria.

title: Relates to enacting the "Nurse Safety Work Act"
abstract: Enacts the "Nurse Safety Work Act," which requires the implementation of safety procedures when hospital staff is alone with a patient.

title: Requires the promulgation of regulations relating to the commercial trade of human reproductive processes involving semen donation
abstract: Requires the promulgation of regulations relating to the commercial trade of human reproductive processes involving semen donation; limits the number of live births from a single semen donor.

title: Relates to participation in games of bingo by minors
abstract: Permits participation in games of bingo by minors who are accompanied by an adult.

title: Relates to unlawful operation of model or unmanned aircraft over a critical infrastructure facility
abstract: Provides that it is a class E felony to operate a model or unmanned aircraft over a critical infrastructure facility including an electrical power generating facility, petroleum or natural gas refinery or stage facility, or an aboveground oil, gas or chemical pipeline.

title: Provides public assistance for home internet service
abstract: Provides public assistance for home internet service payments.

title: Directs the New York state interagency task force on human trafficking to investigate connections between social media and human trafficking
abstract: Directs the New York state interagency task force on human trafficking to investigate connections between social media and human trafficking.

title: Relates to resource exemptions for applicants for public assistance programs
abstract: Relates to resource exemptions for applicants for public assistance programs; amends the Welfare Reform Act in relation to the effectiveness thereof.

title: Limits the amount of time to submit supporting documentation for major capital improvements
abstract: Limits the amount of time to submit supporting documentation for major capital improvements; sets such time at one hundred and twenty days.

title: Authorizes the county seat in Delaware county to have at least one polling place designated for early voting
abstract: Requires the county seat in Delaware county (Delhi) to have at least one polling place designated for early voting.

title: Relates to forfeiture of a beneficiary's right to benefits upon conviction of domestic violence offense
abstract: Permits a retired member to change his or her option election or designate a new beneficiary where the beneficiary has been convicted of a family offense.

title: Authorizes the city of New York to discontinue the use as parkland and alienate certain land within Flushing Meadows Corona Park
abstract: Authorizes the city of New York to discontinue the use as parkland and alienate certain land within Flushing Meadows Corona Park.

title: Limits the authority of cities, villages and towns to impose certain zoning requirements
abstract: Limits the authority of cities, villages and towns to impose certain zoning requirements.

title: Imposes restrictions on lead containing products
abstract: Imposes restrictions on lead-containing products and provides for a private right of action for violations.

title: Establishes the electric landscaping equipment rebate program; provides for the repeal of such provisions upon expiration thereof
abstract: Establishes the electric landscaping equipment rebate program to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, improve air quality, and reduce noise pollution by promoting the adoption of quieter, zero-emission landscaping equipment; provides for rebates at the point of sale for applicants purchasing or leasing certain equipment; provides for the repeal of such provisions upon expiration thereof.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim March 13, 2023, as K9 Veterans Day in the State of New York
Requires anti-bias training for every medical student, medical resident and physician assistant student in the state
abstract: Requires anti-bias training for every medical student, medical resident and physician assistant student in the state; requires the department of health to make an annual report on the implementation and effectiveness of such training.

title: Sets requirements for the sale, lease, and rental of powered bicycles, powered mobility devices, and storage batteries for such devices
abstract: Sets requirements for the sale, lease, and rental of powered bicycles, powered mobility devices, and storage batteries for such devices; provides for penalties for the violation thereof.

title: Amends section 2 of Rule IV of the Assembly Rules, in relation to committee agendas
Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim March as Triple Negative Breast Cancer Awareness Month in the State of New York
Removes the requirement that rent arrears be repaid
abstract: Removes the requirement that rent arrears be repaid; forgives any outstanding repayment agreements for rent arrears.

title: Relates to establishing a twenty-five year retirement plan for firefighters employed by the division of military and naval affairs
abstract: Establishes a twenty-five year retirement plan for firefighters employed by the division of military and naval affairs.

title: Excludes certain judgments, orders or decrees issued in a matrimonial action from a stay of enforcement without a court order
abstract: Excludes certain judgments, orders or decrees issued in a matrimonial action from a stay of enforcement without a court order.

title: Designates uniformed court officers in the town of Ossining, county of Westchester as peace officers
abstract: Designates uniformed court officers in the town of Ossining, county of Westchester as peace officers.

title: Relates to observing Atlantic time
abstract: Relates to causing New York to observe Atlantic time.

title: Provides that state departments, offices, agencies, and authorities are prohibited from imposing any fees, surcharges, or taxes that have not been approved
abstract: Provides that state departments, offices, agencies, and authorities are prohibited from imposing any fees, surcharges, or taxes that have not been approved by the state legislature.

title: Relates to the distribution of fines from speed violation monitoring systems in work zones
abstract: Provides that within a county that has established a traffic and parking violations agency and a liability is disposed of by such agency, eighty percent of such fine or penalty shall be paid to the thruway authority, and twenty percent of such fine or penalty shall be paid to the county in which the violation giving rise to the liability occurred; makes related provisions.

title: Prohibits a court from ordering certain physical examinations of the victim of a sexual assault and relates to the admissibility of evidence of the refusal of such victim to undergo such examinations
abstract: Prohibits a court from ordering certain physical examinations of the victim of a sexual assault; relates to the admissibility of evidence of the refusal of such victim to undergo such examinations.

title: Designates a portion of the state highway system the "Trooper Gerard B. Kane and Trooper Arthur B. Reddy Memorial Bridge"
abstract: Designates the bridge over the Southern State Parkway on Deer Park Avenue between Parkdale Drive and Sylvan Road in the town of Babylon, county of Suffolk, the "Trooper Gerard B. Kane and Trooper Arthur B. Reddy Memorial Bridge".

title: Establishes the zero emission industrial trucks grant program
abstract: Establishes the zero-emission industrial trucks grant program to be administered by NYSERDA, to encourage the purchase and lease of zero-emission industrial trucks, class I to III.

title: Relates to compensation paid to persons employed in positions requiring foreign language skills
abstract: Relates to compensation paid to persons employed in positions requiring foreign language skills; establishes career ladders for persons holding such positions; establishes supervisory positions for persons required to have foreign language skills.

title: Relates to zone pricing of gasoline
abstract: Relates to zone pricing of gasoline.

title: Relates to designating a portion of the state highway system as the 9-11 Fallen Firefighter Memorial Highway
abstract: Designates a portion of the Long Island Expressway as the "9-11 Fallen Firefighter Memorial Highway".

title: Requires the temporary president of the senate and the speaker of the assembly to provide each member of their respective chamber with any reports issued to them
abstract: Requires the temporary president of the senate and the speaker of the assembly to provide each member of their respective chamber with any reports issued to them.

title: Allows voters age sixty-five or older to request an absentee ballot
abstract: Allows voters age sixty-five or older to request an absentee ballot.

title: Provides for the advance payment of the earned income tax credit
abstract: Provides for the advance payment of the earned income tax credit to qualifying employees.

title: Authorizes non-membership not-for-profit corporations to classify their boards through their by-laws
abstract: Authorizes non-membership not-for-profit corporations to classify boards through the by-laws and not solely through the certificate of incorporation.

title: Requires the collection of oaths of responsible use from users of certain generative or surveillance advanced artificial intelligence systems
abstract: Requires the collection of oaths of responsible use from users of certain generative or surveillance advanced artificial intelligence systems by the operators of such systems, and transmission of such oaths to the attorney general.

title: Relates to rent registration statements to be filed for vacant units
abstract: Requires owners of housing accommodations subject to rent registration to file an additional statement at three month intervals, until the unit is occupied.

title: Permits boards of elections to change the date of a primary election if such election conflicts with a religious holiday
abstract: Permits boards of elections to change the date of a primary election within fourteen days of an election if such election date conflicts with a religious holiday.

title: Defines the term mass shooting for purposes of emergency response measures and access to emergency funding
abstract: Defines the term "mass shooting" for purposes of access to emergency funding as a shooting incident involving one or more firearms, rifles or shotguns during which four or more people, other than the individual or individuals alleged to have committed such incident, were injured or killed.

title: Relates to the operation of all-terrain vehicles by minors
abstract: Increases age for use of ATVs by minors from age ten to fourteen.

title: Prohibits the discharge of bilge water into waters of the state
abstract: Prohibits the discharge of bilge water into waters of the state from any vessel, watercraft, marina or mooring.

title: Extends wage parity for home care workers in upstate New York
abstract: Extends wage parity for home care workers in upstate New York.

title: Authorizes the commissioner of finance of the city of New York to establish a property tax amnesty program
abstract: Authorizes the commissioner of finance of the city of New York to establish a property tax amnesty program; provides that such program shall last for 4 months and shall forgive up to $1000 of interest on a delinquent tax bill if 100 percent of the principal bill is paid.

title: Authorizes the town of Henrietta, county of Monroe to alienate certain lands used as parkland and to dedicate certain other lands as parklands
abstract: Authorizes the town of Henrietta, county of Monroe to alienate certain lands used as parkland to Forest Creek Equity Corp., and to dedicate certain other lands as parklands.

title: Includes doulas as medical services providers for Medicaid recipients
abstract: Includes doulas as medical services providers for Medicaid recipients; directs the commissioner of health to submit an application for amendments and waivers to add doulas to such coverage pursuant to section 363-e of the social services law; directs the commissioner of health and the commissioner of the office of children and family services to add, amend and/or repeal any rule or regulation necessary.

title: Relates to eliminating daylight saving time; repealer
abstract: Eliminates daylight saving time.

title: Provides that a fire company may elect to include call firefighters within its membership who shall receive a stipend for each call that he or she responds to
abstract: Provides that a fire company may elect to include call firefighters within its membership who shall receive a stipend for each call that he or she responds to.

title: Increases the number of members on the state commission of correction
abstract: Increases the number of members on the state commission of correction and provides for the manner of confirmation of such members.

title: Relates to requiring a study to determine the effects that exposure to long range acoustic devices have on an individual's hearing
abstract: Requires a study by the department of health to determine the effects that exposure to long range acoustic devices have on an individual's hearing.

title: Relates to jurisdiction of proceedings under the tenant dignity and safe housing act
abstract: Amends the tenant dignity and safe housing act relating to special proceedings for judgment directing repairs of conditions and other relief in residential real property to limit jurisdiction; provides that proceedings may be maintained against any respondent with a legal obligation to maintain the property.

title: Relates to the purchase or lease of zero emission vehicles and charging or fueling infrastructure
abstract: Relates to the purchase or lease of zero emission vehicles and charging or fueling infrastructure by state agencies and the necessary requirements when making such procurements.

title: Requires the division of state police to send renewal notices to holders of a license to carry or possess a pistol or revolver before expiration of such license
abstract: Requires the division of state police to send renewal notices to holders of a license to carry or possess a pistol or revolver at least 90 days before expiration of such license.

title: Specifies procedures for the closure and/or decertification of assisted living residences
abstract: Specifies procedures for the closure and/or decertification of assisted living residences; requires certain review and disclosures to be completed within a certain time frame.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim February 19-25, 2023, as Engineers Week in the State of New York
Relates to proceedings for appointment of a guardian for personal needs or property management
abstract: Enacts "Karilyn's law"; provides that the court set the date for proceedings relating to family visitation under a guardianship petition for not more than ten days from the signing of the order to show cause; provides that visitation shall be a rebuttable presumption.

title: Relates to the practice of professional geology
abstract: Relates to the practice of professional geology.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim February 28, 2023, as Rare Disease Day in the State of New York
Relates to the powers and authority of the state commission on judicial conduct
abstract: Requires the state commission on judicial conduct to transmit its annual budget request to the governor for inclusion in the executive budget without revision; relates to complaints regarding judges and confidentiality of records; extends the jurisdiction of the state commission on judicial conduct as to judges who resign or retire while under investigation or formal charges.

title: Requires the state board of elections to conduct a background check on all candidates which appear on a ballot
abstract: Requires the state board of elections to conduct a background check on all candidates which appear on a ballot.

title: Limits the potency of cannabis products
abstract: Limits the potency of cannabis flower to 15 percent THC in flowers and 25 percent THC in other cannabis or hemp products.

title: Requires racetrack locations awarded a gaming facility license maintain live racing activity
abstract: Requires racetrack locations awarded a gaming facility license maintain live racing activity.

title: Relates to taking big and small game by crossbow in Wyoming county
abstract: Directs the department of environmental conservation to authorize the use of a crossbow for the taking of big and small game by any licensed person for use during the entirety of the archery-only season within Wyoming county.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim May 1-7, 2023, as Tardive Dyskinesia Awareness Week in the State of New York
Requires the governor and senior state officers to appear before the legislature
abstract: Requires the governor and senior state officers to appear before the legislature as requested by the legislature to publicly explain actions and answer questions.

title: Requires that all victim impact statements in New York state be video recorded; requires that the members of the parole board review all relevant victim impact statements prior to the conduct of a parole hearing
abstract: Requires that all victim impact statements in New York state be video recorded; requires that the members of the parole board and all presiding commissioners for such hearing review all relevant victim impact statements prior to the conduct of a parole hearing.

title: Prohibits single-use plastic straws in state and municipal run food establishments
abstract: Prohibits single-use plastic straws in state and municipal run food service establishments; defines terms; provides that no state or municipal run food service establishment in the state shall offer to consumers any single-use beverage straw made of plastic or any other non-biodegradable material; provides for exceptions.

title: Prohibits the release of persons convicted of first degree murder
abstract: Prohibits the release, on parole or otherwise, of persons convicted of first degree murder.

title: Authorizes expedited settlement conference processes for establishing child support orders
abstract: Authorizes expedited settlement conference processes for establishing child support orders where both parties voluntarily agree on the process.

title: Requires that annual reports be distributed in electronic format only, unless otherwise requested by a member
abstract: Requires that annual department reports be distributed in electronic format only, unless otherwise requested by a member.

title: Provides for the extension of NYSLRS service credit for any service credit lost due to either furlough or layoff of a member from when executive order 202 was issued through December 31, 2020
abstract: Provides for the extension of NYSLRS service credit for any service credit lost due to either furlough or layoff of a member from the period beginning when executive order 202 of 2020 was issued through December 31, 2020.

title: Creates an identification card program for local correctional facilities; and relates to issuance of and waiver of fees for identification cards issued pursuant to certain identification card programs
abstract: Creates an identification card program for incarcerated individuals in local correctional facilities; requires such identification cards to be identical to non-driver identification cards issued to the general public; waives fees for such identification cards.

title: Relates to lobbying for the confirmation of persons to state office
abstract: Requires registration and the disclosure of information relating to lobbying for the nomination or confirmation of persons to state office.

title: Exempts zero-emission school buses from sales and use taxes
abstract: Exempts the sale of zero-emission school buses from sales and use taxes.

title: Relates to crimes committed against a child
abstract: Relates to crimes against a child; makes endangering the welfare of a child in the first degree a crime.

title: Requires insurer to respond within thirty days of a request from an insured for his or her health plan documents
abstract: Requires insurer to respond within thirty days of a written request from an insured for his or her health plan documents, including copies of most recent group or individual contracts.

title: Provides for rates for residential health care facilities
abstract: Provides for updates to rates for residential health care facilities.

title: Authorizes Seaford Fire District to file with the county of Nassau assessor an application for a retroactive real property tax exemption
abstract: Authorizes Seaford Fire District to file with the county of Nassau assessor an application for a retroactive real property tax exemption.

title: Relates to the appointment process for state board positions
abstract: Relates to the appointment process for state board positions; provides for a 60 day time period to conduct a background check on potential nominees to state board positions before they can officially be appointed.

title: Requires instruction on conflict resolution for elementary, middle, and high school students
abstract: Requires age-appropriate instruction on conflict resolution for elementary, middle, and high school students; requires the commissioner to develop curricula for schools in the state for such instruction; directs the commissioner to develop resource materials to facilitate such instruction.

title: Provides for limited credit time allowances
abstract: Provides for limited credit time allowances for working in the horse handling program for a period of no less than eighteen months and receipt of a certification from the Groom Elite program.

title: Increases the penalties for sexual performances by a child and provides for consecutive sentencing upon certain multiple convictions
abstract: Increases the penalties for sexual performances by a child; increases age from 16 to 18 for application of existing sexual performance crimes; creates crimes of use of a child in a sexual performance in the first degree, promoting an obscene sexual performance by a child in the first degree, and promoting a sexual performance by a child in the first degree; provides for consecutive sentencing upon certain multiple convictions.

title: Provides an authorized police officer or peace officer the ability to request ambulance service
abstract: Provides an authorized police officer or peace officer the ability to request ambulance service for certain individuals who need emergency admission for immediate observation, care and treatment.

title: Relates to limiting the use of a victims DNA collected from sexual offense evidence kits
abstract: Prohibits the use of a victim's DNA collected from sexual offense evidence kits from being added to the state DNA identification index or other databases or being used in certain actions.

title: Enacts "Destini Smothers' law"; requires collaboration between law enforcement agencies in missing persons investigations and provides support for relatives of such missing persons
abstract: Enacts "Destini Smothers' law"; requires collaboration between law enforcement agencies in missing persons investigations; provides support for relatives of such missing persons.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim March 26, 2023, as Bangladesh Independence Day in the State of New York
Authorizes the town of Goshen to impose a hotel and motel tax
abstract: Authorizes the town of Goshen to impose a hotel and motel tax of up to five percent; provides for the repeal of such provisions upon the expiration thereof.

title: Relates to service retirement benefits for certain members of the New York city employees' retirement system
