abstract: Establishes the "earned time act" providing for time allowances against the term or maximum term of sentences imposed by the court to be credited on an annual pro rata basis.

title: Requires health insurance policies and medicaid to cover biomarker testing for certain purposes
abstract: Requires health insurance policies and medicaid to cover biomarker testing for diagnosis, treatment, appropriate management, or ongoing monitoring of a covered person's disease or condition when the test is supported by medical and scientific evidence.

title: Relates to procedures required for the custodial interrogation of children
abstract: Amends procedures required for the custodial interrogation of children to provide additional protections and for taking juveniles and sixteen and seventeen year olds into custody.

title: Relates to on duty auxiliary police officers
abstract: Relates to an increase in punishment for certain actions against on-duty auxiliary police officers such as criminally negligent homicide, assault or menacing of such officer.

title: Requires policies for the use of automatic license plate reader systems
abstract: Requires the consumer protection division to promulgate a policy governing the use of automatic license plate reader systems by non-law enforcement agencies; requires such non-law enforcement agencies to conspicuously post such policy on their website or in their place of business.

title: Relates to treatment of gains from qualified opportunity zones in calculating taxable income
abstract: Relates to treatment of gains from qualified opportunity zones in calculating taxable income; removes exclusion of gains on property in qualified opportunity zones in calculation of income.

title: Relates to prohibiting the operation of establishments where animals and/or fowls are slaughtered or butchered for food
abstract: Prohibits the operation of establishments where animals and/or fowls are slaughtered or butchered for food; establishes a task force on public health risks and animal welfare concerns of slaughterhouses.

title: Enacts the "Learning for Work" act; appropriation
abstract: Enacts the "learning for work act"; establishes the youth apprenticeship program and the enhanced regents professional diploma; appropriates moneys therefor.

title: Relates to requiring at least a ratio of one clinical, non-student mental health staff member per one thousand students on all SUNY and CUNY campuses
abstract: Requires at least a ratio of one clinical, non-student mental health staff member per one thousand students on all SUNY and CUNY campuses and for state colleges and universities to update such ratio every five years.

title: Requires the board of education in the city of Buffalo to submit the school district budget to the voters for approval prior to adoption
abstract: Requires the board of education in the city of Buffalo to submit the school district budget to the voters for approval prior to adoption.

title: Establishes the crime of forcible touching of a correction officer and increases criminal penalties for certain sexual offenses committed against correction officers
abstract: Establishes the crime of forcible touching of a correction officer; increases criminal penalties for certain sexual offenses committed against correction officers when such correction officer is acting in the course of their employment.

title: Requires certain insurance carriers to certify that at least a majority of prescription drug rebates are provided to patients at the point of sale
abstract: Requires individual and small group insurance carriers and group and blanket accident and health carriers to certify that at least a majority of prescription drug rebates are provided to patients at the point of sale.

title: Eliminates certain services from the class A misdemeanor of theft of services and allows for community service in lieu of a civil penalty for certain thefts of transit services
abstract: Eliminates from the class A misdemeanor of theft of services, the avoidance of payment for railroad, subway, bus or other public transportation services; allows for community service in lieu of a civil penalty for certain offenders of theft of transit services.

title: Relates to the purchase of zero-emission buses and the procurement of electric-powered buses, vehicles or other related equipment
abstract: Relates to the purchase of zero-emission buses and the procurement of electric-powered buses, vehicles or other related equipment and infrastructure; requires public utilities to have infrastructure, capacity, facilities, and transmission and distribution systems needed to supply power for the charging of zero-emission buses and provides a tariff for charging of electric buses.

title: Establishes the "Malcolm X unsolved civil rights crime act of 2023"
abstract: Establishes the "Malcom X unsolved civil rights crime act"; requires the assistant attorney of the civil rights bureau to investigate violations of criminal civil rights statutes that occurred not later than December thirty-first, nineteen seventy-nine, and resulted in a death.

title: Enacts the New York state drinking water bill of rights
abstract: Relates to the right to safe, clean, affordable, and accessible water adequate for human consumption, cooking, and sanitary purposes.

title: Honoring James A. Powers upon the occasion of his designation as recipient of the Lifetime Achiever Award by the Clarence Chamber of Commerce on March 9, 2023
Commemorating the 152nd Anniversary of the Yonkers Police Department on April 10, 2023
Commemorating the 151st Anniversary of the City of Yonkers on June 1, 2023
Relates to conducting studies on personal income tax brackets and the corporate franchise tax
abstract: Relates to conducting studies on personal income tax brackets and the corporate franchise tax.

title: Requires that any disposition of land or buildings by the New York City Housing Authority be subject to and comply with the provisions of New York City's Uniform Land Use Review Procedure
abstract: Requires that any disposition of land or buildings by the New York City Housing Authority be subject to and comply with the provisions of New York City's Uniform Land Use Review Procedure.

title: Places limits on rent adjustments for major capital improvements
abstract: Places limits on rent adjustments for major capital improvements.

title: Relates to requiring certain establishments which sell liquor to have devices which measure blood alcohol content
abstract: Requires a retail licensee for on-premises consumption to maintain and make available to customers, at no charge, a device which measures blood alcohol content.

title: Designates sweet corn as the state vegetable
abstract: Designates sweet corn as the state vegetable.

title: Prohibits the erection or maintenance of billboards advertising alcoholic beverages within 1000 feet of schools or playgrounds
abstract: Prohibits the erection or maintenance of billboards advertising alcoholic beverages within 1000 feet of schools or playgrounds; defines "billboard".

title: Relates to the effect of mandates on school districts
abstract: Provides that state mandates shall not be implemented in school districts after such district has passed a budget; provides that any such mandates shall be implemented in the following fiscal year.

title: Changes population restrictions on apportioning expense of municipal police department member training
abstract: Includes all counties and cities with a population of two hundred thousand or less within provisions which permit the apportionment of expense of municipal police department member training, thus allowing police departments to receive reimbursement of training costs if an officer is hired by another department.

title: Provides that upon sale of a limited-profit housing company project, reserve and surplus funds must be held in escrow and dedicated to major capital improvements
abstract: Provides that upon sale or other conveyance of a limited-profit housing company project to an entity other than a new limited-profit housing company, reserve and surplus funds must be held in escrow by the new owner and dedicated solely to defraying the costs of major capital improvements; provides that no rental may be increased to cover the cost of a major capital improvement until such reserve and surplus funds have been exhausted.

title: Relates to prohibiting a court from denying class certification solely because the action involves governmental operations
abstract: Prohibits a court from denying class certification for purposes of class action lawsuits solely because the action involves governmental operations.

title: Provides for recall
abstract: Provides for recall; empowers the electors with the ability to remove elective officers.

title: Relates to establishing reporting duties of law enforcement agencies with respect to police misconduct allegations and outcomes
abstract: Relates to establishing reporting duties of law enforcement agencies with respect to police misconduct allegations and outcomes; requires the division of criminal justice services to establish and maintain on its official website a public, searchable database of alleged infractions and police misconduct complaints.

title: Establishes a tax deduction for tires that are blown out from potholes on state and local roads
abstract: Establishes a tax credit for tires that are blown out from potholes on state and local roads up to one thousand dollars.

title: Requires the workers' compensation board to provide notice to covered employers before a fine is assessed for failure to obtain having workers' compensation coverage
abstract: Requires the workers' compensation board to provide notice to covered employers before a fine is assessed for failure to obtain having workers' compensation coverage.

title: Enacts the election workers, voters and polling places protection act
abstract: Enacts the "election workers, voters and polling places protection act" to protect voters, poll watchers, election officials, and any damage to physical property being used as a polling place or by the board of elections; makes violations a class D felony which includes imprisonment of up to seven years.

title: Relates to the use of campaign funds for any settlement fees, fines or penalties for sexual harassment civil or criminal actions
abstract: Prohibits the use of campaign funds to pay any settlement fees, fines or penalties for sexual harassment civil or criminal actions.

title: Relates to providing Yonkers city school district with additional supplemental education improvement plan funds
abstract: Provides Yonkers city school district with additional supplemental education improvement plan funds.

title: Relates to criminalizing the act of stalking a police officer or peace officer
abstract: Relates to criminalizing the act of stalking a police officer or peace officer.

title: Requires the county seat in Fulton county to have at least one polling place designated for early voting
abstract: Requires the county seat in Fulton county to have at least one polling place designated for early voting.

title: Relates to the volunteer firefighters' and ambulance workers' credit; repealer
abstract: Repeals the provision of law that volunteer firefighters and ambulance workers who receive a real property tax exemption for service may not receive the income tax credit for such service.

title: Allows Westchester county to require bidders for public works, construction or purchase contracts to hire and retain persons residing in certain targeted communities
abstract: Allows Westchester county to require bidders for public works, construction or purchase contracts to hire and retain persons residing in certain targeted communities based on the combined average poverty rate and unemployment rate.

title: Directs a health maintenance organization which denies a claim due to absence of medical necessity to advise insured as to alternative treatment
abstract: Directs a health maintenance organization which denies a claim due to absence of medical necessity to inform the insured as to preferred alternative treatment, or provide the insured with a statement as to the past ineffectiveness of the requested procedure or treatment.

title: Establishes the New York state local emergency services account
abstract: Establishes the New York state local emergency services account; provides reimbursement for expenses incurred related to procurement of any equipment including radio and communication items, apparatus, vehicles including snowmobiles, all terrain vehicles, and boats, goods or services related to the renovation of any buildings, and personal protective equipment.

title: Establishes family literacy programs for economically disadvantaged families living in poverty areas or areas with low-performing public schools
abstract: Establishes family literacy programs for economically disadvantaged families living in poverty areas or areas with low-performing public schools; provides for competitive matching grants to establish a comprehensive program; requires commissioner of education to submit an annual report to the governor and legislature.

title: Relates to the penalty for the offense of predatory sexual assault against a child
abstract: Relates to the penalty for the offense of predatory sexual assault against a child; provides for lifetime parole for such felons.

title: Authorizes Anthony Pocchia to qualify for post-retirement health insurance benefits
abstract: Authorizes Anthony Pocchia to qualify for post-retirement health insurance benefits.

title: Adds medical and health insurance information within the definitions of identity theft
abstract: Adds medical and health insurance information within the definitions of identity theft.

title: Relates to establishing a residential fuel oil storage tank credit
abstract: Provides a tax credit for costs associated with the removal or permanent closure of a below-ground residential fuel oil storage tank used to provide heating fuel for single- to four-family residences.

title: Increases by 1 degree the severity of rape, criminal sexual act, sexual abuse and course of sexual conduct against a child in the second degrees
abstract: Increases by 1 degree the severity of rape in the second degree, criminal sexual act in the second degree, sexual abuse in the second degree and course of sexual conduct against a child in the second degree.

title: Relates to prohibiting certain payments and benefits to administrators under an individual contract
abstract: Prohibits an administrator employed through an individual contract with a school district or the state university of New York from receiving any additional payout, bonus renumeration, or benefits, including paid leaves or guaranteed faculty positions, upon the termination of such contract.

title: Appropriates funds to the city of Yonkers fire department for a hazardous materials emergency response unit; appropriation
abstract: Establishes and appropriates funding for a Westchester county hazardous materials emergency response demonstration unit to be located within the city of Yonkers under the jurisdiction of the commissioner of the city of Yonkers fire department in cooperation with other fire departments; appropriates $1,498,623 therefor.

title: Requires disclosures required in advertisements using the title "coach"
abstract: Requires disclosures required in advertisements using the title "coach"; defines the title "coach" as a professional designation, credential, certification, or professional description that indicates the person has expertise or training in issues specifically related to providing care or help in choosing a career in their field; provides civil penalties for violations; makes related provisions.

title: Relates to the timely cashing of rent checks
abstract: Relates to the timely cashing of rent checks; requires a landlord to cash a rent check provided by a tenant in his or her possession within thirty days after the check is postmarked.

title: Authorizes interactive gaming in the state of New York
abstract: Authorizes interactive gaming in the state of New York.

title: Increases the available number of nominations for the historic business preservation registry per year
abstract: Increases the available number of nominations per elected official for the historic business preservation registry per year.

title: Authorizes state of New York mortgage agency to purchase labor organization assisted forward commitment mortgages from banks
abstract: Authorizes state of New York mortgage agency to purchase labor organization assisted forward commitment mortgages from banks; sets criteria for labor organization participation; requires them to guarantee up to twenty percent of outstanding indebtedness.

title: Relates to the production of and the assessment of a surcharge for distinctive Feeling Rural Good license plates and to establishing the feeling rural good health care fund
abstract: Relates to the production of and the assessment of a surcharge for distinctive "Feeling Rural Good" license plates; establishes the feeling rural good health care fund; provides that funds deposited into the feeling rural good health care fund shall be used in rural regions of the state to expand school-based health programs, improve access to health research and education, and expand broadband access for improved access to telehealth.

title: Relates to the leasing of state-owned underwater lands for seaweed cultivation
abstract: Permits the leasing of state-owned underwater lands for seaweed cultivation.

title: Relates to establishing a deadbeats most wanted list and worldwide web page
abstract: Establishes a deadbeats most wanted list and worldwide web page.

title: Enacts the criminal street gang related crimes act
abstract: Enacts the criminal street gang related crimes act; provides for enhanced criminal sanctions where crimes are related to criminal street gangs.

title: Authorizes counties to impose fees for performing drug tests and utilizing electronic monitoring equipment
abstract: Authorizes counties to impose fees for performing drug tests and utilizing electronic monitoring equipment.

title: Prohibits fuel oil, grade number four in any building or facility in the state
abstract: Prohibits fuel oil, grade number four in any building or facility in the state after July 1, 2026.

title: Excludes board of cooperative educational services capital expenses from the school district tax levy limit
abstract: Excludes board of cooperative educational services capital expenses from the school district tax levy limit.

title: Allows the implementation of body cameras on police officers notwithstanding binding arbitration
abstract: Allows the implementation of body cameras on police officers notwithstanding binding arbitration.

title: Designates a portion of the state highway system as the Trooper Joseph J. Gallagher Memorial Bridge
abstract: Designates a portion of the state highway system on the Long Island Expressway, county of Suffolk, as the "Trooper Joseph J. Gallagher Memorial Bridge".

title: Directs the commissioner of education to provide for the availability of adequate supplies for use by left-handed students
abstract: Directs the commissioner of education to provide for the proportionate availability of adequate school supplies for use by left-handed students where adequate supplies are available for use by right-handed students; applies to any school supplies and equipment purchased by the department or schools on or after the effective date of rules and regulations promulgated by the commissioner of education.

title: Includes aggravated harassment in the first degree under a specified offense
abstract: Includes aggravated harassment in the first degree under a specified offense.

title: Requires the office of mental health, the office of addiction services and supports and the department of education to create a behavioral health website
abstract: Requires the office of mental health, office of addiction services and supports and the department of education to create a behavioral health website which shall provide information on various behavioral health issues such as depression, eating disorders, anxiety, schizophrenia, post-traumatic stress disorder and bipolar disorder.

title: Relates to waiving the twenty-four hour waiting period for solemnizing a marriage after a license is issued for persons serving in the armed forces; repealer
abstract: Waives the twenty-four hour waiting period for solemnizing a marriage after a license is issued for persons serving in the armed forces.

title: Relates to adding disability to the equal protection requirement
abstract: Relates to adding disability to the equal protection requirement.

title: Authorizes the denial of renewal of professional, business or trade licenses where a taxpayer has outstanding tax debt which the taxpayer has failed to settle
abstract: Authorizes the denial of the renewal of a license, permit, certificate, registration or admission to practice a profession, business or trade where a taxpayer has outstanding tax debt which the taxpayer has failed to enter into a settlement agreement for the payment thereof; requires each taxpayer renewing a license to practice a profession, business or trade to attest to the licensing agency that he or she does not have an unsettled outstanding tax debt.

title: Prohibits price gouging on certain consumer goods sold at thruway gas stations, restaurants, and other facilities
abstract: Prohibits price gouging on certain consumer goods sold at thruway gas stations, restaurants, and other facilities.

title: Relates to licenses to carry and possess firearms for police officers
abstract: Relates to licenses to carry and possess firearms for police officers; authorizes police officers to apply for a firearms license that is valid throughout the state.

title: Reduces sales tax by one percent on vehicles manufactured in the United States
abstract: Reduces sales tax on vehicles manufactured in the United States by one percent; provides that the commissioner of taxation and finance shall obtain a listing of such vehicles from the commissioner of motor vehicles yearly.

title: Exempts receipts from the services provided by a farrier in shoeing a horse
abstract: Exempts receipts from the services provided by a farrier in shoeing a horse including reasonable fees for travel and shoeing a horse in a remote location on a farm.

title: Establishes the veterans' memorials preservation act
abstract: Establishes the veterans' memorials preservation act.

title: Relates to providing for the licensing and regulation of the profession of reflexology
abstract: Provides for the licensing and regulation of the profession of reflexology which is a protocol that is applied to specific reflex areas to stimulate the neural pathways linking body systems.

title: Establishes mandatory training for every high school guidance counselor relating to assisting students with autism spectrum disorder
abstract: Establishes mandatory training for every high school guidance counselor relating to assisting students with autism spectrum disorder; requires high school guidance counselors to receive training at least once a year on the special needs of students with autism spectrum disorder and how to assist such students in the transition from high school to higher education or employment.

title: Relates to payments of grants to farm operations by NYSERDA
abstract: Relates to payments of grants to farm operations by NYSERDA; provides that payment of such grants shall be made no later than ninety days after notification.

title: Amends Rules III, IV and V of the Assembly Rules, in relation to amending bills, certain voting and extending the bar of the house
Relates to youth programs sponsored by fire departments
abstract: Relates to youth programs sponsored by fire departments; provides that participants may respond to an emergency or hazardous activity, but shall remain in a designated or marked off area that has been set up by the chief or officer in charge; provides such participant cannot respond to an emergency on a vehicle using lights and/or sirens; provides such participants may not enter a burning structure.

title: Creates a pilot program to provide for a ranked choice voting method to be used in up to ten local governments for two years and provides for repeal of provisions
abstract: Creates a pilot program to provide for an instant runoff voting method to be used in up to ten local governments, selected by the state board of elections, in election years 2026 and 2027; requires report to state legislature.

title: Authorizes the establishment of the home equity protection insurance program
abstract: Authorizes the establishment of the home equity protection insurance program directing the agency to issue a commitment to insure and insure the full value of certain residences which are owner-occupied by persons who meet certain income qualifications.

title: Provides for the provision to consumers of information concerning household hazardous products at the point of retail sale by labels and pamphlets
abstract: Establishes a program to provide information to consumers concerning household hazardous products; provides such information be available at the point of retail sale by labels and pamphlets; provides such information should disclose hazards and inform people of environmentally safer alternatives; provides for the establishment of a hazardous product list by the department of environmental conservation.

title: Establishes the crime of assault on a pregnant woman
abstract: Establishes the crimes of assault on a pregnant woman in the second degree as a class D felony and assault on a pregnant woman in the first degree as a class C felony.

title: Relates to notice of disclaimer of liability for certain revived claims or causes of action
abstract: Relates to notice of disclaimer of liability for certain revived causes of action; such notice shall occur within 120 days after the insurer has received actual notice of such revived claim or cause of action.

title: Relates to real property tax exemptions for disabled veterans
abstract: Increases, at local option, real property tax exemptions for combat veterans who are 100% permanently disabled.

title: Relates to certain veterans and competitive civil service exam points
abstract: Relates to certain veterans; entitles them to 10 additional competitive civil service exam points if they are disabled; entitles them to 5 additional competitive civil service exam points if they are non-disabled and if they received certain medals or ribbons.

title: Requires the establishment of an annual employment statistics index for unemployment rate of hamlets and villages of the state
abstract: Requires the commissioner of labor to adopt regulations prescribing the methodology for establishing an annual employment statistics index which shows unemployment rates of hamlets and unincorporated villages of the state; directs such commissioner shall prepare and submit an annual report on such index.

title: Relates to the health and environmental impacts of lithium-ion batteries for electric vehicles, and the manufacturing thereof
abstract: Educates the public about the health and environmental impacts of lithium-ion battery use and manufacture on air, water and soil.

title: Establishes a contraband screening plan which includes a canine at the entrance of each correctional facility
abstract: Establishes a contraband screening plan which includes a canine at the entrance of each correctional facility to detect the presence of illegal drugs.

title: Relates to the residency requirements of certain public officers of political subdivisions or municipal corporations of the state
abstract: Relates to the residency requirements of certain public officers of political subdivisions or municipal corporations of the state; prohibits certain officers from being required to forego or make a payment or satisfy a levy due to him or her becoming a nonresident of the political subdivision or municipal corporation of the state.

title: Prohibits the mandated use of credit cards at state parks, recreational facilities or historic sites
abstract: Prohibits the mandated use of credit cards at state parks, recreational facilities or historic sites.

title: Establishes the marine electric propulsion health and environmental impact program
abstract: Establishes the marine electric propulsion health and environmental impact program to provide education, advocacy and increased awareness of the environmental and health impacts of marine electric propulsion systems.

title: Enacts the New York state senior housing opportunities partnership act and establishes a state senior housing opportunities partnership authority
abstract: Enacts the New York state senior housing opportunities partnership act; establishes the New York state senior housing opportunities partnership authority; provides that such authority will finance or collaborate in the financing of senior housing opportunities facility projects.

title: Directs the commissioner of transportation to conduct a statewide study and review of the transportation of individuals with developmental disabilities
abstract: Directs the commissioner of transportation, in consultation with the commissioner of the office for people with developmental disabilities, to conduct a statewide study and review of the transportation of individuals with developmental disabilities.

title: Requires abandoned property escheat to the Indian nation or tribe that historically occupied the land or to nearest nation or tribe; repealer
abstract: Requires abandoned property escheat to the Indian nation or tribe that historically occupied the land or to the nearest nation or tribe; establishes such land shall be tribal land.

title: Enacts the state and local government food waste prevention and diversion act
abstract: Enacts the state and local government food waste prevention and diversion act; requires facilities generating excess food waste to take measures to minimize such waste.

title: Relates to the rate paid by the state to a city for maintenance and repair of highways
abstract: Relates to the rate paid by the state to a city for maintenance and repair of highways.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim February 1, 2023, as Girls and Women in Sports Day in the State of New York
Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim Friday, February 3, 2023, as Wear Red for Women Day in the State of New York
Requires notaries public and commissioners of deeds to complete and retain certain documents relating to the transfer of residential real property
abstract: Requires notaries public and commissioners of deeds to complete and retain certain documents relating to the transfer of residential real property; relates to forgery and offering a false document concerning residential real property.

title: Directs the department of health to create an informational pamphlet regarding the laparoscopic power morcellation surgery technique
abstract: Directs the department of health to create an informational pamphlet regarding the laparoscopic power morcellation surgery technique.

title: Establishes the chief administrator of the courts shall submit annually a report on the Drug Treatment Court Program during the preceding year
abstract: Establishes the chief administrator of the courts shall submit annually a report on the administration, function and effectiveness of the Drug Treatment Court Program during the preceding year.

title: Directs the commissioner of the office of parks, recreation and historic preservation to provide for the re-designation of Donald J. Trump State Park
abstract: Directs the commissioner of the office of parks, recreation and historic preservation to conduct a legal review for the re-designation of Donald J. Trump State Park, in Putnam and Westchester counties to a new name.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim February 2023, as Marfan Syndrome Awareness Month in the State of New York
Relates to outdoor restraints of dogs
abstract: Relates to outdoor restraints of dogs; prohibits tethering under cruel or inhumane conditions, including during dangerous weather conditions when a weather alert, advisory or warning is in effect; provides for civil penalties for violations.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim April 9, 2023, as Yellow Ribbon Day in the State of New York
Authorizes the department of financial services to prescribe by regulation the order of payment of checks and other debts, insufficient funds charges and return deposit item charges
abstract: Authorizes the department of financial services to prescribe by regulation the order of payment of checks and other debts, insufficient funds charges and return deposit item charges.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim February 11, 2023, as P.S. I Love You Day in the State of New York
Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim April 11, 2023, as Submarine Day in the State of New York
Establishes the homeless protection act which designates certain offenses against homeless persons as hate crimes
abstract: Establishes the homeless protection act which designates certain offenses against homeless persons as hate crimes; includes the definition of homelessness.

title: Relates to operators of a vehicle overtaking a bicycle or pedestrian
abstract: Relates to operators of a vehicle overtaking a bicycle or pedestrian outside the city of New York.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim April 2023, as Pet Cruelty Awareness Month in the State of New York, in conjunction with the observance of National Animal Cruelty Awareness Month
Relates to authorizing and permitting appearance enhancement licensees to apply dye to eyelash and eyebrow hair
abstract: Establishes Sabria's law to authorize and permit appearance enhancement licensees to apply dye to eyelash and eyebrow hair.

title: Requires publications to identify when the use of artificial intelligence is present within such publication
abstract: Requires that every newspaper, magazine or other publication printed or electronically published in this state, which contains the use of generative artificial intelligence or other information communication technology, shall identify that certain parts of such newspaper, magazine, or publication were composed through the use of artificial intelligence or other information communication technology.

title: Provides for a formal process for a parent or legal guardian to request the issuance of an AMBER alert
abstract: Provides for a formal process for a parent or legal guardian to request the issuance of an AMBER alert.

title: Relates to the definition of "direct relationship" for the purposes of article 23-A of the correction law regarding certain licensures and employment
abstract: Relates to the definition of "direct relationship" for the purposes of article 23-A of the correction law regarding licensures and employment of persons previously convicted of one or more criminal offenses.

title: Relates to eligibility for extended child care assistance benefits
abstract: Amends provisions for determination of eligibility for extended child care assistance benefits.

title: Relates to the right to assistance of counsel for custody and guardianship proceedings
abstract: Expands the right to assistance of counsel to include respondents in guardianship proceedings and kinship caregivers in custody and guardianship proceedings.

title: Relates to requiring utility companies maintain a toll free number for reporting service outages
abstract: Requires utility companies maintain a toll free number for consumers to call to report service outages which shall be made available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.

title: Prohibits the termination of tenancy in certain housing occupied by senior citizens and/or persons with disabilities
abstract: Prohibits the termination of tenancy in housing occupied by substantially all persons over sixty-five years of age and/or persons with disabilities without cause; prohibits increasing rent more than one percent above the percentage change.

title: Commemorating the 200th Anniversary of the Town of Somerset, New York
Relates to false material statements related to a public utility
abstract: Relates to false material statements related to a public utility.

title: Prohibits ear clipping and tail docking of dogs unless deemed medically necessary to protect the life or health of the dog
abstract: Prohibits ear clipping and tail docking of dogs unless deemed medically necessary to protect the life or health of the dog.

title: Relates to establishing a commission for the educational advancement of multilingual learners in New York
abstract: Relates to establishing a commission for the educational advancement of multilingual learners in New York; provides such commission shall report on the best practices and legislative recommendations to close the achievement gap and high school graduation rates between multilingual learners and their English proficient peers from prekindergarten through twelfth grade.

title: Relates to orders of adjournment in contemplation of dismissal and sealing of defendant records
abstract: Relates to orders of adjournment in contemplation of dismissal by mandating that judges seal certain records of defendants rather than giving judge's discretion for such an action; limits the total period of adjournment to 90 days.

title: Relates to requiring public schools to offer plant-based food options in food service
abstract: Requires public schools to offer plant-based food options in food service.

title: Celebrating the life and accomplishments of Timothy L. Barnett, renowned conservationist, distinguished citizen and devoted member of his community
Authorizes voting by incarcerated people
abstract: Relates to authorizing voting by incarcerated people.

title: Authorizes school districts that provide transition services to allow the delivery of such transition services, including integrated employment, during school hours
abstract: Authorizes school districts that provide transition services to allow the delivery of such transition services, including integrated employment, during school hours.

title: Relates to the number of voting machines required, supplies at polling locations and the number of affidavit ballots to be supplied at polling locations
abstract: Relates to the total number of voting machines required at polling sites in cities with populations of one million or more.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim February 2023, as Turner Syndrome Awareness Month in the State of New York
Relates to the licensing of sign language interpreters and creates a state board for sign language interpreting
abstract: Relates to the licensing of sign language interpreters; creates a state board for sign language interpreting.

title: Grants superior court judges the authority to issue a temporary order of protection when an action is pending in a local criminal court
abstract: Authorizes courts to hold evidentiary hearings for a temporary order of protection in certain circumstances; grants superior court judges the authority to issue a temporary order of protection when an action is pending in a local criminal court in certain circumstances.

title: Grants a total exemption from real property taxation for school tax purposes for certain persons seventy-five years of age or over
abstract: Grants a total exemption from real property taxation for school tax purposes for certain persons seventy-five years of age or over.

title: Relates to the sale of ammunition for assault weapons
abstract: Relates to limiting ammunition for assult weapons to two times the capacity of an authorized weapon over a one hundred twenty day period.

title: Relates to the legislative power of the University of the State of New York
abstract: Relates to legislative review of rules and regulations adopted by the board of regents that will increase school district costs.

title: Congratulating the Syracuse University Men's Soccer Team upon the occasion of winning the 2022 NCAA Men's Soccer Tournament and National Championship
Mourning the death of The Reverend Franklin Florence, renowned religious leader, local civil rights icon, and devoted member of his community
Authorizes certain electronic court appearances
abstract: Authorizes electronic court appearances for criminal matters, excluding jury trials, in all counties in the state; authorizes electronic appearances for criminal matters where the court determines a personal appearance would be impractical, unsafe or excessively burdensome; authorizes sentencing to a period of incarceration to be conducted via electronic appearance for defendants who are already incarcerated.

title: Enacts the accessible electronic information act
abstract: Enacts the accessible electronic information act for blind and disabled persons; creates a new fund in the state finance law; authorizes a not-for-profit entity to administer the program.

title: Directs telecommunication and cable corporations to provide call center service assistance from centers located within the state
abstract: Directs telecommunications and cable corporations to provide call center service assistance from centers located within the state and such corporations' service areas; includes a list of what services must be provided.

title: Directs state agencies to submit reports detailing their telework policies
abstract: Directs state agencies to submit reports detailing their telework policies; permits input from employees anonymously; directs the department of civil service to compile reports and submit a single report to the legislature.

title: Designates the second Monday in July each year as a public holiday, to be known as Abolition Commemoration day
abstract: Designates the second Monday in July each year as a public holiday, to be known as Abolition Commemoration Day.

title: Creates the non-partisan legislative budget office
abstract: Creates the non-partisan legislative budget office; directs such office shall provide information to legislative committees of the senate and assembly with respect to the state budget, appropriation bills and other bills providing budget authority or tax expenditures; requires such office to report to the temporary president of the senate, the senate minority leader, the speaker of the assembly and the assembly minority leader.

title: Relates to reporting unmet need for programs and services for the aging
abstract: Relates to reporting unmet need, which is the number of eligible individuals seeking participation in a program or service who are not receiving such program or service due to insufficient resources or capacity.

title: Requires the board of elections or a bipartisan committee to conduct a risk-limiting audit of voter verifiable audit records
abstract: Requires the board of elections or a bipartisan committee appointed by such board to conduct a risk-limiting audit of voter verifiable audit records from voting machines or systems within the jurisdiction of such board.

title: Directs the superintendent of banks to promulgate rules and regulations requiring licensed cashers of checks to file suspicious activity reports
abstract: Directs the superintendent of banks to promulgate rules and regulations requiring licensed cashers of checks to file suspicious activity reports.

title: Establishes the people with disabilities access to programs commission
abstract: Establishes the people with disabilities access to programs commission to examine, evaluate and make recommendations for new laws with respect to how the state should streamline eligibility requirements and processes for its programs and services to assist people with disabilities.

title: Relates to unregistered and unlicensed mortgage brokers
abstract: Relates to unregistered and unlicensed mortgage brokers; establishes additional penalties against unlicensed or unregistered persons or entities engaging in activities after receiving a cease and desist notice.

title: Authorizes utility corporations, telegraph and telephone corporations, and cable television corporations to provide notice of bills to third parties
abstract: Authorizes utility corporations, telegraph and telephone corporations, and cable television corporations to provide notice of bills to third parties at the request of the customer.

title: Relates to decreasing the length of the suspension period applicable to certain striking workers who seek to obtain unemployment insurance benefits
abstract: Relates to decreasing the length of the suspension period applicable to certain individuals who lose their jobs due to a labor dispute, such as a strike, and who seek to obtain unemployment insurance benefits; decreases the suspension period from two consecutive weeks to one week; permits the waiting period to be served during a suspension period.

title: Provides the New York city water board shall not establish a limit of less than six years to challenge any service charges for the use of or services furnished by the water board
abstract: Provides the NYC water board shall not establish a limit of less than six years to challenge any fee, rate, rent or other service charges for the use of or services furnished by the water board and/or sewerage systems.

title: Enacts the "omnibus emergency services volunteer incentive act" to provide certain benefits to volunteer firefighters and ambulance workers
abstract: Enacts the "omnibus emergency services volunteer incentive act" to provide benefits to volunteer firefighters and ambulance workers; increases the personal income tax deduction after four or more years of service; exempts motor vehicles used in the performance of such volunteers' duties from registration fees, use taxes and special fees for volunteer license plates; authorizes the provision of municipal health insurance coverage to such volunteers; establishes a volunteer recruitment service loan forgiveness program.

title: Includes pharmacists in the list of persons and officials required to report child abuse
abstract: Includes pharmacists in the list of persons and officials required to report child abuse or mistreatment.

title: Requires license plates and liability insurance for electric scooters and limited use motorcycles in N.Y. city
abstract: Requires license plates and liability insurance for electric scooters and limited use motorcycles in cities having a population of one million or more.

title: Requires sellers of limited use motorcycles to have purchasers provide proof of registration of such vehicles at the time of purchase
abstract: Requires sellers of limited use motorcycles to have purchasers provide proof of registration of such vehicles at the time of purchase; provides that such sellers may register the limited use motorcycles for the purchaser as proof of registration; requires limited use motorcycles to be registered at the time of purchase.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim October 29, 2023, as Furniture and TV Tip-Over Prevention Awareness Day
Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim November 28, 2023, as Albanian-American Heritage Day in the State of New York
Relates to electronic bidding
abstract: Allows a city with a population of one million inhabitants or more, or any district, board or agency with jurisdiction exclusively within such city, to authorize or require bids and offers for any contract to be submitted in an electronic format; provides such city, district, board or agency may conduct a public opening and reading of bids or identification of offerors.

title: Prohibits the possession and use of live ammunition at a film production facility or a qualified film production facility
abstract: Prohibits the possession and use of live ammunition at a film production facility or a qualified film production facility; requires all persons employed or present at a film production facility or a qualified film production facility to receive proper training on the safe use, handling, storage and transportation of firearms.

title: Provides for the registration of professional nurse anesthetist
abstract: Relates to the certification of registered nurse anesthetists; provides that for such certification an applicant shall file an application, be licensed as a registered professional nurse, have satisfactorily completed educational preparation for the administration of anesthesia by an accredited entity and pay a fee.

title: Prohibits medical assistance providers from refusing to furnish care, services or supplies to any person for whom Medicaid is secondary insurance
abstract: Prohibits medical assistance providers from refusing to furnish care, services or supplies to any person who is entitled to receive such care, services or supplies under this title if such medical assistance provider furnishes the same care, services or supplies under the Medicare program pursuant to title XVIII of the federal social security act and the person is dually eligible under that program.

title: Requires legislative approval for the closure of correctional facilities and institutions
abstract: Requires legislative approval for the closure of correctional facilities and institutions.

title: Provides for the declination of a designation as a candidate or nomination for a party position under special circumstance
abstract: Provides for the declination of a designation as a candidate or nomination for a party position if the person designated or nominated has received a diagnosis of a life-threatening illness or has resigned the office for which they are nominated or designated to run for re-election.

title: Relates to establishing first responder safety zones
abstract: Relates to establishing first responder safety zones and setting speed limits in such safety zones.

title: Modernizes the practice of podiatry
abstract: Modernizes the practice of podiatry specifically relating to ankle surgery.

title: Relates to the crime of computer tampering in the third degree
abstract: Adds that a person is guilty of computer tampering in the third degree when they intentionally enter or alter in any manner or destroy computer material indicating that a person did or did not receive a vaccination that is reported to the New York state immunization information system or the New York city immunization registry.

title: Requires high schools to provide a course in financial literacy and requires students to complete such course as a condition of graduation
abstract: Requires high schools in grades nine through twelve to provide a course in financial literacy; requires students to complete such course as a condition of graduation.

title: Relates to custody and visitation rights of certain sex offenders
abstract: Relates to custody and visitation rights of certain sex offenders.

title: Provides employers with the opportunity to register for emergency alerts from the state of New York public safety alert mass notification system
abstract: Provides employers the opportunity to register for emergency alerts from the state of New York public safety alert mass notification system.

title: Requires that notice be given to the community boards when there is a change in service furnished upon the rapid transit facilities or the omnibus line facilities of the New York city transit authority
abstract: Requires that notice be given to the community boards when there is a change in service furnished upon the rapid transit facilities or the omnibus line facilities of the New York city transit authority.

title: Deems Lawrence Lakeman to have died as a natural and proximate result of his participation in the World Trade Center rescue, recovery or cleanup operations
abstract: Deems an application filed with the New York state and local police and fire retirement system by the widow of Lawrence Lakeman as timely filed.

title: Relates to certain mined land-plans
abstract: Provides for a minimum 10 foot buffer from the water table for all mining plans for mining on Long Island.

title: Relates to establishing the safe water infrastructure action program
abstract: Establishes the safe water and infrastructure action program for the purpose of making payments toward the replacement and rehabilitation of certain existing local drinking water, storm water and sanitary sewer systems; applies to any county, city, town, village or public authority drinking water system, storm water system or sanitary sewer system within the state that is not under the maintenance and/or operational jurisdiction of a private entity; does not apply to NYC.

title: Provides for the regulation of all indoor and outdoor worksites
abstract: Provides for the regulation of all indoor and outdoor worksites with temperature protection standards and education, training and reporting requirements to ensure that employers provide safe conditions for their employees.

title: Prohibits the siting and construction of battery energy storage systems and related facilities, systems, infrastructure, and substations of any scale and possessing any storage capacity in assembly district 63
abstract: Prohibits the siting and construction of battery energy storage systems and related facilities, systems, infrastructure, and substations of any scale and possessing any storage capacity in assembly district 63.

title: Allows first responders who are diagnosed with post-traumatic stress disorder to request line of duty sick leave
abstract: Allows first responders who are diagnosed with post-traumatic stress disorder to request line of duty sick leave.

title: In relation to the additional vendor fee for a certain track located within Oneida county
abstract: Provides that the additional vendor fee for a vendor track located within Oneida county within fifteen miles of a Native American class III gaming facility shall not be forfeited if the track does not maintain the ninety percent full-time equivalent employee requirement.

title: Increases fines for selling disabled Equidae
abstract: Increases fines for selling disabled Equidae.

title: Requires the superintendent of financial services to promulgate regulations which provide standardized definitions for commonly used terms and phrases in certain insurance policies
abstract: Requires the superintendent to promulgate regulations which provide standardized definitions for commonly used terms and phrases in certain insurance policies.

title: Relates to directing the chancellor of the New York city school district to establish a student fare program
abstract: Directs the chancellor of the New York city school district to establish, in consultation with the metropolitan transportation authority, a student fare program to provide three free fares each weekday to New York city students who live a half mile or more from the school they attend.

title: Prohibits the inclusion of confidential clauses in contracts entered into for the purchase of services or commodities by the state
abstract: Prohibits the inclusion of confidential clauses in contracts entered into for the purchase of services or commodities by the state.

title: Requires the modification of restrictive covenants prior to the sale of real property
abstract: Requires the modification of restrictive covenants prior to the sale of real property when covenants, conditions and restrictions exist which discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, familial status, marital status, disability, national origin, source of income or ancestry.

title: Excludes certain student loan discharge or forgiveness amounts from state income tax
abstract: Enacts the "Tax-free debt forgiveness act"; excludes certain student loan forgiveness amounts authorized under 20 U.S.C. Sections 1098aa, 1098bb, 1098cc, 1098dd or 1098ee from state income tax.

title: Provides that any charges assessed by a credit card company for late payment shall not exceed five percent of the unpaid balance of any bill or twenty dollars
abstract: Provides that any charges assessed by a credit card company for late payment shall not exceed five percent of the unpaid balance of any bill, including any interest thereon, or twenty dollars, whichever amount is less.

title: Relates to assistance for certain small businesses
abstract: Relates to assistance for certain small businesses including dry cleaners and those that practice nail specialty for necessary code related improvements.

title: Prohibits individuals in certain positions from taking any position with a business or entity doing business with an agency or industrial development authority
abstract: Prohibits individuals in certain positions from taking any position with a business or entity doing business with an agency or industrial development authority.

title: Authorizes certain local municipal agencies to use surveillance cameras to combat illegal dumping
abstract: Authorizes certain local municipal agencies to use surveillance cameras to combat illegal dumping.

title: Relates to reporting the use of force by a police officer or peace officer
abstract: Relates to reporting the use of force by a police officer or peace officer; includes pointing a firearm at or in the direction of another person as a use of force which must be reported.

title: Provides for information concerning services for human trafficking victims
abstract: Provides for information concerning services for human trafficking victims in transit facilities operated by the metropolitan transportation authority.

title: Relates to establishing a video on the dangers of drowning for infants and young children to be viewed by a parent and/or parents of newborn children
abstract: Relates to establishing a video on the dangers of drowning for infants and young children to be viewed by a parent and/or parents of newborn children.

title: Establishes the Flax Pond tidal wetlands sanctuary
abstract: Establishes the Flax Pond tidal wetlands sanctuary; establishes uses for the sanctuary, including the limited use of certain boats; repeals provisions prohibiting boating in the Flax Pond tidal wetlands sanctuary.

title: Authorizes the combination of certain petit larceny charges
abstract: Provides that a person who has previously been subjected to two or more petit larceny convictions within 18 months immediately preceding the charge and the aggregate value of the property exceeds one thousand dollars, the person is guilty of grand larceny in the fourth degree.

title: Requires certain state owned and operated parking facilities to install and maintain charging stations for plug-in electric vehicles
abstract: Requires certain state owned and operated parking facilities to install and maintain charging stations for plug-in electric vehicles.

title: Relates to employee representation of state employees designated managerial or confidential; repealer
abstract: Provides that organizations of state employees designated managerial or confidential incorporated prior to 1980 shall be deemed as certified or recognized employee organizations for purposes of employee representation in all matters except of collective negotiation in determining the terms and conditions of employment.

title: Provides for salary and benefits of managerial or confidential employees
abstract: Provides that state employees designated managerial or confidential shall receive an increase in salary comparable to the percentage of the general salary increases provided to employees in the state's professional, scientific, and technical services bargaining unit.

title: Relates to the determination of state contributions for certain benefits provided pursuant to collective bargaining agreements
abstract: Relates to determination of state contribution for certain benefits provided pursuant to collective bargaining agreements.

title: Relates to hazard duty pay for essential work performed in accordance with a state emergency disaster declaration
abstract: Provides for hazard duty pay of an additional twenty-five hundred dollars for essential work performed in accordance with a state emergency disaster declaration.

title: Relates to authorizing geographic pay differentials for certain police officers
abstract: Relates to authorizing geographic pay differentials for certain police officers; authorizes a pay differential for regional state park police, forest ranger, environmental conservation officer, and university police officer titles when wage rates of police officers in a given location are substantially higher than the wage rates paid by the state.

title: Requires the New York state power authority and its employees to submit all unresolvable contract negotiations to binding arbitration
abstract: Requires the New York state power authority and its employees to submit all unresolvable contract negotiations to binding arbitration.

title: Relates to notification of changes to the model contract with managed care providers under the medical assistance program
abstract: Relates to notification changes to the model contract with managed care providers under the medical assistance program; requires the department to post on its website certain changes required to be submitted to the centers for medicare and medicaid.

title: Relates to disproportionate impacts of environmental facility siting on disadvantaged communities
abstract: Relates to minimizing disproportionate impacts of environmental facility siting on disadvantaged communities.

title: Relates to political contributions by corporations
abstract: Prohibits schedule B contributions on campaign finance filings.

title: Enacts the New York state fashion workers act
abstract: Provides for the registration and duties of model management companies; provides complaint procedures and penalties for violations.

title: Requires the installation of smoke detectors in common places of certain dwellings
abstract: Requires the installation of smoke detectors in common places of certain dwellings.

title: Requires the chief administrator of the courts to provide certain reports related to the office of court administration
abstract: Requires the chief administrator of the courts to provide reports on legal training programs conducted by the office of court administration, the performance of the judges and justices of the unified court system, and the security of the judicial and non-judicial officers of the unified court system.

title: Enacts the interstate nurse licensure compact and the advanced practice registered nurse compact
abstract: Adopts the interstate nurse licensure compact (Part A); adopts the advanced practice registered nurse compact (Part B).

title: Includes the Ogden Farmers' Library as an eligible library for the financing of projects through the dormitory authority
abstract: Includes the Ogden Farmers' Library as an eligible library for the financing of projects through the dormitory authority.

title: Relates to the duty to report incidents
abstract: Requires every mandated reporter to make a report to the register unless the register has knowledge of the incident.

title: Relates to authorizing an occupancy tax in the village of Medina
abstract: Relates to authorizing an occupancy tax in the village of Medina in Orleans county not to exceed two percent of the per diem rental rate for each room; provides for the repeal of such provisions upon the expiration thereof.

title: Establishes a notarial recordkeeping and reporting exemption for acts relating to the designation and nomination of candidates
abstract: Establishes a notarial recordkeeping and reporting exemption for acts relating to the designation and nomination of candidates.

title: Relates to the certain offenses and provisions related to the unlawful dissemination of a personal image; and relates to a private right of action for such offenses; repealer
abstract: Provides for the offense of unlawful dissemination of a personal image and a private right of action for such offense.

title: Includes Silver Lake Outlet within the definition of "inland waterways" for the purposes of waterfront revitalization
abstract: Includes Silver Lake Outlet within the definition of "inland waterways" as a major creek for the purposes of waterfront revitalization.

title: Relates to establishing the safe water infrastructure action program
abstract: Establishes the safe water and infrastructure action program for the purpose of making payments toward the replacement and rehabilitation of certain existing local drinking water, storm water and sanitary sewer systems; applies to any county, city, town, village or public authority drinking water system, storm water system or sanitary sewer system within the state that is not under the maintenance and/or operational jurisdiction of a private entity; does not apply to NYC.

title: Requires that all victim impact statements in New York state be video recorded; requires that the members of the parole board review all relevant victim impact statements prior to the conduct of a parole hearing
abstract: Allows victim impact statements in New York state be video recorded; requires that the members of the parole board and all presiding commissioners for such hearing review all relevant victim impact statements prior to the conduct of a parole hearing.

title: Requires the filing of additional transferor and contributor identification information in campaign receipt and expenditure statements
abstract: Requires the filing of additional transferor and contributor identification information in campaign receipt and expenditure statements for the receipt of amounts over one hundred dollars, including the full name, full residential address including any suite, floor, or apartment, occupation, employer and employer's full business address in the case of an individual, and the full name and address of any partnership, committee, association, corporation, labor organization or group of persons.

title: Requires each branch of state government and political subdivision of the state to establish and abide by a code of ethics
abstract: Requires each branch of state government and political subdivision of the state to establish and abide by a code of ethics; requires ethics commissions; sets standards for codes.

title: Allows an individual with disabilities or a disabled veteran to hold full-time or part-time positions for purposes of eligibility for recruitment for state employment
abstract: Allows an individual with disabilities or a disabled veteran to hold full-time or part-time positions for purposes of eligibility for recruitment for state employment.

title: Grants medical assistance eligibility for organ transplant expenses for certain residents of New York
abstract: Grants medical assistance eligibility for organ transplant expenses for residents of New York who are otherwise eligible for benefits except for their immigration status.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim April 30-May 7, 2023, as End Plastic Pollution Week in the State of New York, in conjunction with the observance of Earth Day on April 22, 2023
Relates to the frequency and implementation of lock-down drills in schools
abstract: Decreases the frequency of lock-down drills in schools; directs that such drills shall be implemented with a trauma-informed approach; permits parents to opt their children out of such drills.

title: Relates to free use of state parks, recreation facilities and historic sites by veterans
abstract: Provides that veterans who are NY residents may use state parks, recreation facilities and historic sites without fees.

title: Amends chapter 782 of the laws of 2021 establishing a construction industry advisory council on public contracting reform, in relation to the timing of a report and the effectiveness thereof
abstract: Amends a chapter establishing a construction industry advisory council on public contracting reform, in relation to requiring a report to be submitted 365 days after the first meeting of the council and to the effectiveness thereof.

title: Relates to training requirements for attorneys appointed to represent a child in certain proceedings
abstract: Relates to training requirements for attorneys appointed to represent a child in certain proceedings.

title: Authorizes Congregation RSK to receive retroactive real property tax exempt status
abstract: Authorizes Congregation RSK to receive retroactive real property tax exempt status.

title: Relates to the residential parking system in the town of Harrison
abstract: Relates to the residential parking system in the town of Harrison; extends the area in which such residential parking system can be located.

title: Commemorating the Asian American community's celebration of Songkran on April 13-15, 2023
Requires the department of veterans' services to provide certain assistance to veterans
abstract: Requires the department of veterans' services to provide legal and/or technical support to veterans who want to change his or her discharged status to honorable because such person was dishonorably or administratively discharged from the armed services due to sexual orientation.

title: Relates to extreme risk protection orders
abstract: Relates to extreme risk protection orders; defines "exception"; authorizes a police officer or district attorney to file an application for an extreme risk protection order if found that a person meets the requirements of an exception pursuant to section 6340 of the civil practice law and rules; makes related provisions.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim May 2023, as Trauma-Informed Care Month in the State of New York
Relates to consideration of gender-affirming health care or gender-affirming mental health care in child custody cases
abstract: Relates to consideration of gender-affirming health care or gender-affirming mental health care in child custody cases for purposes of jurisdiction, forum and enforcement of custody orders.

title: Repeals certain provisions of the criminal procedure law, judiciary law and the executive law and makes conforming changes thereto
abstract: Provides judges with more discretion regarding securing orders and limiting the lengths of certain orders; establishes new criminal discovery rules.

title: Authorizes the town board of the town of Southold, county of Suffolk, to accept from GKLF II, LLC, grantee, an application for a refund from the town real estate transfer tax
abstract: Authorizes the town board of the town of Southold, county of Suffolk, to accept from GKLF II, LLC, grantee, an application for a refund from the town real estate transfer tax paid pursuant to section 1449-bb of the tax law for certain real property conveyed on June 22, 2021.

title: Relates to expanding the authority of the attorney general to investigate violations of the public officers law
abstract: Expands the authority of the attorney general to investigate violations of the public officers law.

title: Commemorating the commissioning of the USS Cooperstown on May 6, 2023
Requires healthcare facilities to maintain a fifty percent operating threshold of certain reusable healthcare protective textiles in their inventory
abstract: Requires healthcare facilities to maintain a fifty percent operating threshold of certain reusable healthcare protective textiles in their inventory unless a reprieve is provided for supply chain issues; provides a fine may be assessed for failure to comply, as determined by the commissioner.

title: Commending the Jewish War Veterans of the United States of America, and paying tribute to its members for their outstanding contributions to our Nation
Relates to increasing the base benefit amount for computation of pension cost-of-living adjustments
abstract: Increases the base benefit amount for computation of pension cost-of-living adjustments.

title: Establishes supermarket wine licenses
abstract: Establishes supermarket wine licenses to sell from the licensed premises wine in sealed containers for consumption off such premises.

title: Authorizes the town board of the town of Southold, county of Suffolk, to accept from GKLF, LLC, grantee, an application for a refund from the town real estate transfer tax
abstract: Authorizes the town board of the town of Southold, county of Suffolk, to accept from GKLF, LLC, grantee, an application for a refund from the town real estate transfer tax paid pursuant to section 1449-bb of the tax law for certain real property conveyed on June 22, 2021.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim May 2023, as Brain Tumor Awareness Month in the State of New York
Enacts the New York veteran digital navigator program act of 2023
abstract: Enacts the "New York veteran digital navigator program act"; requires the state commissioner of the department of veterans' services to establish a program to promote digital citizenship, through which the state commissioner shall award grants to eligible entities.

title: Includes certain offenses the exceptions to the authority of a police officer to arrest a person without a warrant and to the authority of a public servant to serve an appearance ticket
abstract: Includes a class E felony and a class A misdemeanor involving harm to an identifiable person or to identifiable property if the person has been convicted of any felony or class A misdemeanor within the previous three years or of any other misdemeanor within the previous two years in the exceptions to the authority of a police officer to arrest a person without a warrant and to the authority of a public servant other than a police officer to serve an appearance ticket.

title: Relates to withholding the governor and lieutenant governor's salaries until the legislative passage of the budget occurs
abstract: Relates to withholding the governor and lieutenant governor's salaries until the legislative passage of the budget occurs.

title: Requires automated external defibrillator equipment to be immediately available at school-sponsored competitive athletic events
abstract: Requires automated external defibrillator equipment to be immediately available at school-sponsored competitive athletic events to athletic coaching and/or training staff.

title: Requires prescription containers for opioid medications to have a red cap top and a printed warning
abstract: Requires prescription containers for opioid medications to have a red cap top and a printed warning about the risks of overdose and addiction.

title: Relates to window coverings required in child day care centers
abstract: Relates to window coverings required in child day care centers; requires child day care centers to ensure that all window and door blind cords, ropes, wires and other strangulation hazards are secured and inaccessible to children in accordance with the regulations of the office of children and family services.

title: Relates to financial statements for assessments of condos, cooperative buildings and cooperative communities
abstract: Relates to financial statements for assessments of condos, cooperative buildings and cooperative communities; requires financial statements to be prepared using GAAP; requires auditing for certain buildings by CPAs.

title: Requires all state and private agencies with mandatory reporters of incidents involving vulnerable people to retrain all staff on reporting to a 9-1-1 operator and the county district attorney's office
abstract: Requires all state and private agencies with mandatory reporters of incidents involving vulnerable people to retrain all staff on reporting to a 9-1-1 operator and the county district attorney's office and state and private websites; requires written materials to be updated.

title: Relates to the capital district transportation district
abstract: Permits Warren county to become a member of the capital district transportation district by action of their governing body.

title: Includes an E felony in the exceptions to the authority of a police officer to arrest a person without a warrant and to the authority of a public servant other than a police officer to serve an appearance ticket
abstract: Includes an E felony in the exceptions to the authority of a police officer to arrest a person without a warrant and to the authority of a public servant other than a police officer to serve an appearance ticket.

title: Commemorating the one-year Anniversary of the mass shooting at Tops Friendly Markets in Buffalo, New York, on May 14, 2023, and honoring the victims, survivors, families, and community at large
Includes a class E felony and a class A misdemeanor involving harm to an identifiable person in the exceptions to the authority of a police officer to arrest a person without a warrant
abstract: Includes a class E felony and a class A misdemeanor involving harm to an identifiable person in the exceptions to the authority of a police officer to arrest a person without a warrant and to the authority of a public servant other than a police officer to serve an appearance ticket.

title: Relates to the use of penalties collected from public utilities
abstract: Requires the public service commission to distribute penalty awards received from public utilities to customers aggrieved by the actions of the public utility.

title: Requires certain meetings between the governor, the temporary president of the senate and the speaker of the assembly relating to the state budget to be open to the general public
abstract: Requires certain meetings between the governor, the temporary president of the senate and the speaker of the assembly relating to the state budget to be open to the general public; to provide an opportunity for the public to attend, listen to, and observe such meetings; and to broadcast and maintain records of such meetings on each party's website.

title: Recognizing August 16, 2023, as Brook Trout Day in the State of New York
Commemorating the 90th Anniversary of the Nazi book burning campaign on May 10, 2023
Increases the number of county court judges in certain jurisdictions
abstract: Increases the number of county court judges in Saratoga and Washington counties by one justice each.

title: Relates to information to be provided by a veterinarian initially prescribing or dispensing a drug to a dog, cat, or rabbit
abstract: Relates to information to be provided by a veterinarian initially prescribing or dispensing a drug to a dog, cat, or rabbit; extends the effective date of such provisions.

title: Extends the authorization of the county of Cayuga to impose an additional one percent of sales and compensating use taxes
abstract: Extends the authorization of the county of Cayuga to impose an additional one percent of sales and compensating use taxes to 11/30/2025.

title: Relates to the discovery of material, non-material and impeachment information and the required time frame for such discovery
abstract: Relates to the discovery of material, non-material and impeachment information and the required time frame for such discovery; requires the submission of a certificate of compliance upon completion of certain discovery requirements.

title: Authorizes fiat-collateralized stablecoins as a form of bail
