abstract: Authorizes fiat-collateralized stablecoins as a form of bail; directs the commissioner of taxation and finance, in conjunction with the chief justice of the unified court system and the director of the office of information technology services, to promulgate rules and regulations identifying forms of fiat-collateralized stablecoin acceptable for posting bail to establish a system for the administration of the acceptance, recording and processing of stablecoins as a means of securing bail.

title: Establishes the first responder epinephrine preparedness initiative (EPI) act
abstract: Establishes the first responder epinephrine preparedness initiative (EPI) act, creating a first responder epinephrine access program; authorizes the commissioner of health to approve and implement a municipal epinephrine bulk purchase program; authorizes taxpayers to contribute a gift for municipal epinephrine bulk purchases; establishes a municipal epinephrine bulk purchase fund.

title: Withholds the governor's salary until the legislative passage of the budget occurs
abstract: Withholds the governor's salary until the legislative passage of the budget occurs; provides such salary should be withheld if the budget has not passed prior to the first day of the fiscal year and shall not be paid until such passage occurs.

title: Relates to payment of the governor's salary
abstract: Requires withholding the governor's salary until the legislative passage of the budget occurs.

title: Relates to withholding the governor's salary after the April first budget deadline until a state budget has been passed
abstract: Relates to withholding the governor's salary after the April first budget deadline until a state budget has been passed.

title: Authorizes service charges for gap waivers
abstract: Authorizes service charges for gap waivers.

title: Relates to prohibiting the sale or manufacture of certain single-use plastic water bottles and single-use plastic beverage containers
abstract: Relates to prohibiting the sale or manufacture of single-use plastic water bottles not comprised of one hundred percent recycled material; prohibits the sale of single-use plastic beverage containers comprised of less than seventy-five percent recycled materials; establishes penalties for violations; requires food service establishments to provide customers with tap water, beverages and leftovers in reusable beverage containers provided by a customer.

title: Enacts the monarch preservation plan
abstract: Enacts the monarch preservation plan requiring the department of environmental conservation to take feasible actions to conserve monarch butterflies and the unique habitats they depend upon for successful migration and develop a grant program.

title: Memorializing Governor Hochul to proclaim August 6, 2023, as Jamaican Flag Day in the State of New York
Requires the commissioner of transportation to report on collisions that have occurred between motor vehicles and bridges or elevated structures on or crossing highways
abstract: Requires the commissioner of transportation to report on collisions that have occurred between motor vehicles and bridges or elevated structures on or crossing highways under the jurisdiction of the department of transportation in the annual report to the legislature.

title: Limits reversals for failure of prompt prosecution under certain circumstances
abstract: Limits reversals for failure of prompt prosecution where there is no violation of periods of limitations, speedy trial time periods, and no showing of material prejudice resulting from unreasonable delay.

title: Repeals the excise tax on medical cannabis and the medical cannabis trust fund
abstract: Repeals the excise tax on medical cannabis and the medical cannabis trust fund.

title: Increases the allowances provided to trial and grand jurors
abstract: Increases the allowances provided to trial and grand jurors to $60 per day for the first ten days and $100 per day every day thereafter of physical attendance.

title: Extends the ability of the county of Albany to impose and collect taxes on occupancy of hotel or motel rooms in Albany county
abstract: Extends the ability of the county of Albany to impose and collect taxes on occupancy of hotel or motel rooms in Albany county.

title: Relates to Southampton village ocean rescue
abstract: Provides that the village of Southampton is hereby authorized to designate emergency response and rescue vehicles assigned to the Southampton village ocean rescue as authorized emergency vehicles.

title: Clarifies that the New York state health insurance program remains subject to certain provisions of the financial services law
abstract: Clarifies that the New York state health insurance program remains subject to certain provisions of the financial services law and coverage for usual and customary costs for out-of-network health care service.

title: Increases the number of county court judges in Schenectady county
abstract: Increases the number of county court judges in Schenectady county from one judge to two.

title: Establishes the crime of criminal sale of a controlled substance upon the grounds of a drug or alcohol treatment center, or alcoholics anonymous or narcotics anonymous meeting
abstract: Establishes the crime of criminal sale of a controlled substance upon the grounds of a drug or alcohol treatment center, or alcoholics anonymous or narcotics anonymous meeting; designates such crime as a class E felony.

title: Makes technical corrections relating to the MTA and the Penn Station Access Project; repealer
abstract: Makes technical corrections relating to the MTA and the Penn Station Access Project; authorizes the city of New York to discontinue a portion of real property in the county of the Bronx as parkland and to grant easements for improvements to the railroad right-of-way to bring Metro-North railroad service to four new stations in the Bronx and to Pennsylvania Station in the county.

title: Relates to public-facing websites operated by political committees
abstract: Requires public-facing websites operated by political committees to contain "paid for by" language; adds such public-facing websites to the list of political communications that qualify as independent expenditures.

title: Relates to the powers and duties of the Hempstead union free school district monitors
abstract: Provides additional powers and duties of the Hempstead union free school district monitors including overriding and proposing resolutions adopted by the school board, requiring the board and school district officers to undergo training, and the approving of the appointment of the superintendent.

title: Requires the chief administrator of the courts and the office of information technology services to develop a portal for the exchange of discovery in criminal cases
abstract: Requires the chief administrator of the courts and the office of information technology services to develop a portal for the exchange of discovery in criminal cases.

title: Requires search engines and social media networks to include a consumer notice on limited services pregnancy center listings and posts
abstract: Requires search engines such as Google, Yahoo or Bing to include a notice to users when searching limited services pregnancy center listings that such limited services pregnancy centers provide limited medical and abortion care and may not have medical professionals onsite; requires social media networks such as Facebook, YouTube, Twitter, Instagram, Snapchat, Tumblr and Flickr to include such consumer notice on any posts or advertisements by such centers.

title: Relates to increasing the membership of the special district operations and development committee
abstract: Relates to increasing the membership of the special district operations and development committee; provides that the committee shall consist of no less than nine members and no more than fifteen.

title: Requires the department of corrections and community supervision to offer civic engagement courses to incarcerated individuals prior to their release
abstract: Requires the department of corrections and community supervision to provide a nonpartisan, peer-led civic engagement program for incarcerated individuals in all correctional facilities in this state which shall be completed by each incarcerated individual within one year prior to their release.

title: Enacts the campus-recognized sorority and fraternity transparency act
abstract: Enacts the "campus-recognized sorority and fraternity transparency act"; requires campus-recognized sorority and fraternity annually submit information on its members and activities to the college or university; requires the college or university to compile such information into a publicly accessible report.

title: Requires the state to enter into an agreement with the Rand Corporation to conduct a study of the impact the 2020 Discovery Reform legislation has had on the handling of criminal cases
abstract: Requires the state to enter into an agreement with the Rand Corporation to conduct a study of the impact of the 2020 Discovery Reform legislation enacted by Part HHH of chapter 56 of the laws of 2020 has had on the handling and disposition of criminal cases; makes an appropriation therefor.

title: Provides for allowing patients to register in the donate life registry through their electronic health records
abstract: Provides for allowing patients to register in the "donate life registry" through their electronic health records.

title: Adds a defendant's identifiable ties to the community, state, and/or county to judges' considerations of whether to fix a securing order
abstract: Adds a defendant's identifiable ties to the community, state, and/or county to judges' considerations of whether to fix a securing order, including residence, employment, enrollment with an educational institution, and immediate family.

title: Relates to penalties for certain utilities
abstract: Enacts the "utility penalty adjustment"; adjusts utility penalties to account for inflation; increases such penalties and ties them to inflation after January 1, 2025.

title: Relates to student class size in public schools
abstract: Relates to student class size in public schools in school districts located outside of a city having a population of one million or more inhabitants; requires such districts to develop a plan to reduce actual class sizes beginning September two thousand twenty-three.

title: Authorizes the city of Olean to impose a hotel and motel tax
abstract: Authorizes the city of Olean to impose a hotel and motel tax not exceeding five percent of the per diem rental rate for each room.

title: Enacts the "political artificial intelligence disclaimer (PAID) act"
abstract: Enacts the "political artificial intelligence disclaimer (PAID) act"; requires political communications that use synthetic media to disclose that they were created with the assistance of artificial intelligence.

title: Relates to the manner in which certain provisions of the correction law are enforced
abstract: Relates to the manner in which certain provisions of the correction law are enforced.

title: Prohibits the use of drilling fluids, brine and flowback water from wells, pools or fields on any highway
abstract: Prohibits the use of drilling fluids and flowback water from wells, pools or fields on any highway for any purpose including but not limited to de-icing or dust suppression.

title: Relates to proceedings involving adolescent offenders and the possession or use of weapons
abstract: Relates to proceedings involving adolescent offenders and the possession or use of weapons; provides for the access of applicable records; expands the meaning of extraordinary circumstances to include when the defendant is accused of an offense involving the use, possession, or display of a firearm, shotgun, rifle or other deadly weapon.

title: Creates the jury duty mileage reimbursement tax credit
abstract: Establishes the jury duty mileage reimbursement tax credit; allows a juror a credit equal to their reasonable mileage allowance owed for each mile actually and necessarily traveled by such juror who utilizes their personal vehicle in the fulfillment of their jury duty.

title: Relates to the contracting of indebtedness by city school districts
abstract: Relates to the contracting of indebtedness by city school districts; removes provisions relating thereto.

title: Provides for memorial land facilities
abstract: Provides a permit for a memorial lands facility.

title: Removes the requirement that willful failure to appear after notice of scheduled appearances be persistent in order to revoke an order granting liberty to a defendant and to fix bail in such action or proceeding
abstract: Removes the requirement that willful failure to appear after notice of scheduled appearances be persistent in order to revoke an order granting an order of recognizance, release under non-monetary conditions or bail to a defendant and to fix bail in such action or proceeding.

title: Establishing a training program for first responders for handling emergency situations involving individuals in emotional distress or experiencing an emotional or mental health crisis
abstract: Establishes a training program for first responders, including firefighters, police officers and emergency medical services personnel, for handling emergency situations involving individuals in emotional distress or experiencing an emotional or mental health crisis; requires documents utilized by state agencies, public authorities and municipalities to replace the term "emotionally disturbed person" with the term "person in crisis".

title: Relates to a license to sell liquor at retail for consumption on certain premises
abstract: Relates to authorizing a license to sell liquor at retail for consumption on-premises, notwithstanding certain restrictions regarding proximity to a school, church, synagogue, or other place of worship, for certain property located in the county of Erie.

title: Relates to recovery of online accounts
abstract: Requires that businesses that provide consumers with online accounts to access services permit consumers who have been victims of identity theft to recover such accounts using proper identification if the business has a physical presence in this state.

title: Enacts the "tenants organizing act"
abstract: Enacts the "tenants organizing act"; allows tenants' groups, committees or other tenants' organizations to invite outside guests or visitors including elected officials, services providers, housing lawyers, etc. without being required to pay fees; defines "tenants' organization"; provides for activities that tenants' organizations can take part in; provides for the manner in how a tenants' organization is established.

title: Prohibits motor vehicle stops for certain violations
abstract: Prohibits motor vehicle stops for secondary violations, including certain violations relating to vehicle registration, equipment, and inspection.

title: Relates to the completion of training requirements for sheriffs and undersheriffs
abstract: Relates to the completion of training requirements for sheriffs and undersheriffs.

title: Relates to recovering attorney fees for legal services rendered under certain claims
abstract: Relates to the cost for legal services in connection with any claim arising under the volunteer firefighter's benefit law.

title: Relates to adolescent offenders authorized to be removed to family court
abstract: Exempts adolescent offenders who were illegally in possession of a loaded firearm from those authorized to be removed to family court.

title: Extends the authority of the county of Columbia to impose an additional 1 percent sales and compensating use tax
abstract: Extends the authority of the county of Columbia to impose an additional 1 percent sales and compensating use tax by two years.

title: Relates to the offense of aggravated cruelty to animals
abstract: Includes use of a deadly weapon or dangerous instrument in the offense of aggravated cruelty to animals.

title: Extends the authority of the county of Columbia to impose an additional real estate transfer tax
abstract: Extends the authority of the county of Columbia to impose an additional real estate transfer tax by two years.

title: Relates to the central New York regional market authority
abstract: Requires the central New York regional market authority to work with the department of agriculture and markets to assure proper development of agriculture and regional market facilities, in the Central New York Regional Market district; requires such authority to furnish an annual real estate report detailing all real estate holdings and detailed property information, including but not limited to the tenants, important lease terms, rents, durations of leases, as well as copies of each lease; authorizes the state comptroller to examine the accounts and books of the authority; makes related provisions.

title: Relates to joining multistate voter list maintenance organizations
abstract: Permits the state board of elections to join certain multistate voter list maintenance organizations and provide such organizations with certain voter information; requires the state to join a multistate voter list maintenance organization on or before July 31, 2025.

title: Removes the requirement that certain orders releasing a principal on their own recognizance, under non-monetary conditions, or fixing bail, be tailored according to the least restrictive means
abstract: Removes the requirement that certain orders releasing a principal on such principal's own recognizance, releasing a principal under non-monetary conditions, or fixing bail, be tailored according to the least restrictive means.

title: Includes offenses involving physical harm or danger to others to be qualifying offenses for the purpose of allowing a principal to be eligible to be held on bail
abstract: Includes offenses involving situations where a person physically harms another or engages in conduct that results in an unacceptable level of danger as qualifying offenses for the purpose of allowing a principal to be eligible to be held on bail; requires the Office of Court Administration, in conjunction with the New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services, to manage an electronic tracking system maintaining a record of all bail decisions and to deliver a report to the legislature.

title: Prohibits certain debt arrears from being reported to consumer reporting agencies
abstract: Prohibits reporting debt arrears of an individual which are due to a COVID-19 related hardship to a consumer reporting agency; provides for the removal of such information from an individual's file with such agency.

title: Directs the commissioner of the division of homeland security and emergency services to conduct a study on the state's COVID-19 pandemic response
abstract: Directs the commissioner of the division of homeland security and emergency services to conduct an after-action review study on the state's COVID-19 pandemic response; directs the commissioner to submit a report on such study after 1 year and make such report publicly available on its website, and share such report with the CDC.

title: Authorizes not-for-profit corporation inclusion as minority and women-owned enterprises
abstract: Authorizes not-for-profit corporation inclusion as minority and women-owned enterprises.

title: Authorizes Chabad of Oceanside to receive a retroactive exemption from real property taxes
abstract: Authorizes Chabad of Oceanside to receive a retroactive exemption from real property taxes.

title: Requires storage warehouse operators to maintain lock boxes for storage of official documents in each rental unit
abstract: Requires storage warehouse operators to maintain lock boxes for storage of official documents in each rental unit; prohibits storage warehouse operators from retaining or disposing of the contents of such lock boxes in the event of non-payment of unit rental fees.

title: Requires schools to provide teachers with written informational material on the use of epinephrine auto-injectors
abstract: Requires schools to provide teachers with written informational material on the use of epinephrine auto-injectors.

title: Relates to criteria for certification by the division of minority and women's business development of MWBE status; repealer
abstract: Relates to criteria for certification by the division of minority and women's business development of MWBE status; replaces the personal net worth limitation with a requirement that a business have been awarded contracts by one or more agencies within the past three years where the total state funding received by the enterprise from the expense and capital budgets for such contracts was equal to or greater than sixty million dollars.

title: Includes urban farming within farm operations for purposes of agricultural districts
abstract: Includes urban farming within farm operations for purposes of agricultural districts.

title: Requires the development of a bleeding control kit program and the installation of bleeding control kits in schools
abstract: Requires the commissioner of education, in consultation with the commissioner of health, to develop a bleeding control kit program which requires bleeding control kits to be installed in easily accessible areas of schools and requires training of personnel to use bleeding control kits in the event of an injury to another person.

title: Establishes the senior driver safety commission and providing for its powers and duties
abstract: Establishes the senior driver safety commission; provides for its powers and duties.

title: Establishes a sea level rise mitigation and adaptation plan for cities with a population of one million or more
abstract: Establishes a sea level rise mitigation and adaptation plan for cities with a population of one million or more to be implemented by the department of environmental conservation; requires a sea level rise vulnerability and adaptation report to be submitted.

title: Requires the petitioner for appointment of a guardian for an incapacitated person to identify all other persons who may be able to manage the affairs of such incapacitated person
abstract: Requires the petitioner for appointment as the guardian for an incapacitated person to identify all other persons who may be able to manage the affairs of such incapacitated person; prohibits appointment solely for the purposes of bill collection or resolving a bill collection dispute.

title: Relates to the court's consideration of the existence of extraordinary circumstances and significant physical injury in determining whether to remove adolescent offenders to family court
abstract: Relates to the court's consideration of the existence of extraordinary circumstances and significant physical injury in determining whether to remove adolescent offenders to family court; defines such terms; provides factors for the court's consideration of whether extraordinary circumstances exist.

title: Relates to the right to hold race meetings and races at Belmont Park
abstract: Relates to the right to hold race meetings and races after sunset at Belmont Park, only at the main track in its current configuration, but only if such races conclude before 10:30 P.M. and only occur on Thursdays, Fridays or Saturdays.

title: Requires nursing homes to designate dedicated storage spaces for the storage of the bodies of deceased persons
abstract: Requires nursing homes to designate dedicated storage spaces for the storage of the bodies of deceased persons; requires nursing homes to develop and submit plans to the department of health for the designation of such dedicated storage spaces; establishes requirements for such storage spaces.

title: Requires electric vehicle charging stations and electric vehicle capable parking spaces to accommodate wheelchair accessible electric vehicles
abstract: Requires electric vehicle charging stations and electric vehicle capable parking spaces to have handicap accessible spaces that are large enough to accommodate such wheelchair accessible electric vehicles, including but not limited to, vans and minivans.

title: Requires each public body to live stream and post video recordings of all open meetings and public hearings
abstract: Requires each public body to live stream and post video recordings of all open meetings and public hearings; requires each public body to post such recordings for a period of not less than five years.

title: Modernizes the metropolitan transportation authority's small business mentoring program
abstract: Increases the threshold for office of the comptroller review of the metropolitan transportation authority discretionary awards to MWBEs and small businesses from one million dollars to one million five hundred thousand dollars.

title: Relates to timely release of principals on bail
abstract: Requires persons held in custody to be released immediately upon posting bail; requires use and acceptance of electronic signatures and records to effectuate communications relating to posting bail.

title: Provides employment protections during the performance of state active duty by members of the national guard
abstract: Provides employment protections during the performance of state active duty by members of the national guard; makes technical corrections.

title: Relates to enacting the health care worker peer support program
abstract: Enacts the health care worker peer support program.

title: Excludes from state income tax unemployment compensation benefits
abstract: Excludes from state income tax up to $10,200 of unemployment compensation benefits earned by a resident of the state.

title: Relates to prohibiting facial recognition technology to be used in connection with an officer camera
abstract: Prohibits facial recognition technology to be used in connection with an officer camera used by both local and state police including the storage of biometric data.

title: Relates to the definition of small business for minority group members and women with respect to state contracts
abstract: Increases the number of persons from three hundred to five hundred to be considered a small business for the purposes of MWBE.

title: Relates to Medicaid eligibility for striking workers
abstract: Relates to automatic Medicaid eligibility for striking workers.

title: Mourning the death of Romolo Pede Sr., loving husband, father and grandfather, distinguished business owner and devoted member of his community
Relates to the Volunteer and Exempt Firemen's Benevolent Association of Williston Park
abstract: Relates to the Volunteer and Exempt Firemen's Benevolent Association of Williston Park; makes changes to membership; directs where tax revenues may be used.

title: Relates to prohibiting retroactive minimum conditions of employment
abstract: Relates to prohibiting retroactive minimum conditions of employment; provides that the employment of an employee who met the minimum qualifications or conditions for employment at the time of appointment may not be terminated or separated from service based on any new qualifications or conditions of employment enacted after the date of appointment to such civil service position.

title: Authorizes the village of Sodus Point, in the town of Sodus, county of Wayne to allow golf carts on certain streets
abstract: Authorizes the village of Sodus Point, in the town of Sodus, county of Wayne to allow golf carts on certain streets under the exclusive control and jurisdiction of such village.

title: Enacts "CJ's law" in relation to increasing the penalties for leaving the scene of an accident without reporting where such accident resulted in the death of a minor
abstract: Enacts "CJ's law" in relation to increasing the penalties for leaving the scene of an accident without reporting where such accident resulted in the death of a minor to a class C felony punishable by a fine of not less than four thousand nor more than eight thousand dollars in addition to any other penalties provided by law.

title: Relates to establishing a variable supplements fund for sanitation members of the New York city employees' retirement system
abstract: Relates to establishing a variable supplements fund for sanitation members of the New York city employees' retirement system; creates a board to manage such fund and to make payments.

title: Requires that thirty percent of state agency property management contracts be awarded to minority and women-owned business enterprises
abstract: Requires that each agency letting contracts for the hiring of property managers for residential and commercial buildings structure procurement goals for such contracts that include the award of thirty percent of such contracts to minority and women-owned business enterprises; provides for the promulgation of rules and regulations.

title: Establishes the beginning farmer advisory board on agriculture
abstract: Expands the young farmer advisory board on agriculture to become the beginning farmer advisory board on agriculture.

title: Relates to assault in the second degree
abstract: Makes the crime of preventing an elected official from performing a lawful duty or essential service a class D felony of assault in the second degree.

title: Authorizes an additional report and recommendations from the stretch limousine passenger safety task force and extends provisions of law relating thereto
abstract: Authorizes an additional report and recommendations from the stretch limousine passenger safety task force; extends provisions of law relating thereto; requires such additional report be issued on or before December 1, 2024; extends such provisions of law until December 31, 2024.

title: Relates to the payment of costs for line of duty injuries of police officers and firefighters
abstract: Relates to the payment of costs for line of duty injuries of police officers and firefighters; requires such costs for retired members of the uniformed forces of the fire or police departments be paid by the city of New York.

title: Relates to requiring agencies to provide unsuccessful bidders that are certified minority and women-owned business enterprises with a written statement articulating the reasons for rejection
abstract: Relates to requiring agencies to provide unsuccessful bidders that are certified minority- and women-owned business enterprises with a written statement of the completion of the procurement selection process and that such enterprise was not selected.

title: Prohibits the imposition of different premium rates for disability insurance based on gender
abstract: Prohibits the imposition of different premium rates for disability insurance based on gender.

title: Authorizes Saddle Rock Minyan to file an application for retroactive real property tax exemption
abstract: Authorizes Saddle Rock Minyan to file an application for retroactive real property tax exemption with respect to the 2021-2022 and 2022-2023 assessment rolls.

title: Increases the state discretionary buying threshold without a formal competitive process for certain commodities from certain businesses
abstract: Increases the state discretionary buying threshold without a formal competitive process for certain commodities from certain businesses, including construction services.

title: Establishes the resilient New York revolving loan program and the resilient New York revolving loan fund
abstract: Establishes the resilient New York revolving loan program and the resilient New York revolving loan fund to provide low or no-interest loans to municipalities, not-for-profit organizations, and individual property owners for hazard mitigation and resilience projects; provides funding from federal STORM Act.

title: Establishes a special prosecutor to investigate and prosecute matters involving the death of an unarmed civilian caused by a law enforcement officer
abstract: Establishes a special prosecutor to investigate and prosecute matters involving the death of an unarmed civilian caused by a law enforcement officer.

title: Relates to the paper carryout bag reduction fee
abstract: Implements a one year phase-in period for a local law, ordinance or resolution imposing a paper carryout bag reduction fee where forty percent of such fees are returned to such county or city for the purpose of purchasing and distributing reusable bags, with priority given to low- and fixed-income communities, and after the first year, such forty percent of fees shall be remitted to the person who collected the fees.

title: Relates to arrest, prosecution, sentencing and penalties for offenses involving vehicular assault, manslaughter and homicide and operating a vehicle under the influence of drugs or alcohol
abstract: Amends provisions involving the arrest, prosecution, sentencing and penalties for offenses involving vehicular assault, manslaughter and homicide; removes certain barriers to prosecution for operating a vehicle under the influence of drugs or alcohol.

title: Extends the effectiveness of provisions of law relating to catastrophic or reinsurance coverage issued to certain small groups
abstract: Extends the effectiveness of provisions of law relating to catastrophic or reinsurance coverage issued to certain small groups.

title: Requires a study of the fiscal impacts of changing education funding from a real property tax-based mechanism to an income tax-based mechanism
abstract: Requires a study of the fiscal impacts of changing education funding from a real property tax-based mechanism to an income tax-based mechanism.

title: Provides for a New York power authority trustee from Niagara county
abstract: Provides that the next appointed trustee of the power authority of New York state shall be from Niagara county and provides for a permanent trustee from such county on such authority.

title: Promotes understanding, awareness and enforcement of animal crimes laws; repealer
abstract: Promotes understanding, awareness and enforcement of animal crimes laws.

title: Relates to the liability of payroll processing companies
abstract: Relates to the liability of payroll processing companies; provides that payroll processing companies that intentionally and wrongfully prevent the distribution of payroll shall be liable to employees that failed to receive an expected payment for an amount up to three times the expected amount; provides an action to recover damages may be maintained as a class action.

title: Relates to qualifications for holding the offices of city controller and city engineer in the city of Amsterdam
abstract: Relates to qualifications for holding the offices of city controller and city engineer in the city of Amsterdam; provides that a person not living in the city of Amsterdam may hold the office of city controller or city engineer for such city provided he or she lives in Montgomery county or an adjoining county within the state of New York.

title: Relates to penalties for striking a pedestrian crossing a street while operating a motor vehicle
abstract: Relates to penalties for striking a pedestrian crossing a street while operating a motor vehicle.

title: Relates to requiring boards of elections to include the number of registration forms distributed to and returned by each agency assisting with voter registration in their annual reports
abstract: Relates to requiring boards of elections to include the number of registration forms distributed to and returned by each agency assisting with voter registration in their annual reports; provides personally identifiable information about the registrants shall not be collected or included in the report.

title: Relates to housing navigation services for those with intellectual and developmental disabilities
abstract: Establishes a curriculum and task force to provide housing navigation services for those with intellectual and developmental disabilities.

title: Allows for distinctive plates to be issued for members of the New York city fire riders motorcycle club
abstract: Allows for distinctive plates to be issued for members of the New York city fire riders motorcycle club.

title: Relates to the appointment of the rent guidelines board member representative of tenants
abstract: Relates to the appointment of the rent guidelines board; requires a member representative of tenants to be appointed no later than 60 days after a vacancy; prohibits meetings until such time.

title: Requires entities responsible for the provision of vital services to coordinate and work expeditiously to restore service whenever such service is interrupted
abstract: Requires entities responsible for the provision of vital services to coordinate and work expeditiously to restore service whenever such service is interrupted; includes gas as a vital service.

title: Moratorium on the prohibition of feeding white-tailed deer in Sullivan county
abstract: Imposes a moratorium on the prohibition of feeding white-tailed deer in Sullivan county.

title: Relates to authorizing media access to certain areas during publicly declared emergencies
abstract: Authorizes media members to have access to areas otherwise restricted to the public during public emergencies.

title: Enacts the New York civil rights cold case records collection act
abstract: Enacts the New York civil rights cold case records collection act; directs the state archivist to create a civil rights cold case records collection; creates the civil rights cold case records review board which shall assist the archivist in the collection of civil rights cold case records.

title: Provides voters an opportunity to cure deficiencies regarding affidavit ballots
abstract: Provides voters an opportunity to cure deficiencies regarding affidavit ballots in order to have their votes counted.

title: Relates to the grounds for which the public employment relations board may seek injunctive relief
abstract: Relates to the grounds for which the public employment relations board may seek injunctive relief; defines "irreparable injury, loss or damage".

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim February 8, 2023, as Students with Disabilities Advocacy Day in the State of New York
Designates rescue cats as the official state cat
abstract: Designates rescue cats as the official state cat; establishes that a rescue cat is a cat of any breed or mixture of breeds rescued and adopted from an animal shelter or rescue group located in the state.

title: Relates to a minority and women-owned business enterprise participation goal requirement in order to receive exemption of new multiple dwellings from local taxation
abstract: Relates to a minority and women-owned business enterprise participation goal requirement in order to receive exemption of new multiple dwellings from local taxation.

title: Relates to changing the timing of when state committees shall assume certain legal authority
abstract: Changes the timing of when state committees shall assume certain legal authority.

title: Creates an excise tax on the collection of consumer data by commercial data collectors
abstract: Creates an excise tax on the collection of consumer data by commercial data collectors.

title: Relates to the rededication of unused funds in the New York state local government records management improvement fund to such fund
abstract: Relates to the mandatory rededication of unused funds in the New York state local government records management improvement fund to such fund.

title: Relates to requiring state and local law enforcement officers to identify themselves to the public
abstract: Relates to requiring state and local law enforcement officers to identify themselves to the public during law enforcement activities.

title: Includes contacts via text, email, private message, direct message or other electronic communication in the definition of the offense of aggravated harassment in the second degree
abstract: Includes contacts via text, email, private message, direct message or other electronic communication in the definition of the offense of aggravated harassment in the second degree.

title: Relates to establishing the crime of voyeurism
abstract: Establishes the crime of voyeurism in the first and second degree which is defined as when someone for their own amusement, entertainment, profit, sexual arousal or sexual gratification trespasses for the purpose of viewing a person dressing or undressing or the sexual or other intimate parts of such person at a place and time when such person has a reasonable expectation of privacy, without such person's knowledge or consent.

title: Relates to commission of murder in the first degree; provides that sentence for commission of certain provisions of murder in the first degree is death or life without parole
abstract: Includes intentionally selecting a victim based on certain actual or perceived traits in the crime of murder in the first degree; provides that sentence for commission of certain provisions of murder in the first degree is death or life without parole.

title: Relates to establishing a judicial diversion program for young defendants
abstract: Relates to establishing a judicial diversion program for young defendants.

title: Relates to the budget
abstract: Relates to the budget; requires the director of the budget's office, with input from the secretary of state's office, to produce an annual citizens' guide to the state budget revenue and expenditures.

title: Expands the empire state child credit
abstract: Expands the empire state child credit to cover children under the age of four; doubles such credit for young children.

title: Authorizes the study of aviation ownership and flight operations by the department of transportation
abstract: Authorizes the study of aviation flight operations by the department of transportation; requires reporting.

title: Directs the department of agriculture and markets to establish a grading system
abstract: Directs the department of agriculture and markets to establish a grading system for retail food stores, food service establishments and food warehouses.

title: Requires that public contracts be divided by size into large, medium, small and micro contracts for the purpose of increasing opportunities for small businesses, including MWBEs, to participate in state contracts
abstract: Requires that public contracts be divided by size into large, medium, small and micro contracts for the purpose of increasing opportunities for small businesses, including minority-owned business enterprises and women-owned business enterprises, to participate in state contracts.

title: Relates to establishing an emergency repair program
abstract: Relates to establishing an emergency repair program.

title: Relates to the reporting of animal cruelty
abstract: Provides that any person charged with enforcing laws prohibiting cruelty to animals shall cause a report to be made when, in the performance of his or her duties, such person has reasonable cause to believe that abuse or maltreatment of a child has also occurred; provides that a person charged with the responsibility of filing a report of child abuse or maltreatment shall also file a report of suspected animal cruelty.

title: Relates to enacting voting rights expansion act; repealer
abstract: Relates to voting rights expansion, voter registration on election day, expansion of the use of and requirements for absentee voting, creation of a real-time statewide voter registration database, special ballots for election employees, and voter affidavits.

title: Relates to liability for the manufacture, sale, leasing or other disposition of ammunition feeding devices and compensation for damages
abstract: Relates to liability for the manufacture, sale, leasing or other disposition of ammunition feeding devices and compensation for damages.

title: Requires health insurance coverage for craniofacial disorders
abstract: Requires health insurance coverage for craniofacial disorders.

title: Requires N.Y. city to collect discarded recyclable materials at city parks, playgrounds, historic sites and other facilities
abstract: Requires cities with a population of one million or more to collect discarded recyclable materials at city parks, playgrounds, historic sites and other recreational facilities; requires the posting of signs on facilities without trash receptacles stating that trash must be retained until you reach a trash can; provides state assistance for such programs.

title: Requires all agencies of the city of New York which issue summons to document violations with photographic evidence when feasible
abstract: Requires all agencies of the city of New York which issue summons to document violations with photographic evidence when feasible.

title: Relates to imposing a school impact tax on developers of non-senior housing developments
abstract: Relates to imposing a school impact tax on developers of non-senior housing developments to be used for the construction of new public kindergarten through twelfth grade schools.

title: Relates to a rebate for residents of Kings county who frequently commute across the Verrazzano-Narrows bridge
abstract: Relates to a rebate for residents of Kings county who commute across the Verrazzano-Narrows bridge more than ten times per month while using a New York customer service E-ZPass account.

title: Creates a private right of action for improper debt collection procedures
abstract: Creates a private right of action for improper debt collection procedures; allows plaintiffs to recover punitive damages and reasonable attorney's fees.

title: Prohibits public employers from taking disciplinary action against public employees in certain cases
abstract: Prohibits public employers from dismissing or taking other disciplinary action against public employees if such employees are elected or appointed to represent the employee organization or its members or communicate or offer commentary on matters of public concern or matters affecting the employee organization or its members.

title: Authorizes the vacating of an arbitration award on the basis of arbitrator disregard of the law
abstract: Authorizes the vacating of an arbitration award on the basis of arbitrator disregard of the law.

title: Relates to the Chisholm Chance Act; repealer
abstract: Relates to the Chisholm Chance Act; creates an administrative hub in Kings county and Bronx county to coordinate community-based organizations and community health workers to combat the maternal health crisis.

title: Provides that lactation rooms in service areas which are maintained or operated by the New York state thruway authority shall display information for services related to human trafficking
abstract: Provides that lactation rooms in service areas which are maintained or operated by the New York state thruway authority shall display information for services related to human trafficking.

title: Requires the department of state to promulgate rules and regulations providing for the recognition of Indian tribes as Indian Nations
abstract: Requires the department of state to promulgate rules and regulations providing for the recognition of Indian tribes as Indian Nations; further requires an annual report to the legislature.

title: Relates to orders not to resuscitate; repealer
abstract: Changes the controlling law for orders not to resuscitate for residents of mental hygiene facilities.

title: Relates to increasing the length of the term of office for members of the legislature
abstract: Increases the length of the term of office for members of the legislature from two to four years.

title: Mourning the death of Sue Montgomery Corey, distinguished citizen, caring family member and devoted member of her community
Commemorating the 50th Anniversary of Confer Plastics in North Tonawanda, New York
Relates to the appointment and promotion of supervisors of the fire alarm dispatcher service
abstract: Relates to the appointment and promotion of supervisors of the fire alarm dispatcher service; requires that a promotion be based on merit and fitness as determined by competitive examination, due weight being given to seniority.

title: Establishes maximum age requirements for New York city correctional officers
abstract: Establishes maximum age requirements for New York city correction officers; provides that the commissioner of correction shall not appoint a person as a correction officer if such person is more than thirty-five years of age as of the date of the applicant's appointment or eligibility to compete in a promotion examination.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim March 25-31, 2023, as Farmworker Awareness Week in the State of New York
Relates to providing a civil action for deprivation of rights
abstract: Provides a civil action for deprivation of rights which is caused by any person or public entity.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim March 2023, as Brain Injury Awareness Month in the State of New York
Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim April 2023, as Lyme Disease Awareness Month in the State of New York
Celebrating the life of Michael Gamilla, renowned ImageOut Board Member and Programming Director, and beloved community member, colleague, and friend
Relates to authorizing the Silver Lake Foundation Inc. to receive retroactive real property tax exempt status
abstract: Authorizes the assessor of Richmond county to grant the Silver Lake Foundation Inc. retroactive real property tax exempt status upon an application therefor.

title: Adds certain substances to the schedules of controlled substances
abstract: Adds certain substances already listed under 21 U.S.C. Section 812 to the schedules of controlled substances.

title: Relates to journalism usage fees, notice to be given to a covered platform and the arbitration of disputes over such fees
abstract: Relates to journalism usage fees; requires notice to be given to a covered platform by an eligible digital journalism provider requiring covered platforms to pay journalism usage fees to eligible digital journalism providers; establishes arbitration requirements for disputes over such fees.

title: Expands the food donation and food scraps recycling program
abstract: Expands the food donation and food scraps recycling program by scaling down the annual average tonnage requirement every two years until 2027; removes exceptions regarding recycler capacity.

title: Establishes a captive insurance program for commuter vans that are engaged in the business of carrying or transporting eight to twenty-four passengers for hire and establishes a commuter van trust fund
abstract: Establishes a captive insurance program for commuter vans that are engaged in the business of carrying or transporting eight to twenty-four passengers for hire; establishes the commuter van trust fund.

title: Relates to hospitalization, care coordination, and assisted outpatient treatment for persons with mental illness
abstract: Relates to hospitalization, care coordination, and assisted outpatient treatment for persons with mental illness.

title: Authorizes the widow of Peter Sistrom to file a retirement option election on behalf of her deceased husband
abstract: Authorizes the widow of Peter Sistrom to file a retirement option election on behalf of her deceased husband.

title: Relates to requiring affordable housing projects to calculate and only use the area median income for the specific county that the project is located in
abstract: Relates to requiring affordable housing projects to calculate and only use the area median income for the specific county that the project is located in for determining affordability.

title: Relates to certification by pharmacists of patients using medical cannabis
abstract: Relates to the content and procedure for certification by pharmacists of patients using medical cannabis; allows a pharmacist employed by a registered organization and responsible for supervising the dispensing of medical cannabis within a cannabis dispensing facility to recommend and certify patients upon consultation within such dispensing facility.

title: Relates to recounts of election votes
abstract: Relates to recounts of election votes.

title: Establishes the real estate appraiser task force
abstract: Provides that the commissioner of taxation and finance shall convene a ten member real estate appraiser task force to investigate and identify the misevaluation of the asset of this category of professionals and develop ways to overcome the biased behavior; makes related provisions.

title: Relates to certification required for payments made for home care services
abstract: Requires an annual statement of wage parity hours and expenses to be accompanied by an independent accountant's report on applying agreed upon procedures on the annual compliance statement of wage parity, hours and expenses prior to payments for home care services by government agencies.

title: Provides for increased participation in state contracts and subcontracts by certified minority and women owned business enterprises
abstract: Provides for increased participation in state contracts and subcontracts by certified minority and women-owned business enterprises; relates to certain performance and payment bond requirements.

title: Increases the penalties for theft of a companion animal
abstract: Increases the penalties for theft of a companion animal.

title: Relates to reduction of air pollution from petroleum bulk storage facilities
abstract: Expands the options for shell color and roof color of petroleum bulk storage tanks to either white or beige/cream, or which limits volatile emissions to the same or to a greater extent as a shell color and roof color of white or beige/cream, as determined by the department of environmental conservation.

title: Relates to a real property tax exemption for property owned by certain persons performing active duty in a combat zone
abstract: Authorizes municipalities to offer a real property tax exemption for property owned by certain persons performing active duty in a combat zone in an amount to the extent of fifteen percent of the assessed value of the real property, but shall not exceed twelve thousand dollars.

title: Authorizes online facilitation of voter registration
abstract: Authorizes online facilitation of voter registration.

title: Relates to the receipt of catalytic converters by junk dealers and scrap dealers
abstract: Places limitations on transactions involving the sale of catalytic converters to junk dealers, junk yard owners or operators, or scrap metal processors or scrap metal processing facilities; relates to record keeping relating to transactions involving the sale of catalytic converters.

title: Relates to extending the benefits of the variable supplements fund for transit police members of the New York city employees' retirement system
abstract: Extends the benefits of the variable supplements fund for transit police members of the New York city employees' retirement system for persons who retired on or after October 1, 1968.

title: Requires paid sick leave does not count against other paid time off
abstract: Requires paid sick leave does not count against other paid time off.

title: Relates to establishing the "340B prescription drug anti-discrimination act"
abstract: Relates to establishing the "340B prescription drug anti-discrimination act"; prohibits pharmaceutical manufacturers and pharmacy benefit managers from discriminating against covered entities and New York state pharmacies based on participation in the drug discount program authorized by section 340B of the federal public health service act.

title: Enacts the "Give Kids a Chance - Carter's Law"; mandates health insurance coverage for congenital anomalies
abstract: Enacts the "Give Kids a Chance - Carter's Law" mandating health insurance coverage for congenital anomalies including certain reconstructive services, habilitative services, and inpatient and outpatient services.

title: Establishes the position of an insurance liaison on the disaster preparedness commission
abstract: Establishes the position of an insurance liaison on the disaster preparedness commission to be appointed by the governor and serve as a non-voting member.

title: Establishes the New York state community doula directory for doulas serving Medicaid patients
abstract: Requires the department of health to establish and maintain the New York state community doula directory for doulas on such department's website for the purposes of Medicaid reimbursement and promoting doula services to Medicaid recipients; establishes criteria for admittance into the New York state community doula directory; makes related provisions.

title: Increases the classification of misdemeanor hate crime offenses to a felony
abstract: Increases the sentencing classification of misdemeanor hate crime offenses or of an attempt or conspiracy to commit a specified offense that is a misdemeanor to a class E felony.

title: Relates to the practice of banning books by publicly funded libraries
abstract: Provides that publicly funded libraries may not ban books because of partisan or doctrinal disapproval.

title: Relates to regulations to restrict docks, boathouses and moorings on Otsego Lake in the town of Springfield
abstract: Permits the town of Springfield to adopt and enforce regulations restricting docks, boathouses and moorings on Otsego lake within such town.

title: Relates to the hours of operation for family courts
abstract: Relates to the hours of operation for family courts; requires family courts in New York City to remain open until midnight on at least one weekday each week in at least two counties effective January 1, 2024, and in at least three counties, effective January 1, 2025.

title: Authorizes the assessor of the town of Babylon to accept an application for exemption from real property taxes from the Phoenix Houses of Long Island, Inc.
abstract: Authorizes the assessor of the town of Babylon to accept an application for exemption from real property taxes from the Phoenix Houses of Long Island, Inc.

title: Requires general hospitals and nursing homes to offer free notarial services to patients
abstract: Requires general hospitals and nursing homes to offer free notarial services to patients; requires an employee of such general hospital or nursing home who is a notary public to be present from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. on business days.

title: Requires all municipalities to update all applicable forms and data systems to include a gender "x" option
abstract: Requires all municipalities to update all applicable forms and data systems to include a gender "x" option by January 1, 2026.

title: Relates to public works requiring advertising for bids and offers
abstract: Relates to public works requiring advertising for bids and offers; relates to consolidated local highway assistance payments.

title: Relates to electronic delivery of insurance notices
abstract: Allows for certain notices related to property/casualty insurance contracts under the workers' compensation law and the vehicle and traffic law to be delivered by electronic means.

title: Authorizes a prenatal and postpartum informational mobile application
abstract: Authorizes a prenatal and postpartum informational mobile application for individuals who are eligible for Medicaid.

title: Relates to inspection of retail premises authorized to sell tobacco and vapor products and enforcement and penalties
abstract: Requires random, quarterly inspection of retail premises authorized to sell tobacco and vapor products to ensure compliance with applicable laws and regulations; increases penalties for violations.

title: Establishes that instruction in financial education be provided to pupils in grades nine, ten, eleven or twelve
abstract: Establishes that instruction in financial education be provided to pupils in grades nine through twelve; establishes what should be included in such curriculum including the basics of financial planning, budgeting, borrowing, interest rates, personal insurance policies, etc.

title: Expands eligibility for appointment to county boards of health and health services advisory boards
abstract: Expands eligibility for appointment to county boards of health and health services advisory boards to include nurse practitioners and physician assistants, and expands to residents in the county or residents of a contiguous county who perform substantial work in the county.

title: Establishes the office of pretrial services
abstract: Establishes the office of pretrial services to certify and establish guidelines for pretrial services agencies in the state; establishes a working group to prepare for the transition for pretrial services from public entities to private, non-profit entities and provides for the repeal of such working group upon the expiration thereof.

title: Requires the department of transportation to establish a central registry of reports, audits, plans and public inspections for freight rail operators, rail cars and freight lines
abstract: Requires the department of transportation to establish a central registry of reports, audits, plans and public inspections regarding freight rail operators, rail cars and freight lines or routes and rights of way.

title: Prohibits certain surcharges on credit or debit card transactions
abstract: Prohibits certain surcharges on certain credit or debit card transactions in the city of New York; provides that no agency or department of the city of New York, or any tribunal located therein, shall be authorized to impose a surcharge on a holder who elects to use a credit or debit card in lieu of payment by cash, check, or similar means to pay any fine, civil penalty, or fee owed.

title: Relates to street lights
abstract: Requires the public service commission to notify any municipality or government entity proposing to acquire title to and transfer ownership of the complete system of street light luminaires or fixtures, all supporting infrastructure, and associated electric circuitry of the health hazards, the lack of United States Food and Drug Administration regulation of light emitting diodes, "LED", lighting products, and the requirement that municipalities that operate LED street lights are required to publish an American with disabilities accommodation plan.

title: Establishes law enforcement officer grant funds and firefighter grant funds
abstract: Establishes law enforcement officer grant funds and firefighter grant funds to cover expenses related to hiring law enforcement officers and firefighters and equipment and resources for such officers and firefighters.

title: Relates to establishing hospital-sponsored off campus emergency departments
abstract: Establishes hospital-sponsored off campus emergency departments as a "hospital"; sets out specific standards for operations, staffing and capacity requirements.

title: Enacts"Bryan Johnson's law"
abstract: Enacts "Bryan Johnson's law"; includes prior convictions of operation of a vessel while under the influence of alcohol or drugs as prior convictions of driving while intoxicated.

title: Requires screening incarcerated individuals for eligibility in the supplemental nutrition assistance program prior to release
abstract: Requires screening incarcerated individuals for eligibility in the supplemental nutrition assistance program prior to release and assistance in applying for such programs; requires officials to seek waivers from the USDA for eligibility for such program.

title: Requires wireless telephone service providers disable stolen cellphones
abstract: Enacts Detective Brian Simonsen's law; requires police officers report stolen cellphones to wireless telephone service providers who must then disable such stolen cellphones.

title: Permits individuals enrolled in the federal deferred action for childhood arrivals program to apply for professional licenses
abstract: Relates to permitting individuals enrolled in the federal deferred action for childhood arrivals program to apply for professional licenses if they meet all additional requirements.

title: Relates to an annual inventory of short-term rental locations and capacities, and monthly utilization data
abstract: Requires short-term rental companies to provide an annual inventory of short-term rental locations and capacities, and monthly utilization data for each county in the state.

title: Exempts commuter vans from congestion pricing in New York city
abstract: Exempts commuter vans from the congestion surcharge and the central business district tolling program in New York city.

title: Relates to the establishment of rates of payment for medical assistance for needy persons
abstract: Requires the commissioner of health to set rates of payment for medical assistance for needy persons to reflect more current base year information.

title: Relates to notices of violation of the city of New York's solid waste recycling laws
abstract: Relates to notices of violation of the city of New York's solid waste recycling laws; requires a photograph of the alleged violation to be mailed with the ticket.

title: Requires that at least one employee at each day care center be trained in administering an opioid antagonist
abstract: Requires that at least one employee at each family day care center, group family day care center, school-aged child care program, and child day care center be trained in administering an opioid antagonist.

title: Requires persons driving on a state expressway or thruway to pull over and seek assistance if their vehicle is unable to exceed thirty-five miles per hour
abstract: Requires persons driving on a state expressway route, state interstate route, or state thruway route to pull over and seek assistance if their vehicle is unable to exceed thirty-five miles per hour.

title: Divides the one hundred ninth precinct of the New York city police department into subdivisions
abstract: Divides the one hundred ninth precinct of the New York city police department into two separate subdivisions.

title: Provides an exemption to the prohibition on tinted windows in automobiles for emergency ambulance service vehicles
abstract: Provides an exemption to the prohibition on tinted windows in automobiles for emergency ambulance service vehicles.

title: Includes assault on a corrections officer as a class C felony
abstract: Includes assault on a corrections officer as a class C felony.

title: Requires the transfer of medical records within sixty days of written request
abstract: Relates to requiring the transfer of medical records within sixty days of written request.

title: Relates to sentencing of a person convicted of murdering a child who is less than thirteen years old
abstract: Provides that a person convicted of murder in the first or second degree, or aggravated murder, in the death of a child who is less than thirteen years old shall be sentenced to life imprisonment without parole.

title: Designates March twenty-first as Down Syndrome Awareness Day
abstract: Designates March twenty-first as a day of commemoration to be known as "Down Syndrome Awareness Day".

title: Relates to the metropolitan transportation authority's voting members; and repeals certain provisions of such law relating thereto
abstract: Changes the structure of the metropolitan transportation authority's voting members; requires a two-thirds vote for such authority to take on any new obligations.

title: Relates to payments from the New York state medical indemnity fund for persons who sustained birth-related neurological injuries
abstract: Permits payments from the New York state medical indemnity fund for adult day programs, sheltered workshops and care coordination services for persons who sustained birth-related neurological injuries as the result of medical malpractice.

title: Relates to supplemental uninsured/underinsured insurance; and extends certain provisions of the insurance law relating thereto
abstract: Ensures that supplemental uninsured/underinsured insurance coverage is included in certain insurance policies; provides for certain notice and information to be given to insured motorists; extends certain provisions relating to supplemental uninsured/underinsured insurance coverage until 6/30/2026.

title: Relates to county-wide shared services panels
abstract: Authorizes the South Nassau Water Authority and the North Shore Water Authority to remain eligible for funding in state fiscal year two thousand twenty-three--two thousand twenty-four.

title: Relates to floor area ratio
abstract: Relates to floor area ratio; provides that except as otherwise provided in and determined under a zoning law, ordinance, or resolution of a city with a population of one million or more, or after consultation with local officials, as provided in a general project plan of the New York state urban development corporation, the floor area ratio (FAR) of any dwelling or dwellings on a lot shall not exceed 12.0.

title: Relates to banning individuals who have violated wage theft laws from bidding on public works projects
abstract: Relates to banning individuals who have violated wage theft laws from bidding on public works projects.

title: Creates the Checkout NY pass
abstract: Creates the "Checkout NY" pass, a comprehensive pass that allows for free or discounted use of state parks, historic sites and recreational facilities; provides one such pass to each consolidated, federated and cooperative public library system within the state free of charge for circulation.

title: Relates to civil penalties for certain fraud or misrepresentation of a material fact with respect to a financial product or service
abstract: Relates to civil penalties for certain fraud or misrepresentation of a material fact with respect to a financial product or service.

title: Repeals the state Medicaid spending cap and related processes; repealer
abstract: Repeals the state Medicaid spending cap and related processes.

title: Establishes a rebuttable presumption of a hate crime when certain crimes are committed on, in or upon a house of worship
abstract: Establishes a rebuttable presumption of a hate crime when certain crimes are committed on, in or upon a house of worship.

title: Relates to certain crematory or crematorium operated by a funeral entity
abstract: Provides that a crematory or crematorium operated by a funeral entity may add an additional retort expressly and solely for use in an instance of mechanical or technical failure of an existing retort; makes related provisions.

title: Enacts the "transparency in health care fees act"
abstract: Establishes the transparency in health care fees act requiring health care providers to submit bills to patients prior to performing services.

title: Directs contracting state agencies to develop a growth plan in order to increase participation of MWBEs with respect to state contracts and subcontracts
abstract: Directs contracting state agencies to develop a growth plan in order to increase participation of minority- and women-owned businesses with respect to state contracts and subcontracts.

title: Designates Pinkster day as a day of commemoration
abstract: Designates Pinkster day as a day of commemoration annually on the seventh Sunday after Easter.

title: Relates to establishing the banking bill of rights
abstract: Relates to establishing the banking bill of rights; includes due process requirements regarding applications for or closure of credit and deposit accounts and penalties for noncompliance.

title: Establishes local wage enforcement authority in the city of New York
abstract: Establishes local wage enforcement authority in the city of New York; authorizes the city of New York to establish a minimum wage that is higher than the statewide minimum wage.

title: Relates to the repair of certain bridges and other structures located on or adjacent to the Palisades Interstate Parkway
abstract: Relates to the repair of certain bridges and other structures located on or adjacent to the Palisades Interstate Parkway; directs the Palisades Interstate Park Commission to select a stone for bridge repair by December 1, 2023.

title: Authorizes the town of Cornwall in Orange county to impose a hotel and motel tax; and provides for the repeal of such provisions upon expiration thereof
abstract: Authorizes the town of Cornwall in Orange county to impose a five percent hotel and motel tax; provides for the repeal of such provisions upon expiration thereof.

title: Relates to providing financial consumer protections for small businesses
abstract: Expands consumer protections for usury and interest to small businesses.

title: Establishes a pilot program to provide high impact tutoring
abstract: Establishes a pilot program to provide grants to local education providers to implement high-impact tutoring programs prioritizing low-income or underserved students to address student learning loss or unfinished learning resulting from the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Relates to certain deceptive acts and practices and the court's jurisdiction over such acts and practices
abstract: Provides that any claim for deceptive acts or practices against a distribution utility providing gas, electric or steam services to the public, the court shall have exclusive jurisdiction over such claim without regard to any defenses alleged; provides that in any claim for false advertising, the court shall have exclusive jurisdiction over such claim.

title: Establishes a cause of action by residents of adult care facilities to petition for appointment of a temporary operator
abstract: Establishes a cause of action by residents of adult facilities to petition for the appointment of a temporary operator of any such facility in violation of the provisions of law, rules and regulations applicable thereto.

title: Restores 20 year service retirement for New York city police officers
abstract: Restores 20 year service retirement for New York city police officers.

title: Relates to information regarding safety issues for certain motor carriers
abstract: Relates to expanding required disclosure of information regarding safety issues for certain motor carriers, specifically stretch limousines.

title: Relates to definitions of certain terms relating to the NYS medical indemnity fund; relates to the effectiveness of certain provisions relating to the NYS medical indemnity fund
abstract: Relates to definitions of certain terms relating to the NYS medical indemnity fund; repeals certain provisions relating to claims for qualifying health care costs under the NYS medical indemnity fund; and relates to the effectiveness of certain provisions relating to the NYS medical indemnity fund.

title: Commemorating the 100th anniversary of Catholic Charities of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Syracuse, New York
Amends election law to accurately reflect proper cross reference
abstract: Amends election law to accurately reflect proper cross reference relating to the operational failure of a voting machine.

title: Relates to the prohibition on naming buildings after public officials
abstract: Prohibits a public officer or member of the legislature from have a building or space named after himself or herself while he or she holds public office based on the fact that such person was responsible for securing public funds for the person or entity involved in naming the building or for securing public funds for the person's or entity's cause or agenda.

title: Relates to providing the New York power authority with the right of first offer and refusal; bans non-state run energy services companies; repealer
abstract: Provides the New York power authority with the right of first offer and refusal for acquiring any renewable generation facility, renewable energy generation project and any power or energy created by a renewable generation facility or renewable energy generation project; bans non-state run energy services companies; allows the New York power authority to take over and operate as an energy services company.

title: Prohibits operation of a motor vehicle on any highway in this state equipped with a radar device commonly known as a phazer II connected to a power source
abstract: Prohibits operation of a motor vehicle on any highway in this state equipped with a radar device commonly known as a PHAZER II connected to a power source; provides for use of rebuttable presumption.

title: Requires restaurants and persons authorized to sell alcoholic beverages to have tangible menus available upon request
abstract: Requires restaurants and persons authorized to sell alcoholic beverages to have tangible menus available upon request.

title: Modifies the requirements for the New York state science, technology, engineering and mathematics incentive program
abstract: Modifies the requirements for the New York state science, technology, engineering and mathematics incentive program for when an award gets converted to a student loan.

title: Relates to salary increases for members of the legislature
abstract: Requires proposed salary increases for members of the legislature to be submitted to the people at the next general election.

title: Provides for the notification of surviving family of homicide victims of the availability of victim support services programs
abstract: Provides for the notification of surviving family of homicide victims of the availability of victim support services programs by the office of victim services.

title: Relates to authorizing grants for the implementation of the seal of civic readiness program
abstract: Relates to authorizing grants for the implementation of the seal of civic readiness program; authorizes grants of $50,000 to no more than 20 applicant school districts for public schools that have successfully completed both the seal of civic readiness application and commissioner created grant application.

title: Requires the New York city housing authority to address certain repairs within thirty days after receipt of a written notice to management
abstract: Requires the New York city housing authority to repair certain conditions within thirty days of receipt of a written notice requesting such repairs; requires NYCHA to convert from gas to electric appliances when repairing or replacing any such appliances.

title: Prohibits the administration of COVID-19 mRNA vaccinations
abstract: Prohibits the administration of COVID-19 mRNA vaccinations; requires the department of health to conduct a study and make recommendations on the benefits and risks of the administration of such vaccines; requires a self-controlled case series to be completed; makes related provisions.

title: Requires bicycles advertised for sale or resale in New York state to have an identifying serial number and for such serial number to be posted in any advertisement for such bicycle
abstract: Requires bicycles advertised for sale or resale in New York state to have an identifying serial number in legible boldfaced figures in one of certain specified areas on the bicycle; requires advertisements for bicycles to clearly and conspicuously include such bicycles identifying serial number.

title: Authorizes George Amendola Tier II status in the New York state and local employees' retirement system
abstract: Authorizes George Amendola Tier II status in the New York state and local employees' retirement system.
