abstract: Establishes a retirement service credit for volunteer fire or emergency service.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim November 1, 2023, as Vegan Day in the State of New York
Expands the list of transactions that constitute testamentary substitutes to include transfer-on-death securities
abstract: Expands the list of transactions that constitute testamentary substitutes to include transfer-on-death securities.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim April 2023, as the Month of the Military Child in the State of New York
Relates to prohibiting the use of chemical agents by police officers against minors
abstract: Prohibits the use of chemical agents by police officers against minors under the age of eighteen.

title: Classifies emergency medical services as essential services for the purposes of state aid
abstract: Classifies emergency medical services as essential services for the purposes of state aid.

title: Establishes the "Purple Star School Program" to assist military-connected students and to recognize the value of military service and civic responsibility
abstract: Establishes the "Purple Star School Program" to assist military-connected students and to recognize the value of military service and civic responsibility.

title: Requires the New York state energy research and development authority to develop recommendations regarding the establishment of microgrids
abstract: Requires the New York state energy research and development authority to develop recommendations regarding the establishment of microgrids.

title: Prohibits the manufacture, distribution, sale and use of nail polish and nail hardener containing certain dibutyl phthalates (DBP), toluene, formaldehyde, formaldehyde resin, camphor, ethyl tosylamide, or xylene
abstract: Prohibits the manufacture, distribution, sale and use of nail polish or nail hardener containing certain dibutyl phthalates (DBP), toluene, formaldehyde, formaldehyde resin, camphor, ethyl tosylamide, and xylene; prohibits the use of such nail polish and nail hardener by appearance enhancement businesses.

title: Relates to prohibitions on fur products
abstract: Relates to prohibitions on fur products; prohibits the manufacture, sale, display for sale, trade, giving, donating, or otherwise distributing of a fur product by any means in the state beginning twenty-four months after this act becomes a law.

title: Requires providers to share electronic health records with plans for purposes of improving patient care and reducing administrative delays
abstract: Requires providers to share electronic health records with plans for purposes of improving patient care and reducing administrative delays.

title: Requires teachers employed by the Buffalo school district to reside within Buffalo city limits
abstract: Requires teachers employed by the Buffalo school district to reside within Buffalo city limits.

title: Enacts the Treyvan Rowe child and young teen mental health community safety act
abstract: Enacts the Trevyan Rowe child and young teen mental health community safety act"; directs boards of education to create policies, procedures, and guidelines for at-risk children and young teens who have demonstrated suicidal ideation, been victims of harassment or bullying, and/or who have eloped from school property; establishes a commission to evaluate the safety and security of children in primary and secondary public and private schools in this state.

title: Enacts "Cariol's Law"
abstract: Enacts "Cariol's Law"; provides for a duty to intervene when a police officer observes another police officer using physical force that he or she reasonably believes to be clearly excessive or beyond that which is objectively reasonable under the circumstances.

title: Authorizes children 10 years of age or older to load and fire a rifle, shotgun or pistol at a shooting range while under the supervision of a qualified person
abstract: Authorizes children 10 years of age or older to load and fire a rifle, shotgun or pistol at a shooting range while under the supervision of a qualified person; increases from 18 to 21 years of age the minimum age of a person who may be designated in writing by the parent or guardian of a child to supervise such child while he or she is shooting.

title: Provides for the installment payment for the earned income credit
abstract: Provides for the installment payment for the earned income credit.

title: Relates to requiring the commissioner of agriculture and markets to establish licensing and educational standards for individuals providing canine training for non-service and non-police dogs
abstract: Relates to requiring the commissioner to establish licensing and educational standards for individuals providing canine training for non-service and non-police dogs.

title: Enacts "Melanie's law"
abstract: Enacts "Melanie's law"; relates to orders of protection; allows courts to issue orders of protection for immediate family members or household members of the named victims, regardless of age.

title: Relates to criminal possession of a weapon in the third degree
abstract: Relates to criminal possession of a weapon in the third degree; increases penalties for possession of a weapon on subways and mass transit trains.

title: Relates to the use of transportation management brokers
abstract: Establishes that providers of adult day health care and managed long term care plans may elect to use transportation management brokers; provides that programs of all-inclusive care for the elderly (PACE) are not required to use transportation management brokers.

title: Relates to adding a surcharge on online delivery transactions within the city of New York
abstract: Adds a three dollar surcharge on online delivery transactions terminating within the city of New York to be used to fund the operating costs of buses and subways in the city of New York.

title: Establishes the university at Buffalo institute for African American studies; appropriation
abstract: Establishes the university at Buffalo institute for African American studies; appropriates $100,000 therefor.

title: Relates to providing for multi-formatted services menus for the cognitively impaired on websites operated by certain state agencies
abstract: Relates to providing for multi-formatted services menus for the cognitively impaired on websites operated by certain state agencies; includes the department of health, office for people with developmental disabilities and the office of mental health.

title: Relates to procurement requirements for end point device security
abstract: Directs that state agencies require that procurement of personal computing goods, services and solutions meet the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) Cybersecurity Framework.

title: Relates to the right of defendants in misdemeanor or felony cases to have such matter appear before a judge or justice admitted to practice law in New York
abstract: Relates to the right of defendants in misdemeanor or felony cases to have such matter appear before a judge or justice admitted to practice law in New York; creates an automatic right to have a case reassigned to an attorney judge.

title: Relates to contingent fee rules for attorneys in claims or actions for medical, dental or podiatric malpractice
abstract: Updates contingent fee rules for attorneys in claims or actions for medical, dental or podiatric malpractice; permits applications for enhanced fees; permits plaintiffs to waive contingent retainer limitations.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim March 25, 2023, as Cerebral Palsy Awareness Day in the State of New York
Recognizing the honorees of the New York State Legislative Women's Caucus upon the occasion of its Annual Luncheon on March 30, 2023, in conjunction with the observance of Women's History Month
Authorizes pharmacists to dispense HIV pre-exposure and post-exposure prophylaxis
abstract: Authorizes pharmacists to dispense HIV pre-exposure and post-exposure prophylaxis.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim June 25, 2023, as El Dia Del Bodeguero in the State of New York
Authorizes the transfer of memberships for certain members of the New York state and local police and fire retirement system to the New York state and local employees' retirement system
abstract: Authorizes the transfer of memberships for certain members of the New York state and local police and fire retirement system who previously held a membership with the New York state and local employees' retirement system back to such retirement system.

title: Relates to residency requirements for the village clerk/treasurer and the deputy clerk for the village of Cold Spring
abstract: Authorizes the village clerk/treasurer and the deputy clerk for the village of Cold Spring, Putnam county, to reside outside such village, but within the county in which such village is located or an adjoining county.

title: Commemorating the 30th Anniversary of the creation of the Folklife Center at the Crandall Public Library on July 25, 2023
Commemorating the 100th Anniversary of the John McLane Hose Company
Relates to allowing certain members of the New York city fire department pension fund to receive a membership date in such fund attributable to service in the title of police cadet program
abstract: Relates to allowing certain members of the New York city fire department pension fund to receive a membership date in such fund attributable to service in the titles of police cadet program and police cadet program II in the New York city police department cadet program.

title: Congratulating Dr. Alan S. Chartock upon the occasion of his retirement after 44 years of distinguished service as CEO and President of WAMC Northeast Public Radio
Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim June 4, 2023, as Cancer Survivors Day in the State of New York
Relates to personal income taxes in the city of New York
abstract: Extends certain provisions of law relating to tax rates and the imposition of income taxes in the city of New York.

title: Relates to the posting of additional nursing home ratings
abstract: Relates to the posting of additional nursing home ratings; provides such posting shall include ratings for health inspections, staffing and quality measures.

title: Expands eligibility for victims and survivors of crime to access victim compensation funds
abstract: Expands eligibility for victims and survivors of crime to access victim compensation funds by removing the mandatory law enforcement reporting requirement, providing alternative forms of evidence that would show that a qualifying crime was committed and the confidentiality of certain records.

title: Relates to the purposes of the volunteer and exempt firemen's benevolent association of East Syracuse and the use of certain tax monies received by such association
abstract: Provides for the purposes of the volunteer and exempt firemen's benevolent association of East Syracuse; changes the title of the association to include firefighters; directs the use of tax monies received to go towards furthering the purposes of such association.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim September 7, 2023, as Wheelchair Charities Day in the State of New York
Relates to the location of the principal office of the cannabis control board and office of cannabis management
abstract: Provides that the principal office of the cannabis control board and office of cannabis management shall be located in Albany county.

title: Relates to gender balance in public authorities, industrial development agencies and local development corporations
abstract: Relates to gender balance on boards of state and local public authorities; provides that all appointive state and local authorities heretofore or hereafter established by law or resolution shall have recommendations for appointments, or reappointments that are gender balanced.

title: Relates to authorizing the World Restoration Center Inc. to receive retroactive real property tax exempt status
abstract: Authorizes the assessor of Nassau county to grant the World Restoration Center Inc. retroactive real property tax exempt status upon an application therefor.

title: Requires OPWDD to purchase and provide essential PPE to all mental health providers in the event of a declaration of a state emergency that relates to public health
abstract: Requires OPWDD to purchase and provide essential personal protection equipment to all direct support professionals, care recipients and group home providers in the event of a declaration of a state emergency that relates to public health.

title: Relates to prohibiting insurance companies from discriminating based on genetic predisposition; repealer
abstract: Prohibits insurance companies from discriminating based on genetic predisposition including refusing to issue or renew, charging any increased rate, or restricting any length of coverage; prohibits insurers from requiring genetic testing.

title: Prohibits the use of restraints on incarcerated individuals during labor, absent extraordinary circumstances, and on pregnant persons during a custodial interrogation
abstract: Prohibits the use of restraints on incarcerated individuals during labor, absent extraordinary circumstances, and on pregnant persons during a custodial interrogation.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim October 2, 2023, as Custodial Worker's Recognition Day in the State of New York
Relates to ordering a study and report on improvements of State Route 9A in the Hudson River Greenway portion of State Route 9A
abstract: Relates to ordering a study and report on improvements of State Route 9A in the Hudson River Greenway portion of State Route 9A; provides for the repeal of such provisions upon expiration thereof.

title: Commemorating the 150th Anniversary of the First United Methodist Church of East Greenbush, New York
Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim June 17, 2023, as Sanitation Workers Day in the State of New York
Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim October 28, 2023, as First Responders Day in the State of New York
Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to declare June 2023, as North American Hurricane Awareness Month in the State of New York
Commemorating the 50th Anniversary of St. Sophia's Greek Cultural Festival
Commemorating the 50th Anniversary of the Hadley-Lake Luzerne Historical Society
Requires sellers to clearly post the price of a credit card surcharge
abstract: Requires sellers to clearly post the credit card price inclusive of any surcharge at the location a sale occurs; does not prohibit merchants from offering a two-tier pricing system; establishes civil penalty not to exceed $500 for each violation.

title: Commemorating the 100th Anniversary of the Church of the Holy Spirit of East Greenbush, New York
Commemorating the Schuylerville Garden Club upon the occasion of celebrating its 80th Anniversary
Commending the Town of Waterford upon the occasion of hosting its Annual Tugboat Roundup from September 8-10, 2023
Includes thyroid cancer in the list of cancers presumed to be incurred in the performance of duty for purposes of disability retirement
abstract: Includes thyroid cancer in the list of cancers presumed to be incurred in the performance of duty for purposes of disability retirement for firefighters in a city with a population of one million or more.

title: Permits certain twenty-five year retirement program dispatcher members to file elections not to participate
abstract: Permits certain twenty-five year retirement program dispatcher members to file elections not to participate.

title: Establishes a clinical preceptorship personal income tax credit for certain health care professionals who provide preceptor instruction to students
abstract: Establishes a clinical preceptorship personal income tax credit for certain health care professionals who provide preceptor instruction to students studying to be a health care professional.

title: Requires municipalities to maintain municipal websites
abstract: Requires municipalities to maintain municipal websites.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim May 1-5, 2023, as Maternal Health Awareness Week in the State of New York
Establishes contingency management services for certain persons with substance use disorders
abstract: Requires the office of alcoholism and substance abuse services to provide contingency management services, including financial incentives, for persons with addiction disorders who abstain from substance abuse and comply with treatment objectives.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim May 1, 2023, as School Principal's Day in the State of New York
Relates to the use of waste tire management and recycling fee funds
abstract: Relates to the use of waste tire management and recycling fee funds; directs certain funds to be used by the department of economic development for funding demonstration projects relating to reuse in agricultural settings and for conducting analysis of waste tire reuse opportunities.

title: Relates to eligibility for appointment as a police officer
abstract: Provides that no person shall be eligible for appointment as a police officer who was previously employed as a police officer and who: was dismissed for malfeasance or other serious misconduct calling into question such person's fitness to serve as a police officer; or resigned or retired from such officer's position while under investigation for such malfeasance or other serious misconduct; defines terms; makes related provisions.

title: Relates to orders of protection in child abuse and neglect proceedings in family court
abstract: Relates to orders of protection in child abuse and neglect proceedings in family court.

title: Commemorating the 50th Anniversary of the Adirondack Balloon Festival
Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim May 23, 2023, as Taiwan Heritage Day in the State of New York
Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim June 2023, as Great Outdoors Month in the State of New York
Commemorating the 120th Anniversary of the Glens Falls Fire Department
Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim June 2023, as Scleroderma Awareness Month in the State of New York

Requires genetic testing results only be received by patients and health care providers providing direct care while health insurance companies only receive a record that the genetic testing was performed
abstract: Requires genetic testing results only be received by patients and health care providers providing direct care while health insurance companies only receive a record that the genetic testing was performed; provides insurers cannot require access to genetic testing results and cannot take adverse action against someone for not providing genetic testing results.

title: Congratulating the Finger Lakes Community College Men's Volleyball Team upon the occasion of capturing the inaugural NJCAA National Invitational Men's Volleyball Championship
Commemorating the 350th Anniversary of the Town of Coeymans on April 7, 2023
Congratulating Frances F. Dunwell upon the occasion of her retirement after 30 years of dedicated service to the New York State Department of Environmental Conservation
Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim May 2023, as Lupus Awareness Month in the State of New York
Relates to transit-oriented development
abstract: Directs municipalities to permit the construction and occupation of dwelling units with a density of at least twenty-five dwelling units per acre, on any land wherein residential construction and occupation is otherwise permitted if such land is within one-half mile of any covered transportation facility.

title: Creates the mobile high-technology training facilities program
abstract: Creates the mobile high-technology training facilities program to award one to one matching grants on a competitive basis to qualified applicants for the design, development and/or outfit of mobile high-technology training facilities that complement certificate, degree or other recognized credentialing programs.

title: Establishes the office of wastewater surveillance and creates a grant program; appropriation
abstract: Establishes the office of wastewater surveillance; creates a grant program; provides such office shall monitor wastewater testing and analyze wastewater test results; provides the grant program shall assist labs in conducting wastewater testing; establishes an advisory council which shall provide advice on: best practices for wastewater sampling, testing and test results analysis; the creation of standards and systems of reporting on wastewater surveillance; the creation of a dashboard; integrate wastewater surveillance for COVID-19 into the office of wastewater surveillance; and any topics deemed essential by the commissioner of health.

title: Increases the various fixed fees for the provision of certain services by the sheriff
abstract: Increases the various fixed fees for the provision of certain services by the sheriff.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim June 2023, as Farmers Market Appreciation Month in the State of New York
Exempts certain income and resources provided to persons enrolled in certain pilot programs in determining eligibility for public assistance benefits
abstract: Exempts certain income and resources provided to persons enrolled in certain pilot programs in determining eligibility for public assistance benefits; requires federal waivers be sought where necessary.

title: Commemorating the 103rd Anniversary of the naming of the Borinqueneers on June 4, 2023
Requires LGBT awareness curriculum or instruction
abstract: Requires LGBT awareness curriculum or instruction.

title: Extends the period given to certain applicants for public assistance benefits to request a fair hearing
abstract: Extends the period given to certain applicants for public assistance benefits to request a fair hearing on a determination of their ability to participate in work activities from ten days to sixty days or within sixty days of receipt of a work activity assignment.

title: Relates to requiring the notification of a public utility company's or municipality's customers when the supply rate increases by at least forty percent and to notify such customers of bill assistance
abstract: Requires the notification of a public utility company's or municipality's customers when the supply rate increases by at least forty percent and to notify such customers of bill assistance programs by posting on the utility company's website.

title: Authorizes the commissioner of the division of housing and community renewal to prescribe certain forms in different languages
abstract: Authorizes the commissioner of the division of housing and community renewal to prescribe for the translation of legal forms and applications in languages other than English, as long as such language is spoken by at least one percent of the population.

title: Commemorating the 100th Anniversary of the Wells College Golf Course in June of 2023
Relates to the role of the department of corrections and community supervision in planning and facilitating the discharge or release of incarcerated individuals to the community
abstract: Relates to the role of the department of corrections and community supervision in planning and facilitating the discharge or release of incarcerated individuals to the community.

title: Relates to taxation of state owned land
abstract: Provides for the taxation of state owned land for all purposes, exclusive of improvements and in accordance with any payment in lieu of taxes agreement.

title: AID TO LOCALITIES BUDGET
abstract: Makes appropriations for the support of government - Aid to Localities Budget.

title: Congratulating Marisa Wigglesworth upon the occasion of stepping down as CEO and President of the Buffalo Museum of Science and Tifft Nature Preserve after seven years of distinguished service
Relates to allowances for the costs of diapers
abstract: Relates to authorizing the payment of costs, up to eighty dollars, of diapers for an eligible child two years of age or younger for children receiving safety net assistance.

title: Establishes the definition for legislation
abstract: Establishes the definition for legislation; provides that such proposed language shall be presented in a clear and concise manner, be limited to 50 pages and use words that have common everyday meanings.

title: Provides for a mandatory ten-year minimum sentence of imprisonment for certain felony convictions of public servants
abstract: Relates to providing for a mandatory ten-year minimum sentence of imprisonment for certain felony convictions of public servants.

title: CAPITAL PROJECTS BUDGET
abstract: Makes appropriations for the support of government - Capital Projects Budget.

title: Authorizes the empire state development corporation to develop a public awareness campaign promoting businesses located in New York state
abstract: Authorizes the empire state development corporation to develop a public awareness campaign promoting businesses located in New York state with an emphasis on small businesses and the need to shop in downtown local areas; requires the creation of the Buy New York Online Networking Directory to connect purchasers with businesses located in New York.

title: Requires corporations and municipalities to notify property owners prior to beginning certain services
abstract: Requires corporations and municipalities to notify property owners prior to beginning services that may interfere with a property owner's ability to enjoy, use, or access such property owner's property; exempts cases where a natural or man-made disaster or state of emergency occurs.

title: Increases the jurisdictional limit from $3,000 to $5,000 for justice courts and increases filing fees
abstract: Increases the jurisdictional limit from $3,000 to $5,000 for justice courts; increases filing fees.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim October 14, 2023, as Chess Day in the State of New York
Relates to certain prohibitions regarding the legal system and gender-affirming care
abstract: Declares that a law authorizing a child to be removed from their parent or guardian based on the parent or guardian allowing their child to receive gender-affirming care is against the public policy of this state; relates to forum in domestic relations cases.

title: Allows the granting of academic credit at city or state operated institutions to veterans
abstract: Allows the granting of academic credit at state or city operated institutions to veterans.

title: Prohibits landlords from refusing to deal with certain people solely because those people were involved in prior summary proceedings
abstract: Prohibits landlords from refusing to deal with certain people solely because those people were involved in prior summary proceedings.

title: Designates a portion of the state highway system as the "Trooper Edward J. Sweeney Memorial Bridge"
abstract: Designates a portion of the state highway system as the "Trooper Edward J. Sweeney Memorial Bridge" in the town of Hempstead, county of Nassau.

title: Authorizes the use of the seventh regiment armory by a not-for-profit entity
abstract: Authorizes the Knickerbocker Greys program to access and use for a permanant headquarters the seventh regiment armory for the purposes of programming during periods which are not periods of civil or military emergency.

title: Relates to the wastewater infrastructure and drinking water program
abstract: Establishes a wastewater infrastructure and drinking water program for the purpose of making payments toward the replacement and rehabilitation of existing local municipally-owned and funded drinking water, storm water and sanitary sewer systems; appropriates six million dollars to initially fund such program.

title: Relates to providing voting materials and assistance in Haitian Creole
abstract: Relates to providing voting materials and assistance in Haitian Creole.

title: Requires the metropolitan transportation authority to publish certain information pertaining to capital project data for projects that are committed for construction on the capital program dashboard
abstract: Requires the metropolitan transportation authority to publish certain information pertaining to capital project data for projects that are committed for construction on the capital program dashboard maintained by the authority on the authority's website; requires sources of funding to be specified.

title: Establishes the "winter moratorium on evictions act of 2023"
abstract: Establishes the "winter moratorium on evictions act of 2023" to prohibit eviction of tenants from residential properties during the winter months.

title: Prohibits the use of SUNY dormitories for the purposes of providing permanent or temporary housing for migrant populations
abstract: Prohibits the use of SUNY dormitories for the purposes of providing permanent or temporary housing for migrant populations; requests the board of trustees adopt a policy stating such.

title: Authorizes the village of Goshen to impose a hotel and motel tax
abstract: Authorizes the village of Goshen to impose a hotel and motel tax of up to five percent.

title: Directs the commissioner to publicly publish an annual report on the environmental radiation surveillance program
abstract: Directs the commissioner to publicly publish an annual report on the environmental radiation surveillance program and analyze such report showing trends and cumulative impact, as well as notify other relevant agencies if contamination has exceeded EPA standards for maximum amounts of contamination allowed in drinking water or food.

title: Establishes a pilot program to create an assistance hotline for individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities and complex behavioral needs
abstract: Establishes a pilot program to create an assistance hotline for individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities and complex behavioral needs.

title: Relates to the confidentiality and expungement of records in juvenile delinquency cases in the family court
abstract: Relates to the confidentiality and expungement of records in juvenile delinquency cases in the family court; requires certain records to be expunged automatically.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to declare March 11, 2023, to April 12, 2023, as Garifuna-American Heritage Month in the State of New York
Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim March 13-19, 2023, as Neurodiversity Celebration Week in the State of New York
Relates to state aid for home health care and hospice services to meet community need
abstract: Provides for state aid for home health care and hospice services to meet community need.

title: Relates to the organization of industrial development agencies
abstract: Relates to the organization of industrial development agencies and the definition of labor organization.

title: Relates to retention and use of funds for the beverage container assistance program
abstract: Requires the comptroller to retain, from revenues collected from unclaimed bottles, an amount equal to 2% of the total revenues collected in the prior calendar year, for use towards expanding and creating bottle redemption centers under the beverage container assistance program.

title: Relates to veterans health care
abstract: Relates to veterans' health care; creates a veteran health care review to ensure veterans and their families have access to health and mental health treatment, including for post-traumatic stress disorder, depression, anxiety, military sexual trauma, reproductive and mental health conditions, and suicide prevention.

title: Requires high schools to carry and have a trained employee to administer opioid antagonists
abstract: Requires high schools to carry and have a trained employee to administer opioid antagonists during all school hours and after school activities.

title: Exempts certain public construction projects from certain restrictions
abstract: Exempts the city of New York, the city school district of the city of New York, the New York city industrial development agency, the New York city health and hospitals corporation, or the New York city housing authority in connection with construction contracts that have an estimated cost of no less than five million dollars or is subject to an owner-controlled insurance program for projects from requirements regarding application to a particular insurance company, agent or broker.

title: Requires allergen labeling for prepackaged foods
abstract: Requires every food establishment to label all prepackaged food with a written notification on the package or on a label attached to the package identifying all ingredients and labeling for major food allergens in such form and manner as required pursuant to the federal Food Allergen Labeling and Consumer Protection Act of 2004, as amended.

title: Requires a personal use pharmaceutical disposal system be provided at the time of dispensing an opioid prescription
abstract: Requires a personal use pharmaceutical disposal system be provided at the time of dispensing an opioid prescription at no cost to the ultimate user of such prescribed opioid.

title: Authorizes a study on lithium-ion battery fires and prevention
abstract: Authorizes a study on lithium-ion battery fires and prevention to review the severity of lithium-ion battery fires, including what specific components of the battery causes severe fires; examine the effectiveness of lithium fireproof blankets on such fires; examine the current measures of safety implemented by fire departments across New York in relation to lithium-ion battery fires; requires a report to the governor and the legislature; makes related provisions.

title: Relates to management, development, and funding of the commercial shellfish aquaculture industry
abstract: Relates to the management, development, and funding of the commercial shellfish aquaculture industry; establishes a director of aquacultural and maricultural resources position in the department of agriculture and markets.

title: Authorizes cities and towns, except N.Y. city, to establish community housing funds
abstract: Authorizes cities and towns, except a city with a population of one million or more, to establish community housing funds; authorizes such cities and towns to impose a real estate transfer tax with revenues to be deposited in such funds; makes related provisions.

title: Relates to the definition of manual worker
abstract: Relates to the definition of manual worker; provides such worker's primary duty is to engage in physical labor.

title: Imposes certain brownfield remediation site work requirements to be eligible for the tangible property tax credit associated with brownfield redevelopment
abstract: Imposes prevailing wage requirements for certain brownfield remediation site work to be eligible to receive the tangible property tax credit associated with brownfield redevelopment.

title: Relates to one-day marriage officiants
abstract: Provides that an applicant for a one-day marriage officiant license must apply for such license in the same town or city clerk's office that issued the marriage license for the couple to be married.

title: Requires certain for-hire vehicles to install and maintain an interior rear-facing video camera
abstract: Requires certain for-hire vehicles o install and maintain an interior rear-facing video camera.

title: Extends provisions which authorize the town of Islip to lease certain lands to a business corporation
abstract: Extends provisions which authorize the town of Islip to lease certain lands to a business corporation.

title: Relates to the distribution of appropriations for humanitarian aid including short term shelter services to migrant individuals and families
abstract: Provides that the comptroller shall examine and audit all state or federal funds appropriated or received for the humanitarian aid including short term shelter services to migrant individuals and families, including costs associated with humanitarian emergency response and relief centers for individuals entering short term shelter on or after April 1, 2022 in New York city or any other municipality in New York state.

title: Requires the Catholic Archdiocese follow certain procedures during the consolidation or merger of churches
abstract: Requires the Catholic Archdiocese follow certain procedures during the consolidation or merger of churches including requiring a vote by the parish councils and trustees of the consolidating or merging churches.

title: Includes information on congenital heart defect births in the informational leaflets required to be given to maternity patients
abstract: Includes information on congenital heart defect births in the informational leaflets required to be given to maternity patients by hospitals and birth centers.

title: Relates to missing and exploited women and children
abstract: Establishes a missing persons unit within the division of state police; adds women to the responsibility of the missing and exploited children clearinghouse; provides that by January first, two-thousand twenty-five included in the curriculum for the training of law enforcement shall be missing and exploited women and missing and exploited women and children of color and indigenous descent; requires the reporting duties of law enforcement departments to include missing women, in addition to missing children and vulnerable adults; relates to the missing and exploited women and children clearinghouse fund; relates to the gift for missing and exploited women and children clearinghouse fund.

title: Relates to certain rates of payment for services provided by assisted living programs
abstract: Provides that such rates of payment shall be updated to reflect the most current mean price for freestanding residential health care facilities with less than three hundred beds each time that the cost basis of residential health care facility rates is updated.

title: Relates to the purchase of apparatus, materials, equipment and supplies
abstract: Relates to the purchase of apparatus, materials, equipment and supplies; excludes contracts for services related to the installation, maintenance or repair of apparatus, materials, equipment and supplies from such purchasing authority.

title: Relates to enacting the "N.Y. state digital equity plan act"
abstract: Relates to enacting the "N.Y. state digital equity plan act"; requires the division of broadband access to develop a state digital equity plan to increase broadband access to underserved populations by January 1, 2025.

title: Clarifies the definition of persons with a disability for purposes of the definition of special populations
abstract: Clarifies the definition of persons with a disability for purposes of the definition of special populations to include people with a mental health diagnosis, people on the office of mental health caseload, people with a intellectual, developmental or cognitive diagnosis, people with physical disability or mobility impairment, and people with a sensorial disability diagnosis.

title: Relates to death benefits for NYC transit authority members
abstract: Provides an option for beneficiaries of NYC transit authority members to receive a lump sum equal to the pension reserve where a member who is eligible for a service retirement dies prior to filing for retirement.

title: Enacts the HOPE pilot program; appropriation
abstract: Enacts the HOPE pilot program; allows households to apply for multiple food and anti-poverty benefits simultaneously online; enables families to work with nonprofit and government agencies to enact action plans to boost their long-term self-sufficiency.

title: Requires disclosure of annual employment reports for certain non-charitable, non-profit entities
abstract: Requires disclosure to the department of audit and control of annual employment reports for non-charitable, non-profit entities that are qualified as an exempt organization or entity by the United States Treasury under I.R.C. 501(c)(3) and (4) and that receives more than twenty-five percent of their total annual revenue from state funds.

title: Relates to a report on the distribution of state highway funding by region
abstract: Directs the department of transportation to issue a report on the distribution of state highway funding by region and to develop a formula for future distribution; requires the commissioner of transportation shall cause to be performed an evaluation of the preventative maintenance of state highways and bridges in each department of transportation region; makes related provisions.

title: Relates to registration of mortgages in default
abstract: Modifies the cap on the registration fee for the registration of residential mortgages in default which may be imposed by a local law, ordinance or resolution.

title: Authorizes the Chabad of Islip Township Inc to receive retroactive real property tax exempt status
abstract: Authorizes the Chabad of Islip Township Inc to receive retroactive real property tax exempt status for the 2022--2023 assessment rolls.

title: Defines bicycles with electric assist and establishes regulations for such bicycles
abstract: Establishes regulations for such bicycles with electric assist.

title: Relates to certain housing accomodations
abstract: Provides that when a housing accommodation has been vacated after continuous tenancy or occupancy of ten years or more prior to vacancy, and the owner has submitted documentation to the division demonstrating restoration of the unit, the new legal regulated rent shall be the rent agreed to by the owner and first tenant after such restoration and reserved in a lease or other rental agreement; makes related provisions.

title: Relates to adult vaccination reporting requirements
abstract: Requires a health care provider who administers an immunization to a person nineteen years of age or older to report such information to the department of health or to a regional health information organization unless such person objects to such reporting.

title: Provides for crediting of probationary service
abstract: Provides for crediting of probationary service when a person appointed provisionally in accordance with section sixty-five of the civil service law receives a permanent appointment to the same title.

title: Relates to establishing speed limits N.Y. city
abstract: Relates to establishing speed limits in cities with populations in excess of one million people by easing restrictions so cities can establish speed limits below twenty miles per hour.

title: Extends the effectiveness of certain provisions of law relating to excess medical malpractice insurance
abstract: Extends the effectiveness of certain provisions of law relating to excess medical malpractice insurance.

title: Relates to waiving application fees for individuals who certify they are unemployed
abstract: Waives application fees for individuals who certify to the state civil service department that they are unemployed; removes provisions requiring an individual also be primarily responsible for the support of a household or receiving public assistance.

title: Authorizes an occupancy tax in the town of Skaneateles
abstract: Authorizes an occupancy tax in the town of Skaneateles, not to exceed five percent of the per diem rental rate for each room.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim May 2023, as Be Kind to Animals Month in the State of New York
Authorizes the county of Nassau assessor to accept an application for a real property tax exemption from the East Meadow Fire District
abstract: Authorizes the county of Nassau assessor to accept an application for a real property tax exemption from the East Meadow Fire District with respect to the 2022-2023 assessment roll for all of the 2022-2023 school taxes and all of the 2022 general taxes.

title: Relates to alternative forms of identification for renters insurance
abstract: Relates to alternative forms of identification for renters insurance, including a municipal identification card, or other state or local government-issued identification card, or a notarized copy of the rental lease signed by the property owner, the property management firm and the insured.

title: Relates to amendments to transportation contracts for the purpose of zero-emission school bus compliance
abstract: Provides for amendments to transportation contracts for the purpose of zero emission school bus requirement compliance.

title: Authorizes an occupancy tax in the village of Skaneateles
abstract: Authorizes an occupancy tax in the village of Skaneateles, not to exceed five percent of the per diem rental rate for each room.

title: Relates to residency requirements for village justice of Laurel Hollow
abstract: Relates to residency requirements for village justice and/or associate justice of Laurel Hollow and allows the village board of trustees of Laurel Hollow to appoint a person who resides in the town of Huntington, county of Suffolk.

title: Relates to recoverability of sovereign debt
abstract: Relates to New York state's support of international debt relief initiatives for certain developing countries.

title: Relates to certain charitable annuities
abstract: Provides that certain charitable annuities may be unisex in nature and shall be computed on the basis of currently applicable mortality tables for calculating the reserves for individual annuities; makes related provisions.

title: Relates to child care assistance under the child care block grant
abstract: Provides that a caregiver shall be eligible for assistance for child care under the child care block grant regardless of the hours the parent actually works.

title: Mandates a code of ethics to be applied to school district employees in the prohibition of the use of school resources for personal gain
abstract: Mandates the trustees of common school districts and the board of education of every union free school district to establish a code of ethics to be applied to the prohibition of the use of school resources for personal gain.

title: Relates to prohibiting the acquisition or transfer of agricultural land by foreign adversaries
abstract: Relates to prohibiting the acquisition or transfer of agricultural land by foreign adversaries after January 1, 2024; provides that such prohibition will not apply to any interest in agricultural land held by a foreign adversary prior to such date or any federally recognized Indian tribe or its government units and enterprises; defines terms.

title: Creates the human cloning prohibition act
abstract: Creates the human cloning prohibition act which makes it unlawful for any person or entity, public or private, to intentionally or knowingly perform or attempt to perform human cloning; defines terms; makes exceptions; imposes penalties for violations.

title: Expands the provisions of the urban development action area act
abstract: Expands the provisions of the urban development action area act by amending the definition of municipality and eligible area to include any city instead of specifically applying to a city with one million or more.

title: Relates to requiring the city of New York and counties outside the city of New York to develop a plan to assist the state in achieving its goals for the transition to zero-emissions vehicles
abstract: Relates to requiring the city of New York and counties outside the city of New York to develop a plan to assist the state in achieving its goals for the transition to zero-emissions vehicles; requires such city and counties to include in such plan the number, location and timeframe for installation of electric vehicle stations and a procurement plan to transition to zero-emissions vehicles.

title: Relates to manufactured home parks
abstract: Removes certain requirements for prospective purchasers of manufactured home parks.

title: Extends the county of Westchester's additional one percent rate of sales and compensating use tax
abstract: Extends the county of Westchester's additional one percent rate of sales and compensating use tax until November 30th, 2025.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim May 26, 2023, as Heat Awareness Day in the State of New York
Grants the legislature to have an equal role with the governor in the budget process
abstract: Provides that the Governor's annual budget proposal to the Legislature shall include statements of any new legislation, amendment to legislation, or limitation on the effect of any legislation contained in the budget; makes related provisions granting the legislature an equal role with the governor in the budget process.

title: Authorizes the Grace Gospel Church of Suffolk to file an application for retroactive real property tax exemption
abstract: Authorizes the Grace Gospel Church of Suffolk, Inc. to file an application for retroactive real property tax exemption for the 2020--2021 and 2021--2022 assessment rolls.

title: DEBT SERVICE FUND--GENERAL DEBT SERVICE FUND
abstract: Makes appropriations for the support of government - State Debt Budget.

title: Authorizes United States citizens currently residing outside the United States whose last residence was in NY to vote in certain federal elections
abstract: Authorizes United States citizens currently residing outside the United States whose last residence in the United States was in the state of New York to vote in certain federal elections.

title: Commemorating the 25th Anniversary of the Endicott Performing Arts Center on September 23, 2023
Relates to effectiveness of judgments entered by the New York City environmental control board; repealer
abstract: Removes the eight year expiration for judgments entered by the New York City environmental control board.

title: Amends certain definitions relating to tobacco products and changes the minimum pack sizes for tobacco products and the tax amount for tobacco products
abstract: Amends certain definitions relating to tobacco products; changes the minimum pack sizes for tobacco products and the tax amount for tobacco products.

title: Relates to making technical corrections to ensure gender neutrality for the admission to practice law and preventing required disclosure of prior interaction with law enforcement or the criminal justice system
abstract: Relates to making technical corrections to ensure gender neutrality for the admission to practice law and preventing the character fitness questionnaire from inquiring into an applicant's prior interaction with law enforcement or the criminal justice system under certain circumstances.

title: Mourning the death of Ashur Terwilliger, distinguished citizen, and devoted member of his community
Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim September 21, 2023, as Day of Peace in the State of New York
Increases the bonding authority of the New York city housing development corporation
abstract: Increases the bonding authority of the New York city housing development corporation.

title: Amends the Hudson river park act to prohibit a heliport within the boundaries of the Hudson river park
abstract: Amends the Hudson river park act to prohibit a heliport within the boundaries of the Hudson river park; extends certain provisions relating to interim commercial recreational use in certain areas of the park.

title: Relates to strategic lawsuits against public participation and makes technical corrections
abstract: Relates to strategic lawsuits against public participation; makes technical corrections; relates to the applicability of chapter 250 of the laws of 2020 amending the civil rights law relating to actions involving public petition and participation.

title: Relates to workers' access to treatment
abstract: Allows for treatment costing less than $1,500 to be done without prior approval, and more clearly defines the list of "pre-authorized procedures" as a floor on treatment as opposed to its current status as a ceiling; allows non-network providers of testing to be compensated at the provider network rate negotiated by the carrier.

title: Relates to the effectiveness of certain provisions relating to long term care ombudsman access to assisted living facilities
abstract: Extends provisions of law relating to long term care ombudsman access to assisted living facilities.

title: Relates to prohibiting the inclusion of a confession of judgment in a contract or agreement for a financial product or service
abstract: Prohibits the inclusion of a confession of judgment in a contract or agreement for a financial product or service.

title: Provides for training and education for sustainable wage jobs and traditional and nontraditional employment in public assistance employment programs
abstract: Relates to training and education for sustainable wage jobs and traditional and non-traditional employment in public assistance employment programs.

title: Relates to the health care transformation fund
abstract: Provides that, on an annual basis, at least 25% of the moneys deposited into the health care transformation fund shall be allocated exclusively for certain community-based health care providers.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim May 15, 2023, as New York State Assembly Legislative Disabilities Awareness Day
Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim May 2023, as Wildfire Safety Awareness Month in the State of New York
Extends a term estate and makes certain other changes relating to property known as Henry Kaufmann Campgrounds in the borough of Staten Island, city of New York
abstract: Extends a term estate; makes certain other changes relating to property known as Henry Kaufmann Campgrounds in the borough of Staten Island, city of New York until September 30, 2122.

title: Commemorating the Finger Lakes' community's celebration of Lake Friendly Living, May 2023
Extends authorization for certain health care professionals licensed to practice in other jurisdictions to practice in this state in connection with an event sanctioned by the New York Road Runners
abstract: Extends authorization for certain health care professionals licensed to practice in other jurisdictions to practice in this state in connection with an event sanctioned by the New York Road Runners.

title: Repeals law permitting peremptory challenges of trial jurors
abstract: Repeals law permitting peremptory challenges of trial jurors.

title: Relates to the Grand Island Volunteer Firemen's Benevolent Association
abstract: Expands the use of foreign fire insurance premium taxes by the Grand Island Volunteer Firemen's Benevolent Association.

title: Authorizes the Good Samaritan Hospital Medical Center to file an application for exemption from real property taxes
abstract: Authorizes the Good Samaritan Hospital Medical Center to file an application for exemption from real property taxes.

title: Prohibits the establishment, incorporation, construction, or increase in capacity of for-profit nursing homes
abstract: Prohibits the public health and health planning council and the commissioner of health from approving the establishment, incorporation, construction, or increase in capacity of for-profit nursing homes.

title: Relates to allowing pharmacies to store medication in automated dispensing machines
abstract: Allows pharmacies to store medication in automated dispensing machines if a contractual agreement is in place with a nursing home or healthcare facility at such facility for the residents.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim May 9, 2023, as Fentanyl Awareness Day in the State of New York
Protects access to pharmacy services
abstract: Requires Medicaid managed care plans to reimburse retail pharmacies in an amount equal to the fee-for-service rate; allows retail pharmacies the opportunity to participate in another provider's network under the medical assistance program; prohibits pharmacy benefit managers from limiting an individual's option to receive medications from non-mail order pharmacies.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim May 14, 2023, as IgA Nephropathy Awareness Day in the State of New York
Relates to certificates of relief from disabilities
abstract: Relates to certificates of relief from disabilities issued by courts or by the department of corrections and community supervision.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim May 2023, as Maternal Depression Awareness Month in the State of New York
Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim May 15, 2023, as Police Dog Day in the State of New York
Extends provisions of law relating to the Terence Cardinal Cooke health care center
abstract: Extends provisions of law relating to the Terence Cardinal Cooke health care center until December 31, 2028.

title: Establishes protocols for the handling of stillbirths by healthcare facilities and establishing a stillbirth research database
abstract: Establishes protocols for stillbirths and a stillbirth research database.

title: Relates to decommissioning nuclear power plant discharges into the Hudson River
abstract: Provides that it shall be unlawful to discharge any radiological substance into the Hudson River in connection with the decommissioning of a nuclear power plant; provides for attorney general enforcement.

title: Relates to declaring the goal of the state of New York to source reduce, reuse, recycle, or compost no less than eighty-five percent of the solid waste generated by the year 2033
abstract: Relates to declaring the goal of the state of New York to source reduce, reuse, recycle, or compost no less than eighty-five percent of the solid waste generated by the year 2033.

title: Grants David Morse, the parent of firefighter Peyton Morse, accidental death benefits
abstract: Grants David Morse, the parent of firefighter Peyton Morse, who was employed by the city of Watertown, accidental death benefits.

title: Relates to competitive bidding requirements for certain contracts providing health related services
abstract: Nullifies certain provisions which exempted certain contracts providing health related services from competitive bidding requirements; relates to enrollment broker and conflict-free evaluation services for the Medicaid program.

title: Relates to the decriminalization of sex work; repealer
abstract: Decriminalizes certain prostitution offenses; amends provisions relating to prosecution of such offenses and vacating judgments.

title: Enacts the "stop Russian aggression act"
abstract: Provides that a state agency shall require a person that submits a bid or offer in response to a notice of procurement, or that proposes to renew an existing procurement contract with a state agency or proposes to assume the responsibility of a contractor pursuant to a procurement contract with a state agency or otherwise proposes to enter into a contract with a state agency with respect to a contract for commodities, services, construction, or contracts entered pursuant to section eight of the public buildings law or section thirty-eight of the highway law, to certify, at the time the bid is submitted or the contract is renewed or assigned, that the person or the assignee is not identified on a list that such person is doing business with or in the Russian federation and shall not be deemed a responsive bidder or offeror.

title: Relates to the designation of a veterans' liaison by all state agencies
abstract: Directs all state agencies to designate a veterans' liaison to provide information and assistance to veterans regarding benefits and services available to veterans within the various state agencies.

title: Establishes the rural suicide prevention council
abstract: Establishes the rural suicide prevention council to identify barriers to mental health and substance use treatment and prevention services and other policies, practices, resources, services, and potential legislation that aim to reduce death by suicide and suicide attempts and acknowledge the demographic and cultural differences in rural communities; makes related provisions.

title: Relates to the authority of nurse practitioners and physician assistants to prescribe certain services
abstract: Permits physician assistants to order home care services and clarify nurse practitioners' authority to order home care services.

title: Relates to confidential hearing records
abstract: Relates to confidential hearing records; authorizes attorney representing incarcerated individual in certain proceedings to obtain a copy of hearing record; prohibits redisclosure.

title: Enacts tuition-free NY to provide free tuition at SUNY, CUNY and community colleges
abstract: Makes tuition free for New York state residents at SUNY and CUNY schools and community colleges; requires state residency and employment for a period of five years after completion of academic program.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim August 2023, as Swiss-American Heritage Month in the State of New York
Relates to health care agents and proxies, decisions under the family health care decisions act and nonhospital orders not to resuscitate
abstract: Makes technical, minor and coordinating amendments regarding health care agents and proxies, decisions under the family health care decisions act, and nonhospital orders not to resuscitate.

title: Relates to medical parole
abstract: Relates to medical parole and determinations of whether a person released on medical parole is physically or cognitively incapable of presenting a danger to society.

title: Extends the effectiveness of provisions of law relating to permissible fees in connection with open end loans
abstract: Extends the effectiveness of provisions of law relating to permissible fees in connection with open end loans from June 30, 2023 until June 30, 2025.

title: Restores medical futility as a basis for DNR
abstract: Restores medical futility as a basis for DNR.

title: Relates to eligibility for medical assistance for infants up to age three
abstract: Provides eligibility for medical assistance benefits for infants up to age three.

title: Extends certain provisions relating to the boarding of out of state incarcerated individuals
abstract: Extends certain provisions relating to the boarding of out of state incarcerated individuals until September 1, 2026.

title: Requires that applications submitted by individuals with developmental disabilities for eligibility determinations and service authorizations be processed in a timely manner
abstract: Requires that applications submitted by individuals with developmental disabilities for eligibility determinations and service authorizations be processed in a timely manner; provides that where such application is not reasonably clear or omits required information or where the office reasonably suspects fraud based on specific information available, the office shall notify the applicant in writing requesting the specific information needed to process such application; removes reporting requirements.

title: Mourning the death of Judith Heumann, tireless leader and advocate for the Disability Rights Movement
Relates to the operation of a motor vehicle by deaf or hard of hearing drivers
abstract: Relates to the operation of a motor vehicle by deaf or hard of hearing drivers; provides that no deaf or hard of hearing driver shall be required to wear a hearing aid while operating a motor vehicle provided that their vehicle is equipped with a full view mirror.

title: Relates to notifying certain individuals of their ability to seek an extreme risk protection order
abstract: Relates to notifying certain individuals who apply for or are issued an order of protection or a temporary order of protection, of their ability to apply for an extreme risk protection order.

title: Prohibits employment discrimination against persons whose criminal charges have been adjourned in contemplation of dismissal
abstract: Prohibits employment discrimination against persons whose criminal charges have been adjourned in contemplation of dismissal.

title: Relates to the removal of incarcerated individuals diagnosed with mental illness to a residential mental health treatment unit
abstract: Relates to the removal of incarcerated individuals diagnosed with mental illness to a residential mental health treatment unit.

title: Relates to hotel and motel taxes in Ulster county
abstract: Relates to hotel and motel taxes in Ulster county and to the deposit of revenue resulting from the imposition of such tax.

title: Relates to prohibiting discrimination against police and firefighters injured in the line of duty
abstract: Relates to prohibiting discrimination against police and firefighters injured in the line of duty; prohibits the City of New York and the NYC police and fire departments from penalizing members injured in the line of duty in any manner including transfer, denial of promotion, dismissal or any other actions related to a member's medical leave.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim June 2023, as Dairy Month in the State of New York
Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim May 2023, as Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis Awareness Month in the State of New York
Removes residency requirements for Jefferson county assistant district attorneys
abstract: Removes residency requirements for Jefferson county assistant district attorneys.

title: Honoring The Reverend Joseph Salerno upon the occasion of his retirement after 43 years of distinguished service as an ordained Catholic priest
Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim October 2023, as Rett Syndrome Awareness Month in the State of New York
Authorizes the Friendship Engine and Hose Company to file an application for exemption from real property taxes
abstract: Authorizes the Friendship Engine and Hose Company to file an application for exemption from real property taxes with respect to the 2021-2022 and 2022-2023 assessment rolls.

title: Relates to contributions from persons doing or seeking business dealings with a state governmental entity
abstract: Relates to contributions from persons doing or seeking business dealings with a state governmental entity.

title: Authorizes collaborative programs for community paramedicine services
abstract: Authorizes collaborative programs for community paramedicine services as part of the hospital-home care-physician collaboration program.

title: Relates to Suffolk county sales and compensating use taxes
abstract: Extends the authority of the county of Suffolk to impose an additional one percent of sales and compensating use tax.

title: Grants retroactive tier IV membership in the New York city employees' retirement system to Ryan D. O'Connor
abstract: Grants retroactive tier IV membership in the New York city employees' retirement system to Ryan D. O'Connor.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim March 22-28, 2023, as Doula Week in the State of New York, in conjunction with the observance of World Doula Week
Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim March 2023, as American Red Cross Month in the State of New York
Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim May 17, 2023, as Dyslexia Awareness Day in the State of New York
Authorizes the New York state and local employees' retirement system to accept an application for disability retirement benefits from Andrew Reilly, Jr.
abstract: Authorizes the New York state and local employees' retirement system to accept an application for disability retirement benefits from Andrew Reilly, Jr.

title: Provides senior citizens shall be entitled to use any park, recreational facility or historic site without the imposition of any fee or other charge
abstract: Provides senior citizens shall be entitled to use any park, recreational facility or historic site without the imposition of any fee or other charge; defines senior citizens as persons 62 years of age or older.

title: Mourning the death of Dr. Nelson Torre, renowned physician, distinguished citizen, and devoted member of his community
Authorizes the county of Steuben to offer an optional twenty-five year retirement plan to deputy sheriff Erica M. McCoy
abstract: Authorizes the county of Steuben to offer an optional twenty-five year retirement plan to Erica M. McCoy, a deputy sheriff employed by such county.

title: Mourning the death of Caroline Joyce Whitby, distinguished citizen and devoted member of her community
Mourning the death of Chief Warrant Officer Christopher Robert Eramo
Relates to police staffing at certain parks
abstract: Relates to police staffing at certain parks.

title: Expands health care services provided by telehealth
abstract: Expands health care services provided by telehealth to include services delivered through a facility licensed under article twenty-eight of the public health law that is eligible to be designated or has received a designation as a federally qualified health center, including those facilities that are also licensed under article thirty-one or article thirty-two of the mental hygiene law.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim May 18, 2023, as Haitian Unity Day in the State of New York
Establishes regional minimum hourly base reimbursement rates for home care aides
abstract: Requires the commissioner of health to establish regional minimum hourly base reimbursement rates for home care aides.

title: Relates to kinship guardianship of children whose parental rights were surrendered or terminated
abstract: Relates to kinship guardianship of children whose parental rights were surrendered or terminated.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim May 20, 2023, as Transatlantic Flight Day in the State of New York
Relates to an action for willful neglect of residential real property and treble damages
abstract: Relates to an action for willful neglect of residential real property and treble damages; requires landlords to finance the tenant's temporary relocation.

title: Relates to the maximum number of employees that a minority and women-owned business enterprise may have during a declared state disaster emergency or other emergency or critical need
abstract: Relates to the maximum number of employees that a minority and women-owned business enterprise may have during a declared state disaster emergency or other emergency or critical need; changes such maximum from three hundred employees to three hundred employees who work thirty or more hours per week over the period of fifty-two weeks for a total of 1,560 hours worked.

title: Requires the state police to have a local liaison within the New York state intelligence center who alerts municipalities of certain suspected domestic extremism threats
abstract: Requires the state police to have a local liaison within the New York state intelligence center who alerts municipalities of certain suspected domestic extremism threats and receives information from local law enforcement regarding domestic extremism.

title: Expands the purposes of certain firemen's benevolent associations
abstract: Permits an incorporated firemen's benevolent association created by act of the legislature to include the following in the purposes of the association without an additional act of the legislature; to promote friendly association for the betterment of the members of the corporation; to promote relations between the members of the corporation and the local community; to provide relief, aid and assistance to those members and their families who are injured, disabled or indigent; to provide for the health and safety of the members of the corporation; to maintain suitable headquarters for the members of the corporation; to acquire real and personal property such as may be necessary for the purposes set forth in this section; to study and disseminate among the members of the corporation the most efficient manner of fighting fires; and to promote the volunteer fire service within the territory now served or which may hereafter be served by the fire department associated with such corporation.

title: Allowing for child protective services workers to complete certain required training through distance learning methods
abstract: Allows for child protective services workers to complete the required training on the fundamentals of child protection through distance learning methods beginning April 1, 2024.

title: Directs the metropolitan transportation authority to rename the Ozone Park-Lefferts Blvd subway station the Lefferts Blvd-Little Guyana subway station
abstract: Directs the metropolitan transportation authority to rename the Ozone Park-Lefferts Blvd station the Lefferts Blvd-Little Guyana station.

title: Relates to the New York state health care quality and cost containment commission
abstract: Provides that the New York state health care quality and cost containment commission shall: evaluate each mandated benefit; investigate current practices of health plans with regard to the mandated benefit; investigate the potential premium impact of repealing and/or modifying the mandated benefits on all segments of the insurance market; hold at least two public hearings; and submit a report to the legislature; makes related provisions.

title: Directs the department of health to conduct a study on the number of accidents involving non-electric bikes, electric bikes and electric scooters resulting in an individual receiving emergency medical services
abstract: Directs the department of health to conduct a study on the number of accidents involving non-electric bikes, electric bikes and electric scooters resulting in an individual receiving emergency medical services at a hospital.

title: Allows Tammy Sciavillo, wife of deceased firefighter Vito Sciavillo, to file an application for continuation of state health insurance benefits
abstract: Allows Tammy Sciavillo, wife of deceased firefighter Vito Sciavillo, who was employed by the Greenville Fire Department in the county of Westchester, to file an application for continuation of state health insurance benefits.

title: Allows the use of electronic notices and documents in premium finance transactions
abstract: Allows the use of electronic notices and documents in premium finance transactions; sets guidelines for consent to the use of electronic notices and documents.

title: Enacts the Syracuse regional airport authority design-build act
abstract: Enacts the "Syracuse regional airport authority design-build act" allowing for the Syracuse regional airport authority to enter into a design-build contract for the installation, construction, demolition, reconstruction, excavation, rehabilitation, repair, and renovation in connection with a landside improvement project, terminal operational enhancement and aircraft deicing facility located in the towns of Cicero, De Witt and Salina at the Syracuse Hancock International Airport.

title: Relates to obtaining military credit for members of the New York state and local police and fire retirement system
abstract: Relates to obtaining military credit for members of the New York state and local police and fire retirement system; provides that the calculation for military credit shall be equal to the product of the number of years of military service being claimed and three percent of such member's compensation earned during the twelve months of credited service.

title: Relates to the tier of members of a retirement system who retire from such system and later rejoin such retirement system
abstract: Provides that members of a retirement systems who retire from such system and later rejoin the retirement system are reinstated as a member of the same tier they were in prior to retirement.

title: Relates to increasing the discretionary purchasing threshold for certified minority and women-owned business enterprises in New York city
abstract: Increases the discretionary purchasing threshold for certified minority and women-owned business enterprises in New York city to $1.5 million.

title: Provides a tax credit to certain volunteer firefighters and volunteer ambulance workers
abstract: Provides a tax credit to certain volunteer firefighters and volunteer ambulance workers under certain circumstances.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim May 21-27, 2023, as Military Animal Appreciation Week, and to honor these animals for their service
Allows the department of financial services to have additional oversight of banks and insurance companies that are not currently licensed
abstract: Allows the department of financial services to have additional oversight of banks and insurance companies that are not currently licensed in this state; provides penalties for violations.

title: Celebrating the life of Tina Turner, legendary performer and musical icon hailed as the Queen of Rock and Roll
Commemorating the 30th Anniversary of Turning Stone Resort Casino
Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim September 17-23, 2023, as Constitution Week in the State of New York
Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim May 2023, as Water Safety Awareness Month in the State of New York
Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim May 2, 2023, as Domestic Violence Awareness and Prevention Day in the State of New York
Establishes the drinking water quality institute to make recommendations to the department of health relating to ensuring the safety of potable water
abstract: Establishes the drinking water quality institute to make recommendations to the department of health relating to ensuring the safety of potable water.

title: Eliminates rent increase for major capital improvements
abstract: Eliminates rent increase for major capital improvements.

title: Enacts the "New York State Resident Experience Act of 2023"
abstract: Requires state agencies to measure, collect, report, and utilize metrics relating to the experience of residents interacting with agencies to improve provision of services to the people of the state, and to provide a biannual report to the governor and legislature.

title: Establishes an operation SNUG program
abstract: Establishes an "operation SNUG" program within the division of criminal justice services which provides grant awards to reduce, prevent or respond to gun violence.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim May 2023, as Tennis Month in the State of New York
Relates to requiring governmental entities to implement multifactor authentication for local and remote network access
abstract: Requires governmental entities to implement multifactor authentication for local and remote network access; requires public websites to encrypt all exchanges and to comply with privacy standards.

title: Relates to authorizing the county of Otsego to impose an additional mortgage recording tax of 25 cents per $100 of principal debt
abstract: Authorizes the county of Otsego to impose an additional mortgage recording tax of 25 cents per $100 of principal debt or obligation.

title: Extends the authorization for Otsego county to impose additional rates of sales and compensating use taxes
abstract: Extends the authorization for Otsego county to impose additional rates of sales and compensating use taxes.

title: Relates to collecting data regarding alternative living arrangements for children who are at a substantial risk of maltreatment
