title: Relates to authorizing the manufacture of beer, spirits, cider, wine and mead at the community college in Broome county and the Cornell university college of agriculture
abstract: Authorizes the manufacture of beer, spirits, cider, wine and mead at the community college in Broome county and the Cornell university, acting on behalf of the New York state college of agriculture and life sciences and the New York state agricultural experiment station.

title: Relates to the availability of technical assistance grants in brownfield site remedial programs
abstract: Relates to the availability of technical assistance grants in brownfield site remedial programs; provides that the commissioner of environmental conservation shall provide grants to the New York city community board with jurisdiction over the site or to any not-for-profit corporation exempt from taxation under section 501(c)(3) of the internal revenue code at any site which may be affected by a brownfield site remedial program.

title: Relates to the practice of physicians licensed in another state or territory of the United States pursuant to a reciprocal agreement
abstract: Authorizes physicians licensed in another state or territory of the United States to practice time-limited follow-up care via telehealth in NYS pursuant to a reciprocal agreement; requires annual authorization.

title: Authorizes renewals to the court of appeals based on a subsequent change in law
abstract: Authorizes renewals in certain instances by an aggrieved party to the court of appeals based on a subsequent change in law.

title: Establishes a brand owner's license
abstract: Allows a person with a federal basic permit to apply to the liquor authority for a brand owner's license; establishes a fee therefor.

title: Relates to reciprocity between the state and New York City for businesses that are certified as minority and women-owned business enterprises
abstract: Authorizes the director of the division of minority and women's business development and the mayor of the city of New York to enter into a memorandum of understanding to allow reciprocity between the state and New York City for businesses that are certified as minority and women-owned business enterprises.

title: Provides grounds for attachment and relates to procedures where employees may hold shareholders of non-publicly traded corporations personally liable for wage theft
abstract: Provides grounds for attachment; relates to procedures where employees may hold shareholders of non-publicly traded corporations personally liable for wage theft; relates to rights for victims of wage theft to hold the ten members with the largest ownership interests in a company personally liable for wage theft; relates to penalties for certain wage violations.

title: Authorizes county highway superintendents to rent road machinery from any city, town or village and authorizes town highway superintendents to contract for the use of town machinery, tools and equipment
abstract: Authorizes county highway superintendents to rent road machinery from any city, town or village; authorizes town highway superintendents to contract for the use of certain services and town machinery, tools and equipment with another municipality, district corporation, school district, community college or any unit of the state university.

title: Establishes a moratorium on the building or placing of any permanent or semi-permanent wind turbines in certain areas within the jurisdiction and control of New York State
abstract: Establishes a moratorium on the building or placing of any permanent or semi-permanent wind turbines in certain areas within the jurisdiction and control of New York State including the waters of Lake Erie or Lake Ontario.

title: Expands who can hold membership in an adult-use cooperative license
abstract: Expands who can hold membership in a licensed adult-use cooperative to include persons other than natural persons.

title: Prohibits local government action which prevents the enforcement of federal laws
abstract: Requires that local governments comply with a detainer request issued by a federal law enforcement agency; requires that such local government not interfere with the ability of federal law enforcement officials to conduct enforcement activities at municipal or county jails in furtherance of their duty to enforce federal laws.

title: Permits a close friend to make an anatomical gift of a decedent's body
abstract: Permits a close friend to make an anatomical gift of a decedent's body.

title: Relates to the suspension and revocation of certain learner's permits and the impounding of an operator's motor vehicle upon certain circumstances
abstract: Provides for the suspension and revocation of certain learner's permits, and the return of numbered plates and registration suspensions in certain circumstances.

title: Allows prospective tenants of rent controlled or rent stabilized housing accommodations to request the complete rent history of such housing accommodations
abstract: Allows prospective tenants of rent controlled or rent stabilized housing accommodations to request the complete rent history of such housing accommodations.

title: Directs the commissioner of transportation to conduct a study on the effects of the congestion surcharge imposed in lower Manhattan
abstract: Directs the commissioner of transportation to conduct a study on the effects of the congestion surcharge imposed in lower Manhattan, including impacts to residents and businesses in the congestion zone, and any reduction in emissions resulting from such surcharge; requires a report on the findings of such study to be submitted no later than 2 years after the effective date.

title: Amends the membership of the New York city water board to include the five borough presidents
abstract: Amends the membership of the New York city water board to include the five borough presidents, the mayor or a public member appointed by the mayor and a public member appointed by the governor who has experience in the science of water resource development.

title: Expands the description of certain services which are not prohibited by statutes governing the practice of nursing
abstract: Expands the description of certain services which are not prohibited by statutes governing the practice of nursing, including direct support staff to nurses.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim November 2023, as Hospice and Palliative Care Awareness Month in the State of New York
Relates to providing notice to elected officials upon receipt of application for a cannabis retail dispensary or on-site consumption license
abstract: Requires the cannabis control board to provide notice to state legislative representatives upon receipt of application for an adult-use cannabis retail dispensary or on-site consumption license in their district.

title: Establishes a procedure for appointing a president or chairperson upon a vacancy of such position and corrects certain gendered language
abstract: Establishes a procedure for appointing a president or chairperson upon a vacancy of such position; corrects certain gendered language.

title: Requires the use of local labor to qualify for certain real property tax exemptions relating to business investment and the installation of certain energy systems
abstract: Requires the use of local labor to qualify for certain real property tax exemptions relating to business investment and the installation of certain energy systems; defines local labor; provides for exceptions from the local labor requirement in certain circumstances where local labor is not qualified to perform the work or available.

title: Congratulating the Ward Melville High School Science Olympiad Team upon the occasion of winning the Eastern Long Island Regional Science Olympiad Tournament on January 28, 2023
Relates to a period of probable usefulness for the lease of a parking garage by the city of White Plains
abstract: Provides a period of probable usefulness for the financing of a leasehold interest in a certain parking garage by the city of White Plains, of twenty years.

title: Expands prison work release program eligibility and participation
abstract: Expands prison work release program eligibility and participation.

title: Authorizes Frank R. Smith to receive accidental performance of duty disability retirement benefits
abstract: Authorizes Frank Smith, a New York city police detective, to receive accidental performance of duty disability retirement benefits for illness suffered as a result of exposure to disease during undercover assignments as a member of the police department of the city of New York.

title: Relates to restricted clinical laboratory licenses
abstract: Updates the scope of restricted clinical laboratory licenses to include the practice of molecular testing.

title: Relates to purchasing restrictions
abstract: Relates to purchasing restrictions and persons boycotting American allies.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim May 21, 2023, as Telepractice Awareness Day in the State of New York
Requires employers to pay employees who are manual workers no less than semi-monthly
abstract: Requires employers to pay employees who are manual workers no less than semi-monthly; provides that there is no civil penalty against an employer by an employee who unknowingly violates such provisions; authorizes the commissioner to levy a civil penalty against employers who violate such provisions.

title: Relates to promotions of lieutenants
abstract: Relates to promotions of lieutenants; grants a lieutenant who has served for a period of fifteen years the same rights in respect to the police pension fund as a lieutenant detailed to act as lieutenant commander detective squad or lieutenant special assignment.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim November 11, 2023, as Lung Cancer Screening Awareness Day in the State of New York
Relates to the purchase of zero-emission capable hybrid and zero-emission buses; and the procurement of electric-powered buses, vehicles or other related equipment
abstract: Relates to the purchase of zero-emission capable hybrid and zero-emission buses; relates to the procurement of electric-powered buses, vehicles or other related equipment; provides for the repeal of such provisions upon the expiration thereof.

title: Relates to the administration of certain immunizations by a pharmacist or a certified nurse practitioner
abstract: Authorizes the administration of the mpox vaccine by a pharmacist or a certified nurse practitioner.

title: Relates to regulatory flexibility for small businesses
abstract: Relates to consideration of the potential impacts of a proposed rule on small businesses and local governments; requires additional efforts to notify interested small businesses or local governments and/or organizations representing their interests of proposed rules.

title: Requires the ethics commission of the unified court system to post judges' annual financial disclosures on the commission's website
abstract: Requires the ethics commission of the unified court system to post each state-paid judge's annual financial disclosures on the ethics commission's public website for five years beginning with filings made on January 1, 2018.

title: Relates to independent utilization review agents
abstract: Directs the establishment of a pool of utilization review agents from health services specialties; requires impartiality; provides for the appointment of agents from the pool; requires random review of utilization review records; prohibits conflicts of interest.

title: Establishes environmental standards for lead in ambient air and lead contamination in soils and lead dust on floors and window sills
abstract: Establishes environmental standards for lead in ambient air and lead contamination in soils and lead dust on floors and window sills.

title: Requires Richmond County to establish a hazards annex to the Richmond county emergency management plan for certain fixed energy storage facilities
abstract: Requires Richmond County to establish a hazards annex to the Richmond county emergency management plan for certain fixed energy storage facilities to ensures that Richmond County is prepared to deal with the potential dangers, such as high-temperature chemical fires, associated with large scale energy storage facilities, including those placed or planned to be placed in assembly district 63.

title: Commemorating the 79th Anniversary of the D-Day Invasion on June 6, 2023
Relates to requiring principals to notify co-trustees and co-beneficiaries of the signing of a power of attorney
abstract: Requires principals to notify co-trustees and co-beneficiaries of the signing of a power of attorney including the identity of the agent where the agent is not a co-trustee or co-beneficiary.

title: Creates a registration and licensing process for limited-scope radiographers
abstract: Creates a registration and licensing process for limited-scope radiographers who shall be permitted to practice radiography under the direct supervision of a licensed practitioner at urgent care centers.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim November 13 - 21, 2023, as Hunger and Homelessness Awareness Week in the State of New York
Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim October 2023, as Czech-American Heritage Month in the State of New York
Relates to the licensure of athletic trainers; and adds athletic trainers to the list of persons and officials required to report cases of suspected child abuse or maltreatment
abstract: Relates to the licensure of athletic trainers; adds athletic trainers to the list of persons and officials required to report cases of suspected child abuse or maltreatment.

title: Prohibits a person convicted of violating "Buster's Law" from owning or possessing a companion animal
abstract: Prohibits a person convicted of "Buster's Law" from owning or possessing a companion animal unless authorized by court order, after appropriate psychiatric or psychological testing.

title: Relates to the automatic sealing of certain convictions
abstract: Provides for automatic sealing of certain convictions after a certain passage of time from either imposition of sentence, release from parole or probation, and if the defendant does not have a current charge pending; excludes certain offenses; permits access by certain persons.

title: Provides treatment for sexually transmitted diseases to minors without a parent's or guardian's consent
abstract: Provides treatment for sexually transmitted diseases to minors without a parent's or guardian's consent.

title: Authorizes the commissioner of general services to transfer and convey certain unappropriated state land to the town of Romulus
abstract: Authorizes the commissioner of general services to transfer and convey certain unappropriated state land to the town of Romulus for the purposes of operating and maintaining a water treatment plant.

title: Requires camps and youth sports programs to establish an automated external defibrillator implementation plan
abstract: Requires camps and youth sports programs to establish an automated external defibrillator implementation plan; requires camps and youth sports programs to have at least one person trained to use such defibrillators at camps, games and practices.

title: Relates to establishing certain cultural and religious observances as school holidays in certain districts
abstract: Relates to establishing Eid al-Fitr, Eid al-Adha, Diwali, Tihar, Bandi Chhor Divas and Onam as school holidays.

title: Clarifies provisions regarding health care professional applications and terminations
abstract: Clarifies provisions regarding health care professional applications and terminations.

title: Congratulating Frank Borelli, Jr. upon the occasion of his retirement as Town Councilman in Clarkstown, New York
Commending the Veterans Outreach Center upon the occasion of celebrating its 50th Anniversary
Requires proposed amendment to the constitution or other question provided by law to be submitted to a statewide vote be submitted to the people for their approval in plain language
abstract: Requires a proposed amendment to the constitution or other question provided by law to be submitted to a statewide vote be submitted to the people for their approval in plain language which is deemed to be no higher than an eighth grade reading level.

title: Relates to the establishment of a single computerized state DNA identification index and requires municipalities to expunge any DNA record stored in a municipal DNA identification index
abstract: Relates to the establishment of a single computerized state DNA identification index; requires municipalities to expunge any DNA record stored in a municipal DNA identification index.

title: Enacts the democracy preservation act
abstract: Enacts the democracy preservation act; prohibits contributions by foreign-influenced business entities; requires certification.

title: Commending Alan Dagistino upon the occasion of being named the 2022 Veteran of the Year by the Rockland County Veterans Coordinating Council
Relates to information concerning services for human trafficking victims in lactation rooms
abstract: Relates to information concerning services for human trafficking victims in lactation rooms in Port of New York Authority terminals.

title: Extends the authorization for the county of Schoharie to impose a county recording tax on obligation secured by a mortgage on real property
abstract: Extends the authorization for the county of Schoharie to impose a county recording tax on obligation secured by a mortgage on real property.

title: Enhances the scope of health equity impact assessments to require consideration of reproductive health services and maternal health care
abstract: Enhances the scope of health equity impact assessments to require consideration of reproductive health services and maternal health care.

title: Names a portion of route 202 in the town of Yorktown the  Captain Kenneth Sgroi Memorial Highway
abstract: Names a portion of route 202 in the town of Yorktown the "Captain Kenneth Sgroi Memorial Highway".

title: Prohibits unlawful dissemination or publication of intimate images created by digitization and of sexually explicit depictions of an individual; repealer
abstract: Includes "deep fake" images created by digitization within the definition of unlawful dissemination or publication of an intimate image.

title: Relates to complaint procedures and retaining billing records for a certain period of time
abstract: Ensures that residential gas, electric and steam service customers will receive a written determination regarding rate related complaints explaining the reasoning for the decision; requires that decisions are made by the public service commission within 90 days of receiving the complaint; requires utility corporations to retain customer billing statements dating back at least eight years.

title: Prohibits religious discrimination in recreational water parks
abstract: Prohibits the discrimination of persons based on their religious attire in recreational water parks, including, but not limited to, beaches, lakes, pools and other water facilities operated on land or water for recreational use.

title: Authorizes local water and sewerage authorities to charge fees for surface runoff
abstract: Enacts the water bill fairness act; authorizes local water and sewerage authorities to charge fees for surface runoff.

title: Establishes a SNAP and cash assistance fraud victims compensation fund; appropriation
abstract: Establishes a SNAP and cash assistance fraud victims compensation fund.

title: Establishes temporary health care staffing agencies
abstract: Establishes temporary health care staffing agencies to assist qualified health care professionals to find temporary employment at health care facilities.

title: Relates to paying drug-impaired driving surcharges to counties to reduce drug-impaired driving incidences
abstract: Pays drug-impaired driving surcharges to counties for programs and initiatives to reduce drug-impaired driving incidences.

title: Requires information concerning services for human trafficking victims to be provided in lactation rooms in Port Authority bus terminals
abstract: Requires information concerning services for human trafficking victims to be provided in lactation rooms in Port Authority bus terminals.

title: Establishes the University of the State of New York environmental sustainability office
abstract: Establishes the university of the state of New York environmental sustainability office to lead the coordination, planning and implementation of policies, programs, and processes to fulfill the university's sustainability obligations and targets cohesively, across all university campuses, and at the system level.

title: Relates to income earned while working at the polls
abstract: Exempts income earned working at the polls from the definition of income.

title: Allows certain adult care facilities to arrange for limited nursing services
abstract: Allows an adult home, enriched housing facility, assisted living residence or special needs assisted living residence to provide for nursing services in the facility that are not continual, either by arrangement with a provider of nursing services or by employment.

title: Extends the authorization of the county of Chemung to impose an additional one percent of sales and compensating use taxes
abstract: Extends the authorization of the county of Chemung to impose an additional one percent of sales and compensating use taxes to November 30, 2025.

title: Modernizes the metropolitan transportation authority's small business mentoring program
abstract: Increases the number of years a small business can participate in the small business mentor program from four years to five years for Tier 1 and from four years to five years for Tier 2; increases cap on awards under MTA's small business mentor program from one million dollars to one million five hundred thousand dollars for Tier 2 contracts; requires a report to the legislature and the governor.

title: Provides for reimbursements for certain home health services that meet the definition of core public health services
abstract: Provides for reimbursements for certain home health services that meet the definition of core public health services.

title: Relates to licensing restrictions for on-premises alcohol consumption for certain manufacturers and wholesalers of alcoholic beverages
abstract: Relates to licensing restrictions for on-premises alcohol consumption for manufacturers and wholesalers of alcoholic beverages at specific locations.

title: Extends the time period for the conveyance of lands for the establishment of the Gateway National Recreation Area
abstract: Extends the time period for the conveyance of lands for the establishment of the Gateway National Recreation Area until June 30, 2025.

title: Creates a banking development district working group
abstract: Creates a banking development district working group to assess the banking development district program and provide an annual report to the governor and legislature on the strengths and weaknesses of such program; defines unbanked and underbanked.

title: Extends the authorization of the county of Delaware to impose an additional one percent of sales and compensating use taxes
abstract: Extends the authorization of the county of Delaware to impose an additional one percent of sales and compensating use taxes.

title: Extends the authorization of the county of Cattaraugus to impose an additional mortgage recording tax
abstract: Extends the authorization of the county of Cattaraugus to impose an additional mortgage recording tax until December 1, 2025.

title: Authorizes the county of Nassau assessor to accept an application for a real property tax exemption from New York Jesus Baptist Church
abstract: Authorizes the county of Nassau assessor to accept an application for a real property tax exemption from New York Jesus Baptist Church with respect to the 2022-2023 assessment roll for all of the 2022-2023 school taxes and all of the 2023 general taxes.

title: Establishes minimum maintenance roads in designated towns
abstract: Permits designated towns to designate minimum maintenance roads by a local law passed by the town board following a hearing.

title: Extends the expiration of the provisions authorizing the county of Cattaraugus to impose an additional one percent sales and compensating use taxes
abstract: Extends the expiration of the provisions authorizing the county of Cattaraugus to impose an additional one percent sales and compensating use taxes until November 30, 2025.

title: Authorizes the county of Niagara to continue to impose an additional rate of sales and compensating use taxes
abstract: Authorizes the county of Niagara to continue to impose an additional rate of sales and compensating use taxes.

title: Relates to the tax on gaming revenues in certain regions and to additional vendor fees for a certain track located within Oneida county
abstract: Relates to the tax on gaming revenues in region five of zone two and to the tax rates on certain facilities within the Tioga county portion of such region; adds additional vendor fees for a certain track located within Oneida county; extends the effectiveness of such additional vendor fees.

title: Requires electronic reporting by contractors and sub-contractors for state contracts
abstract: Requires all state agencies to require all contractors that provide services for state purposes pursuant to a contract, submit an annual employment report with the job titles and number of employees necessary to perform such contract; further provides that such information be submitted electronically in order for such information to be searchable and transferable to a spreadsheet or database.

title: Relates to expiration dates of orders of protection and the duration of temporary orders of protection in juvenile delinquency cases
abstract: Relates to orders of protection expiration dates and the duration of temporary orders of protection in juvenile delinquency cases; requires expiration dates for orders of protection under certain articles of the family court act to be plainly stated; provides that a temporary order of protection in juvenile delinquency cases may remain in effect for an initial period of up to thirty days and may be extended by the court for good cause, upon notice to the juvenile; provides that the juvenile has a right to counsel upon the extension of the order of protection.

title: Modifies the allocation of revenue from the hotel and motel taxes in Chautauqua county and extends the authorization for such taxes; repealer
abstract: Modifies the allocation of revenue from the hotel and motel taxes in Chautauqua county; extends the authorization for such taxes.

title: Permits the sale of beer at retail on Sundays; repealer
abstract: Permits the sale of beer at retail on Sundays.

title: Authorizes Brett W. Brewer to take the competitive civil service examination for the position of police officer to be a full-time police officer for the village of Ilion
abstract: Authorizes Brett W. Brewer to take the competitive civil service examination for the position of police officer and be placed on the eligible list for employment as a full-time police officer for the village of Ilion, notwithstanding the age requirements under the civil service law.

title: Establishes the "New York Early Mail Voter Act"
abstract: Establishes early mail voting; authorizes registered voters to obtain early mail voting ballots through application to the board of elections; requires the state board of elections to establish and maintain an electronic early mail ballot application transmittal system through which voters may apply for an early mail ballot online.

title: Prohibits discrimination on the basis of a person's height or weight in opportunities of employment, housing, and access to public accommodations
abstract: Prohibits discrimination on the basis of a person's height or weight in opportunities of employment, housing, and access to public accommodations.

title: Proposes a constitutional amendment to divide the state into three autonomous regions; repealer
abstract: Proposes a constitutional amendment to divide the state into three autonomous regions; the New Amsterdam Region, the New York Region and the Montauk Region; provides regional governors and regional legislators; provides only for a state sales tax; divides various departments and agencies; provides for separate court systems and prison systems.

title: Permits certain retail licensees to purchase wine and liquor from certain other retail licensees
abstract: Permits on-premises retail licensees to purchase wine and liquor from off-premises retail licensees and off-premises retail licensees to purchase wine and liquor from on-premises retail licensees.

title: Authorizes Isaac B. Bertos to take the competitive civil service examination for the position of police officer for employment as a full-time police officer for the village of Ilion
abstract: Authorizes Isaac B. Bertos to take the competitive civil service examination for the position of police officer and be placed on the eligible list for employment as a full-time police officer for the village of Ilion, notwithstanding the age requirements under the civil service law.

title: Extends certain provisions authorizing the county of Hamilton to impose a county recording tax on obligations secured by mortgages on real property
abstract: Extends certain provisions authorizing the county of Hamilton to impose a county recording tax on obligations secured by mortgages on real property to December 1, 2025.

title: Makes major revisions to provisions of the alcoholic beverage control law relating to the issuance of licenses and hours of operation; repealer
abstract: Relates to the hours during which liquor and/or wine stores may be open on Sunday (Part A); permits the sale of beer at retail on Sundays; repeals certain provisions of law relating thereto (Part B); authorizes special permits to remain open during certain hours of the morning (Part C); permits certain retail licensees to purchase wine and liquor from certain other retail licensees (Part D); relates to permissible sales by license holders (Part E); allows multiple off-premises licenses (Part F); relates to licensing restrictions for manufacturers and wholesalers of alcoholic beverages and retail licensees (Part G); relates to the approval of seven day licenses to sell liquor at retail for consumption off the premises (Part H); adjusts licensing fees regarding certain alcoholic beverages (Part I); relates to notifying municipalities of the filing of certain applications (Part J); relates to changes of ownership of a licensed business (Part K); relates to the issuance of temporary retail permits; makes permenant certain provisions relating to liquidator's permits and temporary retail permits (Part L); relates to the issuance of temporary wholesale permits (Part M); relates to licenses issued for on premises consumption within two hundred feet of a building occupied as a school, church, synagogue or other place of worship (Part N); repeals certain provisions relating to licenses for premises located within five hundred feet of other licensed premises (Part O).

title: Permits the Albany Cemetery Association to file a certificate of amendment of certificate of incorporation with the department of state
abstract: Permits the Albany Cemetery Association to file a certificate of amendment of certificate of incorporation with the department of state within one year of the effective date.

title: Provides for disability benefits for pregnancy loss
abstract: Provides for disability benefits for pregnancy loss.

title: Enacts "the planned offshore wind transmission act"
abstract: Enacts "the planned offshore wind transmission act"; requires the New York state energy and research development authority to establish a plan for improved transmission planning and coordinating systems for an offshore grid; requires the authority conduct a benefit-cost-analysis and ratepayer impact study to determine the overall costs of implementing planned transmission and coordinated systems for an offshore grid.

title: Extends expiration of provisions of judiciary law authorizing referees to determine applications for orders of protection while family court is in session
abstract: Extends the chief administrator of the courts' authority to allow referees to determine certain applications to a family court for an order of protection.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim September 2023, as Blood Cancer Awareness Month in the State of New York
Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim September 10-16, 2023, as Truck Driver Appreciation Week in the State of New York
Mourning the death of Augustine Paul, loving husband and father, and devoted member of his community
Relates to authorizing a tax abatement for alterations and improvements to multiple dwellings for purposes of preserving habitability in affordable housing
abstract: Authorizes a tax abatement for alterations and improvements to multiple dwellings for purposes of preserving habitability in affordable housing.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim November 2023, as Pancreatic Cancer Awareness Month in the State of New York
Celebrating the life and accomplishments of Margaret R. Johnston
Congratulating Don Hammond upon the occasion of his retirement as the Mayor of the Village of Nyack, New York
Congratulating Nick LaMorte upon the occasion of capturing the 138-pound Division I wrestling title at the NYSPHSAA Wrestling Championships
Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim October 17, 2023, as Black Poetry Day in the State of New York
Relates to a settlement of certain land claims between the state and the Saint Regis Mohawk Tribe, the Mohawk Council of Akwesasne, and the Mohawk Nation Council of Chiefs
abstract: Authorizes the governor to execute a settlement relating to certain land claims between the state and the Saint Regis Mohawk Tribe, the Mohawk Council of Akwesasne, and the Mohawk Nation Council of Chiefs.

title: Commemorating June 14, 2023, as Flag Day
Relates to the procedure for voting increases in the rate of state taxes
abstract: Provides that no bill which increases, extends, imposes or revives any tax, fee, assessment, surcharge or any other such levy or collection, be passed or become a law, except by the assent of two-thirds of the members elected to each branch of the legislature voting separately; makes an exception for any bill which results from the passage of a home rule message.

title: Provides a tax exemption on real property owned by active auxiliary police officers in local law enforcement agencies in certain counties
abstract: Provides a tax exemption on real property owned by active auxiliary police officers in local law enforcement agencies in certain counties having a population of more than three hundred twenty thousand and less than three hundred fifty thousand, determined in accordance with the latest federal decennial census.

title: Relates to requiring new employees to be provided certain information relating to student loan repayment information
abstract: Directs the development of materials to be provided to new employees relating to student loan repayment information.

title: Recognizing June 8, 2023, as World Oceans Day
Requires menstrual products to be offered for free in non-public schools
abstract: Requires menstrual products to be offered for free in non-public schools.

title: Authorizes payments to nonparticipating or nonpreferred providers of ambulance services licensed under article 30 of the public health law
abstract: Authorizes payments to nonparticipating or nonpreferred providers of ambulance services licensed under article 30 of the public health law.

title: Requires notice of adverse step therapy determinations
abstract: Requires written notice of an adverse determination made by a utilization review agent in relation to a step therapy protocol override determination.

title: Abolishes citizens arrests; repealer
abstract: Abolishes citizens arrests in New York state.

title: Establishes an urban deer management pilot program
abstract: Relates to establishing an urban deer management pilot program; authorizes the department of environmental conservation, after a review of the site-specific deer management plan, and upon a finding that deer have become a nuisance, destructive to public or private property or a threat to public health or welfare, to issue a certified nuisance wildlife specialist a deer cull permit; defines terms.

title: Relates to the creation of crime database of all convictions of animal cruelty
abstract: Relates to the creation of a crime database of all convictions in New York state of animal cruelty, fighting, neglect, abandonment and mistreatment; makes such crime database available to all law enforcement entities, district attorneys, duly incorporated humane societies, societies for the prevention of cruelty to animals, dog or cat protective associations and animal control officers.

title: Relates to ballots submitted in envelopes that are sealed and have no indication of tampering
abstract: Relates to ballots submitted in envelopes that are sealed with tape, paste or any other binding agent or device and have no indication of tampering.

title: Requires cable companies to charge the same rate for the same service
abstract: Requires cable companies to charge the same rate for the same service to different subscribers.

title: Relates to collaborative prescriptive authority for psychologists
abstract: Allows a licensed psychologist to apply to the department of education for conditional prescribing certification if the psychologist meets certain requirements; allows the department of education to waive certain requirements for an applying psychologist; provides that a conditional prescribing certification shall be valid for a period of two years.

title: Commending Kennedy Westbrook upon the occasion of receiving the 2023 Valley Principals' Award
Congratulating Thomas M. Catallo upon the occasion of celebrating his 100th Birthday
Relates to the computation of building aid for the construction, reconstruction or modernizing of certain schools by the Binghamton City School District
abstract: Relates to the computation of building aid for the construction, reconstruction or modernizing of certain projects by the Binghamton City school district.

title: Relates to reporting of digital assets on the annual statement of financial disclosure
abstract: Relates to reporting of digital assets on the annual statement of financial disclosure filed with the legislative ethics commission or the joint commission on public ethics.

title: Amends the constitution to convey land to Debar Pond Institute Inc. in order to facilitate the preservation of historic buildings
abstract: Amends the constitution to convey land to Debar Pond Institute, Inc. in order to facilitate the preservation of historic buildings.

title: Increases the state reimbursement rate for preventative child protective services
abstract: Increases the state reimbursement rate for preventative child protective services from 65 to 75 percent.

title: Adds North Chuctanunda creek to the definition of inland waterways
abstract: Adds North Chuctanunda Creek to the definition of inland waterways.

title: Authorizes the commissioner of motor vehicles to enter into reciprocity agreements with other states, countries, provinces or territories that issue driver licenses
abstract: Authorizes the commissioner of motor vehicles to enter into reciprocity agreements with other states, countries, provinces or territories that issue driver licenses.

title: Provides an exemption for the sale of the first $35,000 of a battery, electric, or plug-in hybrid electric vehicle from state sales and compensating use taxes
abstract: Provides an exemption for the sale of the first $35,000 for a battery, electric, or plug-in hybrid electric vehicle from state sales and compensating use taxes; authorizes local governments to elect such incentives; repeals the hybrid exemption after ten years.

title: Relates to the applicability of open meetings and freedom of information laws to certain not-for-profit corporations
abstract: Relates to the applicability of open meetings and freedom of information laws to certain not-for-profit corporations.

title: Establishes a statewide presumptive eligibility standard for the receipt of child care assistance
abstract: Establishes a statewide presumptive eligibility standard where upon application for child care assistance, with included documentation required by a local social services district, a family shall be presumed eligible for such assistance for a period of thirty to sixty days.

title: Authorizes the city of New York to reduce the interest accrued on certain charges assessed on real property located at 1690 60th Street in Brooklyn
abstract: Requires the city of New York to reduce the interest accrued on certain charges assessed by the NYC department of health for inspections, clean-ups, examinations and other services performed between 1/21/97 and 11/9/99 on real property located at 1690 60th Street in Brooklyn.

title: Relates to the use of voice recognition features on certain products
abstract: Relates to the use of voice recognition features on certain products.

title: Exempts the East Dunkirk Volunteer Fire Company, Inc. from the requirement that the percentage of non-resident fire department members not exceed forty-five percent of the membership
abstract: Exempts the East Dunkirk Volunteer Fire Company, Inc. from the requirement that the percentage of non-resident fire department members not exceed forty-five percent of the membership.

title: Relates to residency requirement for the village clerk/treasurer and deputy village clerk/treasurer for the village of Otisville
abstract: Relates to residency requirements for the village clerk/treasurer and deputy village clerk/treasurer for the village of Otisville, Orange county.

title: Establishes a residential investment exemption in certain cities
abstract: Establishes a vacant residential investment exemption in cities with a population of not less than seven thousand fifty and not more than seven thousand sixty, determined in accordance with the two thousand twenty census.

title: Relates to research and restricting advertisement and promotion of electronic cigarettes
abstract: Prohibits clauses restricting certain research and restricts advertisement and promotion of electronic cigarettes.

title: Authorizes the Friendship Engine and Hose Company to file an application for exemption from real property taxes
abstract: Authorizes the Friendship Engine and Hose Company to file an application for exemption from real property taxes.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim November 2023, as Alpha-1 Awareness Month in the State of New York
Permits certain defendants in a criminal action in Delaware, Otsego or Schoharie county to appear electronically, with the approval of the court
abstract: Permits certain defendants in a criminal action in Delaware, Otsego or Schoharie county to appear electronically, with the approval of the court.

title: Establishes a school speed zone camera demonstration program in the city of Albany
abstract: Establishes a school speed zone camera demonstration program in the city of Albany; repeals authorization of program December 31, 2028.

title: Authorizes conditional adult-use cultivator and processor licensees to sell tested, packaged, and sealed cannabis products and cannabis to a cannabis dispensing facility licensed by a tribal nation for retail
abstract: Authorizes conditional adult-use cultivator and processor licensees to sell tested, packaged, and sealed cannabis products or biomass to a cannabis dispensing facility licensed or permitted by a tribal nation for retail sale.

title: Enacts the "village of Washingtonville deficit financing act"
abstract: Authorizes the village of Washingtonville, Orange county, to issue serial bonds, subject to the provisions of section 10.10 of the local finance law, on or before November 30, 2024, in an aggregate principal amount not to exceed $4,500,000 for the specific object or purpose of liquidating the accumulated deficits of the general fund, water fund, sewer fund and capital projects fund.

title: Relates to the functions of the Medicaid inspector general with respect to audit and review of medical assistance program funds and requiring notice of certain investigations
abstract: Requires the Medicaid inspector general to comply with standards relating to the audit and review of medical assistance program funds; establishes procedures, practices and standards for the adjustment or recovery of a medical assistance payment from recipients; requires notice of certain investigations.

title: Authorizes an occupancy tax in the village of Weedsport
abstract: Authorizes an occupancy tax of seven percent of the per diem rental rate of hotel rooms in the village of Weedsport, county of Cayuga; provides for the repeal of such provisions upon the expiration thereof.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim October 2023, as German-American Heritage Month in the State of New York New York
Grants retroactive membership with Tier IV status in the New York state and local employees' retirement system to Dawn Ward
abstract: Grants retroactive membership with Tier IV status in the New York state and local employees' retirement system to Dawn Ward.

title: Requires the department of education to develop school health and mental health professionals to student ratios in public schools
abstract: Requires the department of education to develop school health and mental health professionals to student ratios in public schools for students who do not receive services pursuant to the individuals with disabilities education act.

Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim May 26, 2023, as Heat Awareness Day in the State of New York
Increases the number of judges in certain courts
abstract: Increases the number of judges in the second, ninth and eleventh districts; provides for additional family court judges in the city of New York and certain counties; provides for additional city and civil court judges in New York city.

title: Honoring the late Stack Bundles upon the occasion of re-naming a street in Far Rockaway, Queens, in his name, in recognition of his legendary musical career and remarkable life on June 10, 2023
Relates to certain tax deductions related to the sale, production, or distribution of cannabis products
abstract: Permits certain tax deductions related to the sale, production, or distribution of cannabis products.

title: Congratulating the Buffalo Bandits Lacrosse Team upon the occasion of capturing the National Lacrosse League Championship
Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim July 25, 2023, as Afro-Latina, Afro-Caribbean, and African Diaspora Women's Day in the State of New York
Establishes Diwali as a school holiday in public schools in the city of New York
abstract: Establishes Diwali as a school holiday in public schools in the city of New York.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim October 11, 2023, as Coming Out Day in the State of New York, in conjunction with the observance of National Coming Out Day
Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim October 2023, as Careers in Construction Month in the State of New York
Establishes the village incorporation commission
abstract: Establishes the village incorporation commission to evaluate and make decisions regarding village incorporation elections.

title: Memorializing Governor Kathy Hochul to proclaim October 6-12, 2023, as Physician Assistant Week in the State of New York
Relates to the claiming of credits under the empire state film production credit
abstract: Relates to the claiming of credits under the empire state film production credit; provides for the application of certain provisions of the tax law related to the empire state film production credit and the empire state film post-production credit.

abstract: Relates to procedures for appointment and reappointment of notaries public, certificates of official character, and certification of electronic notarial records.

Congratulating Michael M. Grant upon the occasion of his retirement after 37 years of dedicated service to the residents of the County of Rockland, the Town of Haverstraw, and the Village of West Haverstraw
Declares Asian Lunar New Year a school holiday
abstract: Declares Asian Lunar New Year a school holiday.

title: Commending the five members from the Town of Carmel Police Department in their heroic efforts in saving the life of an eight-year-old child

Implements an agreement between the state and an employee organization; providing for the adjustment of salaries of certain incumbents in the professional service in the state university; appropriation
abstract: Implements an agreement between the state and an employee organization; provides for the adjustment of salaries of certain incumbents in the professional service in the state university; makes an appropriation for the purpose of effectuating certain provisions thereof.
